title: Avoid
text: The dark grey and black decor was depressing. Old building with a surface update. Bedroom was small. Only way to control heating was to turn off at the plug. No fan or ventilation in the bathroom. Few TV channels. Elevator was erratic as electronic card reader frequently didn't work on the one elevator functioning out of 3.  We were on 11th of 12 floors so often a 15 minute wait for elevator and too far to use stairs. Hospitality room with specialty coffee and afternoon snacks was not available despite visited on two separate days within the posted times of availability. Urns of regular coffee were there 24 hours but cold when I tried them. Reception staff would smile and shrug that nothing they could do about any problem. Location was good but better hotels in the price range available on same street.

title: Great short stay in NYC at the Kixby
text:
Great hotel in a great location. Breakfast options include bagels, muffins, fruit and cereals. About a 15 minute walk from Time Square and the subway is on the same road. Staff helped us to book a taxi back to the airport at the end of our stay. Great restaurant connected to the Kixby called ‘The Black Tap’ which I also recommend. They also give you a free water bottle. Gym is small but nice and next door you can fill up flavoured water for free as well as teas and coffees. 

Very helpful to find an umbrella in our room because it was raining when we first arrived. Also equipped with shower products and a hairdryer. Even an iron and ironing board! 

We hope to return in the future.

title: A little gem
text: Great two night stay at the end of our honeymoon. Staff are so friendly & helpful. Rooms are clean and the beds are super comfortable. The location is just fantastic just off Fifth avenue with a short stroll to Times Square. There was a bottle of bubbly & chocolates to greet us in our room which was such a lovely touch. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks so much to everyone who made our stay a memorable one.

title: Perfect stay in an excellent and clean hotel
text:
I cannot fault the Kixby! Myself and my husband enjoyed every second of our stay during March (23-27th) We were in PH06 (which I believe my husband requested and the request was met so thank you!) The room was stunning, complete with a bath and shower, as well as twin sinks and so clean. As it was my birthday a note and bottle of bubbly was left which was such a lovely touch. The location is excellent, a metro station at the bottom of the road and in walking distance to MSG, Macy’s and the Empire State Building - really handy for getting around.

We are truly grateful to the team at Kixby. A special thank you to Shawn on reception also, we were shattered after a long flight to NYC and Shawn was so friendly and helpful it was refreshing after a tiring day.

Thank you Kixby; we will recommend you to all friends and family without a second thought 😊

title: Fabulous as always…
text: Have just returned home after another lovely stay at the Kixby.  The hotel is in a great location for Macy’s,  Empire State Building and Times Square, but what makes the Kixby for me is the wonderful staff!  The rooms are nicely decorated and a great size by NYC standards.  Yes, you may have to wait for the elevator at times but she’s an old building now, and take it from one who knows, we all can get a bit doddering with age!

title: Midtown West Hotel Option
text: Good hotel in the heart of NYC located close to 5th Avenue, Empire State Building on the west side of Midtown. The room was somewhat small but nicely appointed. Good restaurant on the premises. Would stay here again. Water and coffee station on second floor. Great rooftop bar which opens in April. Would stay again.

title: Kixby Hotel - New York
text:
Kixby hotel located on 35th street, between 5th and 6th avenue is a great location and easily accessible to all tourist attractions. 
We had a deluxe king room which was very spacious compared with a lot of other hotel rooms in New York. The hotel has a small gym on the 2nd floor, for those who haven’t done enough walking during the day. The 2nd floor also has a room offering an ice machine in addition to hot and cold drinks. 
The hotel does have a continental style breakfast available at a cost, and is located in the bar area just near the hotel lobby. (we didn’t try this so can’t comment) the hotel also has an amazing rooftop bar (open in the spring and summer months) but out of season you can still access it, and is great to take a coffee or snacks there and enjoy the view, especially as you are so close to the Empire State Building.
Herald Square subway station is a 2 minute walk giving you great access  to Brooklyn, the financial district and Central Park.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: A perfect spot in a hip hotel
text: We’ve been using this hotel since it was NY metro years ago. They underwent a renovation and the newly branded Kixby is still our go to spot when we stay in manhattan. It’s nestled in the heart of Korea town and is mere steps away from great dining, bars, and of course underneath the empire for amazing views from their rooftop terrace. And anything else you need to get to in the city, there’s a subway station on the corner. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfortable. We’ve stayed in everything from the king beds to the family room with 2 rooms and 3 beds for a group. The decor is tastefully hip while still keeping that art deco charm from midtown. The staff are always polite and it’s always a pleasure to see and chat with Amy when I run into her in the lobby.

title: Kixby is Lovely.
text: Just spent six days at the Kixby and had a great time.   It is a lovely little place.   Many hotels in New York are incredibly expensive and feel run down.   The Kixby isn't cheap, but it is lovely.   The rooms look like the photos.   The staff were friendly.     The roof top patio has an incredible view of the Empire State Building.     The location is great.   The Herald Sq. Subway is just steps away.     If you want to walk to plays on Broadway it is only a short 10 minute stroll.  Around the corner,  Little Italy Pizza at 33rd and 6th is a great spot for a late night slice.   Green Leaf Gourmet is a great little deli  at 34th and Park and makes a great cheese, bacon and egg bagel.   And if you are looking for a good drink the Portrait bar at 28th and 5th is amazing.     Thank you Kixby... you rock.

title: A gem in the heart of NYC
text: This hotel was recommended to us by our travel agent. It lived up to expectations. Friendly staff and smooth check in. Lovely spacious room especially for New York sizes. Room was cleaned daily, they did forget our daily water but nothing a trip to reception didn’t solve. We had an incident where a top was mistaken for a towel and once notified it came back clean and pressed. The location of the hotel is great, right outside Macy’s and the Empire State Building. The view from the roof top is a must especially at night. Walking distance to lots of fantastic sites and restaurants. This was our 3rd trip to New York and when we go again we will definitely stay at The Kixby. Would’ve already booked but it’s sold out!

title: Not for us.
text:
We feel this hotel was not as it was advertised, the pictures we looked at before visiting look light and had solid wood flooring, not laminate.  We found our room to be dark, cold and small, the heating a/c unit made hell of a racket when on, and your unable to open any windows, also no heating in the bathroom. 
Requested a high floor room, which we didn't get, we were put on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel, with a view of a brick walls, which obviously made the room feel even darker. 
The bed and bedding was very good, the shower was decent, the rooms were cleaned to a high standard, the staff were also all very friendly and helpful. 

Maybe we were just unlucky with our room, I see from other reviews on here that other guests had fantastic views of the empire state.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Just spent 11 night in the Kixby for a special trip. The welcome was warm and friendly and informative. The room on the 6th floor was spacious and quiet, spotlessly clean daily.
The Look Up roof bar area was amazing with the best view of the Empire State Building in all its glory!.
It’s situated in the middle of most things, bars restaurants and shops Macy’s at the end of the street.

Would return in a heart beat.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We stayed for 4 nights as part of my 40th birthday celebrations. The hotel kindly left me a card and bottle of bubbly, which was a really nice touch. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Hotel facilities including the gym are all great, and the location is ideal for tourists.

title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL/RUDE INTIMIDATING MANAGER ANU
text:
Gutted I'm even having to write this, I am not one to moan but this hotel really isn't what i thought it would be in regards to customer service. We woke up to a leak in our room which was coming from the bathroom, we used every towel possible to clean it up in a panic, we went down to get more towels and got moved to another room. 
A guy come up to our room to check it over who flushed the toilet and said,' it doesn't sound right'... a stressful, morning but we moved on from it ...a day passes and we get a letter slipped under our door saying the manager Anu wants to speak to us to 'understand' what happened'?? which was a worry as we didn't even understand it ourselves. The meeting took place and i explained what happened we woke up to a leak in the bathroom.....the manger said we must have left the tap on????... i explained over and over again that was not the case yet she didn't believe me.. i thought the meeting was to understand what had happened so she could prevent this happening again instead she made her mind up before the meeting even took place, that we left a tap on ( we definitely didn't)  ... so we sat for around 10/15 minutes of her interrogating me,and insinuating I'm a liar without actually calling me one...
i felt so judged and powerless..i asked are you trying to charge me she said yes
$500 for the damage ...i explained i don't have that kind of money as this trip was a gift yet she had NO empathy and continued to insinuate that it was our fault..
i really wish i didn't pay as it was no fault of our own, I have never been treated with such judgement and tension before.
I said i am not paying it and she said i had no choice... there are so many other hotels in new York to choose from, and i would advise anyone NOT book this place.
$500 is a lot of money for me, but for a multi-millionaire company this isn't at all a drop in the ocean for them. This situation completely ruin our trip Manger Anu should not be sitting in the chair that she is if she can so easily demand money from people with no proof of her theory which still isnt true. since being home i have explained this to everyone i have spoken to, and each person has been gobsmacked that this actually happened. I will continue to tell everyone to avoid this hotel at all cost cause it probably end up costing you more money....no sorry was given by manger Anu that i can remember anyway as i was concentrating  more on  trying to process the shock of this....and still am!! STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

title: Friendly hotel in a great spot for exploring New York
text:
Friendly, warm welcome. Rooms tastefully done and generously sized, with super comfortable beds. Nice touch with the free reusable water bottle and amazing variety of waters to select from.  Great coffee in your room too. Best hotel we've stayed at, in New York.

We were in the street side of the hotel so there was street noise, however I enjoyed listening to the authentic sounds of New York before I popped my ear plugs in.

title: Lovely but be aware of fees added at the end.
text: Lovely hotel, room, food and service but felt robbed on check out for the nightly $35 charge for amenities. If that was transparent in terms of fees and amount then not an issue but it isn’t it’s very hidden. Shame as without that I’d have rated 5 star, B A holidays also at fault for not being transparent.

title: Ok but would not return
text:
We stayed here for four nights as part of a package with Virgin Holidays and the main plus points are definitely the cleanliness (absolutely spotless) and the location (very central to main tourist attractions and close to MSG). The staff are also friendly and are helpful when it comes to directions, booking airport taxis etc. Another positive was the very comfortable bed and cosy bedding - needed after long days exploring the city. 

Now for the negatives - our main issue was the noise at night. Obviously we expected noise to some degree in central NYC but there didn't seem to have been any attempt at soundproofing the windows/rooms - we were on one of the highest floors and could still hear loud traffic/street noise all night. We have stayed at other NYC hotels very close to this one and this has not been the case. There was also a constant humming from an air conditioning unit which seemed to continue regardless of whether or not we turned it off in the room. 

Watch out for the $35 per day facility fee per room that will be charged upon check in (on top of $250 refundable holding deposit). We did not know about this beforehand but were informed that the fee was for things such as the gym, unlimited flavoured water and a branded water bottle that was left in the room. I believe that this is relatively common in NYC but even so, we would have chosen not to pay for these things had it not been mandatory and again is not something that we have not experienced elsewhere. 

Unfortunately due to the above reasons, we would stay elsewhere next time, however I expect that you could do a lot worse than this hotel.

title: Lovely little place
text:
Lovely clean hotel and great decor check in was nice and easy and staff were all friendly and very helpful..
The resort fee or what ever it's called is a bit mad tbh 35 dollars a day for unlimited water is all I could see but that's what we expect now with traveling to the US.
Maids were all form and did an amazing job all polite and friendly when we bumped into them in the hall...
The heating unit was like an old tractor starting up and the shower removed a layer of skin as it had three shower heads which made showering scary but weirdly fun. ( User error maybe on my part )
Room had a safe and a fridge which was nice.
Noise of the bar downstairs was a bit of a pain as our room was above it but little gripes that's all..

Well worth it tbh

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel was great. We had a king size room and was really impressed with size. Bed was super comfy. Location is good also subway at the end of the road which means you can prestige anywhere. The only downside is noise from the street but that's NY for you

title: Overall very good but teeny tiny rooms
text:
Kixby is a nice small hotel in a good central location. As with all places there are pros and cons.

Pros:
Location is great really easy to get to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park
Subway at the end of the road 
Restaurant next door/attached is delicious
Road is quiet ( in NYC terms)
Quick check in
Rooms are clean
Shower is great
Free water tea and coffee 
Bed is so comfortable 
No road noise
Despite small corridors no noise from other guest bedrooms 
WiFi was good

Cons:
The standard double room is tiny ( like literally we had to move around strategically as we couldn’t pass each other ( 1 child, 1 small adult) so I think 2 adults would struggle
View was none existent and had to keep blinds closed as another guest room looked in
The weed bus outside meant that the smell of weed was constant and I found that disappointing
Shower was great but knob was hanging off and had no instructions how to use
Aircon was loud so had to turn off
Fridge was loud constant humming
Cleaners started early and because corridors were narrow it meant noise travelled and their talking and banging started at 7am
Lifts were hit and miss sometimes had to wait up to 5 mins for a lift so mostly used the stairs

Overall great stay and would recommend and the cons are really for awareness. Except room size and view this would make me perhaps rethink

title: Great stay great location
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights. Hotel is in a great location.  No issues with noise/heating or lifts we was on the 8th floor. 
Rooms were small but very well equipped.  Enough space for us, it’s only a base for your holiday.  
USB ports on the bedside lights. 
No plugs near mirror but not a major issue.  
Fridge and safe in room 
Fees we were charged a holding deposit and city tax etc.  this was pending until check out then just £140 was taken from our account.  Which I thought was reasonable.  
Rooms cleaned everyday apart from our first day then we realised we needed to put out the please clean sign.  
Reception was friendly and always had a smile.  
Shower wasn’t the best it took some working out then as it has 3 heads there was a constant cold drip on the heads you wasn’t using.  Again no major issue. 
Black tap next door was great for our first night. Lovely food.  
We would defiantly stay again when we come back to New York. The location was just perfect.  2 minutes from the subway.

title: Poor Customer Service
text: The hotel is perfectly nice.  Rooms are small but clean and comfortable.  My one issue is that you can't control the temperature and I found it got much too hot.  Unfortunately, I had a bad experience with the manager.  I was charged for two nights but only stayed one.  My hotels.com booking clearly showed one night but the manager was quite rude and insistent that hotels.com was at fault.  After numerous back and forths, the Kixby accepted responsibility and provided a refund but no apology.

title: An amazing stay for first time visiting NYC
text: This hotel is amazing. We stayed here for 5 nights and couldn’t fault anything. Our room was clean, modern and spacious. We loved that they had the drinks machines on level 2, we used these everyday while we were there. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in such a fab location and close by to lots of things to do. We went to Black Tap next door which does amazing food and drinks. If we returned to New York, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing hotel but issues with the housekeeper.
text: Everything about this hotel was amazing from the staff to the location! Right in the centre of manhattan, you’re only a couple minutes walk from busy New York. The staff at the front desk were lovely and very accommodating. The only issue I had was on our second day we came back to our room being cleaned and a charger missing. The staff said that they asked the housekeeper and she said she didn’t have it but of course she’d say that meaning I didn’t have a charger to charge my phone. Other than a stolen charger we had an amazing experience!

title: Great hotel, deceptive “facility fee”
text: The Kixby had everything going for it - great rate advertised on Expedia (more on that), great location, great room and service, beautiful architecture, and helpful staff. The downside was the deceptive $30 a day “facility fee” that I was informed would be added to my bill when I was checking in. The fee was to cover the “amenities” available on the second floor. When pressed, I found out these amenities included access to unlimited refills of water. SAY WHAT??? The desk clerk explained that this was a mandatory fee imposed by all hotels in the city (which I later found to be a lie). Even with the facility fee the rate was a grab, but don’t lowball prospective guest in order to get them to the property.

title: Ok but not great
text: We stayed here beginning of December and felt it lacking for a 4 star hotel. When we arrived the check in was ok but no conversation and no explanation on how to use the lift which can be tricky at first! The room was comfortable and small as you expect in New York. Location is pretty good just down the road from Macy's. I would say nothing really to complain about but just felt it didn't live up to a 4 star and wouldn't return

title: Nice stay but room could have been bigger
text: This hotel came highly recommended by the travel agent so we had high hopes but it didn’t meet those unfortunately. The lady on the reception desk wasn’t very welcoming when we arrived although generally the other staff were polite and friendly. Be mindful that they charge a $250 holding deposit when you check in (no cash or travel cards accepted) and if you’re from the UK it will take about 14 working days to be returned depending on your bank. We had told the travel agent we were celebrating a birthday to which they had said they would mention it and gave us the impression this hotel would do something special to celebrate although there was no mention of this. We didn’t mind this so much if it wasn’t made worse by the fact we were right at the end of the corridor in probably the smallest room they have that had to constantly have the blind closed as it overlooks other people’s rooms and some pipes - not the New York scenery we were looking for! The room however was clean and tidy and cleaned daily, bedding washed every second night I believe. They give you a water bottle where you can go and fill up with all different flavoured waters and hot drinks from 1-8pm which was a nice extra.

title: PERFECT HOTEL - GREAT BASE LOCATION
text: Excellent hotel. Superb location. Beds really comfy - Rooms great for the price - staff very welcoming and helpful - great bar next door adjoining called Black Tap. Added some extra photos as the ones on your website don’t do the rooftop terrace justice. Feel free to use them on your website if you like. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

title: Fab experience
text:
Lovely experience at The Kixby, dark and moody decor gave it a warm feeling, especially in winter! Love that the rooftop terrace is open year-round to get the perfect vantage point for the Empire State Building, the location is top-notch, half a block from the nearest subway station that pretty much gets you everywhere. 

The rooms are well sized and the fridge was a bonus, soft sheets, and comfy beds. 

There is a deli just around the corner called Toast, used it a few times, perfect for breakfast or lunch on the go as they have a hot food bar daily, very useful and reasonably priced. 

The drinks facility on the 2nd floor was also a nice bonus, reception gave you a bottle on check-in to use throughout your stay.

title: Amazing hotel 10/10. Roof top bar view is spectacular
text: I would love to stay at the Kixby hotel again, and if I ever come back to NYC I will make sure to book it. Comfortable beds, spacious rooms (we were in a superior king room), kind staff, nice bathroom, bath robes provided and we got a lovely bottle of Prosecco when they found out we got engaged. The roof top bar is such a bonus, it wasn’t open when we were there due to closing for winter but that didn’t stop us going up every morning to see the views and take a view photos of the Empire State Building.

title: Everything you need and more
text:
Wow! Lovely hotel and the staff were so friendly and helpful.  Lovely clean and comfortable rooms with everything you need for your stay.  We received a bottle of prosecco on arrival and a card wishing us a happy stay as it was a trip to celebrate by 50th birthday.

Facilities were great, iron, fluffy dressing gowns, very comfortable bed, luxourious towels and shower/bathroom provided.  Even had an umbrella provided, which came in handy on our first day when the heavens opened.

The bar and restaurant attached 'Black Tab' was great and we used it most nights.  Staff got to know us and we met a few locals who worked in the neighbourhood.  The food and drinks were brilliant.  There is a quieter bar area at the back of the hotel, but we didn't feel the need to use that one and it was closed for a few nights for private functions due to the Christmas and Holiday Season.

Only thing I have to say - not a bad thing but something to be aware of, the steps down from the Black Tab to the main street are dark and steep.  I missed my footing one night and fell down them, causing me to land badly on my arm and hurt both my arm and foot.  The concierge at the Kixby was lovely though and helped me.

All in all, very impressed and will definitely recommend and use again when I next visit NYC, as I left part of my heart in the City and can't wait to return

title: Would not recommend.
text: Unfortunately very disappointed with our stay. Rooms a lot smaller than expected (could barely open our cases), bathroom door extremely squeaky and horrendously loud from outside. I understand being in a big city this can happen but it seems like the hotel have done nothing to cater for this. We complained twice during our stay as we thought the window might not be closed properly; we were not offered to move rooms and told the window was fine. I complained again on check out as it really affected our stay, and again no compensation was offered. I emailed and complained on our return and it took the hotel a month to get back to us and simply offered 25% off of our first night stay. Feels miserly. Wish I could upload a video on to here for people to understand how loud it really was at 02:36am when I recorded it; felt like the bin truck was in our room!!! Would definitely not recommend this hotel when there are so many options in NYC.

title: Great base location
text: Perfect location in short walking distance to almost everything. Rooms spacious and clean. Only downside was we stayed on the second floor and it was very noisy from the streets during the night. … but it’s a city and New York so can’t really complain, ask for a higher floor to help get a more quiet night. p.s the view of the Empire State Building is amazing from the roof… staff was lovely, wouldn’t hesitate to book here again!

title: A great hotel and cracking location
text: Room was quite spacious and bathroom very modern with good lighting. It was very clean and always turned down every day, plus restocked with water. The location was perfect just round the corner from Macy’s and Empire State Building. There was a subway on the corner of the street which was really easy to get around and navigate. The staff were really friendly and helpful, we left our bags on the last day whilst we were out exploring and they were really helpful booking a taxi when we got back. The room also had a really easy to use safe which was useful.

title: Nice place but spoilt visit due to hidden fees and lack of such information.
text:
This would have been a better review but for the hidden charges for a ‘facilities fee’ which we were told nothing about until I noticed it added to my credit card bill just before left the hotel in the afternoon.
Upon arrival at approximately 7.30pm three nights before, we were given our room key and two small bottles of water. All we were told was that they needed my credit card for a $250 retainer for the room which would be refunded and that was it. No information about any fee  tobe taken or what the facilities were for tht fee, or that we would have to pay and it was not optional.
Yet upon check out which was early at 7am so we could do more shopping, we were again told nothing about this fee. To make matters worse when we returned from our shopping we were told we would have to go to the restroom ( which was small and shared with the adjacent bar) to add the shopping to our cases.
When I noticed this deduction from my credit card and asked what the fee was for, we were told it was for fast WiFi, the bottles of water, free tea and coffee and the gymnasium. I explained I had not been told anything about this and asked for the $66 dollars to be refunded to my card but told no, even though we knew nothing of these facilities and so didn't ever use them. 
I am frustrated about this as the website states free WiFi and complimentary tea and coffee but clearly it isn’t free or complimentary so anyone thinking of staying here please bear in mind that these facilities are not free or complimentary. Indeed I onserved as another client checked in and was not told anything about a facilites fee being deducted from the retainer.
For all of the above reasons I would not stay here again, especially when I have been charged for something that was never mde available to me or that you have to add to your packing in a public toilet.
This was a trip for my birthday which was long awaited after it being cancelled due to covid, so it wasn’t a nice way to end the experience.
The room was fine and clean/comfortable but being hoodwinked in this way means I would not stay again or advise other to do so.

Jeanette

title: parfait par rapport à la localisation de cet établisssement
text: j'avais une belle chambre au 12ème étage, par contre vue sur cour intérieure. Literie confortable. Malheureusement le ménage n'est pas toujours bien fait. Les lampes étaient poussiéreuses, par certaine que la douche ni le lavabo soient nettoyés tous les jours. le petit déjeuner n'est pas bien fourni pour un 4 étoiles. Des bagels tous les jours, et ce n'est pas ce qu'il y a de plus appétissant .

title: Wouldn't return.
text:
On our arrival after a nightmare 20 hr trip. We were met at reception by 2 male receptionists. One didn't raise a smile and the one who gave us our our keys went through the info very quickly.  Didn't feel particularly welcomed, more herded through. Felt more of an inconvenience than a guest. 
We booked the Kixby as the rooms on their site looked spacious and airy. Believe me, they are not. We were upgraded to a king size room. You had just enough space to walk around the bed. The bathroom was tiny and the toilet was set in a recess so small, you couldn't put your elbows out!  The whole room was painted in a very dismal blue which brought the room in even more.  The windows don't open & we had to keep the blinds shut as we were looking directly into other rooms. It was quite claustrophobic. On the good side, it was very clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  Paper cups to drink from rather than cups, which I don't expect at any hotel.  If you want a quiet room, make sure you're on a high floor at the back of the building. The corridors are black/grey and very dismal. 
We were supposed to get 2 complimentary bottles of water a day, which we didn't. We asked a lady on reception who told me that they should be left by the maid. We mentioned this on 3 consecutive days and left a note for the maid.... still no water, although she did take the tip.  Gave up in the end and bought water from the 7/11. 
The adjoining Black Tap served a decent burger. A Chardonnay (which was from a tin), was $16. 
The Hilton Garden Inn next door looked much nicer and with hindsight, I wish we'd have booked there instead. 
The hotel is very central. A minute from Maceys and a short walk from Times Square. Subway at the end of the street. 
My personal opinion..... would I return to New York?... no. Very dirty and everywhere you go smells of cannabis.  If I did return, would I come back to the Kixby?... no.   Much nicer hotels available.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Nice looking hotel, good sized room especially for New York, shower fab. Great location, right next to Macy's which suited us for the Thanksgiving Parade. Gym very small and not that useful. Staff really helpful. Had no breakfast or meals here, there's an adjoining pub which looked it did burgers etc. No nice hotel bar which I normally like after the hustle of a day sightseeing in a city. Not sure if it was just noisy neighbours but the door being slammed reverberated in our room.

title: Good central hotel.
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Kixby. Easy to get to from JFK using the airtrain and subway. Nearest subway is a minute walk. The room was a good size and nice big comfy bed. Aircon was noisy, but worked well. Rooftop bar is lovely with good views of the ESB. Pricey drinks though and it closed early one night we were there so we missed out on a nightcap. Very clean and tidy. We were on the 9th floor, so no noise from outside. Definitely recommend.

title: Great stay
text:
Such a lovely hotel very clean and big bathroom very friendly staff. The porter couldn’t do enough for us.Room was a little noisy but it was outside noise and I would expect this from a hotel central New York.
Breakfast was available but we had breakfast out. The bar and restaurant at the back avoid it , it was a massive let down unfriendly staff that are sat talking about how they could attract more costumer's they could clearly see us stood there for 10 minutes I would start by serving the ones that come in first. so we ended up leaving and complained to the hotel.I couldn’t recommend the hotel itself enough.we loved our stay thenk you Kixby hotel x

title: Not for us.
text:
This is definitely not a luxury hotel. I found it dark and claustrophobic. The pictures I viewed before visiting looked light, spacious and appealing. After check in and parting with a deposit of $250 (refundable) and $114.75 (5 night tax payment) we were given our room key. We were on the 9th floor at the back of the hotel. The room and bathroom were very small. The decor was blue which pulled the room in even smaller. The view over looked more rooms and fans, ducting etc and gave little light. The room had a coffee pod machine, and paper cups were provided. I’m sorry to say the coffee was not nice. We had an air conditioning unit, and we used it daily, the room got so hot, the windows didn’t open, but the a/c was so loud. The noise from outside was also loud, I’d recommend getting earplugs. 
The bed was comfy! Which we’re grateful for, as my husband got food poisoning from the adjoining eatery and we ended up spending a day and a half in the room. 
The staff were friendly and helpful. The cleaners did a great job. The hotel is in a great location, but it just wasn’t our thing.

title: Honeymoon couple
text:
We stayed at the Kixby for first part of our honeymoon & upon arrival the room wasn’t available to check in  ( we got there around 2pm) but couldn’t check in till 3pm, so we left our luggage and went to times square until we was able to check in and freshen up. We was given an upgrade to a King Room and some chocolates and Prosecco which was a very nice touch. We could see a little bit of Empire State from our room. The room upon arrival was very cold as Air-con was on max,  the only criticism i’d have is it is very loud as windows appear paper thin, we expected it to be loud due to central location but i think the windows/walls could be improved to cut out a little noise. Recommend to bring earplugs or noise cancelling headphones to sleep.

Overall was a pleasant base given the great central direction.

title: Ideal für Sightseeing
text:
Negativ: 
- Heizung geht nicht/Klimaanlage lässt sich nur ausschalten, wenn man sie aussteckt
- Fenster geht nicht auf (lüften nur über Badezimmer möglich)
- sehr laut!!!! 
- WLAN geht nicht wirklich gut 
- kein Schrank, Platzproblem, da alles auf dem Boden herumstehen muss
- Frühstück mikrig, sehr wenig Auswahl (nur 2 Käsesorten, Muffins, eine oder zwei Brotsorte und Beagles), Marmelade, Honig. Keine Wurst.

Positiv:
- mega (!) freundliches, kompetentes und schnelles Personal
- bequeme und lautlos Betten
- Lage brachial gut direkt an der U-Bahn, direkt am Mach's Einkaufszentrum, einige Gehminuten vom Times Square (oder eben U-Bahn!), direkt neben dem Empire state Building, Busbahnhof und Penn Station keine 10 Laufminuten, MSG genauso direkt um's Eck, genug Essensmöglichkeiten (Burger und Chinese einige Meter entfernt)

title: Great stay for a solo parent
text:
Great stay in NYC as solo parent! 
Kixby is in a great location, staff are really friendly and accommodating. Staff recognised it was my birthday during my stay and write a lovely birthday note and chocolates. Staff were a always helpful around the hotel if they saw me struggling with my 110 bags and a stroller. 
Breakfast option was continental style which my 2 year old loved, for this area $20 for two of us was pretty good.
The the burger place next door is nice and not bad priced, good when you’ve had a long day exploring and don’t want to go to far for dinner. 
Our room was lovely and modern, everything you need for a few nights.

title: Rigid policies that prioritize money over guests
text: My experience with the Kixby Hotel in NYC was incredibly disappointing. When I came down with COVID and needed to change the dates of my stay, I reached out to them. Even though I had booked directly through the hotel and didn't request a refund, they refused to make any accommodations or adjust my stay dates. This rigid, money-focused policy left me frustrated and disappointed, and I will definitely not be booking with them again in the future.

title: Defo worth booking for for NYC stay
text: Brilliant location with Empire state buildings next street. Macy's if your a shopper 2 mins  away in fact you can see it from hotel entrance. The staff all very helpful, however I would like to make a special mention to Jose who on our arrival was just amazing. Unfortunately we never got to see him again to tip him or even to give him a proper thanks. Hotel kixby I would definitely recommend you and I hope Jose gets a chance to see this Thank  you from the Scottish couple you made feel safe and welcome ❤️

title: Family Room review
text: I travelled with my best friend and her twin 15 year old daughters to NYC for three nights in late September.  We searched high and low for an ideal room configuration for the four of us all over the city and were thankful to have discovered the family room at Kixby.  When you enter the room, you actually are entering a hallway.  The closet and a small enclave with a bar sized sink are both on the left.  The next door on the left is the bathroom with a walk in shower, toilet and vanity.  There is a very large bedroom with two queen size beds on the right and at the end of the hallway is another bedroom with a king size bed.  The king size room has a door on it, but the bedroom with two queens doesn’t.  The queen size room is downright palatial by NYC standards!  Having the small bar sink in the enclave was nice to have since four of us were sharing one bathroom.  If anyone at the hotel is reading this, my only suggestion would be to add mirrors in the bedrooms since there are none.  As far as location goes, this can’t be beat.  Tons of restaurant options all around, less than one block away from Macy’s and the subway stop is at the end of the block.  It was an easy walk to Times Square and Central Park.  We had no trouble getting taxis or ubers.  Desk staff was incredibly polite and helpful!  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Central location without being too noisy.  Really helpful staff. Would highly recommend staying here.  Close to Maceys and Herald square subway.   Make sure you book Black Tap restaurant as it gets very busy

title: Great base in midtown
text:
Recently returned from our 4 night stay at the Kixby.
Had a great trip with my wife and the hotel offered us a great base to explore New York.
A good central location, clean well equipped rooms and as others have mentioned the jewel being the roof terrace with the Empire State Building in the background. Although the bar was closed for the season, my wife and I often used it , buying the drinks at the bar on the ground floor and enjoying them in the shadow of the surrounding architecture.
Our room was on the 5th floor , no view unfortunately but this didn’t effect our enjoyment. I guess the roof terrace made up for it.
Only slight issue was that the background noise from the neighbouring air conditioning may not be to everyone’s taste. The heating in our room was also a bit hit and miss. Hence the 4 stars as opposed to 5.
Great friendly staff , offered a friendly welcome.
Would definitely visit again.

title: A comfortable, well placed mid-town hotel with friendly and very helpful staff.
text:
The hotel is well placed in mid-town Manhattan with comfortable and well equipped rooms. 
Of particular note, the staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful and deserve thanks and congratulation.

title: Amazing stay
text: The Kixby Hotel does not disappoint. It is set in an amazing location which is very central for getting around New York.  The rooftop is lovely, and is a must if staying at the hotel. The staff are helpful,  the pillows and bed are very comfy. The hotel is smart and not too high in stories. On the last night we discovered the bar/diner next door. Wish we had found out about this before definitely worth a visit too.

title: Great hotel, fab location
text:
Just arrived home after 4 nights at The Kixby. Great little hotel in a brilliant location. Rooms are clean with a great shower, air con and comfy bed. We were in room 911 and it was so quiet. No road noise. 
Check in was easy, the restaurant attached served great burgers. We didn’t use the sky bar (we just ran out of time) nor the breakfast (why have continental when you can have an American one). 
We would definitely stay again if we ever found ourselves in NYC.

title: New York at the kitsby
text: The hotel was clean, central, staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious, the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast although fresh was basic and overpriced. The toast cafe around the corner was much better value for money. We had maid service every day, who left the room tidy with fresh towels. The toiletries available were lovely. Definitely stay here again

title: Good mid-range hotel in excellent location.
text: Excellent location near Herald Square, Macy's and Penn Station, 35th St between 5th and 6th Avenues, very important to us. Rather gloomy decor but everything worked. Staff very helpful. We did not eat in the hotel.

title: Excellent Hotel,  would definitely return to stay here
text: Chic rooms well appointed with comfortable beds; in this privately run hotel. Well situated a short walk from Macey's.  Staff are friendly and helpful. Offers continental breakfast at a reasonable rate and has the Black Tap restaurant attached. Really enjoyed my stay.

title: New York State of Mind
text:
We spent 4 nights at The Kixby and overall were pretty impressed.  Check in was speedy although watch out for the $250 deposit required for the room.  Our room was a King on the 9th floor - no view to speak of but being away from the main road meant we were never bothered by street noise.  The room seemed well prepared, with a complementary bottle of fizz, wall mounted Samsung TV and walk in closet large enough to store our suitcases.  It was small however, the bathroom being especially tiny, but if you're spending time in NYC in your room then you're doing it wrong.

House keeping did a good job keeping the room clean throughout out stay.

title: Comfort and convince in New York
text: Thankfully not part of a chain, well-situated near 5th Avenue and ideal for tourists . Rooms nicely appointed and very clean, staff well-trained and efficient especially front desk team of Francesco,Inna Natalia and the ever attentive Jose.

title: Midtown Convenience
text:
Having stayed at this hotel twice, albeit under two different incarnations, I feel qualified to pass judgement. On this occasion, our luxury room on the 10th floor offered a large comfortable bed, an excellent shower and plenty of space for both clothes and luggage. Our option included daily bottles of fresh water and a coffee/tea making machine, thankfully equipped with mini milk cartons rather than that awful powder the Americans call ‘creamer’. The hotel offers a decent and decently priced continental breakfast and there are countless bars and restaurants nearby. Liberty was our favourite..There’s a subway within 100 yards and Macy’s across Herald Square. The Empire State Building is almost within spitting distance! We found staff to be very obliging. In central NY space is at a premium so the room wasn’t over large but the space was more than adequate. The major proviso is the noise. Despite ear plugs sleep was regularly interrupted- the soundproofing just wasn’t up to the job.
:

title: Excellent location, comfy beds, friendly staff, but very loud Air Conditioning.
text: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of a holiday around the US, and it was definitely a fantastic place to stay, located very close to the Empire State Building, Koreatown and Herald Square, where there’s a subway station. Overall a very positive experience for the most part, the beds were very comfortable and the curtains excelled at darkening the room. The only qualm I had with my stay was that the Air Conditioning Unit was very, very loud. We tried setting it at 68, 70, and 72, but all 3 of these resulted in a loud buzzing noise and mechanical churning noises, so we’d just unplug it immediately before going to sleep. Staff were extremely helpful when there was confusion over the identity of our taxi to LaGuardia Airport, and solved the situation quickly and effectively. Definitely recommend staying here if you’re visiting New York City, lovely decor and comfy rooms, just make sure you ask for a room with quiet AC!

title: Ideal location and extremely comfortable
text: Ideal location, lovely hotel, spotless and extremely comfortable.  Stayed with my daughter for her 30th birthday the hotel left sparkling wine and chocolates in the room and a card for our arrival. So close to everywhere, just around the corner from Times Square. Subway at the end of the road, bars and restaurants all around. Staff all very nice and friendly and helpful. Shout out to Floyd the concierge for sorting our taxi to the airport. We had been told about the tourist tax but were surprised about the deposit too. Rooftop bar views were fab and we did go into the adjoining bar and restaurant which was very nice. Again can't fault the staff as they were lovely throughout. Nice touch to have a fridge and decent size free safe. Would definitely recommend 👌 thank you kixby x

title: A very good hotel!
text:
Fantastic location, just one block away from the Empire State Building and a couple of blocks from Times Square. The hotel decor was lovely and our room was beautiful and well equipped! The room and hotel was really clean. The two free bottles of water per day were very appreciated in the heatwave we found ourselves in. The staff we encountered were pleasant but we were disappointed to find even though we attended at check in time (4pm) we still had a 20 minute wait+ for a room to become available. Also, it was also surprise that they took $250 security deposit when you check in as this hadn’t been mentioned when booking which didn’t end up being refunded until a couple of days after check out. Furthermore, the lifts are really small and slow and at times we had to wait 10-15 minutes for one to become available for you to use which was not a massive issue for us but could be for anybody with mobility issues. 

We did visit the black tap (the burger restaurant) joined on the hotel which was fantastic (I have reviewed this separately). 

All in all, the kixby was a a really good hotel, it was just held back by the couple of issues mentioned above.

title: Fantastic stay would recommend
text:
Excellent location, boutique hotel just off 5th Avenue in the Korean district. Room was tastefully decorated, compact but containing everything you need including great walk-in shower, tea/coffee machine, king size bed, safe, mini fridge, plentiful draw & wardrobe space and air conditioning.  Room cleaned, fresh towels and tea/coffee replenished daily.  Other facilities free to occupants were on 2nd floor (opposite the lifts) small gym with peloton bike etc and a free tea & coffee room with ice machine and computer with printer for guest use.. Excellent roof top bar (The Look Up). We were on the 9th floor room 905 with a speculator view of the Empire State Building especially at night when lit. The only negative we found with our room was the really loud street noise ie rubbish collections at midnight, building works and general traffic noise.  We resorted to buying earplugs to sleep .  Maybe secondary glazing would help to block out street noise. We found the 
staff friendly and accommodating. Having free baggage storage after check out at 11am was a bonus.

title: Did the job
text:
My friend and I stayed here at the end of august / start of September. Overall the hotel was suitable for what we needed. The room was clean however it was not very spacious. The decor was beautiful and I loved the brand of toiletries that were provided by the hotel. 
We stayed in room 302 and the air conditioning unit was extremely loud and unfortunately kept us up every night. We complained about this however we were told to just turn it off which during a heat wave was not an option. The engineer (who was very helpful) attended and explained to us that the noise was normal. We have both stayed in many different hotels and have never experienced the air conditioning unit being so loud. 
We went up to the roof top bar which was stunning and the view of the Empire State Building was amazing so would highly recommend taking a trip up. 
Finally we checked out at 11am and our flight wasn’t until 11pm in the evening. We were able to keep our luggage in the hotel which was a huge help however when we returned we went to the back corner of the reception out of the way of any traffic to sort ourselves and put our shopping into our cases. We were quickly moved into the very small and dark toilets as we were not allowed to quickly get ourselves together. This was extremely disappointing and if that is the case then there should be somewhere for people to go to allow them some time to sort out their belongings. Overall the hotel was a good location and a place to lie our heads at night but would consider other hotels next time.

title: Fab at fifty!
text:
We stayed at the Kixby, for 6 nights in August for my 50th birthday. There were 4 of us and we had 2 adjoining rooms on the 4th floor above the main entrance. I only noted noise on 1 night, probably too tired the rest of the time and wasn't bothered by the Aircon but I sleep with a fan on at home. 
Our room was slightly bigger than the other, both lux king, but both perfectly suitable for our needs. Clean with daily service, purposeful bathroom and a great touch for my birthday from the team.
We didn't have much reason to speak to reception but on the occasions we did they were polite and helpful and friendly. We were booked for bed and breakfast and made full use of this but  when I return I will book a room only and explore the city. We had 2 rooms, therefore 2 charges of $250 were held pending on my credit card and we paid a half day fee to keep one of the rooms until 3pm on our last day to give us somewhere to change, use the bathroom etc this was taken from the deposit and the rest cancelled within 48 hours of our checkout.
We generally used the subway a lot because my partner is awaiting a knee replacement but it was so handy a few yards from the hotel. We took advantage of the ESB being so close and visited there on our first night and also ate in The black Tap attached to the Kixby on our first night which was very tasty, didn't manage to try the shakes though. 
We would definitely stay again, the location is perfect, between 5th and 6th Avenue within easy walking distance of many attractions and away from Times Square which I wanted. Great trip overall, I will be back!

title: Lovely hotel, great staff and location
text: Great location with this hotel, we stayed in a luxury double which was a nice size. The rooms were well serviced with fresh bottles of water every day. The room had amazing air conditioning, this is via a unit in the room so you can hear it but easily blocked out by some ears plugs 😊. Breakfast was included in our package, there are lots of options locally if you don’t want to stay in the hotel, we opted one day to go to Friedman’s about a 6 minute walk away which was lovely as an alternative. At the hotel you can expect juice, fruit, bagels, muffins, cereals & yoghurts all fresh and well presented great to set you up for the day. Hotel staff were very helpful, rooftop bar was a bonus with great views of Empire State and Macy’s nice to relax at the end of day. Would recommend and should we visit NY again would definitely choose the Kixby Hotel.

title: First Class Experience
text: From check in to check out my experience was first class.  The room was excellent in every way and a good size for New York.  I wouldn’t hesitate in recommending this hotel.  I would like to make a special mention of the reception team, in particular Illa who was extremely helpful to me.

title: Nice hotel….BUT if you book a package you are treated differently!
text:
We recently returned from our stay in New York staying at The Kixby. My second trip to NYC. 
I spent quite a while choosing the hotel as I wanted us to be centrally located but not in madness of Times Square. The location didn’t disappoint. The next street from The Empire State Building yet always a fairly quiet street after returning from a day exploring.  
On arrival I didn’t realise check in was as late as 4pm so after a long journey from the UK it was disappointing not be able to check in earlier. I just assumed it would be around 2pm which seems reasonable. 4pm is quite late, especially when you have to check out at 11am. 
I paid the tourist tax, which I was
aware of before we arrived. I was not aware of the upfront $250 deposit, but paid this on a debit card. In every other hotel I’ve ever stayed in card details are kept to debit any charges at the END of the stay, not before, yet here they took the $250 off the card there and then & it didn’t get returned to my account until days after I returned to the UK, which wasn’t ideal.
The hotel itself is nice. It’s clean & designed well. Once you get used to using the key card to operate the lift it’s easy to get to your floor.
The refreshment room is a nice touch where you can get tea, coffee etc. there is a gym next door. 
The rooftop bar area is lovely. The view of the Empire State Building is stunning.

We liked the hotel but won’t be returning. 
I have travelled a lot and was very disappointed by the customer service (not staff on reception, housekeeping etc, they were fine), but the ‘office’ customer service. 
I emailed them months before our stay to ask for a twin room as I was travelling with my adult child for their birthday (I’d organised & paid for the trip as a surprise). 
I was told that because I had booked the trip via BA I was unable to make changes! I’ve absolutely no idea why 🤷🏻‍♀️
I responded that I was fully prepared to pay any additional costs, but I really needed a twin room, which I knew the hotel had. Again, I was told this wasn’t possible, despite being prepared to pay.
I had no choice but to accept the room with the one bed as I had already paid and couldn’t afford to change the booking and lose the money.
The room we were given was very small (with one bed). The housekeeping are great though, and attended every day of our stay.

The last sting in the tail for me was that other people arrived during our stay and were upgraded to much bigger rooms, without asking, for free!! 
I was prepared to pay, I wasn’t expecting anything for free, yet was told this wasn’t possible, yet other people arrived and were just given alternative rooms! For this reason we will not be returning to the Kixby. I am already planning our next NYC holiday & it won’t be here. The hotel is busy enough not to care, but equally there are 100’s, probably 1000’s, of hotels in New York. It’s a saturated market with lots of choice and customer service is always at the top of the list for most people, so the hotel should bear that in mind in such a competitive market.

title: Kixby we love you
text:
Utterly amazing hotel.
From checking in, to checking out, 5 days later, the staff were truly kind and very helpful.
Great location in midtown, noisy, bustling but with beds this comfy you'll easily drop off to sleep.
Our Lux Queen room (804), was well appointed, spotless, modern, comfortable with a view to die for. A perfect view of the ESB from my bed!
Robes, umbrellas, USB charging points, mini fridge, coffee maker were all good additions.
We stayed BB board so had the pleasure of the delicious breakfast each morning (7-10am), great choice of pastries, muffins, fruit, cheeses, etc...topped up with a good coffee or two!
Black Tap, is attached to The Kixby and it serves delicious burgers and milkshakes, these are not to be missed!
Rooftop bar was epic with a fantastic view of the ESB, perfect for an evening cocktail.
This hotel is a great choice and would definitely stay here again.

title: Happy memories
text:
Actually came here when it was the Metro Hotel back in 2010.  Spent our engagement in NY over valentines.  This hotel was great for being close to Times Sq and was central for most of the attractions in NY. If you’re up for a walk, then Central Park and Battery Pk is walkable.  If not…use the underground. 

Hotel 10/10.  Great staff and room were great then.  Look even more amazing now.

title: Perfect hotel
text: we have just stayed at this hotel for 10 nights . The location is enviable with the subway under the hotel that connects you everywhere and Times Square a 5-minute walk away. The room was very nice and well furnished (we had a luxury king) but unfortunately a little noisy due to the non-adjustable air conditioner and the power of the fans. The rooftop located on the 12th floor was spectacular and offered a truly enviable view of the Empire State Building. I recommend this hotel for families and couples . thank you for hosting us.

title: No sleep for 5 nights
text: Lovely hotel, excellent location but the rooms are very very noisy at night and early morning.I would not stay here again due to the fact I like to have a goodnight rest  ready to start the next day full of engery.

title: First Stay at Kixby
text:
Just returned from a 5 night stay at Kixby for my son’s 21st birthday.  I had contacted Kixby prior to arrival and was delighted to be allocated 2 lovely bright rooms on the 7th floor with bubbly, chocolates and a card wishing him a happy birthday.  

Hotel is centrally located next to a subway station and close to Penn with many attractions within walking distance.   I was aware of room security deposits ($250 each room) and the per night per person Facilities fee so although it’s an unwanted added initial expense, didn’t come as a shock. 

Roof top bar is worth a visit particularly in the evening as it has a spectacular view of Empire State Building;  staff in bar were so friendly and helpful.

We were very fortunate with our room allocation as they were quiet and spacious, I note  from other reviews this isn’t always the case but couldn’t have been happier.  

Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly return.

title: Great hotel unlucky with our rooms
text: We had a lovely stay in the Kixby, the hotel is in a great position 10-15 minutes walk from Times Square.. The hotel has the roof bar with amazing views, and a cool bar and restaurant on the ground floor… Our Rooms were 201 & 202 our floor had the gym and the tea and coffee room which was great, but if I went back I wouldn’t take these rooms one was tiny and very noisy and the other a bit soul less, when we checked in the lady said if your not happy we can move you tomorrow, I gather from that that these aren’t the best rooms, we had 3 nights so stayed put … Would I stay again, yes I would but not in 201 & 202 .

title: Perfect hotel for our stay - highly recommend
text:
We stayed here for a birthday trip and I’m so glad we did! 
Room was lovely with nice decor. It’s not spacious but that’s exactly what we wanted as we only planned on sleeping and washing there! 
Rooms are clean with plenty of storage for clothes. Also a fridge in the drawers which came in handy. 
There was noise from outside but not too much and I wouldn’t be the best sleeper with noise, but I did sleep here. 
We went to the roof top bar 2 nights for drinks.  The view of the Empire State Building especially as it turns dark is beautiful. Highly recommend going up for one drink. They also do non alcoholic cocktails too. 
Staff were very friendly and helpful from the minute we arrived and until we left. 
Location is perfect! Literally on empire state buildings door step. We mostly walked to all of the sights we wanted to see, but we did use the subway and there is a stop at the end of the street, which also was useful. 

Only negative was the cards for the lifts, others also had problems one lift seemed to accept our card but that could be one of those things or human error on our behalf. 

If I’m lucky enough to travel to New York again I will be staying here again. 
I honestly can’t recommend this hotel enough. 

Thank you to the Kixby hotel for a fantastic stay.

title: Friendly, well placed, well priced, well designed and comfortable beds!  NYC at its Finest :-)
text:
So now the Jet Lag has worn off I've got the energy to write a proper review of the Kixby, the TL:DR is that the place is wonderful,

Day 1 - Easy to find, although the surrounding street is busy with the restaurant next door it was no problem getting in.  Check-in was quick, polite, and informative, first impressions were excellent and then we had also been upgraded from two King to two Queen rooms.  I also even got a call after check-in with something reception realized they hadn't told me.

The Rooms - Spacious, well equipped, three lamps in the room, and all had USB sockets along with three pin US wall sockets so felt safe and secure even when using a UK to US convertor.  

I even found a bottle of Wine waiting for me along with a lovely note for my Birthday (celebrating my 40th a few days later) this was a lovely gesture, while I don't drink another member of the family made sure it didn't go to waste :-) 

The rest of the stay - A pleasant greeting from every member of staff, the housekeeping team was polite, friendly, and efficient.  Cleanliness was excellent throughout our stay.  

The air conditioning in 511 was very effective and although it took a bit of getting used to the noise was actually very quiet for an AC Unit as big as it was.  Unfortunately, the unit in 520 was a fair bit noisier, however, it was just as efficient.  

The view from the roof of the hotel is excellent, seeing the Empire State Building that close was quite a fun experience.  The bar also seemed to be popular, although I will admit I didn't really make use of it.

The only slight hiccups we encountered were resolved with a quick call to reception, in fact, the only negative we can report is that the breakfast on paper plates and plastic cutlery with limited options wasn't what we'd expected.  However, we are aware that as the hotel doesn't have it's own kitchen it is limited in what it can provide.

If your traveling with Virgin then taking the Air Train from JFK to Jamaica station followed by the LIRR to Penn Station is by far the easiest (but not cheapest) option.

Overall, I can think of no reasons not to stay at the Kixby, and if you are reading this wondering if it's a good place to stay IT DEFINITELY IS!  DO IT :-)

title: Nice Hotel in a good location.
text:
Overall a very nice Hotel. Free Wi-Fi, coffee and two water bottles a day. Friendly and helpful staff.
The Subway is just a few steps away.
Two negative things:
The nights were loud (thin/old windows) and parts of the room were dusty.
Would recomend it.

title: Above & beyond
text: We have stayed at Kixby a number of times before and always loved our stays. We were due to stay again this week but unfortunately due to a family death we had to cancel last minute. The Kixby were incredibly understanding and I really appreciate their help, especially Angela & Devika. We’ll definitely be back again soon

title: Quite stylish, friendly staff, but pricey
text: Ok, so the place is well situated and the staff are really friendly. We stayed in a room with a King Size bed which was quite nice but small. Well equipped. There was some care and attention with coffees and bathroom gifts. But the air con was old and very noisy ti the point where you couldn’t have it on at night and nights were very warm indeed. Also the noise from the air con machine outside was noisy throughout our stay.  The breakfast which is $21 is very average with breads and fruit and yogurt. The gym is well equipped but small. The bar is very dark and hip hop is played which didn’t give a good ambience. There is a $20 gov tax every day to add to the bill as well as your breakfast if you eat there. Drinks in the roof too served in plastic cups and very pricey. NYC is just very pricy atm so if you go get to Williamsburg where the bars are plenty and the food much cheaper.

title: Lovely hotel in great location but disappointed with breakfast and bar
text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Our room was small but really quiet, which is what we asked for at the back. The bed was comfortable and we slept well and the shower and toiletries were great. The roof bar view is amazing but the service is disappointing and drinks mega expensive. The hotel location is great and central for everything, with a metro very close. Breakfast was really poor - pastry based and bad coffee all served in paper cups and plates. Actually it’s not served as it’s self service - lots of great breakfast options near by and much cheaper, we liked Andrews Diner.  Front of House staff were very pleasant. We would stay again.

title: Lovely hotel and would stay again
text: We actually stayed in late November/December 2021 and I neglected to leave a review. Hotel was lovely and we had a great stay. It was still in the covid era so things were a little different and the rooftop bar wasn’t open but we were aware of that before we booked. The staff were lovely and could t do enough. There was a self service breakfast in a separate room, with coffee, muffins and fruit which was a lovely touch. Lovely toiletries in the bathroom and a fabulous shower. The room was big enough for 2 and spotlessly clean. We had a great stay. The hotel is centrally located to everything we wanted to see and do. Would definitely recommend.

title: Week at the kixby
text: Had a week in New York and stayed at the kixby, the hotel was excellent lovely clean rooms and very central for all the attractions, I would however give the rooftop bar a miss as drinks were very expensive and of poor quality when it came to the cocktails, also non residents are allowed in and were very noisy and loud. Can't fault the actual hotel and staff as both were excellent

title: A highly enjoyable stay
text:
We were a honeymoon couple and treated to a lovely bottle of champagne with chocolates and a handwritten note.

The room was small, but that's not unusual in NYC. It was clean, tidy, with a great shower and all amenities you need, including a mini-fridge which you DON'T need to pay extra for - a rarity in far too many places in America! 

Location is absolutely brilliant, a 2 minute walk from the nearest Metro station, which is only one stop away from Times Square - or, if you prefer, around a 10-15 min walk. The hotel is attached to 'Black Tap', who offer excellent food, and there are a range of other good places to eat and drink nearby as well. We recommend The Liberty. The rooftop bar is a cool place but very expensive even by NYC standards.

So why only 4*? Well, unfortunately, the air-con was temperamental. It was either off entirely or on at full blast and very loud. There were controls on the unit itself but they didn't do anything, as it was instead controlled by a wall thermometer. Changing it one degree (F) seemed to be the difference between having it on or having it off entirely; it was impossible to have it at a 'low' level. 

NYC itself is constantly noisy and busy, so the air-con in and of itself is not disrupting an otherwise quiet paradise, but it was frustrating. Maybe we were just unlucky with the unit.

Despite that, I'd have no hesitation in recommending the Kixby to anyone looking to stay in NYC.

title: August 2023
text:
Brilliant location and ideally situated for getting about NY.
The rooms are small but adequate.
The gym consists of two peloton bikes, two treadmills and some free weights.
One small downside to our stay, we had to vacate our room by 11am , which is standard, but was told that we weren’t able to drink in the hotel lobby ( their own tea/ coffee) whilst waiting for our taxi.

title: Honeymoon Stay
text: We had a fantastic stay at the Kixby for our honeymoon. It is in an excellent location and only a short walk to Times Square. Our room was clean and spacious! All staff were very helpful and we visited the rooftop bar which was lovely, it gives a great view of Empire State. Thank you Kixby!

title: Short break in NY at the Kixby Hotel
text: Just returned from a great 4-day stay at the Kixby Hotel to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. Loved the hotel which was perfectly located for everything we wanted to do in NY. We had a lovely spacious room on the 4th floor away from the lifts which was really quiet. We particularly liked the rooftop bar which we visited every evening with amazing views of the Empire State Building. Room was serviced every day. Staff were friendly and there was a diner attached to the hotel for convenient meals. We thought it was excellent value for money and the mid-town Manhattan location was perfect. Easy access from JFK airport to Penn Station (very close to the hotel) via the Airtrain and Long Island Rail Road. Would recommend this boutique hotel for a short stay in Manhattan.

title: Perfect location in central NYC
text:
A great modern hotel in central NYC, right next to the Empire State Building and Macy’s. It’s very close to a number of subway stations so easy access to anywhere in the city.
Our bedroom was on the 3rd floor at the back, and unfortunately had the constant outside noise from what was perhaps heating/air con unit.
 Very friendly helpful and knowledgeable staff. 
Would highly recommend, but request a room on the higher up floors of the hotel.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
A group of couples and friends stayed here over 6 rooms.  All of us agreed it's a lovely hotel.  The rooms are decorated nicely and very clean, pretty good size as well considering we're in New York.  Location is fantastic with a great view of the Empire State Building from the roof top bar. 10 min walk to Times Square and various subway lines within a short distance.

Only thing I would say bring ear plugs as it can be fairly noisy at night/early morning.  

I would stay here again.

title: Small but perfectly placed!
text: Good size hotel, well placed for everything with the metro  just steps away. The spotlessly clean rooms are a little on small side (Luxury Queen ) but perfect for relaxing after along day sightseeing. The 2nd floor offers free tea and coffee making facilties 24/7 and a computer with printer, all of which we used. The roof top garden in the shadow of the Empire State Building is perfect spot for a take away breakfast or coffee and from 4pm opens as bar for over 21s only.  But its the staff that make this hotel special, nothing was too much trouble. A special mention to Inna, Natalia and Stan on reception and the hard working bellhops Jose and Saul. Cant wait to come back.

title: Good Location
text:
Recommended by our UK travel agent for four-day sight-seeing trip to NY prior to a 7-day UK return on Queen Mary 2.

Room was at the rear of the hotel so no problem with noise. Room spacious, well-furnished and well serviced by housekeeping with usual facilities and a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine on arrival. 

Hotel is conveniently located about mid-way between Battery Park, (for Statue of Liberty), and Central Park, (for Metropolitan Museum etc) and almost adjacent to the Empire State Building and Macy’s.

For anyone not familiar with New York be aware that the Kixby is a ‘tall’ rather narrow 12-story hotel located on a busy, bustling street of similar tall, ‘thin’ buildings, some used as hotels/restaurants but others as commercial/industrial premises. Kixby rooms may be on higher floors and access to these, for all but the very athletic, is via a lift not the stairs.

I imagine, like many NY hotels, there is no swimming pool, gym etc: and only a limited outlook from the rooms. This is a city hotel, I should think aimed predominantly at visitors like us, there to see the ‘sights’ and wanting a comfortable place to ‘flop’ in the evening after being out all day. 

Our package did not include breakfast (available at and extra US$19.50), which, as 'big' breakfast eaters we found at one of the well-reviewed local bakeries, a five minute walk away. 

The convenient location, and the roof top bar, which gives access to some outside space and fresh air, in what is a very urban area, makes this hotel recommendable.

title: Great Location
text: The Kixby location is great for visitors.  The room appeared to be recently updated.  There are several shopping options within walking distance such as the huge Macy's on 34th/Herald Square as well as several restaurants.  The rooftop view of the Empire State Building at night is really nice.  A subway station is close so just a short walk to get around the city.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Comfortable hotel
text:
Hotel is well located near to Macys and close to a wide range of restaurants 
Comfortable room on 12th floor. Tidy and clean. Staff were both pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was a bit basic but did the job. 
Would have no problem in recommending it

title: Our go to New York Hotel
text:
I’ve been to New York 5 times and stayed in various hotels but this is my favourite based in quality of the room and the location. We were upgraded to a bigger room which was indeed big especially taking into account the size of most New York Hotel rooms. The bed was very comfy and the shower in particular was impressive. Has everything you’d expect from a hotel room safe, fridges, iron, hair dryer etc. 

Location is right next to the Empire State Building and Macy’s. Also is just a few steps away from the Herald Square Subway Station, which from our experience can get you pretty much anywhere you’d want to go. We went as far as Coney Island, Yankee stadium and pretty much everywhere in between on direct trains from this station. 

Breakfast is pretty much what it says (a continental breakfast) a choice of bread for toasting a range of bagels and two types of cereals, fruit etc. Perhaps could have had a more exciting choice of cereals and it’s served on paper plates/bowls with plastic cutlery. 

Staff are great and friendly. Would recommend and would stay again.

title: First Visit to New York and The Kixby
text:
What a lovely hotel..

We visited New York over our anniversary and 30th Birthday, The Kixby had a bottle of fizz waiting on our arrival wishing us a happy belated birthday and Anniversary which was a lovely touch. The hotel is well decorated and immaculate, the staff are very friendly and happy to help. The location is fantastic, subway at the end of the road and walkable to most of the famous tourist attractions, the first being times square. Rooms are great with powerful shower, queensize bed, coffee Machine and the rooftop bar is nice to have a drink at.

We would definitely return to this hotel. 

Thank you for a lovely stay

title: Wonderful experience - would return!
text:
The only reservation about this place is that the room Aircon is quite noisy, but no issue if you manage it adequately.  Beyond this minor quibble, a great place to stay. The staff are helpful, friendly and sincerely polite; the rooms are comfortable, modern in design without going over the top and well appointed. The shower in my room was a marvel - essentially a miniature wet room.  
Points of note:
1.  They will ask for a 250 dollar deposit on a credit card (only) on arrival against any charges, refunded on departure if not used. 
2. Breakfast is not included unless you have it as part of a package; otherwise it is 19.50 plus taxes per day. It's European continental buffet style and bakery heavy, so no good for coeliacs like me. 
3. The absolute winner here is the rooftop bar "The Lookup". The staff are again an asset but the absolute clincher is the view of the

title: Disappointing!
text:
Great location! 
Smallest room ever - for a 5 night stay you certainly didn’t want to stay in the room - which we had 2 days of storms and made it hard work! 
Forget breakfast it was awful! 
The bar on the rooftop is ok and the view was really good - but not a great atmosphere for a rooftop bar! 
Some great eateries on the same street and the next street so don’t waste your time staying in the hotel for food!

title: Good Hotel, Good Location.
text: Staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. Smaller hotel but this was better. Just around the corner was a great breakfast/food  place called Toast on 6th Avenue. We got the LIRR train from JFK to Penn Station and walked to hotel. Good location with subway outside hotel.Recommended. Martin And Jackie from Scotland.

title: A good clean New York hotel option if your exploring the city.
text:
A good functional city centre hotel. We stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary for 4 nights in a Lux King room.  The hotel was clean & we had a good sized room and we had no noise issues like others have said from the lifts. However you can hear the city outside the room. The hotel’s location is amazing as you can walk to most of the main sights. We hardly had any contact from the staff partly as we where out most of the day when we did talk to the front desk team they where ok and most of the time friendly, as other have noted they will not give you early access to your room, we did not find this a issue and just enjoyed the city for a hour or so but if with family may be worth noting.
The whole time we stayed there was no recognition that it was our anniversary (it was all over our booking). This was a bit disappointing as something to note it would have maid our stay more special.

So to end, if your looking for a good clean hotel to crash in and explore the city this is a good option.

title: Stylish & Friendly Boutique hotel
text:
We have stayed in New York as lot, mainly Soho Grand.  After our stay at Soho Grand last September we were disappointed so wanted to try something new.  Looking for mid town location for a change, boutique non chain hotel we stumbled upon Kixby.  Very well located and very reasonably priced so booked a Lux King for our 10 nights.

Warmly greeted at reception by Inna and we upgraded to a suite (maybe a lux  family room - 2 bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen sink in the lobby etc. Suited us more as one would be working form the room part of our stay.

Delighted in the room size and feel - very stylish .  Great top end toiletries int he bathroom (replenished every day), 3 coffee/tea makes and were set.

Could see ESB  from the master bedroom and the light noise from the traffic made it clear we were in NYC and that is surely what gusts want ?  To know they are in the heart of the city that never sleeps .
