Rooftop bar was a huge draw. The friendly manager/supervisor took care of us especially during the Drag PRIDE event which was SO much fun.  We loved it.

Also worth mentioning the Black Tap bar and kitchen - great service and the food is divine. We used it a lot.  

The shining star of this long visit has to the be the friendly, professional, attentive staff.  Also present and always helpful.  Inna stands out and deserves an accolade.  Every day we saw her she checked on us to see if we had everything we needed or could she help.  Amazing asset to have in such a boutique hotel.  We requested a late checkout and it was processed at a very decent rate.

I dont recognise any of the review that make a point of elevator noise, street nouse (see comment about being in mid town NYC !) rats or lack of housekeeping. Your suite was kept immaculate  as were all the other public areas of the hotel.

This will be now our hotel of choice when visiting NYC - thanks Inna and Kixby you over delivered on our expectations.

title: Very poor
text: Hotel location is good, noisy though we had room 1004 we literally had to shoulder our room door to enter and wrench it to leave. Breakfast options poor, ate off paper/plastic plates using plastic cutlery. Restaurant of hotel next door has rats freely running around outside.

title: Great base while exploring NYC
text:
Wow, what a great hotel tucked away up a side street.
Great location, room lovely, staff very attentive.  Continental breccy was OK,  tea and coffee machine on room and also supplied on level 2 for free 24/7.
Would definitely recommend this place.

title: Excellent
text:
Just back from a week at the Kixby , all staff extremely friendly and helpful,  room cleaned and towels changed daily, smallish room but not too bad and it's New York so room size at a premium, large storage closet and decent safe ( Digital and easy to use) Tremendous view of the Empire State Building from the roof bar, drinks quite expensive up there but worth it. Bar next door which is connected to the hotel not so good, dark, very pricey and the beer, to be honest,  was absolutely awful,  only used it once.
Location is absolutely spot on , a great base for all the touristy things and shopping.
We were lucky to have a room at the back of the hotel and were not troubled at all by noise from the street, slept very well in the large and comfortable bed.
All in all an excellent experience.

title: Could not have asked for better!
text: Kixby was fantastic! The best was the absolute most comfortable bed I've slept in, and the bedding was divine. We were in Room 914 for five nights and we could not have chosen a better spot. The Black Tap restaurant has fantastic food (chicken fingers with the three dips are to die for) and the front desk staff was wonderful too. You couldn't ask for a better location. The only (small) drawback was that they were replacing wallpaper on our floor and you could smell glue as soon as you left the room and walked to the elevator - small price to pay for a great stay. We will be back, Kixby!

title: Excellent location and great hotel
text:
Really nice hotel, everything you need after a day exploring, a powerful shower, a comfy bed and a coffee machine.
Absolutely brilliant location for the subway and close to everything, 
Glad we stayed here  and would love to stay again if we visited NY in the future

title: Enjoyed our stay - would stay again
text:
The Kixby was exactly as we expected from the information on it's website and reviews.  We were not disappointed.  Stylish and unfussy and in a convenient location.  

The room was large and spacious.  We had a deluxe kingsize bed - very comfortable.  The bathroom was a little small but fine.  It had a good shower.  We were not disturbed by any noise in the corridor or other guests when in our room.  There were city noises but these are part of NYC.  We could see the Empire State Building from our window on the 11th floor.  Amazing!    As it was out of season the rooftop bar was closed but the area was open so we had it to ourselves to view the ESB even more clearly.   The fridge and heater/AC were quite noisy.  We turned them off but you may not be able to do that in the summer

We didn't eat in the restaurant and I think the bar was closed.  As others have said, one lift always out of order but we didn't find this a problem.  

Check in was simple although later in the afternoon than we expected so we had to hang out in Herald Square for a bit.  The hotel staff were happy to store our luggage until we could check in.

All staff friendly enough.   All public areas and the bedroom very clean.  Wi-fi not a problem. 

I was not happy with the resort tax.  We did not want to use the gym so it worked out as an expensive way to pay for 2 bottles of water a day and hot drinks in the room.  There was a bottle of rose and some chocolates and a nice card when we arrived.  A nice touch and appreciated, however, I think we paid for it with the resort tax.  NB a deposit is taken upon check in.  This is quickly paid back when you check out.

Location is really good.  Easy walk to Broadway/42nd St/Times Square/Empire State Building/Madison Square Garden/Macys/5th Avenue. 
 We ate at Andrew's NYC diner and the Tic Toc diner for breakfast.  Only a block or two away.  

We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.

title: Overall a good place to stay
text: Good Location , walking distance to most tourist attractions . Well maintained , rooms clean, shower could have been cleaner for my liking .  I had requested a  quiet room at the back of the hotel which was granted . One lift was a bit hit and miss but it wasn’t a busy time when using it so no major issues .  Staff very friendly and efficient . Breakfast was basic but well presented .  The deposit retained on my debit card was returned within minutes of checking out . Overall a good place to stay .

title: Not for me thanks
text:
Never again, had a room right opposite the lift, binging all day long. Staff indifferent, refused to release the room until bang on 4pm even though I was poorly. 
Tried the food one evening, basic short order and quite keen on getting a tip for delivering a burger from the bar to our table. 
Good points, if you want to be central this is the place, easy in walking to most attractions just avoid room 10 on any floor. 
In the morning the staff take one lift out of service for themselves, all patrons have to manage with one lift or use the stairs

title: Not for everyone
text: Didn’t like this hotel from the moment I got there, I was there 45 mins before checkin was allowed sorry your room isn’t ready yet it wasn’t like 2-3 hours before I was tied from being up nearly 24 hours go for a walk and come back in a bit so I got back and was given my room 2nd floor room 203 was very noisy at night you couldn’t sleep because of the noise house keeping is a hit and miss I put my sign on the outside door to say I wish my room to be cleaned,nothing for the first 3 days so I had to go and ask for clean towels this isn’t a budget hotel but that’s what I got the king size room wasn’t any bigger than your bedroom at home.the closet for your clothes and suit case was tiny I ended up checking out first thing Tuesday morning to come home to get some sleep there are way better hotels in the city for the price you pay.

title: Lovely Hotel for City Break
text: Lovely quiet room , really  comfortable bed and soft plump pillows ,just what you need to sink into after a busy sightseeing day.  Good shower . All very clean . Staff very helpful . Black Tap bar next door very good , fast food but good . However roof top bar a little pretentious, and very expensive.

title: Comodo e pulito
text:
Camera ampia e pulita, per essere a NY.
Posizione comoda, sia per muoversi a piedi, che per prendere la metropolitana. 
Pur essendo vicino a Times Square e alla sua vita frenetica, la qualità del sonno è stata buona.
Inoltre l'hotel ha un bel rooftop, con una bella vista sull'Empire

title: Perfect stay in NYC!
text: We came here for my fiancés 30th birthday surprise and it did not disappoint! It was our first time visiting New York and we loved every second. We stayed at the Kixby for 4 nights and we don’t have a bad word to say. The rooms were stylish, clean and the beds were super comfortable! Perfect location with lots to see and do in walking distance, including the Empire State Building, Times Sq and Grand Central. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and always greeted us with a smile. A trip that we will remember for a lifetime! 🤍✨

title: anniversary trip
text: we stayed in April for our 50th wedding anniversary and it didn't disappoint. really central, 5 mins or so from penn station and madison sq Gardens one way and 10 mins from time sq!! Room was  large for new york. very clean. staff couldn't do enough for you. really enjoyed our stay

title: Anniversary trip
text:
Excellent location. Really big room for new york, very clean lovely bathroom. Staff very friendly.  Few minutes walk from Penn station and maddison sq gardens.  Times sq about 10 mins the other way! 
50th anniversary well celebrated.  Certainly go back!!!!

title: Superb located hotel
text: Stayed there for four nights. The hotel is around 8 minute walk to Penn station, so is easy to get to and from JFK. Get the air train to Jamaica station then the king island road train to Penn station. Is around 45 minute journey give it take and much cheaper than getting a taxi or Uber.  There is a subway station in the same street of the hotel, though I preferred to use Penn station for where I went. There is plenty of places to eat either at the hotel, the same street or elsewhere. Can also buy bits and pieces from the 7/11. It is ideally located for access too Times Square, Bryant park, Central Park, top of the rock, summit one, high line, Hudson court and more. All within walking distance. Central Park is quite a walk away so factor this in. I stayed on the 8th floor and the room was fantastic . It was very clean, spacious and comfortable. I didn’t find it noisy though was situated towards the back. Hotel facilities are top notch and staff are friendly and helpful. If you got to the very top of the hotel there is an amazing view of the Empire State Building also. Price wise is okay for the location and could get cheaper but then there would be other costs to think about. All in all I fully recommend staying here and will happily go there again.

title: Highly recommended
text:
We had stayed at this hotel many times when it was the Metro so were a little worried that it wouldn't be as good. 
It was great. Lovely size room, big for New York, really comfy bed and coffee machine with pods stocked up every day. Great staff. 
No issues at all. Towels changed daily and toiletries replenished. Highly recommended.

title: Very comfortable
text: Great location,  very comfortable bed,complimentary bottle of wine on arrival, bath robes. A great stay. Very welcoming at reception and helpful throughout. Have luggage storage. Some renovation going on but didn't impact our stay. Would definitely return

title: Excellent location but avoid room 10 on all floors opp the lifts
text:
Let’s start with the good stuff first.
The Hotel is perfectly sited for those who like to walk to stuff. Empire State Building is just around the corner as is Macy’s. Easy stroll to Central Park and we even hoofed it to the two memorials at ground zero albeit a bit of a distance. 
Bed was fine, TV channels a bit limited and the bathroom was minuscule bearing in mind we had a Deluxe room, it did have a useable fridge and some sort of coffee pod machine too and a nice view of some brick walls.
Bad bits
On arrival about 12 noon after about 20 hours of travel /awake and a terrible flight the reception staff refused to release the room until dead on 4pm. 
We literally fell into bed…. that was until we heard two loud ‘bings’ only then did we realise our ‘deluxe’ room was bang opposite the lifts !. The world and his wife must have sat gabbing outside our room, the one with a paper-thin door and a do not disturb sign in it, day and night we had to sleep with ear plugs in place. NY traffic noises we can deal with, lifts that go bing in the night, nope. 
Final thing about the lifts, in the morning the cleaning staff switch one of the two lifts for their personal use so the other lift is very full, being on the 7th floor we used the stairs in the AM as it was quicker.
We did try the food one evening, it’s all short-order, not bad, I was puzzled as to why our server expected a tip for delivering a burger to the table?, isn’t that what they get paid to do, maybe its just me but I don’t tip for doing the job you are paid to do in the first place.
Anyway she got her tip as the card machine only offers a tip option and I was too tired to argue the toss. 
I’ve worked for 50+ years, never asked for a tip and would refuse if offered as it was my paid-to-do job which I did with pride.

title: Kixby
text: Lovely clean hotel all bedding lovely and room temp perfect.friendly  and very helpful staff. great location. Close to all attractions  and tube. rooms with all amenities  deffinately  return  food was lovely

title: Great hotel great location
text:
This hotel was great. Close to all the subways and walking distance to times square. Loved how convenient it was. 

The rooms where a good size for the area and roof top bar was beautiful bit never busy 

The only downside was the black bags on the road outside but its normal all over newyork and sadly nothing the hotel can do

title: Short stay experience of New York
text: Clean comfortable, and extremely well situated in the centre of Manhattan. Empire State Building, Penn Station and Times Square close by. Breakfast was a buffet style affair but a good selection on offer.

title: Needs TLC but handy location for shops etc and the cockroach in our room
text:
Great and friendly staff especially in the adjoining bar. But lift out of order (2 others working) in a very tired part of Manhattan with rubbish in streets and a cockroach in our room . Little cleaning in communal areas and room very small - nowhere to sit other than in bed etc.
Needs TLC upgrade but handy location for Macy’s, Broadway theatres etc. we won’t be back. Try Soho next time.

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text:
The Kixby is my favourite place to stay in New York. It’s a great location for midtown and nothing is too far. 
It’s refurbishment is fabulous and it has really bought a new style to an old favourite.
I look forward to booking again furing the next NHL season.

title: A Great Find!
text:
I absolutely loved this hotel. The staff were absolutely lovely and very helpful. Our bed (Lux King) was huge and very comfortable! Shower was amazing and room amenities were great. Room also very clean and bed made and towels changed each day. The views of the Empire State Building from the rooftop were awesome! Very central hotel, close to everything!
I would love to give this hotel 5 stars, and if there was a 4.5 star option I’d go with that. Only downside was the noise from outside. I don’t think the windows were even double glazed as it was quite drafty and being so central there were lots of sirens, beeping horns, etc. Also the blinds weren’t brilliant, as they let in a lot of light. Luckily, we came equipped with eye masks and earplugs so it wasn’t too bad!
If I come back to New York, I would most definitely stay at the Kixby again….all in all we loved it! Special mention to Floyd, what an absolute gentleman ……made sure our taxi was booked back to JFK and seemed like such a sweet person! Thank you to everyone!

title: Central location, clean hotel, but too loud
text:
We stayed at the Kixby for 4nights in March. One positive: it’s centrally located, in midtown. V close to main subway lines and walking distance to many of New York’s iconic buildings. 
One negative: it’s centrally located, in midtown. The area around the hotel is very loud. Our room was on the 5th floor at the front of the hotel, and the noise at night was unbearable. Cars beeping, construction noise in the middle of the night, etc. The windows are ineffective at blocking out sound and drafts. In over 20yrs of travelling, it was the first time we had to use earplugs to sleep. 
Staff: the staff are all lovely, welcoming, and helpful. 
Breakfast: basic breakfast of bagels, muffins, tea, coffee etc. Personally, I preferred to go to Ess-a-bagel down the road, but perfectly fine for something small to start the day. 
Room: the room was clean, bed was comfortable, lovely bathroom, good shower. A/c unit is loud. 
Overall, it’s a clean hotel, in a central location with good staff. But ask for a room at the back of the hotel if you want some sleep.

title: Ideal location. Friendly staff
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic central location round the corner from the Empire State building and round the opposite corner from Macy's! 
We had a lux King sized room which was comfortable and clean. Although we had no view I believe some rooms look onto the Empire State building itself. 
The rooftop bar wasn't open but you can still go up there for the view and we bought lunch in a cafe and ate it on the rooftop a couple of times!  
The staff were so polite and helpful and the breakfast was very good (only oddity was that it was all on paper plates!). As it was my husbands birthday the hotel gave us a bottle of sparkling wine which we appreciated.
Herald Square subway Station is about 50 metres from the hotel entrance so couldn't be handier!
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a brilliant, central location with friendly staff.

title: New york
text: Kixby hotel was very central short walk to Time Square ,Macy's Empire state building Rockafellow center all short walk subway nearby. Hotel staff friendly helpful room big and clean comfortable bed. Would recommend hotel

title: Fantastic hotel and stay!
text: Phenomenal hotel. Not one bad thing I can say. Staff are lovely and welcoming, bedrooms are spacious and are always being cleaned with fresh bedding and fresh towels. Great views of the empire state and located centrally in midtown which is perfect for tourists. I would and will be highly recommending this hotel to anyone coming to New York

title: Clean, spacious and in an ideal location
text:
Myself and my husband spent 4 nights staying at this lovely hotel for my hubby's 40th birthday celebrations and St Patricks Day.
The hotel is in a great location for tourist attractions. 

The hotel room was ideal for us. There was plenty of space in the room and bathroom. 

The hotel had a bottle of complimentary fizz on ice, for when we arrived to celebrate our 10-year wedding anniversary also. It was a really lovely touch that we appreciated.

We would most definitely stay at this hotel again if we visit New York again in the near future.

title: Perfect location, lovely hotel!
text:
Great boutique style hotel in a fabulous location, we were able to walk to nearly all of New York's main attractions. 

All staff were very friendly, rooms were very stylish and very comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate to get you going for a busy day in the city.

I would strongly recommend this hotel, only tip I would give you is to request a high room at the back of the hotel to minimise street noise.

title: Great location, average rooms, disappointing service
text:
As the other reviews all say this hotel is in an ideal midtown location for tourists, & we walked to the Empire State, Times Sq, Rockefeller & Grand Central easily from the Kixby. 

If you want great service or luxury this probably isn’t for you. It’s a decent hotel with big beds in small rooms, draughty cold windows & limited space to put anything. Long wait for a lift/elevator every single time & this was a midweek trip in February so I suspect it’s torture when it’s a busier time.

We never had a smile or a chat with any staff member, not even at check in or out. I had emailed ahead with room preferences but they didn’t take it into account. Breakfast was an overpriced grab & go so we ate out, lots of diners nearby. 

I’m short - excellent location, average room, disappointing service.

title: Smart, friendly hotel
text:
We stayed at this friendly, smart  hotel to celebrate my  husbands 60th birthday with a trip to NYC  to see Billy Joel for his March date at Madison Square Garden. The hotel kindly gave us a lovely bottle of bubbly rose on ice to mark the occaision. 
The hotel is handy for the subway and close to the Empire State Building and MSG. We had breakfast included in our deal , good selection of cereal, bagels, muffins and fruit, being constantly replenished.

Staff were very helpful.
We had a king lux room with an Empire State building view which was spacious with plenty of storage, fridge and coffee machine , the bed was comfortable and it was cleaned every day to a good standard. Solid  power shower and good quality toiletries.
It would be nice if all 3 lifts were working but there were workmen looking at the broken one while we were there. Its a busy area with some current building work nearby and not particularly quiet at night but I slept well using ear plugs. My husband slept well without. 

A good base for our first trip to NYC.

title: Disappointing service
text:
We arrived at the Kixby to a nice family room and were happy with it. However, that evening we experienced a breakdown of the heating and the temperature dropped to 62 so had to put on sweaters.  Asked manager to adjust our bill to compensate for this as my granddaughter was just recovering from a major illness and the chill air was not great.
Manager said she would look into it and on our checking out was told she was 'in a meeting'  Bill NOT adjusted.  Also, the elevator situation was a drawback as there was always at least one elevator not working. The pantry quoted in the old ads turns out to be a room with a hot water, coffee urn and cups.....nothing else. The rooftop gave a beautiful view of the empire state building and would be great for travel in the summer as there would be a bar.  The location is great.

title: Heart of NYC
text:
Right in the heart of NYC , great location for Times Square ,Broadway and Penn Station is the other side of Macy’s.
The roof top terrace is a must ,sadly the bar is open seasonally but we was welcomed to take a drink with us from the hotel’s bar upstairs. 
Walk out onto the terrace and The Empire State Building is staring you in the face.
Yes the room was cosy but had everything you needed and the whole hotel was beautifully decorated .
Burgers, beers and cake shakes ( worth a Google ) in the bar attached to the hotel is definitely worth a visit

title: Tolle Stadt, wunderbares Hotel in bester zentraler Lage
text:
Ich war in der zweiten Woche im März mit meinem Freund in New York und wir hatten das Kixby Hotel ausgesucht, da uns von mehreren Portalen die Bewertungen am besten gefallen und zugesagt hatten.

Wir wurden am Morgen unserer Ankunft direkt sehr freundlich empfangen und konnten unser Gepäck abstellen, da unser Zimmer am Vormittag natürlich noch nicht fertig war (early check-in auf Anfrage möglich). Das Hotel ist wunderbar zentral, in einer Seitenstraße mit direktem Zugang zur Metro, unmittelbar am Herald Square, Broadway und Macy’s, gelegen. Wenn man das Kixby betritt hat man den Eindruck man wird zurück versetzt in die goldenen 20er. Das ganze Hotel ist neu renoviert und trotzdem wurde der einzigartige und charmante Art déco-Stil des Hotels erhalten. 

Als wir am Nachmittag von unserem ersten Rundgang, wir sind über den Broadway am Herald Square bis zum Times Square und schließlich weiter über den Broadway bis zum Central Park gelaufen um schließlich über die 5th Avenue,  vorbei am Rockefeller Center, der St.Patricks Cathedral und dem Bryant Park, wieder zurück zum Hotel zu gelangen.

Zurück im Hotel erhielten wir unser Gepäck, als auch Informationen und Unterlagen für die Stadt, sowie einige Restauranttipps (unbezahlbar) von der wirklich sehr netten Inna an der Rezeption und ein Zimmer in der 4.Etage zum Hinterhof. Einige haben geschrieben, das die höher gelegenen Zimmer „besser“ seien wegen Lautstärke und Aussicht, das hatten wir vorher nicht berücksichtigt, aber unser Zimmer war geräumig, wir fanden den großzügigen Kleiderschrank toll und alles war sehr sauber und das Bett total komfortabel! 
Wir hatten keine Schwierigkeiten mit dem schlafen, ich habe aber die Klimaanlage nachts komplett ausgeschaltet.

Wie bereits häufiger beschrieben, findet man ein gut ausgestattetes Fitnesscenter, sowie einen Raum mit Computer, Teewasser und Tee, Kaffee und einer Eiswürfelmaschine (Eiskübel in jedem Zimmer) auf der zweiten Etage. Aber in jedem Zimmer befindet sich auch eine Kaffeemaschine mit Kaffee- und Tee, außerdem kann man das Wasser in New York ohne bedenken trinken. Die Rooftopbar ist in der Winterzeit leider geschlossen. Diese Info hatte ich aber bereits auf der Webseite gelesen.

Wir hatten in unserer Buchung das Frühstück inklusive und so haben wir den ein oder anderen Morgen einen Kaffee/Tee und einen Bagel mit Cream Cheese und etwas frisches Obst oder Fruchtjoghurt gegessen. Es gab außerdem jeden Morgen eine schöne Auswahl an Muffins und Marmelade. Für mich war das Frühstück absolut ausreichend,da ich eher selten frühstücke. Wer jedoch gern ein sehr üppiges Frühstück und eine große Auswahl genießen möchte, der sucht sich ein Restaurant aus der Liste aus ;) 

Direkt neben dem Hotel liegt ein tolles Restaurant „Black Tap“, man kann abends sehen, da die Türen zum Hotel geöffnet sind, was gegessen wird - unter anderem Burger, tolle Salate, Milchshakes zum Träumen.. wer etwas asiatisches bevorzugt, es liegt ein paar Häuser weiter ein koreanisches Restaurant „Cho Dang Gol“, wo man leider immer warten muss. Unmittelbar in der Nähe gibt es außerdem eine Rooftopbar (Monarch Rooftop oder auf Empfehlung von Inna ein paar Meter zur Refinery Rooftop Bar laufen). Mein Freund hatte am vorletzten Tag unseres Besuches Geburtstag und wir haben eine wunderbare Karte von Inna und eine Flasche Rosesekt erhalten. Mein Schatz war begeistert über diese tolle Überraschung und Aufmerksamkeit. An dieser Stelle nochmals Danke dafür!

Leider kommt der Tag der Abreise dann immer viel zu schnell, unser Gepäck wurde am Vormittag von Floyd angenommen und verstaut, er war sehr aufmerksam und hat sich auch um die Bestellung unseres Taxis gekümmert, welches uns am Nachmittag wieder zum Flughafen bringen sollte. Alles in allem war es ein wunderbarer Urlaub im schönen New York und hat es durch die tollen Mitarbeiter, wie Floyd und Inna, abgerundet und unvergesslich werden lassen. Wir würden jederzeit wieder ins Kixby kommen, wenn wir einen Trip nach New York planen.

Auch nochmal Danke an Natalia und das Housekeeping, sie haben noch Dinge gefunden, welche ich im Hotelzimmer vergessen hatte!

title: Our home away from home
text: We've been to New York 3 times and all 3 times we've stayed at the Kixby. This time for my birthday and was upgraded to a beautiful room upon check in.  All of the staff are wonderful and I mean all of them. The rooms were spotless each day, we had everything we needed and there was always a friendly doorman to greet us as we came in and out. The beds are so comfy you may not want to get out of them in the mornings! Perfect location to explore the city and we consider it our home away from home. When we return we will of course stay here again.

title: Great location but basic facilities.
text:
Great stay,
Ideally suited for most things, Empire State a stones throw away, Macy’s at the end of the street. The hotel itself was fine, room was comfortable not massive but had everything you need, was disappointed that your give paper cups for tea/coffee making not ideal. Our bathroom was freezing there seemed to be no heating in there. Towels didn’t get dry and were only replaced if put in the shower. 
Overall for 4 nights it was fine. The buffet breakfast was again ok but yet again paper cups, plates and bowls. Plus plastic cutlery!!! Just expected a bit better. 
Overall ok but would have expected a bit more for the money.

title: Location, location, location!!
text:
We stayed 4 nights at the Kixby hotel and it was amazing, the rooms were so comfortable and modern. 

The staff were friendly and helpful, housekeeping came everyday and topped up any empty toiletries and provided fresh towels.

The location of the hotel is incredible, everything is within walking distance and you’re a stone throw away from 5th Avenue and the Empire State!

The only downside is one night there was some sort of karaoke going on outside the hotel which was extremely loud and went on until about 1/2am, we were on the 2nd floor so we could hear it quite clearly (perhaps not an issue if you’re on a higher floor). Also not the fault of the hotel but definitely not ideal when you’re trying to sleep!

title: Hotel zum Wohlfühlen in zentraler Lage
text: Zentral in Nähe des Empire State Buildings gelegenes Hotel mit schöner Rooftop-Bar (Aussicht auf Empire State Building). Angenehme Atmosphäre, auch dank des sehr freundlichen Personals. Insbesondere Inna von der Rezeption ist toll und sehr freundlich! Schöne, saubere Zimmer mit guten Pflegeprodukten. Frühstück wird angeboten. Jederzeit wieder!!!

title: Right in the thick of it.
text:
Nice hotel. Right in the think of it for tourist attractions. 10 minutes walk from Empire State Building. Macy’s at the end of the street. 15 minutes walk from Time Square, and The Rockefeller Centre a further 5 minuets on. 
Hotel room comfortable and clean. Shower had see better days but made do as only there for 5 days. Not keen on the black decor but think it’s a New York thing. 
A subway station 100 yards down the street. Past subway station turn right and a lovely deli called Toast. Great food. Seating area upstairs. Nice little bar/bistro next door to hotel call the Black Tap. Also an Irish pub selling nice basic food just 100 yards up the road. 
One thing that would of been useful would of been if the reception had a small map of the area and of the subway system on the reception desk. We found a subway map on our last evening in the visitors centre in Macy’s. Absolutely no maps on the subway or on the trains letting you know where to go. Mobile phones came in very useful for this thankfully.

title: First Trip to New York
text:
Just stayed at the Kixby for 5 nights on our first trip to New York. 
It was excellent. The hotel was in a perfect location. Right in the centre of midtown which meant an almost equal distance in either direction to cover all of new New York and the big known attractions. 

South - could be walked in maybe an hour or so for the Staten Island Ferry (free and in my opinion, all you need to do to experience the statue of Liberty. 
9/11 memorial, museum, and the new One World Trade centre (👌)
Wall Street - exactly that, just a long concrete street
Brooklyn Bridge - great for a picture and view

North - easy walk to central park where you can also view the Plaza Hotel. 
The natural history museum
Trump Tower
Public library
Rockafella- top of the rock and ice-skating 

Round the hotel - the hotel is situated nicely just off 5th Avenue
Round the Corner from the Emoire State building 
The Summit One Observatory Vanderbuilt
Macy's 

An just a short walk from Times Square

Perfect location!!! 

The room was lovely and very modern. Coffee machine was superb an the best start to a day!! 

The only minor issues if any would be:
Only 2 of the 3 lifts (elevators) were working an the took far too long. Very erratic stopping at every floor. 
The A/C wasn't the easiest to work
The bar area was never opened 

Regardless - would most definitely recommend and would stay here again. 

Thanks

title: Fantastic boutique hotel in a great location
text: My partner and I stayed for a long weekend for his 40th birthday. The hotel left a bottle or champagne chilling in our room when we checked in, kicking our stay off in a lovely way. The location is superb, right next to Macy’s on Herald Sq. and a short walk to Times Sq. The hotel is brilliantly located for access to the Empire State Building, Grand Central Terminal and lots of other tourist attractions as well as in each reach of the Subway. The room was a good size for New York, spotlessly clean and good facilities including a safe, iron and coffee making facilities. There’s also an on site gym. Check-in was a little later than other places I’d stayed at 4pm, but we left our luggage and went for a walk to get our bearings. Otherwise an excellent stay with really friendly staff.

title: Fabulous…
text: I stayed at this hotel many times when it was the Metro and wanted to visit the Kixby after the refurb.  I finally made it last weekend and was not disappointed!  Refurb is gorgeous, the rooms are really lovely with all the amenities you need.  This hotel is in a great location half way between 5th and 6th Avenues, with Macy’s, Empire State Building and transit close by.  The staff are very pleasant and helpful and of course have to give a big shout out to Floyd who really looked after me.  Thank you the Kixby hotel xoxo

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: The Kixby hotel is in a great location in mid Manhattan with a subway right on the corner. The rooms are small but newly decorated, clean and has everything you need. A mini fridge, TV, safe, wardrobe, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, complimentary toiletries, air con, coffee/tea making machine and all the lamps in the room have USB sockets as well as US plug sockets. They have an umbrella for use whilst you stay along with robes. You can purchase these if you wish. The staff were friendly enough and helpful if you had questions. Continental breakfast was lovely. From 7-9:30am, offering fresh bagels, bread, muffins, yogurts, fruit, cereals, jams, cream cheese, cheese, coffee, hot chocolate, tea etc… check out is 11am which is great and if you have a later flight they have a luggage storage room you can keep your bags in. The one downside was that only 2 out of the 3 lifts were working and we gave up a number of times and walked the stairs. We were on the 6th floor so it added to the steps and exercise! They have a roof top bar/terrace (bar only open from May), but you can go and sit up on the roof top and look over Manhattan. You can see the Empire State Building from the roof top and very lovely view at night. The hotel bar down on the ground floor wasn’t open which was a shame. They said it was being refurbished but we didn’t see any work being carried out. That’s where we were having breakfast. On floor 2 there is a gym and also an area to go grab hot water, ice and cold water. Hotel is very close to shops, restaurants, bars and takeaways. We enjoyed the Irish bar and Katherine’s Italian which were a couple of doors up. As mentioned above, you are in walking distance of most attractions, and if you’re not up to walking there’s not  only the subway in the corner but you have many other subways near the hotel. We would stay here again if I visited NYC.

title: Great hotel
text:
Could not fault this hotel.  A fantastic location very close to Macy’s and Empire State Building.  

Spacious room exceptionally clean with a fabulous daily housekeeping team.  

All staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Recommend!!! Great location, beautiful hotel and friendly staff
text: Beautiful boutique hotel! Modern, clean, friendly and helpful staff, good options for breakfast and dinner, with a rooftop with a great view of the Empire State Building a block away. Inna from the Front Desk and Albania from the breakfast staff were wonderful, very friendly and helpful. I was visiting for my boyfriends birthday and Inna had an amazing surprise gift and hand written card in our room for when we arrived. Detail oriented staff, clean and gorgeous hotel room and common areas, excellent location just walking distance from many points of interest in Manhattan. Will definitely stay here again!! Highly recommend to everyone.

title: Amazing hotel
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it is fantastic. We were in room 915, which was clean, compact and quiet. The hotel is in a brilliant location in midtown and the subway is a 1 minute walk away, and close to the majority of sites such as Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, and Madison Square Garden, as well as Macy’s. 

The breakfast is included in the room rate and features the usual coffee, juice, bagels, cereals and different flavours of muffins each day. 

The staff are helpful and knowledgeable of the area, and will store your luggage pre or post check-in which is really helpful.   

We would definitely stay here again

title: Lovely little hotel in heart of Manhattan
text:
This hotel is lush. It’s in the heart of Manhattan; the are many sites a walk away like the Empire State Building and Macys. The subway is also a one minute walk away. 

The decor is beautiful and the staff are polite and helpful. 

This hotel does not have resort fees! Save yourself some £££ and stay here. 

I only booked the room as there are so many places to eat close by. 

Only a few bits which could have been improved:
- the room wasn’t cleaned everyday so there were evenings without fresh towels. 
- Our door was left open by housekeeping. Luckily nothing was taken

Tips:
Take a taxi to and from the airport if you have a lot of luggage
Use the subway to get around - it’s very easy. Just tap you card like an Oyster card. 
It’s standard to tip;  take that into account into your budget. Standard rate between 15-20%.
Take trainers - there’s a lot of walking.

title: Couldn't have picked a better hotel!
text:
I recently visited New York with my partner for my 30th birthday and the hotel did not disappoint. The staff all incredibly polite, the hotel and room was tidy and clean, the room was modern and stylish, and I was even gifted a bottle of of Prosecco Rose for my birthday. 

It's located perfectly for exploring New York and close to plenty of stations. It's about an hour from the airport by train. 

Hopefully will stay again soon!

title: Absolutely fantastic
text:
We chose this hotel for it's boutique style, and it didn't disappoint. The rooms were lovely and comfortable. All the staff were very helpful, especially the reception staff (lady with blond hair). The continental breakfast was delicious.

We decided to go to the rooftop, and the view of the Empire State Building was awesome.

We will be back at this hotel, as it is very local to all tourist area.

title: SUPERB
text:
Pillows are like big fluffy clouds ☁️ beds are the same, hotel is spotless 
It’s in a superb location, Macy’s is your local store it’s that close, the hotel is quiet, peaceful which in turn offers you a good night’s sleep 💤 
No tourists tax which is a massive bonus. Stay at the Kixby you honestly won’t be disappointed

title: Great stay in NYC!
text:
Great hotel, have been to NYC several times best hotel so far.. great inc buffet style Continental breakfast inc… great location super easy to get about around the city.  Room was modern , clean and a super comfy bed, slept well every night.

No issues at all , great stay! 

Would stay again and deffo recommend 🗽🇺🇸💕

title: Almost perfect
text: Stayed here in January for 5 nights. Beautiful hotel with a great room (king), clean and as pictured.  Decent sized tv, good service and friendly staff. It's in a fantastic location in the centre of Manhatten which was the perfect base. Would gladly stay again. Only thing that let it down were the windows which did let in the street noise. Yes it's manhatten and it's always loud but if the windows were updated, it would have made it a 5 star stay

title: Great Location
text: This Hotel is in a great location being a stones throw from Macy's. It appears to be newly renovated as the whole place is clean and tidy. The room was a god size for a New York hotel, although the only heating was from an air conditioning heat pump unit. It sounded like an industrial turbine as it kept cutting  in and out all through the night. The bathroom however had no heating whatsoever, which made drying towels a little difficult. One minor issue as well was the pillows, they were through horrible foam filled things, not pleasant. Overall though the Hotel was great. No room service and just a craft beer and burger joint next door.

title: Clean, modern, well organized
text: The hotel is very well located, and the rooms are sizeable and clean. Front desk staff was friendly and highly competent. Minor downsides are: no room service (although there are restaurants nearby), and complimentary water bottles not replaced after initial delivery.

title: Great Central location but...
text:
We arrived at the Kixby Hotel at around 6.30 p.m. on the 22nd Dec for our Xmas Break in New York.
The lady on reception [Inna.??] was really welcoming & continued to be a source of great help throughout the week with her knowledge & pointers.
Kixby Hotel is in a great location in Midtown just 5 mins from the nearest Subway & a similar distance from The Empire State Building & the rooms [Ours was 620] were generally OK with a huge double bed and decent bathroom facilities.
Unfortunately the Air Con constantly kicked in at night [ despite trying adjust to minimise our disturbances] & the morning breakfast complete with disposable plates & plastic utensils was something of a disappointment.

title: Amazing Location & great rooms!
text:
Would highly recommended & will definitely be back! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

- Location is SUPURB! Proper midtown manhattan location, just off Hearld Square. Less than 10 mins walk to Times Square, Grand Central, Bryant Park, Flatiron etc 

- Rooms have recently been renovated and are super nice. Our room was on the 12th  floor and had a view of the Empire State Building. 

- We reserved room only and didn’t get breakfast any morning so can’t comment on it. We did have food in the adjacent restaurant - a craft burger & beer joint and it was delicious. 

- The rooftop was cool & we found the staff friendly and helpful.

- Subway is right on the corner and so many restaurants, shops and attractions within walking distance.

title: Great hotel!
text: Highly recommend Kixby.  Good sized room, great service.  Macys at your doorstep.   They even kept our bags after check out with no problem.  Nice rrestaurant downstairs so if you arrive late yu don't have to go too far for a meal.

title: Excellent
text: Un hotel excelente en manhattan, vale la pena es un gran lugar con una atención impecable. Cuartos de muy buen estilo, limpios, la CAM es muy cómoda, sin lugar a dudas será una de mis opciones cuando regrese a la ciudad

title: Great hotel
text: Fantastic hotel lovely rooms overlooking empire state building from rooftop view near Macys and times square nice rooms and burgers in restaurant are very good value our 2nd visit here would recommend a stay here when looking for a central hotel

title: Outstanding visit, we will be back
text: Location perfect great balance of being close to everything but just hidden off the side road away from the main noise. Rooms of good standard, spacious and everything you need so no requirement to pack those extras, stunning decor. However key standout out is the warm friendly welcome show by all staff whilst walking around the hotel, the customer service is outstanding, nothing is to much trouble. Finally whilst the outside bar is not open, the area is still accessible so make sure you pop up to view the awesome light show of the empire state building..Room 808 steve &kerrie

title: Excellent stay
text: Went on 23rd Nov for a belated 30th celebration with my daughter. Bottle of fizz in the room on arrival which we had on the roof top bar. Great clean rooms, friendly staff and great location. Would definitely recommend 🗽

title: Fantastic location
text:
Fantastic location one way it’s Empire State the other macys 
Walk the length of 5th avenue from the hotel
Starbucks around the corner
Good shower and spacious room we had a king deluxe comfy bed 
Lamps had a charging point for phones no need for the plug
Hairdryer didn’t work due to high voltage but there was a hotel one in the room worked fine / ghd straightener worked ok though
Floor 8 slight view of empire if you look up
Quite noisy at night from street below but you are in a city so expected nothing less nyc is horn crazy
Air conditioning in room noisy but it drowned the street noise out 
Black tap below great shakes
Coffee machine topped up daily 
Room cleaned daily fresh towels 
Rooftop view of empire was amazing

title: Excellent
text:
We are sad to leave after what has been a great week. The Kixby has been a great base for us, ideally located between 5th Avenue and Broadway. The room was nicely decorated, art deco style and spacious with a very comfortable bed and a stylish bathroom. The staff are very friendly and helpful with a smooth check in/out and complimentary luggage storage upon departure. Reception kindly ordered us a car back to the airport.
The only small issue was that our room (518) is situated above the adjoining burger restaurant so there was a constant smell of fried food. Ask for a room at the front rather than the back.
We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend.

title: Great location
text: Loved our stay at The Kixby, great location in NYC right near to Macy’s and Empire State.  You can see the Empire State from the roof area.  Hotel is immaculately clean.  Bedrooms are decorated lovely with the comfiest of beds.  The bedrooms have a safe, fridge and coffee machine. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, Inna on reception was the best, so helpful, going above and beyond to assist.  Innna we went and bought the perfume, our girls will always remember you now!   It’s a great location with a subway just a few hundred yards away. Lovely bar area, bar staff very friendly.  We didn’t have breakfast we only had room only.  Kixby has a lovely roof area which I imagine is great in the summer months.  Would recommend this hotel is yours visiting NYC

title: Super
text:
Très bonne expérience dans cet hôtel ;
Positif : propreté impeccable, ménage bien fait chaque matin ; équipement des chambres (machine à café, coffre fort, parapluie, produits de toilette variés et de qualité, fer...) ; gentillesse du personnel ; possibilité de laisser ses valises la journée après le check-out ; salle de sport ; terrasse agréable ; ordinateurs et imprimantes à disposition ; literie ultra confortable ; très bien placé

title: Brilliant find
text:
This boutique hotel is excellent 
The beds are so comfortable, showers are powerful and plenty of hot water, huge bonus is tea and coffee with a fridge for snacks and drinks. 
Inna and reception staff helpful and eager to please. 
Hotel within walking distance of all amenities
Traffic noise but I’m a light sleeper and hey it’s the city that never sleeps could ask for quiet room 
Will definitely return here 
Fantastic stay 
The adjacent restaurant has great food too

title: Wee gem of a hotel
text: Great location with a roof top bar overlooking the Empire State Building.  About 10 minute walk to Times Square; hours walk to World Trade Centre (although subway nearby); 40 min walk to Central Park.  Have a superb Black Top burger bar attached and Chinese and Irish bar just next hotel.  Hotel rooms very modern and well serviced.  Left luggage available.  I would def stay here again…

title: Look for a better alternative
text:
At most, 3-star hotel. 

The windows are drafty and let a lot of noise and air in. Even for New York, it’s difficult to sleep. 

The wall a/c , heater was broken as were 2/3 elevators which made for really long wait times. In the mornings and evenings, could take 10+ minutes to get an elevator. 

Plenty more affordable, nicer places to stay.

title: Perfectly located boutique hotel
text:
My second stay here, so you know I love it! I especially love the size of the room which is bigger than most the big chains offer. The receptionists are welcoming and very helpful in finding out about anything you might need. The room was beautifully decorated in a modern style and there was a coffee machine and fridge, perfect for keeping your drinks cool in the summer. The king bed was super comfortable and the shower worked perfectly. 

Off the Lobby is the Tap Bar which offers a great selection of American style foods plus an awesome veggie falafel salad (which i would eat every night!) Here you will also find the bar and you can either stay or take your drinks to your room. There is a seasonal roof bar with the most awesome views, but if its closed you can take your drink up from the Tap Bar.

title: Super Hotel
text:
Hotel was super, vriendelijk personeel, schone nette en mooie kamers. Werd elke dag opgeruimd, bed opgedekt en schone handdoeken neergelegd. Vanaf het dakterras keek je op het Empire State. Alles foto’s en beschrijvingen op de website kloppen. Wij zaten niet aan de straat kant dus lekker rustig. Koelkast en kluisje verwerkt in een kast. Koelkast maakte snachts geluid. Werd direct de stekker eruit gehaald op ons verzoek 👍.
Het bed was perfect. Beste hote- bed waar ik ooit in heb geslapen!

title: Una eccezione a NY
text: Hotel di charme con stanze grandi e ben arredate, bagno con finestra, una eccezione a NY. Posizione ottima vicina alla Metro e a molti ristoranti  validi. Personale gentilissimo attento alle nostre esigenze, in particolare la Sig.ra Ianna, che  ci ha fatto sentire coccolati. Torneremo sicuramente.

title: Perfect hotel for a special trip to NYC
text:
We arrived on Friday, October 28th around mid afternoon. After booking in, they informed us that they had upgraded our room to a kingsize as the holiday company we used for booking our trip to NYC had told them it was our anniversary on the Saturday. 

The room was tastefully decorated and had everything we needed and the massive bed was super comfy.

The staff were brilliant in every way, from recommending a very nice restaurant for our anniversary, to advice on using public transport, to lending us the correct plug adapter  (I inadvertently brought the wrong one)

A great boutique hotel in a great location that's within walking distance of so much. 

Woukd definitely recommend.

title: Lovely room, roof terrace and location
text:
Loved this place! And am recommending it to all.

I travelled with three teems and had two rooms. The rooms are a good size and furnished really well. The decor is very beautique and dark, not my bag tbh but I'm not cool!

The staff were nice enough, nothing out of the ordinary but did the job. I'd recommend they push for some of that brilliant service and friendliness that the US service industry is famous for. 

The terrace on the top is excellent, you can bring your own food and drink and relax. This is a huge win for the hotel, no pressure to spend a fortune which is so refreshing. You are literally beside the empire state and the view down 34th Street to Maceys is amazing. My kids absolutely loved it. 

The location is everything. A real gem in the heart of the city. I will be back!

title: Nice Hotel. Great Location
text:
Reviewers complain about the size of the room and the street noise, this is NYC, noise and small apartments are to be expected.  This is a centuries-old city. 

This is a nice hotel in a great location. I’ll definitely stay here the next time I am in NYC.

title: First NY experience
text: Chose the Kixby for our honeymoon and first trip to NY. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Inna. The room was everything we could have asked for and had everything you’d need. We had a penthouse suite so it had a jacuzzi bath, walk in shower and a coffee machine. Have to say the bed was the comfiest we’ve ever slept in. The view from our room was great, looking straight at the Empire State building. The rooftop bar has great views too although the bar itself was closed due to it being out of season. It can get a little noisy in the mornings but I guess that’s due to its location which is great and within walking distance of loads of attractions and within 100 metres of a subway station which is so cheap and easy to use. Only negative would be the lifts which are old and slow. Only one of the three would work for us. Would definitely stay here again though.

title: Headed out for a cruise
text:
We stayed at the kixby for one night to see the music band. It was fabulous. But I have to brag on the staff at the kixby
From Inna at the front desk who was pleasant and helpful to Floyd who hailed taxis and took care of our bags. I have stayed in numerous NYC hotels. This is a favorite by far.

title: Big let down
text:
Negatives.. there is a $250 deposit to be paid on each room. We booked 3 luxury king rooms, we failed to find the luxury, all 3 rooms small, bathrooms small . In one room we were not able to open the windows nor the  blinds as could see into other windows. In other room unable to open bathroom window due to overwhelming smell of cannabis. Lifts very slow and not always working. Staff brusque, no please, thank you. Adjourning bar very expensive. Reception led us to believe you bought bus tickets from them, they charge you extra and give you a bar code which you then have to exchange for a ticket.
Positives... bed comfy

title: Great experience at the Kixby Hotel
text: Our stay at the Kixby was terrific. We stayed in the penthouse, which had a luxury bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub and separate walk in shower.  In room keurig Coffeemaker was a nice feature as well as a built in mini frigerator. We opted for the Continental breakfast meals, which were good and convenient.  Juice, fresh bagel assortments, fresh fruit, yogurts, pastries and steaming hot coffee were available to us. Our front desk person, Inna, couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. As a new visitor to NYC, we had tons of questions and Inna gave great advise and great directions. Our hotel breakfast lady was very sharp and kept the dining area fully stocked and clean. The location on 35th St. and 5th Ave. was great. 1 min. walk to the subway. Lots of restaurants and Bryant Park all within walking distance. There is a rooftop bar that was closed for the season, but you were able to walk out and see an impressive view of the Empire State Building.  Definitely recommend this 5 StarHotel.

title: Great location but take earplugs
text:
The hotel is in a great location - walking distance to lots of places like Bryant Park, Times Square, Penn Station etc and close to a subway line.  But the location is super noisy and my room was as well.  It ended in 06 and overlooked the street.  There were street noises at all hours of the night - horns, cars, trucks, people yelling etc.  Plus the rooms have doors that almost slam when people don’t hold the handle to close them so the doors bang closed loudly.  The toilet also flushed like a jet engine!  

The room was small.  One small work chair that hit the bed when pushed back.  No other chair to sit on so if there are two of you, it’s squishy.  The bed was comfortable and the decor good.  Clean and tidy. 

Breakfast is basic as others have said and if you want a bagel, get there early.  It’s otherwise toast, a few muffins, two cereals, yoghurt and fruit.  The breakfast room is also really warm.  So much single use plastic and paper plates too.  

View from the rooftop is great.

title: Parfait pour un séjour à New-York
text: La seule  chose à reprocher ce sont les déjeuners froids avec des muffins du genre gâteau.  Il me semble que des oeufs brouillés ou à la coque seraient un plus.  Mais quand même, nous avons apprécié que le déjeuner soit inclus, on y trouve quand même du fromage et yogourt pour la protéine, et hop nous étions prêts à visiter.  Puis, quel bel encroit, les chambres sont petites mais complètes, et propres.  Le mini frigo très pratique.  La salle de bain parfaite, avec un miroir grossissant, et une super douche.  Le peignoir, machine à café, et le lit confortable rendent cet endroit parfait pour les répits entre les visites.  Je recommande 10/10!

title: Super
text:
Top situation entre la 5eme avenue et Broadway avec le métro à 100m.
Staff super accueillant et sympa 
La chambres sont spacieuses et jolies
Le hic ... aucune insonorisation des fenêtres donc le bruit la nuit  ... et pdj très cher pour ce que c'est en réalité.

A part ça,top !

title: Wow
text:
The rooms are extremely spacious and clean, was honestly surprised how big the room was given this is NYC. 
The room was very clean and the overall design of the hotel is very nice.

Location is PERFECT- near all the main attractions in Manhattan and within a couple min of walking from multiple metro stations

We had a wonderful time and would definitely visit again in the future

title: Brilliant base for seeing New York
text:
The Kixby Hotel is really well located for a few day stay in New York. Subway station a few minutes away at the end of the block for those times you don't want to walk.

Pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, had been led to believe that New York hotel rooms were tiny.  Only downside to the room is the air con which makes quite a bit of noise.  

The rooftop bar COULD be awesome and we enjoyed a drink up there every night with a great view of the Empire State Building.  However, the drinks on offer from the bar (tinned wine/prosecco) at exorbitant prices meant we went up there most times when the bar had closed and took our own drink.  The hotel miss a trick here.

Staff were friendly enough but unless you instigated a greeting, you got nothing. 

The burger bar attached to the hotel offers good food at good value and friendly staff.

Would look to stay here again when next in New York, maybe by then the rooftop bar will serve quality drinks at a sensible price.

title: Aanrader als je in Manhattan wil zitten
text:
Heel fijn hotel met een geweldige ligging. Je loopt naar Times Square in een ruim kwartier maar je zit ver genoeg van alle drukte. Ligt in een leuke straat met een pub en en bar en heerlijke hamburgers Next door. Ook om de hoek bij macys dus heel veel ov knooppunten om de hoek dus reis en met de metro is ook echt prima geregeld. Ontbijt zat er gratis bij toen we boekten via het hotel. Niet heel uitgebreid volgens onze normen maar wat er ligt, bagels, roomkaas diverse muffins, cereals en fruit is prima te noemen. De kamers zijn echt ruim de koffers
Etc passen prima in de kamer en er is een zitje met koffie en thee. En natuurlijk de heerlijk bedden. Het uitzicht op de empire is een leuke bonus maar goed wanneer ben je in je hotelkamer? De rooftop was voor en na openingstijden van de bar gewoon open en dan kon je met je eigen drankje gewoon daar zitten. Personeel is heel vriendelijk enige minpuntje is dat ze niet echt op
de mail reageren van ons en van onze vrienden die een champagne voor onze trouwdag wilden regelen. Maar van het hotel kregen we wel bubbels en chocolade voor onze dag dus dat was super. Wij komen zeker terug!

title: Best Value-Best Location-Best Service
text: Spent a long weekend and the room was spectacular.  The location is perfect for anyone who wants to be close enough to walk or to get to any transportation. Restaurants and entertainment are all around.  The staff was friendly and so helpful with great recommendations and service.

title: Avis mitigé.
text: L’emplacement de l’hôtel Kixby est parfait. Il permet de visiter facilement le uptown et le downtown. Les chambres sont belles, rénovées avec goût et la propreté est irréprochable. Ceci étant dit, Il y a beaucoup de bruit à cause des climatiseurs. L’environnement immédiat de l’hôtel est TRÈS sale, ce n’est pas de leur faute mais les odeurs et les immondices sur le trottoir ne sont pas du tout agréables. De plus durant la semaine que nous avons passée dans cet hôtel, pas une fois le bar de l’hôtel où le rooftop n’étaient ouverts. Ce sont des prestations  qui font partie intégrante de  la facture. C’est un peu limite!

title: Not up to scratch.
text:
We were sold this as a 4 star hotel (n.b. TA says it is 3 star and having seen it, we are now not surprised). It felt like a youth hostel, not a hotel. To be fair to them, the Staff were helpful but of course they could not change the fact that this is not anywhere near what we would call a decent hotel. we arrived very late as we flew over from San Francisco on an afternoon flight. The room and bed felt flimsy; thr bed was like a camp bed. Hotel lift, lobby, stairs and hallway were unkempt, shabby and smelt badly. The room itself smelt badly. Bathroom was so small you could hardly turn around in it. No space for our luggage. This was supposed to be a 'lux' room. No curtains only a flimsy plastic venetian blind, which was tacky and dirty.
 Despite arriving at around 1 am nyc time, we didn't stay at all - checked out immediately and went to a decent hotel we stayed at previously. Overall, a terrible experience for us.

title: New York at its best!
text: Very charming hotel next to Empire State Building! Very clean , excellent location.  Service is very efficient. Front desk staff Inna went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect, she was professional and personal and caring…! In New York I’d say all these qualities it is not easy to find ! Next time I will be staying there again!

title: Brilliant NY hotel.
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Kixby for 7 nights in September and it was the best hotel! All the staff were very pleasant and helpful, especially the lady at breakfast! The breakfast isn’t massive, bagels, muffins, yogurts, fruits, cereal and coffee but perfect for setting you up for the day. The rooms were great, we stayed in the lux King and the bed was the biggest and comfiest bed ever which is needed after a day of walking around New York. Housekeeping came by every day too. The rooms aren’t massive but it’s New York and you aren’t in your rooms that much anyway. Nice shower and tv. Plenty of plug sockets and USB. Thankfully they give you a hairdryer as my UK one’s power was useless. The air con is a bit noisy but nothing that would keep you awake after a day in NY! 
The location is brilliant. Midtown is very convenient for getting around, especially when you manage to work out the subway. 
Only thing I’d say is the rooftop bar is a bit over priced for only cocktail cans however outwith the serving times you can take your own food and drinks up and has the most amazing views of the Empire State Building. We were in room 1210 and there was little to no street noise. 
Absolutely loved this hotel and would 100% recommend staying here

title: Perfect location for a memorable trip
text:
Perfect location - lots of attractions within walking distance and local subway station connects to most places.
Great service from helpful staff. Gave us an upgrade and bottle of champagne due to 'special' birthday - Thank you!
Room was beautifully decorated, really well appointed and had everything we needed. Fridge drawer was so useful. Excellent shower - big, hot and powerful.
Everywhere was very clean - housekeeping done every day.
Coffee machine was easy to use and tasty.
Lovely toiletries. Robes provided. Rooms well lit. Nice touch with the branded umbrella (almost a shame we didn't get to use it). 
Two hidden gems: the Black Tap Burger Bar on ground floor - great food, great service in a cool, relaxed atmosphere. Secondly, the rooftop bar with amazing Empire State Building view - magical!
Things to fix: one lift out of service during our stay, caused some delays waiting for lifts - hope that's fixed soon. Air-con is really noisy.
Would stay again and highly recommend.

title: Fab 4 night stay.
text:
We always study hotel reviews before we stay anywhere and the general reviews for the Kixby were very good.
The hotel decor was fantastic, the rooms are very ‘New York’ on the small side but everything fitted in comfortably.
it’s located literally under the Empire State and we sat on the roof top and had a beer most afternoons. The roof bar was only open a couple of hours each night which was a result because the price of a drink was outrageous, the service was poor and a real flat atmosphere.
We had a wonderful stay in this hotel, I can not blame the. For the current state of NY. If you are going stay here you won’t regret it.

We wanted to be mid town so we could walk everywhere, in hindsight mid town is a bit of a mess, there are literally drugged up zombies everywhere, having been to NY several times we have come to the conclusion we won’t be coming back for a while. 
NY needs a clean up, speaking to lots of the locals they are very unhappy with the Major and how NY is currently being run.

There’s an Irish bar next to the hotel, really great service, fair drink prices.

title: Bucket list destination
text:
The city that never sleeps ..... 100% true.  
Hotel is clean and staff always helpful when we needed directions.
Safe provided in the room, bed was comfortable and hotel was quiet on the inside. 
Special mention to Inna, on the reception desk who was always friendly, smiley and genuinely interested in visitors. You were a joy to see every day 😃

title: Disappointing stay, unenthusiastic staff.
text:
On arrival told receptionist we were getting married on 16th September in Central Park, how excited we were and wondered if we had a great room, we were reassured we did. Room was small and extremely noisy from the road, no soundproofing whatsoever. The air conditioning was so loud, fuse blown on one occasion.
On morning of wedding at about 7:30am I requested a mirror, plug points and office desk space, seating area had no mirror. 
Returned from breakfast still no mirror, I managed to do make up and hair without a mirror in front of me. How inconvenient and very disappointing behaviour from reception. After wedding and dinner cruise, returned to room at 11:00pm, mirror, champagne and glasses in room. Sorry, to little to late. 
No atmosphere at all, clean though. 
Friends who came to wedding had much bigger room! 
Staff really didn’t care!

title: The big apple
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights the hotel is situated in a great location easy to get around we  walk all round the city with no problem and the subway is at the end of the street .Staff are friendly and helpful and the roof top bar has a great view of the empire State Building at night ,rooms had a safe and coffee making facilities and the only problem we had was it had wooden shutters up at the window which did not block out all light the room was quite big but friends we where traveling with had a much smaller room j..
Please watch when you asking for a cab to get from the airport to the hotel it was $65 and we gave him $90 as there were 4 of us and 8 piece of luggage this was a yellow cab when we got the hotel to get us one it was not a yellow cab but a black peoples carrier and we got charged $135 double so always get a Yellow cab do not get ripped off .

title: Fab hotel
text: Lovely hotel in great location. Good sized room with robes and umbrella (should have used it as got caught in torrential rain).  Housekeeping and clean towels daily.  Central to lots of tourist spots and Subway literally a few steps away for those days when walking is not an option.  Small overcharge on bar bill quickly resolved.  I would definitely return if in NY again

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We visited the hotel at the beginning of July, we booked via British Airways and got a great price on the hotel. The room we got was on the top floor and was massive by New York standards, bathroom really big. Hotel was lovely, staff were friendly and there is a great burger place attached to the hotel.

The street outside the hotel isn't the greatest, lots of rubbish from some nearby restaurants but that didn't spoil things but maybe something the hotel may want to try and help resolve with the local businesses.

Across the road from Macys and in an ideal position for all attractions, if I was in New York again would definitely stay here.

title: Fabulous stay
text: Great hotel in the centre between 5th and 6th Avenue good sized room for a New York  hotel. Huge comfortable bed and fabulous shower room. Staff were friendly and helpful. Very close to subway to go downtown or uptown. Would definitely recommend.

title: Amazing stay! Stayed 3 nights!
text: Amazing boutique hotel! Very modern!! Amazing rooftop lounge views! Close to everything and close to a subway line! Amazing amenities for the shower, very spacious and comfortable and a nice King Bed! The view from the room is nothing special but that’s ok! They had luggage storage witch was amazing since our flight landed at 6:30am! Loved everything

title: Summer in the city
text: Excellent friendly staff beautiful hotel with an amazing roof top bar during the summer top tip all rooms ending in 19 ie 519 619 etc are very quiet the beds are so comfy also the blacktop burgers and shakes which has a through door is outstanding food you will not be disappointed staying here

title: 3 Night Stay - 4*
text:
My partner and I have just returned from a 3 Night Stay. 

See Feedback:-

Pro's- 
- Bubbly on arrival
- Quiet Room
- Great Location - Very central
- Small-Mid Sized Room

Con's - 
- Elevator's broke a couple of times whilst we were there 
- Air Con Unit is quiet loud

Overall, good stay, Would recommend.

title: Disappointed
text:
Average at best. Quite disappointed as I booked the hotel for my partner’s 40th birthday and we’ve been extremely underwhelmed from the moment we arrived. The rooms are significantly smaller than they look on the hotel photos. We booked a Lux King room which is one of the smallest king rooms we’ve ever stayed in. Room features are basic, nothing to wow. Two small bottles of water are provided in the room upon arrival, and when they weren’t replenished I phoned reception to ask for more to be told that the two provided upon arrival are complimentary but no further bottles will be provided during the stay - very strange and something I have never experienced in any hotel anywhere in the world. We also had an issue with being unable to open our safe one morning, so we phoned reception for assistance to be told they’d send an engineer up right away. 20 minutes later and no one arrived, so we went to reception to ask for an update to be told the engineer was in a meeting!! Surely guests are the priority here and the meeting should be interrupted to attend to guests rather than guests having to wait around for the engineer?! We waited a total of 30 minutes for this to be resolved which was unacceptable.

Overall, I’m extremely disappointed by the lack of little details (such as bottled water being replenished daily) and also the lack of good service which would make a big difference. I’m really upset that I chose to book the KIXBY over the other hotel choices I considered, and I would not recommend the hotel to others who enjoy good service as it doesn’t seem to exist here.

title: Top Lage, mit minimalen Abzügen
text:
Das Kixby war unser Zuhause für vier Tage. Die Lage ist schwer zu übertreffen, von anderen Zimmern und von der Rooftop Terrasse hatte man einen direkten Wahnsinns Blick auf das Empire State Building. In die Metro ist man quasi gefallen aus dem Hotel kommend. Das Personal war durchweg super freundlich und hilfsbereit. Im zweiten OG gab es kostenfrei Wasser, Kaffee, Tee und Eiswürfel. Auf der Terrasse oben konnte man zu bestimmten Zeiten Drinks und kleine Snacks genießen, außerhalb davon auch eigenes Essen und Getränke mitbringen.
Die Zimmer waren TOP. Super neu renoviert, wunderbar groß, wurden jeden Tag gereinigt und jeden Tag wurde auch Kaffee nachgefüllt. Es gab außerdem einen Kühlschrank und einen tollen großen Safe. Die Betten waren sehr komfortabel. Einziges Manko bei uns war die Aussicht auf einen dreckigen Hinterhof und eine viel zu laute und schlecht zu regelnde Klimaanlage, die das schlafen zum Teil unmöglich machte.
Auch ein recht ärgerlicher Punkt ist eine zu hinterlegende Kaution, pro Zimmer $250,- welche wir nun auch vier Tage nach Abreise noch nicht wieder haben. Hätte man irgendwo erwähnen können, ist für ein Hotel auch sehr unüblich.
Aber gut, top Lage, top Zimmer, top Personal… sehr zu empfehlen… gerne wieder.

title: Great stay
text:
Great 4 night stay.  Queen room was large, clean and well appointed. Very comfortable beds. As others said, the air con was very noisy but we put in on before bed to cool the room then were able to switch it off overnight. Street noise was very noticeable but it is NY! Earplugs helped. 
The hotel was really handy located for Times Sq, One Vanderbilt, Macy’s, Bryant Park and Empire State, with views from rooftop bar. 
There’s a subway station just down from the hotel.

title: Delightful Hotel, Perfect Location
text: Really lovely Hotel in an amazing Location. Really close to  Tomes Square, Empire State Building, in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, other points on the Island are easy to get to from here. The room,  bathroom and other facilities were spot on. Staff very nice. Would really recommend.

title: Great midtown hotel
text: We travelled to NYC for 5 nights booking 2 rooms for our group at the Kixby and I have to say it was a great hotel, from check in the staff were friendly and efficient giving us rooms close to each other - the rooms were clean and cool with a good amount of space for our belongings. The beds were very comfortable with good quality bedding that was changed every other day, there were nice touches such as the robes, the branded toiletries to use and an abundance of fluffy towels. One of the lifts was out of order but still 2 to use - we were only on the third floor so frequently used the stairs anyway. The gym looked good with peloton bikes (we were so busy we never got the chance to spend time in there) . We had an issue with the fridge in one of the rooms which we reported on our way out, it was all fixed on our return so cannot fault the front desk staff. Special call out to Inna on the desk who was really helpful on our last day it was like nothing was too much trouble! I would definitely stay here again

title: De mauvaises surprises
text:
Cet Hôtel est un mystère. Il y a de très bonnes choses mais aussi des sujets inacceptables pour ce type d'hôtel.

D'abord il est très bien situé à proximité du Métro, à 10 min de Bryant park . C'est vraiment le site idéal. En plus, le rooftop donne directement sur l'Empire State Building. C'est vraiment magnifique. 

Les chambres sont propres, quasi neuves. Juste la déco n'est pas très moderne mais c'est le style de l'hôtel.

Pour le personnel il est accueillant. Il est dommage qu'il ne parle pas le français mais c'est le prb aux USA.

On va attaquer les sujets qui font mals.
* On avait 2 chambres ( 1 pour nous et 1 pour les enfants ) et on avait demandé qu'elles soient à proximité. Mais elles étaient dans des étages différents. Il n'est normal  pour ce type d'hôtel de n'avoir pas fait l'effort de les mettre au moins dans le même étage 
* Le bruit, on avait le bruit du bloc ext de la clim de l'hôtel en permanence.  Le niv était de 60db ( avec notre clim arrêté). je suis surpris par le manque d'isolation phonique. Ok NY c'est bruyant mais pas à ce point là.
* Pour finir, le sujet le plus surprenant, le ptit déjeuner.... un vrai scandale..... quelques muffins, donuts  bien dégueulasses, qqes yaourts, salades de fruits bien industriels...mais pas de bacon, pas de pancakes, pas d'oeufs, pas de charcuterie  on sent le pt déj fait à l'économie.

title: Nice Hotel
text:
Starting our honeymoon here, was nice place and gave us bottle of bubbly and chocs nice touch
Was in good spot to get to places, would recommend if anyone wants to Visit NYC 
Nice staff and cleaned daily , will Stay again if we go back in the future

title: Great location for Theatres and Shops in Midtown
text: The Kixby is a medium sized boutique style hotel situated on West 35th - formally known as the Metro. The location is perfect in Midtown from which to explore NYC. Close to the Subway and Herald Square (opposite Macy’s), it offers good, not overly big, rooms and a rooftop bar. The beds are very comfortable and the linen is changed every 2 days. Breakfast is simple and can be collected from the bar area and taken back to your room, if preferred, (about $22 per person). The only negative is that the air-conditioning, while effective, is very noisy and may disrupt a light sleeper. (Suggest that the Hotel look to upgrade). However, we found it a very good base for our 6 night stay and, being centrally located, allows you to explore NYC while never being too far away. Lastly, and very importantly, the staff are very friendly, efficient and helpful. We booked it as part of a British Airways joint flight/hotel deal. This proved to be VERY cost effective and should definitely be considered!

title: Great Location, Top notch Customer Service
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York and our stay at the Kixby hotel. It was a challenge navigating the city with our mom in a wheelchair (she doesn't travel much - and didn't even before her hip injury), it gives me a whole new appreciation for the struggles that those with disabilities face every day. All of the staff at the Kixby was very accommodating during our stay. The location is very conveniently located next to Herald square with subway access (including an elevator for handicap access) to get you anywhere you need to go in the city. Our room (802 family room) had a separate king bedroom with view of Macy's and the main room with 2 queen beds had a room of the Empire State building.  The other room for mom (809) didn't have a view but did have 2 queen beds and a step-in shower with a fold-down seat for her. When we made our reservations, Zakiya went out of her way to ensure we got the room we needed for my handicapped mom. The rooftop area had amazing views of the Empire State building. I definitely recommend eating at the attached restaurant, Black Tap, which had great burgers and shakes!

title: Aanrader
text: Perfect ligging. Personeel was heel vriendelijk, kamer was heel netjes en ruim, dagelijkse schoonmaak. Ontbijt was maar pover maar wat er was, was wel ok! Lekkere hamburgers in restaurant ernaast. Jammer genoeg was rooftopbar niet open.

title: Mooie kamers
text:
Mooie kamers, hotel ziet er goed uit. De plek van het hotel is ook goed vlakbij de Macy's 
Bedden lagen uitstekend, personeel vriendelijk.
Voor de rest vond ik New York erg smerig en overal lag huisvuil op straat, niet 1 dag maar dagen.

title: Would recommend
text:
The hotel was a very good location for everything we wanted to do whilst in New York, it is only the block over from Empire State, 15 min walk to times square, street away from Macy’s and has the subway entrance just outside on the corner from hotel. 
The beds were soo comfy and rooms were clean and the coffee/milks refilled regularly so no complaints there. The rooftop hotel bar was not open but you were allowed to bring your own drink and sit on top which I actually preferred. We ate at the black tap restaurant that is joined to the hotel and enjoyed the food there.
It was a nice touch that the hotel gave mini bottle of shampoo, conditioner and body wash as we travelled with hand luggage so liquids were light and we found them useful.  
Enjoyed the stay and had no issues

title: Great location, would stay again and recommend
text:
Visited here in July 2020 with 5 others (had 3 double bedrooms). The rooms were lovely and clean.
