Our hairdryer was broke but I asked reception if they could replace this and they replaced it very fast. There is also an iron and a bucket where you can fill with ice on floor 2 (room next to the gym).
The WiFi works really good.
The gym is TINY- only one treadmill out of two working. There was two peloton bikes which both worked. If other people go in this, it would be very crowded.
The location is amazing- 10/15 min walk to Times Square, 2KM to Central Park which was perfect for runs, there’s a 24/7 McDonald’s and a Toast around the corner. There is a subway on the corner of the street which we used to get to Central Park and then down to Brooklyn area. The Empire State is just around the corner.
The rooftop bar was closed so we brought our own food and drink to the top which was great. The view of the Empire State from the rooftop was lovely in the evening. 
The staff were friendly.
The only annoying thing was the lifts! One lift was broken so you had to wait for one of the two. Sometimes this would take ages.
You also have to put down a credit card for a $250 which gets held until you check out.
Would recommend this hotel! Would stay again.

title: Not a hotel with rooftop bar beware
text:
Staff and location are good .However booked this hotel for rooftop bar rooftop terrace was open but without access to a bar as it was closed as much use as a chocolate kettle.
Hotel shared a bar which was next door open to public and hotel guest which in a city that never sleeps closed at 10 so no romantic night cap.
When we were there hotels own bar was open for private function so can't understand why it can't open for paying guest.
Won't stay here again better hotels with better vacilites near by.

title: V nice boutique hotel
text:
Arrived at the Kixby after a long and sweaty Uber ride from JFK! Greeted by amazing front desk staff who were extremely polite and friendly. Had a room on the 7th floor which was directly opposite the elevator so was a little worried about noise from other guests, there was a bit of noise at times but nothing major. 

The room was at the back of the hotel so non of the street/construction noise as mentioned in previous reviews! The AC was a god send if not a little noisy! The most amazing bed and pillows… I’ve not slept so well in a long time! Shower and amenities great also. Bottled water wasn’t replaced once I’d had the 2 bottles that were there tho. Roof top bar still wasn’t open tho which was a shame. Overall a good stay and will consider it again on my next NY visit.

title: OK but some issues
text:
Stayed overnight on our return to the UK from another part of the US. The location of the hotel within Manhattan cannot be faulted, central, close to the Empire State Building and a minutes walk from a subway station. However as other reviewers have said, the presence of black bags of rubbish along the street close by are very off putting. The smell as you walk into the street is appalling and it wasn't unusual to see homeless people going through the bags. Not the fault of the hotel but something to consider when choosing this hotel. The room (Deluxe double) was very nice. Spacious, well decorated, nicely equipped and with complimentary water and coffee. It was clean and the bathroom was spotless. The downside was that the noise of the air conditioning plant outside the room was continuous throughout the night resulting in very poor sleep quality. The in room air conditioning was also noisy but at least we could turn that off. Public areas were also clean. The hotel is trying out a complimentary continental breakfast. My view is that they should charge and put on a better breakfast. Bagels, pastries, coffee, orange juice and yogurt is ok but the quality was very average. If you are expecting a typical US hotel breakfast buffet then you are going to be very disappointed. It is self service too. I have little doubt that the reason for the change is staff shortages which are being experienced everywhere post Covid. Staff were generally pleasant and helpful with one exception. We arrived early morning before we were allowed to check in and left our bags. The member of staff on the bag storage was not at all representative of other staff. He grumbled when he saw the number of bags we had, muttered out loud when he picked up one of the bags due to its weight and had no manners (please or thank you) whatsoever. As this was our first contact with Kixby staff it wasn't a good advertisement for the hotel.
All in all it was an ok stay. A few areas to work on but nothing serious which spoilt our stay. I would return if looking for somewhere central in Manhattan

title: Great hotel in great location.
text: The hotel is centrally located, just around the corner from the Empire States Building and close to subway station.  We walked from Penn Station with two large heavy suitcases and it took us around 15 minutes of easy walking.  Staff were very friendly and welcoming.  The room was spacious with adequate storage.  Lovely comfortable high quality bedding and pillows.  Spacious bathroom with large bath and shower.  Breakfast was collect your own from buffet selection to take to the room.  Good selection of fruit, muffins, biscuits and yoghurt.

title: #100 out of 516 hotels in NYC
text:
This was a best friend’s vacation that had been on the cards for a few years 
First booked with BA and staying in the Riu Plaza but BA cancelled a few weeks before 
So booked another package with Virgin it was £700 more to stay at the Riu 
So for nearly the same money we booked the Kixby 
We stayed on the 12th Floor 
Air conditioning worked fine but did keep my friend awake at night because it was so Noisy. 
Great Location for Macy’s department store it’s at the bottom of the street 
Also the Subway was at the end of the street too.
Our bed was extremely comfortable 
Our room was cleaned everyday and towels replenished every day. 
Nothing personally to this hotel if I ever came back to New York I wouldn’t stay near time square it’s a dump 
There was homeless people sleeping in the doorways out our hotel 
Black bags piled up on the streets with Rubbish 
We could hear Horns and Sirens all night but I suppose that’s NYC 
The corridors always felt like they hadn’t been hoovered 
The staff were very friendly and were always polite and extremely help full to us

title: Good NYC base
text:
The Kixby is in a great location. Close to subway stations, restaurants, shopping, Empire State Building, perfect! 

The beds were sooooo comfortable. Air-con in room was effective but noisy but not really an issue for us. Rest of the room was stylish, good size, clean and good amenities. TV was huge!

We used the grab and go breakfast service once which was good but there are lots of other great places nearby for breakfast such as Pio bagels- highly recommend. 

We didn't eat at the Black Tap but did get drinks to go to the room and roof terrace with. Roof terrace bar not open but guests still have access and there are tables and chairs. Great view of the Empire State Building. We had a drink at the Lot 15 bar.

All staff were friendly throughout. Overall I would come back and recommend to friends!

title: Lovely hotel in excellent location
text: Had a lovely stay in the Kixby in July . The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable . Air conditioning was great to keep the room cool in the hot weather . Nice bathroom too with a great shower . Was great to have the tea/coffee maker in the room . The hotel is in a great location too only a couple of minutes to a subway station and Macy’s. Also easy walk along to Times Square if required . Would love to stay in this hotel again if returning to New York . Staff were great to deal with too have no complaints there . The only small complaint we would have would be the slow elevator as we had to walk down the stairs sometimes due to the long wait but we were on the 5th floor so no hardship.

title: Great location, friendly staff and ideal for New york
text: Really enjoyed our stay in hotel. Great location 2 mins from Macy's. Comfortable bed, value for money. Staff very friendly. Easy to use air conditioning in the room. Only downside roof bar closed. Highly recommend

title: You can do better
text:
Let’s start with the good stuff - your bedroom will be clean, free of cockroaches, won’t smell, the TV is quality and it’s quiet

The hotel is on Herald Sq so it’s easy to get around, the Black Tap is excellent and your never get lost (just look for the big building in the next street)

The not so good? Well, the street outside looks like a rubbish tip thanks to the Korean restaurants nearby and there’s loads of homeless people sleeping in the doorways, but at least they’re friendly and helpful compared to the staff. 

An example of this would be when I mentioned at check in that it was my wife’s birthday and it was our first time in the States, I was met with an ‘oh’. When I mentioned that we hadn’t received the complimentary bottle of fizz that everyone else had, the receptionist said’well that’s down to housekeeping and there’s nothing we can do’ when the bar was open and 20 feet away. There are other examples but …well, I didn’t get the impression customer service was their top priority.

New York is an amazing city. New Yorkers were friendly and, in our experience, brilliant people to be around. 

But you can do better than the Kixby

title: Fab hotel
text: Great location short walk to subways. Clean hotel, nice and quiet. The bed was the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in! Shower was wonderful. Kixby was the only hotel to acknowledge our honeymoon and provided a bottle of fizz and chocolates! Very much appreciated even though I can’t drink as I’m pregnant. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at kixby! Would highly recommend it to anybody. We didn’t eat at the hotel but plenty of options near by and the rooftop was delightful for the 4th July firework display. Couldn’t get a full look but for someone who doesn’t like big crowds it was a nice quiet place to enjoy the display! Thank you for a wonderful comfortable stay.

title: Great location
text: Just returned from a week long stay at this hotel.  Great location to visit all top attractions and sights. Great access to subway/metro stations from the end of the block or a couple of blocks along. Hotel staff were always pleasant and friendly, though we didn't have much interaction with them.  Didn't have any issues with cleanliness in the hotel or our room or any noise even though we were at the front of the hotel.  Our first few days we had access to the "grab and go" breakfast which was good, but then changed to fixed price menu downstairs (which we didn't use).  If you are looking for something good in the mornings, we can't fault Andrews Coffee shop which is just along the next block and had amazing choice.  The rooftop bar wasn't open - however you were still able to use the area any time of day or night.  We loved it at night, when we just wanted to finish off a days sightseeing with a few drinks to wind down.  Took our own drink & snacks and we were able to chill out with amazing views of the Empire States Building and surrounding skyline. Would not hesitate to go back to this hotel if we visit again.

title: Tolles Hotel für den Städtetrip
text:
Tolles Hotel, großartige Lage mit kurzer Entfernung zum Times Square und weiteren Sightseeing Hotspots. Sehr nettes Hotelpersonal und tolle Zimmer. Einzig der Blick in einen dreckigen Innenhof hat gestört aber auch nicht wirklich.

Absolute Weiterempfehlung !

title: Perfect hotel for our first couples holiday
text:
Absolutely perfect. Lovely big rooms with plenty of drawer and wardrobe space and a safe. Nice to have a roof terrace looking at the Empire States Building. Fabulous toiletries supplied. 

Perfect location in midtown a few minutes from Macy’s.

title: Excellent location - average hotel
text: We stayed here for 5 nights in June. Firstly it is very well located to see the key sights and there is an underground station nearby. The room itself was fine - very comfortable bed, good shower, good AC and it was cleaned properly every day. However it was very noisy at the front of the house . We requested a switch to  another room and it made a huge difference. Avoid the front if you can as there are building works ongoing outside. The "grab n go breakfast" was fine - fresh orange juice, good coffee and bars/ muffins. The reception staff were very helpful. Good wifi coverage.

title: Average NYC hotel
text: An ok hotel in New York which is well located for all the key sights. However, it felt overpriced for what it was. We got a luxury king room which was nothing special and basic. The hotel also did not feel very clean, the lifts often smelt and the corridors were never hoovered so dirty the whole of our stay.

title: IDEALEMENT SITUE A proximité de tout
text: Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cette hôtel pour notre voyage de noces, idéalement situé, proche de l'empire state building de Broadway, de tout en fait.... Chambre très agréable, literie hyper confortable, personnel disponible dont 1 parle français, un gros plus. Il y a en en plus une terrasse donnant directement sur l'empire state building illuminé c'est au top. Excellent séjour.

title: Terrible breakfast, loud rooms
text: We asked if breakfast was included, yes of course they said. This is what we got. Impossible to sleep in room because of traffic,construction and so on. The positive is that rooms were clean and tidy.

title: Impressive but room for improvement
text:
Upon arrival we noticed that a $250 incidental deposit is required for all checkins, this was a bit of a surprise and not something we’ve seen before or something we were made aware of prior to arrival, thankfully we had the funds to pay this but it did have an effect on our spends for the rest of the break, but this caught out at least one other person as we passed them in Reception on our last day. We did get this back at the end so I assume it is related to the condition of your room at checkout. 

We were in room 420 which is next to the elevators, the dinging and other noises took some getting used to for the first couple of nights, on the subject of the elevators there are three, but the left one is currently out of order (Though there were people working on it throughout our stay), the working lifts were a bit noisy and would make you wait a while when you called one, we got in the lift to come back down from the rooftop one evening and the lift just didn’t work at all interestingly. 

The grab and go breakfast leaves a bit to be desired, it’s just a little room on the 2nd floor with coffee, muffins and fresh fruit, that being said the muffins were lovely! Reception told us it was served 8:00am til 10:30am but it is actually served 7:30am til 9:30am so by the time we got down there a lot of stuff had gone already. 

Now onto the good stuff! We had champagne and chocolates on our arrival as this was our honeymoon, so that was a nice touch and turned a few heads when we took it up to the rooftop at 8:30 the following morning! The room was lovely, everything you could need for a stay in NYC, complimentary dressing gowns, big umbrella, ironing board, iron, hairdryer, fridge, safe (Which you set the pin for yourself), coffee machine with pods and other accessories, little toiletry bottles in the bathroom. The room also included a huge walk in shower which my wife loved! It was also clearly recently renovated and spotless. The only thing we would have improved would be the A/C which as a lot of other people have mentioned is really noisy, you couldn’t have it on overnight as it would keep you awake, but in the day it is very effective nonetheless. 

The hotel has a rooftop bar but it wasn’t open during our stay, it also seemed like it would not be open for some time but I know that hospitality in NYC has struggled since the pandemic so I can understand their hesitancy to open this, although I’ve no doubt it would get a lot of custom. On the subject of bars there are two others in the hotel, Lot15 and Black Tap, these are both run by a third party and the opening hours are a bit strange (Not open Monday or Tuesday, then only open until 9:30pm other nights) but I guess this ties back to my point about hospitality in NYC at the moment. We tried both bars and they were great, the food at Black Tap must be tried as it is fantastic!

Worth mentioning that the hotel has good WiFi coverage but you have to sign into it every 24 hours on each device to ensure you have Internet access, WiFi was good and we were able to video call home which was pretty much all we used it for. 

We would definitely stay again and would not have wanted to stay anywhere else for our honeymoon, thank you Kixby!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Spent three nights here in June 2022. We were assigned a room on the top floor (11?) and it was clean and very nice. It was obviously freshly painted and renovated in modern (i.e., grey, black and white) colors. The beds were great and the bathroom large (by NYC standards...). The rooftop area was a bonus. Recommended.

title: Très accueillant et très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très sympa, très très bien situé à 2 pas du métro, 5 pas de l'Empire State Building et 10 pas de Times Square!
Le personnel à la réception est adorable et répond volontiers à vos questions. La chambre est assez grande, rénovée récemment et le lit est top. Les linges sont changés tous les jours si besoin et la chambre est propre.
Pour le petit dèj, il y a à disposition des muffins, des fruits, des jus, du café et du thé, c'est en libre service. J'ai adoré prendre ce qui me faisait envie et aller déjeuner sur le rooftop où la vue sur l'ESB est juste... amazing! 
Dans le hall de l'hôtel, il y a un bar et un restaurant de burger. Et il y a plusieurs petits resto dans la rue (coréen, irlandais, etc).
Seul bémol, à la période où j'y étais, le bar du rooftop était fermé, c'est dommage d'avoir un tel lieu à disposition mais de ne pas en tirer tout le bénéfice. Malgré cela, j'ai plusieurs fois profité de prendre l'apéro en fin d'après-midi sur la terrasse, endroit idéal pour faire connaissance avec d'autres voyageurs.
Sans la moindre hésitation, je recommande cet hôtel!!

title: Definitely use this hotel again
text: Really friendly staff on reception ,Inna & Floyd.  Good size rooms, comfy bed & being high up not too much traffic noise , roof top bar was a great place to chill & excellent view of Empire State Building. It was really  close to all the sights. We enjoyed the grab & go breakfast .

title: Brilliant
text: lovely place to stay.. all the staff were really friendly from front of desk to the ladies who look after the rooms..centrally located in manhatten and the subway only 100 yds away..great to get around if you need it..big shout to Saul the bellman.. really good for getting taxis,if needed and a really nice personality..enjoyed every minute..i will be back

title: Nice hotel
text:
Booked this hotel for our recent visit to NYC. Hotel itself is nice. The best thing about it is the bedrooms, in particular the beds….. so so comfortable! Loved climbing into it after a full day sight seeing! The bedrooms were kept very clean and tidy. Bedding changed every second day and towels everyday if required. It also has a well stocked coffee machine and a fridge to store your cold drinks! I did feel the communal areas in the hotel, such as lobby’s outside the bedrooms could have been cleaner though. Didn’t look as if a hoover had been used in quite a while! 

There is a roof terrace with fantastic views. However,I was really disappointed with  it. The hotel advertises that it has a roof top bar. I emailed the hotel to ensure this would be opened whilst we were there and was informed it would be opened on the 1st June, we arrived the 2nd! The bar was not opened and hotel said it was unlikely that it would be opened this year!!! Please bear this in mind if this is what you are looking for in a hotel. You can take your own drinks or get them from the bar downstairs, really not the experience I was expecting though! 

There is a bar/restaurant but this was closed most nights of our stay, only managed to visit once as it was closed for private functions or not opened that night! When we asked about it we were told, well there is other bars down the street! Don’t advertise that you have these facilities if your guests can’t use them! 

Overall the hotel itself is in a good location , the bedrooms are fab but I feel there is nicer areas to stay in! View outside our window was of a very dirty street, with quite a few homeless people which had camped up across the street( very sad to see). There is a subway very close, so great for getting around! We didn’t spend that much time there as we had really full on sight seeing days so didn’t bother us too much!

title: This is usual GO TO HOTEL!
text:
Kixby has always been a pleasure, I first visited here before the Pandemic hit, after staying at other chain hotels, such as Lexington Hotel & Westin Grand Central, this hotel hits different on many levels, Its cosier in the rooms than both. 

The only thing the hotel seriously lacks on is the television sets, no Netflix/streaming functions and low-quality cable television standards, the previous stay we had an issue with our bed in our room on the final full day, the bed broke and clearly had previous repairs done to it, this was however swiftly checked and we was moved into a lux king room free of charge, they also ensured we was close to our other guest that we was on holiday with.

title: Perfect NYC base!
text:
We visited the Kixby as part of our honeymoon and thought it was a great choice! 
The location is great and very central, the rooms were lovely and the bar 'The Black Tap' served great food. There was also nice little touches like free grab and go breakfasts (muffins, juice, coffee etc)

Recommend!

title: Couldn't have picked a better hotel
text:
So booked a 7 night stay in New York for end of May after it being covid cancelled twice before. What can I say about the Kixby other than it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. OK I'm not picky like some people but if anyone has a complaint it was certainly not my experience.
Arrived 2 pm on the Monday and room was ready despite being before official check in time. A bottle of complimentary cava in an ice bucket was waiting for me. Coffee machine,fridge,safe, dressing gowns, umbrella and fancy toiletries were a great bonus.
Slept really well in the comfy bed and air conditioning was welcome in a climate hotter than Scotland! It may be the city that never sleeps but I certainly did every night and despite it's central location was surprisingly quiet.
The next morning was up early and enjoyed free breakfast of muffins,cereal bars, fruit, orange juice and coffee. Gave the gym a bypass but great facility for anyone who appreciates that sort of thing.
After a busy day got a bottle of wine and filled an ice bucket to take to the rooftop. Bar there wasn't opening till June but it is a fantastic space with stunning views of the Empire State Building just a street away.
Then I went to the downstairs bar which I frequented every night it was open. My friends were in another hotel and after packed days often just wanted to relax in the evenings. Lewis (Louis?) the barman deserves a special mention as he was not only friendly but engaged me in really interesting conversations which I'm sure was above his job description.!He works hard and is an asset to the business.
All the staff were friendly and helpful from cleaning staff to receptionists and Floyd who stored my bags at checkout on the lsdt day and arranged a taxi to the airport.
In summary, fantastic hotel in a stunning location, great room, brilliant staff and if I ever go back would be my first choice.

title: Great hotel in a fab location
text:
Recently renovated to a high standard, this hotel has friendly and helpful staff.
The rooftop is a great space to gaze at the Empire State Building or just sit and soak up the sounds of the city.
Bedrooms are spotlessly clean with comfortable beds and bathrooms are lovely too.
The Black Tap eatery on site serves lovely craft burgers, shakes and beer.
We will definitely go back (this is our third time at this hotel)
The photo I have added is the view of Empire State Building from the roof of the hotel

title: Perfect trip
text:
Great hotel, situation in a perfect spot just off 5th! Staff very friendly and we were greeted with a bottle of bubbly and a room upgrade for our honeymoon. 
The roof top is amazing! The bar was open when we visited however we still took breakfast up and then bought beer in the evenings to enjoy the weather and the view!! 
A must visit hotel

title: NY Visit May 22
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights during May 22. Booked a package through Virgin. The hotel location is great for sight seeing and exploring as very central within Manhattan and subway station is just down the street. 

We found check in to be quite frosty (not the famous American welcome we had expected!). Stayed on the 10th floor. The room was very clean, seems to have been newly furnished and the decor was very nice, however, photos on the website from Virgin and the hotel were quite deceptive in terms of the space in the room, we had chosen the hotel VS another due to the appearance of a more spacious room. We weren’t in the room a huge amount but it did get a bit annoying having to shuffle around each other. There was also no mirror in the room and so nowhere to style hair if needing a plug so dashing between the bathroom mirror and plug socket to check for missed bits was a bit of a pain. The beds and linens were very comfortable and very welcome after a full day in the city. 

Being in the centre of the city there is street noise, mainly horns and sirens which you can obviously hear at night time, we did find that the air con was needed so used overnight. As mentioned by others the air con was very noisy but we found the constant sound from that was better than the street noise at night time as your brain seemed to be able to switch off from it. If you’re sensitive to noise though you may benefit from earplugs. 

The grab and go breakfast was very welcome, we took a coffee, (huge!) muffin and fruit most days which was really handy especially with an early start for sight seeing. 

We’d definitely stay at the hotel again, mainly due to location, cleanliness and comfort rather than service as we didn’t find this especially friendly or helpful. A couple of niggles could be improved upon to improve the rooms but overall a good stay. 

The Duane Reade on 6th Avenue is handy if needing water, snacks, medications etc, Keens steakhouse on 36th is a must visit (but book in advance if you want to be guaranteed a table) and Barn Joo across the street from the hotel does amazing Korean food if you are looking for something local.

title: Excellent 5 stars
text:
Last day in NY and the Kixby has been superb.
Very straight forward and easy check in.  Rooms very clean and most importantly after a day exploring the city very comfy beds.  Complimentary breakfast of coffee and muffins was a perfect way to start your day. Coffee machine in the room but also on 2nd floor tea and coffee 24hrs.  Then take your coffee up to the rooftop bar and watch the city wake up, or a drink before bed. The location is perfect for walking to Times Square only 10 minute walk.  Subway Station at the end of the street.  Would recommend to anybody.  Cant wait to come back

title: Helpful and comfortable
text: Stayed recently with my mum - had such a lovely stay. All the staff were incredibly helpful And even booked and organised our taxi when we left. The room was spotless, cleaned every day and great roof

title: Clean, Comfortable, and Central
text: The hotel is so nice and clean all of the staff are super friendly and helpful. Just ensure that your check in time is correct as the communication between holiday provider and hotel can be mixed. Ended up waiting two hours to check in after landing. Apart from that I would still stay here again!

title: Amazing!
text: We stayed at the Kixby for 5 nights this month, the room was gorgeous everything you would need inc ironing board,iron, toiletries! We had a welcoming gift as we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, delayed due to covid, a lovely bottle of wine and chocolates, very lovely touch, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel is in a good location, few mins to times square, great view of the empire state building, would definitely recommend and hopefully come back one day!

title: Location, comfort and style
text: We (two parents, one teen) stayed at this hotel for a weekend in May 2022 in a two-queen room on the top floor. The location is perfect for walking or taking the subway anywhere in Manhattan. Driving in and out was easy (for Manhattan) as it's a straight shot to and from the Lincoln Tunnel, and parking at the garage a few doors down was easy and reasonably priced (again, for Manhattan).  Our room was surprisingly spacious - I'd call it huge, not just for Manhattan, but for any city.  We loved the comfortable beds & bedding, friendly staff, international clientele, even the beautiful blue walls!  We heard almost no noise from the street (our room was not on the street side).  Other doors closing were quite loud and we could clearly hear neighbors talking in the hall but not in their rooms - fortunately our neighbors came and went at reasonable times so it did not disturb us a bit. Breakfast was grab-and-go fruit and muffins, which was all we needed. I would have loved other tea options. While the rooftop bar was not open for the season yet, the rooftop seating area was, and it is spectacular - even on a foggy weekend the view of the Empire State Building is stunning.  I would absolutely stay here again and hope to do so soon!

title: Excellent in every way
text:
I’m not sure I’ll stay anywhere else in NYC again! This hotel is perfect. Its location is fabulous, decor is lovely, staff are so helpful and friendly. A special call out to Inna on Reception and Saul at the front desk. Inna went out of her way to make my stay the best. I paid for an upgrade to a King room based on TA reviews and am so glad I did. The room was really spacious. You get lots of fresh, soft white towels and lovely products (M&G-I can’t remember how to spell them-Malin & Goetz maybe). 

The rooftop is so lovely and really does has lovely Empire State views. 

It’s a no brainier for me to stay here again, I couldn’t fault it. 

They do charge for packages in advance of your arrival which bugged me pre-stay but once I saw the size of the cloakroom I understood why. 

Enjoy!

title: Excellent
text:
Hello , just wanted to say anyone considering the Kixby hotel them it’s a must . Lovely hotel very friendly staff , fabulous  rooms lovely decorated  and we have a fabulous view of the Empire State Building . Right in the middle of everything. We are here at the moment our second  day . Just had completely breakfast muffins breakfast bars coffee and juice really nice . So it’s a definite return for us to this hotel . 
Simon & Jackie

title: Lovely hotel
text: Had a lovely 5 night stay in the Kixby.  The room was clean and modern with a very comfortable bed, fridge, coffee machine, iron, ironing board and hairdryer were all included. Grab and go breakfast was handy as we were up and out early so took a muffin and coffee to go. Great location, just down the road from Macy’s and there is a subway station at the end of the road.  Great views of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar, even though the bar itself wasn’t open you could still go and sit out there with your own drinks (see photo!).  I would definitely recommend and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.  I’m giving 4 stars though as the 2 lifts were so slow and it took forever to get down to the lobby!

title: Kixby
text:
Have just returned from 5 nights here and the hotel was great. We had a king sized room and the bed was so comfortable! The room was spacious and clean and had a coffee machine. Grab and go breakfast was good with muffins, cereal bars and fruit. The rooftop bar was not open but you can take your own drinks out on the rooftop, with great views of the Empire State Building. 
Location was good, a short walk to Times Square and a subway station at the end of the road. There were some bars up the road which we used.
The only downside is that the lifts were really slow and stairs were closed due to some floors being refurbished. Also, don’t get a bottle of bubbly in our room like some others did 😢🤣.

title: Excellent Base for Everything
text:
Stayed here for my wife's special birthday trip to NYC as recommended by Trailfinders. Very warm and friendly welcome and nice touch of card/bubbly in our room.
1 complaint - my daughter and grandson arrived 2 days after us and had to wait almost 2 hours for their room to be ready ( it was next door to ours and we saw the bed being stripped when we went out in the morning) after published check in time of 3.00pm. Fortunately, they were able to use our room whilst waiting but not impressed. 2 comments - " grab and go breakfast" should finish later in the morning/hallways needed cleaning. Room was nothing special but was clean, well equipped and had a nice bathroom/shower. Roof top area was a nice touch and would be great in Summer months. Excellent location with Empire SB only minutes away/ good shopping and transport very nearby/plenty of restaurants/ Times Square and Broadway only 15-20 minutes walk. Helpful and friendly staff. Quite expensive but what isn't in NYC! Overall, a nice base for sightseeing but probably wouldn't stay there again.

title: A NY stay in April
text:
I was looking forward to our stay but left feeling disappointed.  The staff are welcoming and friendly and very helpful but overall the hotel is not really a 4 star quality property.  A few issues of note:
- The air conditioning is exceptionally noisy.  Our stay was cold for NY so we didn't turn on the AC until the final night and we had a disturbed night's sleep due to the noise.  It was more like the kind of unit found in a budget motel
- the TV is very small and the sound is really poor quality, trying to listen to it was impossible
- the breakfast was very disappointing. Orange juice was not fresh.  The apple and banana were OK and supplies were refreshed through the breakfast period but nothing else other than a sugar laden muffin was on offer
- you had to book the gym with reception and not their fault but a mother and daughter seemed to monopolise it for hours when we were trying to access it
- the location is convenient for Penn Station and Times Square / Heald Square but 35th Street is decidedly seedy
- a mirror in the room rather than inside the wardrobe would have been better

On a positive note the bed was comfortable

title: Tolles Boutique Hote, ideal gelegen. Unser Zuhause für 10 Tage.
text:
Wir hatten ein neu renoviertes Superior Zimmer mit Kingsize Bett. Für NY ein sehr großes Zimmer. Wir hatten eine nette Sitzecke mit 2 Sesseln und Tisch. Leider war der Tisch zu klein um zusammen "Take Away" zu essen. Platz für einen größeren Tisch wäre durchaus vorhanden.
Das Zimmer war ausgestattet mit einem Kühlschrank, einem modernem Safe (Notebookgröße), Föhn, Bügelbrett (haben wir als Ablage genutzt - leider gab es nur eine faltbare Kofferablage), 2 Bademäntel, 1 Regenschirm, Schreibbereich + Stuhl und reichlich Seifen, Schampoos, Conditioner etc. Letzteres steht im Gegensatz dazu, dass das Hotels etwas für die Umwelt tun will. So entsteht viel Plastikmüll. Große Seifen- und Schampoospender (wie es mittlerweile in vielen Hotels üblich ist)  wären besser. Bett/Bettwäsche wird laut ausgelegtem Zettel nur alle 3 Tage gemacht/gewechselt (das finde ich vollkommen in Ordnung) und trotzdem wurde unser Bett ab dem dritten Tag dann doch täglich "schön gemacht". Vielleicht auch weil wir hier insgesamt 10 Tage übernachtet haben.
Wir hatten ohne Frühstück gebucht, es gab aber täglich ein "Complimentary Breakfast". Muffins, Obst, Orangensaft und Kaffee standen in einem kleinem Raum zur Abholung bereit.
Die Dachterrasse mit Blick auf das Empire State Building (deswegen der Name der Bar "Look Up") ist genial. Die Bar war nicht offen, aber trotzdem konnte man jederzeit (Wetterabhängig) dort oben den Blick geniessen, oder am Abend seinen eigenen Sundowner geniessen.
Metrostation, Restaurants, Fastfood, Liquor Store und Macy's um die Ecke.
Das Hotelpersonal ist supernett.
Das Bett und das Bettzeug waren himmlisch. Wir haben sehr gut geschlafen.
Klimanlage und Heizung waren idiotensicher bedienbar.
Housekeeping und Sauberkeit top.
Roomservice gab es , haben wir aber nicht ausprobiert.
10 Tage haben wir uns hier wie Zuhause gefühlt.
Wir kommen wieder!

title: Good value hotel in good location
text:
Good value hotel in good location. Inna on reception very helpful.
Room good with required amenities , comfortable bed, could have done with comfortable pillows to go with it. 
Room clean, hallway carpets could have done with more regular vacuuming.

title: Brilliant 🇬🇧✈️🇺🇸
text:
Excellent location. 
Fabulously clean.
Comfy beds.
Great customer service.
Great knowledge of the area.
Nothing was ever too much trouble. 
Have recommended to some friends already and we haven’t even been home 48hours yet!!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. The Butcher’s 🇬🇧

title: Comfy bed, great location
text:
There's a lot I loved about this little hotel! Firstly, that is was little, almost boutique. I prefer this. The location was super - views of the Empire state and just down one street from Macy's. Tube station on same street. 
The bed was incredibly comfortable, very welcome at the end of every day having walked so much!
The grab and go breakfast was brilliant. So handy if you're heading off early, or just to get a bit of energy before getting breakfast elsewhere. 
Nice free toiletries in the bathrooms. Umbrella provided in case of rain (which we got none of!). 
Very friendly staff.
Not much on the down side. We stayed a week and the maid didn't change our sheets, however, had this been a big deal we would have mentioned it. We were so tired it didn't really bother us. And I'm not sure I'd stay here in summer- the AC is incredibly noisy and the room is very stuffy without it. And the stairwells need cleaned more often.

title: Lovely hotel in the middle of everything
text: We were very pleased with this hotel. It is close to everything and the subway is very close by. The rooms are comfortable, and clean, and the staff were helpful and friendly. The all day free coffee on the 2nd floor is a nice touch, as are the free muffins, fruit, and snacks at breakfast time.

title: Great 4 night stay
text:
Room warm cosy and quiet, came with, safe, TV, hairdryer etc – hotel wifi in room was very good.
Comfy bed nice - but smallish bathroom, great shower.
No resort fees.
Location excellent, Right next to subway and close to many of the sights. Pio bagel shop Next Street good for breakfast bagels/ coffee.
Great pub 3 doors up – playwright Irish pub nice food and beers – good atmosphere.
Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Comfy, trendy and well presented hotel in central location.
text:
We stayed at the Kixby for 5 nights. It is in a very central location with key tourists spots within walking distance. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfy and the bathroom had an excellent, powerful shower. We could see the Empire State Building from our bedroom window which was a nice added bonus. The roof top bar was not yet open when we stayed but we were able to go up to the terrace with our morning coffee or just pop up and enjoy the view. 
It is noisy at night, even when staying on higher floor (we were on 10) due to being so central and and also not being a particularly tall building.  However, I imagine in New York, you would be hard pushed to find somewhere that is quiet and is just part of the experience!

title: Very impressed!
text:
We stayed at the Kixby Hotel in March 2022 and have to say we were very impressed! The hotel didn't look much from the outside due to all the building work going on in the street (and within the hotel itself), but inside it was a beautiful haven. You could tell it had recently been re-furbished.

It was my partner's birthday during our stay and the hotel were kind enough to upgrade our room for us. The room was spacious, clean, and there were lots of little touches which made for a comfortable stay. The bathroom and shower were amazing too. The location of the hotel was also ideal for exploring New York - close walking distance to Times Square and easy access to the subway to explore further afield.

Rating as 4/5 due to the fact there were no real breakfast facilities (it was advertised as grab&go breakfast which mainly consisted of muffins, but on 3/4 mornings we went down there was no food left at around 8:30/09:00) and the rooftop bar advertised was closed and this was part of the reason we chose the hotel.

title: Top locatie
text:
Super goede locatie, heel erg centraal van alles, maar net uit de drukte.
Hele fijne bedden en mooie ruime kamer.
Badkamer helemaal compleet met fijne douche 👍🏼.
Al met al een echte aanrader en een plek waar we zelf nog eens terug zullen keren.

title: Amazing Hotel & Staff
text:
Can't fault anything about this hotel. Located right next to Macys less than 10 min to Times Square. Nice quiet street away from the noise. Hotel Newly renovated. Rooms incl coffee machine (dolceGusto) robes hairdryer umbrellas USB ports for charging. Huge Rainfall shower including Malin+Goetz toiletries 
All Staff were incredible they couldn't do enough for us.
Breakfast was grab&go. Muffins were huge! Orange juice soo fresh
You can  walk through to gastro foodbar within hotel and burgers were amazing! Bring a drink up to rooftop bar for epic views of Empire Sate 24/7. Will definitely return to this hotel. Couldn't of wished for better.

title: Definitely recommended
text: We cant fault this hotel. Superb welcome. Lovely staff, especially Inna from Ukraine. I'm not deducting any points for the lack of rooftop bar and breakfast facilities. I'm sure that these will return before too long. If we do return to NYC, this will be our hotel of choice. It's smack in the middle of Manhattan but it's not noisy either.

title: Great Stay
text: Great hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff, great rooftop seating area for sitting out day or night. Located beside Macy's, and within walking distance of all of the attractions like time square, Madison square garden and empire state building. Subway station beside hotel. Would recommend to a friend.

title: Spacious and clean!
text:
Great location, seconds away from the subway, few minutes walk to Times Square and plenty of eating options in the immediate vicinity. Staff were lovely, very welcoming and always greeted us on return. 
We had a room on the third floor which was at the back of the hotel and didn’t notice much outside noise. The room was clean,modern and really spacious. It had a tea/coffee machine, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, safe, robes and umbrellas. The heating/air con was quite noisy but then we’re not used to it, having radiators back home. Took earplugs for me, but didn’t bother my daughter. The bathroom was quite tight but for the time you spend in it, it doesn’t matter. Again it was modern  and clean, had a huge illuminated mirror above the sink and also a moveable magnifier mirror. 
We also had a room on the 9th floor at the front of the hotel. This room was smaller but still a great size for NYC and actually had a slightly bigger bathroom. The TV was huge and had all the same amenities. Any outside noise didn’t disrupt sleep. None us noticed any renovations in the building? 
Grab and go breakfast wasn’t  to our taste but it’s complimentary and we used it. Tea, coffee, fresh orange juice, bananas, apples, oranges, nature valley cereal bars and huge muffins.
We ate at the Black Tap attached to the hotel and all enjoyed our food and shakes. Used room service, think this is an external supplier but food was fine and reception rang to advise delivery was on its way up. Had an Uber deliver pizza, went down to reception to collect it, 
Rooftop terrace has amazing views of the Empire State Building, 
Had a fabulous time in New York and would 100% stay here again.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
Hotel is a 5 min walk to Times Square .Rooms are very clean and have all amenities you’ll need.Front desk are very pleasant and will help you with travel advice and booking cabs etc.
Must do list. Visit the Edge. Go to Ellen’s stardust for breakfast.Go to Connolly Irish bar 45th st and use Toast just round the corner for extremely affordable buffet food.
We enjoyed our 13th visit to nyc .would definitely recommend the Kirby Hotel

title: Average hotel
text:
We booked this via a virgin holiday package. It was pretty cheap but I had a quick look at the reviews and felt that as it was a 4* it would be ok. It was ok, not great,  but could of been worse. I think we were expecting a little more for its 4* rating but I highly suspect this is their own rating, not an official one. We stayed at the 5* Conrad last time which was miles superior. I would say this is a 3* at best. The road it’s on is a little run down but it is in a good location, 20 minutes to Central Park, 10 mins from Times Square, 5 mins from Madison square gardens and about $15 to most other places around Manhattan. 

The room was ok, quite spacious and very clean. The aircon was so incredibly loud, you’d not be able to sleep a wink if you wanted it on through the night. The TV was tiny and the sound quality was dreadful. The front doors slam hard if left which rattled through the rooms, makes you jump every time another guest comes or goes from their rooms. There was no mirror at all in the bedroom, only on the back of the bathroom door which is totally unacceptable. I asked the less than helpful staff for ear plugs, a kettle and a small mirror. We never got any of it. Fair enough they don’t have a kettle, they don’t really use them but ear plugs and a spare mirror, especially as half the place is currently being renovated, they must of had 1 small mirror somewhere!! The bathroom was fine, shower was always hot and it was spacious. 

We didn’t have the grab & go breakfast at all but did make use of the 24/7 hot water and coffee on level 2. When the hot water was full, it was often empty. We did take room service one night which was really expensive and my chicken wings were as tough as leather. The burger my boyfriend had he enjoyed though. 

We slept well and felt clean so that is the most important. It’s just not quite luxurious enough for our tastes, we like a doorman and staff that go above and beyond. This had hostel type vibes. But, it was cheap so we definitely got what we paid for. We wouldn’t recommend or return though.

title: Great, couldn't ask for more
text:
Spent 4 nights mid-march, and really loved this hotel, hope to come there back for my future stays (might depends on price, had a great flight + hotel package with British airways).

I chose this hotel because of its location, not only is it convenient to go be in midtown (so mostly everything in Manhattan was close) , but being so close from the subways, with different trains, was really great. Also because it was refurbished lately, so everything was in good condition (btw they are redoing the penthouse rooms, I'm sure they'll be wonderful).

Breakfast was below average, but free, so you can't complain. Didn't try the  burger restaurant, but had some from them in their swiss restaurant and it was good. They used to have a rooftob bar, it's closed, but you can stilll access it. I had a beer on the top, with empire state building views, it was nice.

My room was calm and big enough (maybe because I asked the staff before coming, which was nice and fast to answer). Only  thing I didn't like that much is that the you still have daylight with their curtains, and the AC/heating system makes quite a lot of noise. They have a small fridge, hairdresser, bathrobe (unfortunately discovered this only while leaving, it's in a cupboard i didn't use!).

title: 10/10! We had a fabulous stay!
text: Really enjoyed our stay at Kixby. The hotel is in a fabulous location, just a street away from the empire state, subway station a few doors down and a short walk to some of the main attractions. The rooms are of really high quality, clean and spacious, and a perfect place to rest after miles of walking each day! The staff were really friendly and helpful and always welcomed you each time you came into the hotel. Best bit of all? The rooftop terrace which has the best view of the empire state building. Would 100% recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to NYC!!

title: wonderful stay
text:
I've given this 5 but 4.5 would be fair.

Great location and comfortable rooms. We didn't have any issues with noise from outside but the heat/cool unit within the room was a bit noisy and we had to unplug this overnight - but we weren't cold at all. Reasonable value.

A mention for Natalya on the desk - a great concierge and she managed to sort all our ticketing needs at lower than advertised prices. And she was really helpful with general info too.

Would stay here again.

title: Great location but some issues
text: Good location, short walk from Penn Station. We had a King Lux room which was good size, refurbished and clean. The main issue we had was the noise from the street at the front even though we were on 9th floor. There appears to be construction work going on at surrounding buildings and some of noise appeared to come from some loose and banging materials. The compressor on the fridge ran continually through the night and was also noisy which resulted in me pulling plug out. We had ear plugs but still found it noisy. Staff were good on reception. Complimentary grab and go was handy but required taking items from 2nd floor room to 9th floor as nowhere else to sit down to eat/drink. Bed very comfy just a shame we had interrupted sleep because of noise.

title: Ok but..
text:
Lovely hotel but needs a few things to make better. We booked 2 king lux and one room huge and the other not!  Don't get me wrong both have great comfortable beds and all amenities in the room  especially the coffee machine, toiletries and safe but our room at front of hotel very noisy but this is new York!  Get ear plugs you will need them.   Great location.  Subway on doorstep.  Macy's 2 minutes away.   New York v v expensive food average apart from Keens steakhouse which is amazing.

This hotel is being refurbished so I'm in afraid you can expect dust and workmen and the smell of paint on certain floors...this is why 3 stars.  Can't understand why not mentioned before!!

Also one of bars is open craft ...!!!!!!!  Stay away from times Square sorry since legalisation of cannabis not nice.. go to Hudson yard/Chelsea)/ central park..nicer.

title: Great central location and facilities
text: First time back in NYC in over two years because of covid and the kixby didn’t disappoint. This was a girls trip for a birthday, I emailed the hotel before arriving and asked for rooms on the same floor. Whilst they couldn’t guarantee they said they would try to accommodate. Not only were our rooms on the same floor they were only a couple apart which was really helpful. The rooms are clean and tastefully decorated. All of the staff were exceptionally helpful, pleasant and extremely friendly. The grab and go breakfast was a real bonus as the hotel bar and restaurant were not open yet. Would recommend visiting the roof terrace even though the bar is not open as you get excellent views of the Empire State Building feels like you can almost reach out and touch it. The wine and chocolates the hotel provided for our friends birthday were a nice touch and very much appreciated especially as it was her first visit to NYC. This hotel is in a great central location and is an ideal base for touring around the city can’t recommend enough. Whilst their bar was not open there is a bar a couple doors up called the Liberty which I would highly recommend

title: Fab
text:
Just a great few days. Hotel was ideally placed for sightseeing. Friendly staff, spotless and comfortable. 

I stay in a lot of hotels, and am not easy to impress but this place was as good as the reviews suggest. Thanks 🙏🏻

title: AMAZING
text:
If you ever need a place to stay, book in at the Kixby. My son (17) and I stayed for 5 nights. The hotel is so clean, stylish, friendly and has THE MOST amazing view from the Look Up rooftop bar. 24 hour tea and coffee, lovely free breakfast in the morning and such helpful staff. Cannot fault the place. Thank you to all staff, you are doing an incredible job. Sad to leave last night but we will most definitely be back. 
Definitely  recommend getting a metro card ($33 for 7 days) and journey to the airport from Penn Station getting the air shuttle to jfk ($7.75 each).
You guys rock. Thank you x

title: Amazing stay
text:
What an amazing stay in the Kixby, even though there were still restrictions this did not take away from my 7 nights there. Stan and the rest of the team were amazing! 
I was so looked after. The location was perfect especially for me as a first time visitor. I can not wait to go back.

title: WOW Just WOW!
text:
We have just arrived back from 4 nights at the Kixby, wow where do I start, from the moment we arrived we felt genuinely welcome, reception staff are amazing, always there to greet you with a huge smile whenever you come & go during the day, they recommend Andrews coffee shop for breakfast (Nutella French toast - was the best!) 
Our room (Lux King- room 603) was just perfect, beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, fresh towels every day, lovely toiletries, the room includes robes for the duration of your stay & an umbrella should you need it (thankfully we didn’t) 
The view of The Empire State room from the rooftop was fab, there is a bar up there but was obviously closed for winter, but imagine it would be amazing up there on a warm summer evening! 
Reception staff also arranged the yellow cab for our return back to JFK. 
I would totally recommend this hotel, a real hidden gem in this amazing city! We will definitely be back when we return to NYC!

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed at the Kixby for 3 night on our recent trip to JFK. Inna at reception was extremely helpful and polite. We upgraded our room to a Lux queen queen upon arrival and we were super impressed. Room size was great and bathroom was stocked with animal friendly toiletries. No food or beverage options during our stay but the hotel very kindly provided coffee, orange juice and breakfast bars for guests. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is one night I was kept awake by the heating system in the room making constant noises and also on our last day we checked at reception to confirm check out time and was advised it was 11am but the sign on the back of the closet door says 12pm.

title: Great location. Fair prices. Helpful staff.
text: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to NYC. I am absolutely pleased with the hotel. Location is perfect and I believe the hotel offers great value for money. Inna at the reception was always very helpful and kind to accommodate all our requests. I highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family. PS hotel serves very cool branded cruelty free shampoos, body creams.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Spent 5 nights at this fabulous hotel at the end of January. The hotel is in a great location-amazing view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop. Room was great & bed super comfy. Tea & coffee maker in room-nice coffee pods (& tea) provided. Grab & go breakfast an unexpected bonus. Staff very friendly & helpful. Can’t wait to return.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Fantastic hotel. Staff were great. So clean and comfortable. Room 708 was spacious, bed was comfy. Room had a safe, fridge, coffee machine, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. There were robes and an umbrella that you could use throughout your stay (with the option to purchase them if you wanted to). Free grab and go breakfast of juice, fruit, cereal bars and muffins. Free tea and coffee available 24/7.  Check in / out was easy. Hotel will store your bags if you have a late flight home. The view from the rooftop was simply stunning. This hotel is quite simply amazing and I will stay here again.

title: Kixby to the max 😊😊👏
text:
Sometimes a hotel is only a place to lay your hat and it’s wot you do is the best part of your stay🤗
Well 🤔 this hotel is just Perfect with a capital P 👍 the room is massive clean and warm , hey you know me I don’t wander around looking for stains or minor damage just to be a pain, I probably could but why would I?? 
Back to the room & hotel, the location is more than perfect and suitable for shopping and sightseeing, rite next to Macy’s and Penn street station.. I usually don’t review Hotel breakfast cuz I like to go out wander have Brekkie and watch the world go by.. the roof top bar is seasonal and not open but the view is just NY to a t with the Empire State on your doorstep.. would I stay again, ohh yes 🙌 🙌🙌🙌

title: Perfect Birthday Celebrations
text: Stayed here at the end if January to celebrate my wife's 40th Birthday. Fantastic hotel in a great location. 1 block from Macey's and the Empire State. Only a 10 min walk to Times Square. We stayed for 4 nights. The room was perfect. The best shower in the world and always piping hot water.  The room was spotlessly clean and had everything needed for a beautiful stay, perfect for the 2 of us. Coffee machine with pods topped up daily. Also complimentary grab and go breakfast and a room which had 24hr access to tea and coffee. Reception staff were lovely and very helpful at all times. Could not find fault at all. Loved our stay at The Kixby and will definitely be back. Thank you to all of the staff.

title: Amazing hotel.
text: We stayed here for 5 nights and honestly we couldn’t fault it one bit. The rooms were amazing, super clean the beds were unbelievably comfy! The reception staff were amazing Maria & Floyd were the best. The hotel has been refurbished it’s so lovely & modern. Perfect location, the hotel is only a walking distance from some of the main sites. 100% would stay here again & would recommend it to anyone.

title: FABULOUS!!!
text: The Kixby Hotel has an exceptional location for exploring Manhattan, I cannot recommend it highly enough. Beautifully decorated rooms, super comfortable beds, immaculately clean & has everything you need. The hotel staff are extremely helpful & friendly. The view of the Empire State Building from the roof top bar is absolutely breathtaking! However, the most fabulous feature of The Kixby Hotel is the most genuinely warm welcome you receive upon arrival from the absolutely gorgeous receptionist, Maria. She is the most authentic, genuine, friendly, wonderful New Yorker you will have the pleasure to meet during your stay in NYC & by the time you leave...she is your brand new best friend - wonderful woman! We most definitely will be returning to The Kixby when we next visit NYC - loved our stay here.

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay at Kixby Hotel.
The reception team were very welcoming and friendly. Special mention for Maria B who was really helpful and gave great advice on where to go/ how to get there/ what to do etc. Floyd was also friendly. 
The location of this hotel is excellent. The Empire State Building is one block away ( 2 minutes walk).
Times Square is 10 minutes walk. 
Macy’s store is across the road. 
There are lots of fast food outlets close by along with a supermarket and wine/liquor store. 
The room was lovely and a good size for New York. 
Comfy bed.
Phones could be charged via the bedside lamps which was useful. 
Hot and powerful shower.
Towels changed daily. 
Tea making machine in room which produced a nice cuppa. 
Hot drinks, juice, water, fruit, cereal bars and  muffins were available for breakfast on the second floor. 
We visited the top floor of the hotel which has an outside bar (closed) which had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. This would be a lovely place for a drink in the warmer months. 
The hotel and room was really quiet considering it’s central location. 
Very good pub next door called Libertys ( turn left when exit hotel) and one called the Playwright next to Libertys. 
Lots of restaurants close by. 
My only fault with the room was there was no light near the wardrobe so it was hard to see clothes and also the corridors were slightly dark. However this would not put me off from staying again. 
This is a small boutique hotel and I would highly recommend.

title: A gem of a hotel for the first step on our honeymoon
text:
This hotel was suggested to us by trailfinders and it turned out to be an excellent suggestion.
The location is great, a block from the Empire State, walking distance of plenty of restaurants, underground station at the end of the block.
We arrived to a very friendly and efficient check in and up to our room, a decent sized room, especially for NYC. Also a lovely gesture of a bottle of fizz and lovely card as it was our honeymoon.
The room is really nice with loads of features rather than just the boring boxes that many NYC rooms are.
Staff on reception were really helpful, and invited us to go to the top floor, although the bar was closed this still gave excellent view of the Empire State.
Would definitely recommend this for anyone visiting NYC

title: Awesome stay at The Kixby!
text: Stayed at The Kixby back in early December.  Awesome visit!  Friendly and professional staff, nice accommodations with all of the amenities and a perfect location in Mid-Town.  Kudos to Linda Davis - she rocks!  Will definitely be back when visiting NYC.

title: The perfect experience
text:
Amazing hotel. Huge rooms for New York, clean and tidy and the comfiest beds. Location was great, about a 15/20 min walk to Times Square, 2 mins from a subway station and about 5 mins from Bryant park. 
But the thing that made our trip the most special was the staff. If you are lucky enough to have Maria B on the front desk, I can guarantee your day will be even better. Anything we needed, she was there and she always made the effort to have a chat with us about our day and what we got up to. 
I can confirm we definitely be back when visiting New York, the perfect experience.

title: Perfect Location
text: We have just come back from 4 nights, lovely Hotel. Lucky to check in early, had initial problem with room but so accommodating and upgraded us straight away. Hotel was clean and the staff super friendly. Maria is a lovely lady and was lovely to meet her very friendly and informative. Hotel staff happy to navigate you and help you out. Hotel is great location and if we were to come back here I would stay here again 100% would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Simply Superb Hotel
text:
We have just come back from staying 5 nights at this hotel! We were lucky enough to be able to check in just after 12pm instead of the 4pm check in, check in was simple, quick and easy. The staff made us very welcome, along with giving us tips for places to eat etc. 

Our room was just like the pictures! Modern, clean and very large! The bed was super comfy, with the bedding been changed every 3 days, towels each day. There is a safe and fridge in the room. Coffee machine with tea and coffee, topped up every day. The noise wasn't too bad, and managed to get to sleep easy each night.

There was a coffee and "Grab-and-go" area on the 2nd floor, open all day serving tea and coffee. Breakfast was muffins, cereal bars and fruit, but also orange juice before 11am. Great for grabbing something before your day out in NYC

The location of this hotel is excellent, we didn't get a single taxi or subway etc, we walked to everywhere we needed to 

We were able to go onto the rooftop and sit have coffee and enjoy the view of the empire state building.

It was a little bit disappointing the bar and restaurant was not open but did not retract anything from this amazing hotel.

On the day we checked out, the hotel stored our luggage and arranged for us for a taxi to take us to the airport that even. It was about $70 for a private taxi inc taxes and tips etc.

title: Good Stay
text: We stayed here for a week. It was a good stay. The reception staff were helpful. The takeaway coffee and tea and muffins were a good touch. The room we stayed in was a good size and had everything you need. Very  good location, very near to the Empire State Building.

title: Perfect location
text: Stayed in the Kixby hotel this week the location is amazing. The service the hotel offers is excellent from the rooms been so clean and the stunning views from the rooftop. Maria and Floyd at the front desk were also so welcoming and friendly it was nice to have a chats with them in a country were we knew no one they made our stay that bit more enjoyable.

title: Loved NY
text:
When we arrived we were told we had been booked into a Queen room as the had not availability to fit us into a Queen Queen room for our dates yet once we had paid them the extra suddenly we ended up in a Queen Queen room. The bathroom has tiled flooring which is very cold so I recommend taking some slippers or something to slip your feet in whilst using the bathroom. Your rooms have the towels chained daily but your bedding is only changed every third day. You’re told to keep the bottles of water which are in your room on arrival as they won’t be replaced and you can refill on level 2 24 hours a day.The manager of the reception is quite rude and unwelcoming whereas Maria is so kind and lovely and would try to help in any way she could. Breakfast is described as continental but it’s simply assorted flavour muffins, breakfast bars and some fruit. Tea and Coffee are available 24 hours a day on level 2. Alternatively, there is a coffee shop at the end of 35th street next to Macy’s called Andrew’s coffee shop which is very nice and have friendly staff. You could go up to the rooftop to see the Empire State but it was shut and so were the cocktail bar and restaurant which was also a let down. On a more positive note, The Kixby is in an ideal location for site seeing. The subway is easily accessible from the Kixby. 
There’s places I didn’t manage to see whilst in New York so can’t wait to return to New York but whilst there is still many covid restrictions in place it won’t be for a few years. Lord of restaurants are either closed or takeaway only due to covid which is annoying. 
Ellen’s stardust diner is a must whilst staying in New York too.

title: Room 304 William & Kala 5 night stay
text: We have just come back from a 5 night stay at the Kixby. The hotel is excellent and Marie & William on the desk are very friendly and attentive. The Room was clean and modern design with an comfy . The House keeping kept us topped up with fresh towels daily and left nice accomplishments. The hotel location is perfect for time square and food places and right next to the subway. Overall we would stay again and are happy with our stay. Thankyou

title: Fantastic hotel - highly recommended
text:
One word describes the Kixby hotel - fantastic!  Rooms are amazing.  Sometimes you see a picture of a hotel room and in reality the room looks nothing like the sales pictures - not at the Kixby - the rooms look better than the pictures. 

Staff were all super helpful and could not do enough for you. 

I would not hesitate to stay at the Kixby hotel again and in fact, can't wait for my next trip.

title: Brilliant stay
text: Lovely midtown hotel, newly renovated and very clean. The rooms are a good size and well appointed. Mostly though this place gets its 5 stars for the staff. So welcoming and friendly. We have had daily chats with the receptionist Maria B and she is just lovely. The other guys have all been great too. Thank you for helping us enjoy New York again.

title: Brilliant hotel! Can't fault it
text:
Just returned and had a wonderful time, we stayed at the kixby hotel and I cannot fault it.
Roof terrace and bar ( bar closed in winter but can still go to roof for views) Empire state literally across the road I will post pictures later, macys at bottom of street and times square 10 minute walk.
Newly refurbished all 3 of our rooms were lovely and we had a free upgrade. NO RESORT FEES! And free coffee tea and breakfast muffins and juice every morning. Maria on reception was great and really helpful as we're all the staff, can't recommend it highly enough. To give you idea on price £488 for flights and hotel from Heathrow for 4 nights booked through BA

title: Wonderfull place
text: Nous avons passé une superbe semaine dans cet hôtel. Idéalement situé, le lieu est très accueillant. Le personnel est particulièrement agréable et serviable. Merci à Maria pour sa compassion, merci à  Inna pour sa grande bienveillance et merci à Floyd pour professionnalisme. Si nous retournons à New-York nous n'hésiterons pas résider au Kixby4Q

title: Hidden gem!
text: This hotel from staff,cleanliness and the room is probibaly the best hotel Iv had, also the bed was amazing! I travel a lot and have stay med in hundreds of hotels. There is no resort fee and there’s complimentary fruit and muffins for breakfast fantastic wifi. This really was a wee Biden gem!

title: Great hotel in central Manhattan location
text:
Many have commented on the excellent staff at the Kixby and it was certainly true for us too. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and happy to assist with any questions. We appreciated the local breakfast diner recommendation for Andrews (corner of 35 & 7) and went there regularly. 

Our room was quiet, spacious, clean and generally well equipped although we could have used more coat hangers since we visited in Winter and had several layers to hang up. The bathroom was simple and functioned very well and the fridge was large and useful. 

The location is very central and we were able to walk to our various destinations easily which was very helpful during covid times. 

We welcomed 2022 on the rooftop listening to NYC celebrate noisily below and watching the light show on the Empire State Building. 

Truly memorable and many thanks to all at the Kixby for making our stay so pleasant. We will return soon.

title: Nice but nothing special
text:
We were finally able to go back to NYC this December and spent five nights at the Kixby, it's a nice hotel but certainly not as we expected given their website.

The staff are friendly, helpful - we had a problem with our A/C which was fixed immediately so kudos there and there was free coffee, fruit and some muffins/breakfast bars each day.

The location is ideal for most desinations and the Herald Square subway is a short amble away for further afield.

The room we had was a good size, clean and the facilities were good although there were some minor paint chips on the woodwork and something heavy had scored the floorboard quite badly. The bathroom was well lit with a great walk in shower. A nice touch was the gratis hand sanitiser and bathroom soaps etc.

The lobby is quite dark however and unlike almost every other hotel we walked past there was no indication that it was Christmas with no tree or decorations.

The restaurant was closed down and the the roof bar also seemed to be closed.

It was nice but I doubt we'd stay here again.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Hotel was immaculate, so clean everywhere, the rooms were amazing and great size compared to other New York hotels. I loved that they had robes and umbrellas in the room to use an purchase ( if you wanted to take them home) which was a nice touch to the room. Iron/hair dryer was all supplied in room and bathroom was a brilliant size.Staff were so kind nothing was too much trouble they were always keen to help! They even store your luggage for free if you have a late flight, location to hotel was perfect! Macy’s at the end of the round and facing the Empire State Building! The view from the Kixby rooftop was gorgeous! Many shops all 2 min walking and so close to Bryant park, couldn’t fault the location or hotel. Will 100% always choose Kixby when I go back to NYC

title: Perfect location
text:
Very nice hotel in a perfect location near restaurants, shops and walking distance to Time square.
Very friendly stuff, nice room with fridge, tv, iron & board, hairdryer, shower with toiletries , coffee maker and a safe.
Basic breakfast to take to room including hot drink, orange juice, muffin and fruit.
A gym is available for hotel guests.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed at the Kixby for 1 week in December, fantastic hotel with the most friendly staff. 
Rooms are great, we had a lux king room size was fine. Bed comfy, fridge, tv, iron & board, hairdryer, big shower with toiltries provided, coffee maker etc. basically has everything you would need and i’m sure if you needed anything else the staff would be happy to help. Wifi was great in hotel/room.
They provided breakfast in the mornings which i think was muffins, fruit etc with teas/coffees but i never used this so cant comment. 
Roof top bar wasnt open as it was winter however you could still go up between 7-10 some nights we took a pizza and drinks up to sit at night, views of empire state are amazing. 
Hotel happily kept our cases on day of check out which we then picked back up later in the day. 
There also wasnt any extra fees to pay (taxes etc) at check in which was great, just had to give a credit card for deposit which is refunded on check out. 
If/when i visit new york again, kixby will be my 1st choice.

title: Modern, clean rooms. Great location, 10/10.
text: Great location and very close to metro. Modern, clean rooms. Standard small size for NYC but had fridge, safe and large wardrobe in the room. A few great bonuses! Bathroom was large, modern and clean. Also, on the go breakfast was offered with orange juice, muffins and fruit. Rooftop bar was closed but staff said we could buy drinks/food and take it up there if we wanted. All staff very welcoming and polite. Would definitely stay again.

title: Great stay
text:
Hotel is in a excellent location. Very close to Macy's, but a short walk to all iconic areas, Times Square, Madison Square, Empire State, Rockafeller etc. Cannot fault the location at all! 
Maria at reception is a gem! So friendly, really makes you feel welcome. 
Hotel lobby is very welcoming, doorman always said hello too. 
Rooms were small, but you expect this being so close to Times Square BUT they we did have a closet which was very handy to put our cases away and enough drawers for our clothes. Could have perhaps done with a few more hangers, but we made do. Bathroom had a shower, with shower gel, shampoo, conditioner etc. Towels were replenished and clean.. Room was not cleaned daily BUT wasn't an issue for us. 
Breakfast was muffins with tea/coffee and juice - as expected. No complaints as there was always plenty available when we went there. Top floors were being renovated it seemed, but we never heard noise - but then we never spent all day in the room. 
Would happily stay here again!

title: Doesn't quite come up to expectations
text: Our room was a lot smaller than we expected for the money and the term 'lux king'. There was very limited space and with the luggage rack out we couldn't use the desk. The toilet had a horrible brown stain in the bowl and there was a mark on the floor in front of the toilet. That said the rest of the room was clean and the size of the bathroom was good with an excellent shower and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that I have stayed in for ages. The linen was good. A complimentary breakfast of fruit, cereal bars or muffins was great to get us going in the mornings. The location was a stones throw from Macies and near the subway. Excellent Korean restaurants nearby.

title: Very disappointing 😢
text:
I have been coming to this hotel (previously called Hotel Metro) since 2008, very disappointed with our stay.
No restaurant 
No bar
When we arrived was told they supplied a grab n go breakfast, this was a muffin no other choice. 
Rooms cleaned once a week on a Thursday 😳 so rooms very dirty, dust everywhere. Dirty towels left in bathroom 
Workmen working on site till 9pm at night! 

Needed an electrician to mind plug point as the only socket that worked was the one behind the fridge so every night we were moving furniture 

Our whole floor smelt of cannabis, phoned reception and they confirmed guests had been fined for smoking it in their room. 

Hotel Metro was fabulous unfortunately the Kixby doesn’t even come close

Won’t be coming back

title: Fantastic rooms, staff and location.
text: From start to finish our stay at the Kixby was faultless. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful very knowledgeable about the local area. Maria B is really friendly and can’t do enough to help you! A nice selection of muffins, fruit, juice, tea and coffee are available for a grab and go breakfast. A very short walk from Macy’s department store and near to Times Square and other attractions.  Rooms are spotless and very comfortable. Air conditioning is fantastic and helps to drown out the road noise we stayed on the 6th floor and didn’t find the noise an issue. All communal areas are spotlessly clean and modern. The view of the Empire State Building from the roof terrace are amazing! We would love to visit again when all the hotel amenities are up and running. Thank you Kixby for such a fantastic stay!

title: Lovely Hotel in a great location.
text:
We have just returned from a 9 night stay at the Kixby.  We had such a pleasant stay.  The room was very comfortable and we were in a room on the main road.  We were not troubled by noise at all.

The hotel staff are so pleasant and helpful and nothing is too much trouble.

The location of the hotel is perfect and a daily trip to Macy’s across the road was an added bonus.

I would definitely stay at the Kixby again and I would recommend this lovely hotel.

Thank you to all the team at the Kixby.

title: A very good hotel at an amazing location
text:
The rooms are very spacious and very nice, and this seems to be the case for all the rooms. The photos on their website are nice, but even so, the rooms are even nicer in real life. 

The staff is very accommodating and helpful. When I arrived in my room, there was a card to welcome me, some chocolates and water. I really appreciated the gesture.

The location is amazing. It's only half a block from Macy's. 

The only downside is that the complimentary breakfast is only muffins and fruit. More what you'd expect at a roadside motel. But I understood that this is due to issues related to Covid, so having at least something was a very nice gesture. And there is coffee and tea available all day.

I can definitely recommend the hotel and will absolutely stay here again.

title: Great Central Location
text: Superb hotel, clean, professional, friendly and two minutes walk from Macy’s. Shame the hotel dining options were limited due to renovations but plenty of good restaurants only a stones throw away.
