For those light sleepers please remember that NYC is the city that never sleeps, so considering the hotels central location it would be wise to request a room that is not facing on to its vibrant streets or in my case buy some ear plugs.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Just finished up an excellent six night stay at Kixby. I stayed in a Lux Queen on the seventh floor. The rooms are modern and well appointed, and there were all sorts of amenities available in the room (umbrella, ironing board, Keurig coffee machine, great soaps). The rain shower and the Frette towels were a dream. The hotel is a short walk from Herald Square and the 34th street subway station, a perfect location for exploring the city. Best of all, the service was world class! Shout out to Inna, Shawn, and Natalia at the front desk. I would definitely stay here again, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting New York City.

title: a perfect stay
text: so happy to have discovered this new hotel, and it turns out I stayed here before (formerly Hotel Metro). And just like before, the staff and stay were excellent. The room was modern and spacious, and the Malin and Goetz toiletries and Bigelow hand sanitizers were a nice touch.  Location is great and walkable to everything, not to mention in-your-face views of the Empire State Building from the rooftop. Thanks, Kixby, for a perfect stay!

title: Falta de mantenimiento en terraza y lounge
text: El turno de noche tiene una terrible atención personal , siempre de mal humor, la ubicación es increíble  y la terraza super con excelente vista al empire pero muy descuidada al igual que la sala lounge que se encuentra en el penthouse, es ovio que falta buen gusto y limpieza a esa area.  Esta semi abandonada y es un lugar importante del hotel ya que es el único con mesa para platicar del día en pareja,  no existe otra area,  salvo la super terraza pero como mencione  le falta mantenimiento y más atención.

title: Best Hotel Ever
text: This is the best hotel hands down. I've been to multiple hotels in NYC for a nice getaway with my significant other. Maria checked us in on Halloween night and it was a fast and smooth process. The moment we stepped into our room, we were blown away. The hardwood floors were beautiful, and the decor and interior design of the room was amazing. The bathroom was small, but it was still perfect with really good water pressure. The TV was amazing and had great selections to choose from. The price of the hotel was perfect for us as it was right in our budget. One of the best parts was the AC! We've been in multiple hotels with crappy AC that doesn't work so this was a massive plus! Overall, we would definitely return. This might just be our go-to hotel forever!

title: Modern & Clean
text: My stay at the Kixby was an enjoyable one! Cleanliness, modern amenities, and excellent customer service are my non-negotiables when it comes to any hotel experiences and the Kixby provided all of that for me! The location is accessible to the subway, shopping, and delicious restaurants. The staff, especially Natalia, was very helpful and gave great suggestions. I will definitely rebook in the future!

title: This is the old Hotel Metro and we are so happy!
text:
We loved staying at the Hotel Metro but it went downhill. So happy that Kixby renovated and reopened in the space. Staff were great. Bed super comfy.
The neighborhood is just where we want to be. We can walk anywhere in NYC from there and also get to Penn Station easily.

title: couldn't of asked for a better first stay in NYC!
text: The room was clean and modern, with a very decent sized bed, TV has good selection of  tv channels, the fridge allowed us to be able to chill drinks and there was plenety of storage room for luggage.  We didn't stay in a street view room however we appreciated being away from the street noise. The halls and reception area were immaculate and the rooftop view is breathtaking. All staff were pleasant and helpful and no issues with the maid service. The restaurant next door is worth a visit to! The locality of the hotel is perfect for navigating around the city, will absolutely be staying again - thank you for a memorable first visit to NYC!

title: 21st Birthday Rip Off - Don’t Bother
text:
Booked this hotel in November 2019 to stay in NYC for my 21st birthday in March 2020. Just before lockdown I sent multiple emails asking for an update on the situation & that it looked very unlikely i would be allowed travel and leave the UK due to restrictions. When I finally got a response, it was very unhelpful, & unsympathetic - nearly 8 months down the line, I’m still waiting for an update & conclusion. 
So disappointed & upset that this has been so badly dealt with. Something totally out of my control & my birthday celebrations ruined. Thanks for nothing Kixby Hotel.

title: Heart of New York
text: The hotel is in the heart of town. Ten minutes by walking to the Times Square, three minutes to the Empire State, subway every 100 meters etc.. very good choice if you want to discover the New York City fast and easy!

title: Excellent location with amazing views and very clean
text:
Stayed here for 7 days in February just before the Covid lockdown. Check in very fast and efficient although we found the staff here weren't as welcoming as other hotels we've stayed at in NYC, entrance to hotel extremely clean and modern. Our room was on the 7th floor, it was huge probably the biggest hotel room we've had in any hotel we've stayed in to date which was great. We had 2 bedrooms - 2 double beds in one room and another double bed in a separate bedroom. Views of the empire state from the window were amazing - especially on Valentines day where it lit up red with a 'heartbeat'.
Small box of chocolates in room on arrival as it was mine and my sons birthdays whilst here which was lovely. Rooftop bar was not open due to time of year however could still go up there to see the views of the ESB which was amazing!
Literally a few steps from the subway, Herald Sq./Macy's/MSG etc which was fab for sightseeing and shopping. Given a voucher for a free breakfast at Black Tap on arrival at check in, however i don't recommend breakfast there as it was terrible! Very little options (croissant, baked beans and pain au chocolat) Would not have paid for that breakfast! The milkshakes there however, were amazing and definitely worth every cent!
Rooms were warm and air con also worked well, however it was -8 when we were there so the air con didn't get used a great deal. 
Advisory i'd give of the hotel was that the windows were old and thin and so it sounded like they were completely open when they were not as the street noise was so loud. I spent the first few days trying to figure out ways to block the noise out at night, but i was woken at least 4 times per night the entire trip. The best bet is to put the heater/air con on to drown the noise out a little of the rubbish carts and vehicles.

Overall I would possibly stay here again, but only if guaranteed a room on the highest floor away from the road.

title: Best hotel
text: We stayed here in Feb 2020 and it was our first time in NYC. The hotel was amazing, great sized rooms and really friendly staff. A few minutes walk away from the Empire State Building and really central to everything. Would definitely stay here again

title: 5 Days In NYC
text:
We booked to go to NYC in December through virgin and was pleasantly suprised to see that the hotel had been renovated and renamed before our visit. We chose this hotel because of the location and the positive reviews

We was not disappointed. Check in was a breeze and easy, we was allocated one of the lux rooms which was a nice touch. The room itself was a good size and there was  built in storage for shopping and cases. The bathroom was also a good size and the shower was brilliant. The mini fridge and coffee machine were really nice touches too. The bed was super comfy.  I always worry about hotel safes but these ones are brand new and seemed very secure.

The location of this hotel is beyond amazing. Macy’s is a a couple mins walk away and there is a subway station night next to the hotel. Plenty of good restaurants and tourist attractions within walking distance. Andrews was the best place for breakfast as recommended by the Kixby staff. Also try the coffee cart outside the hotel, best coffee and doughnuts!

This trip was especially special as i was planning to propose to my girlfriend, I decided somewhere private would be best on the hotels rooftop bar. The staff put my mind at ease and helped me plan this so we could have that special moment

The staff really make this place. The reception staff are helpful. Would like to give special thanks to Christian, Kelvin and Leo for their recommendations. Would definitely rebook this hotel again, and this hotel will always have a special place in our hearts. Sorry we didn’t post the review sooner, hope you guys are all well.

title: Fantastic!
text:
I stayed at the "Kixby" in early January this year and it was a fantastic experience. As this was my partners & I first time to New York City, we wanted to make sure we found the right hotel and we certainly did!

As soon as we walked through the door we were warmly welcomed on what was a cold night! I had previously emailed asking that if possible we could have a higher room floor and we were certainly given one.  

Our bedroom was good. It wasn't one of the new refurbed ones but it had all that we needed. The shower room was lovely, bed comfy, condiments provided and the best part of the room was the view it gave us of the Empire State Building! We couldn't really ask for more.

On arrival we were given a voucher/token to have a breakfast with the neighbouring restaurant to which the name has escaped my mind! Again the breakfast was perfectly fine. There was fresh fruit, cereal, croissants and more. You really don't need much as im sure youll be eating throughout the day! 

The rooftop bar wasn't open but you can still go up there and enjoy the fine views. When I say "fine" views I mean incredible views. You are so close to the Empire State Building you could almost touch it. Macy's is also right next to you which im sure youll go and check out!

Location wise I also couldn't fault it! Far enough from Times Square that you weren't on top of it but close enough that the walk is incredibly short.

Please take this review from someone who will read every review about a hotel before booking it. I really can't recommend the "Kixby" enough to anyone!

Thank you for giving us a warm welcome and we certainly will be back one day!

Christopher Y & Angel H

title: Comforting shelter in strange times
text: Stayed here for a week in early March, just before NY shut down. Staff were fantastic, room lovely and room service delicious - especially the Impossible Burger. Huge thanks to the team at the Kixby for taking such good care of me at a very strange time

title: understated, relaxed, but underlying good customer service.
text:
Stayed for a week early March for our wedding anniversary (a big one), booked our trip of a lifetime with Virgin last year when the hotel was still known as the Metro. This was probably the problem I had with our stay......the room with Virgin was classed as "premier" and at time of booking I would have expected our room to be as described on the virgin website, which is actually the hotel's old "classic" room. However from booking to arriving I had seen the transformation from Metro to Kixby and was hoping for a new room, even though these are classed as "Lux" by the hotel.
On arrival I was disappointed to find we had been allocated a classic room, but equally delighted with the view of the Empire State Building, and the lovely fizz, card and chocolates. However, the downside to the view was the street noise, its a busy city so be aware of the level of noise you can hear.
The room had everything we needed for a comfortable stay, but it was niggling about Virgin's room classification and I sent Virgin an email, as I don't believe, it was right to complain to the hotel. However when I spoke to reception they had received communication from Virgin and explained we had been given a bigger room, with the view. The next day they then offered us an upgrade to a new room free of charge (Soni must have been sick of me, but he didn't show it).  We had a look at the room, and they are lovely, and made our classic look tired and shabby. If we hadn't already spent a few nights in our first room, and hadn't been so tired from sight seeing, I would have swapped, and thought this was a generous gesture. Which kind of sums the Kixby up, quite understated, relaxed, but underlying good customer service.
The front of desk staff are reserved, but polite and willing to help, (extra coat hangers, sorted; broken blind fixed immediately; lost remote control, replaced straight away)  you just have to ask. The guys on the door were excellent, really friendly and helpful. Cleanliness of the room was great at first, but did start to notice a slip by the end of the week, such as toiletries not replaced, cleanliness standard drop and the removal of the tv remote, but we put this down to staff levels at this testing time of Covid 19 as by the end of our stay, the city was bracing for lockdown and must have affected staff availability. 
It was really sad leaving and saying goodbye to the guys on the door, knowing the hotel was closing for the lockdown,
The hotel has a great location for all the sights, and the subway is seconds away, with a few bars and restaurants close by. Lot15 was lovely, and staff in there are great, especially the girl who had lived in manchester ( sophie?). 
Once the hotel transforms totally into the Kixby and leaves the Metro behind, this would be 5 rated.

title: Comfortably met our needs
text:
I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone based on our experience of a Lux room. We had booked a Classic King, but on arrival were randomly upgraded to a Lux King; so many thanks to the hotel for that.
The room was as described by others and the only possible negative I can think of was the street noise that could be heard, but it wouldn't put me off going again.
Reception staff were cheerful and efficient as too the doormen, who always struck up a conversation.
I would also like to make a special mention of the understanding and approach taken by the hotel to remedy a misunderstanding that had occurred with our travelling companions' separate booking, whereby British Airways had sold the holiday using a previous room type name which isn't now used by the hotel. Because of this our companions had apparently booked an inferior room to that which they thought and on carefully listening to their "story" the hotel kindly upgraded them as well after the first night. Excellent service.
The hotel is very well located, especially being close to the subway and in particular Penn Station as this was where we arrived into and departed from Manhattan via JFK.
.

title: Thank you
text: A huge thank you goes out to Amy of the Kixby Hotel for looking after our clients so well during such difficult times in the world -  it is people like you that make our business so much easier @blixentravel

title: Overrated?
text:
Well, what can I say. Visited for my 40th Birthday, my wife had emailed ahead a couple of time’s to explain we were celebrating an occasion. I did get a birthday card.
The hotel staff seem pretty disinterested in what’s going on there. The rooftop bar area was ok. Nice view of the Empire State Building.

Our room was clean but a very thin, threadbare feeling carpet, bed was saggy in the middle. Toilet/bathroom so small you struggled to get in and close the door behind you.

Miserable little room at the back of the hotel overlooking an alleyway with the smell of next door restaurant wafting through.

Overall not as good as we expected or as good as they make out in their social media.

Would I return. No.

title: Good hotel
text: Room was lovely and a nice sparkling bottle on arrival as it was our anniversary whilst staying there. Though we had to unplug the heater/air con unit as it was very noisey through the night. The hotel was perfectly located for us though you will do a lot of walking. Reception were lovely and the young ladies (Sorry I didn't get your names) there were especially helpful with navigating New York.

title: Fantastic location and hotel
text:
Just recently returned from a long weekend to New York.  Booked through Virgin we chose Hotel Kixby for it’s location to a majority of landmarks but also its distance from the hustle of Times Square.

Staying in a Lux King room the bed was a super king.  The room included a coffee machine, fridge with complentary drinks, large tv and bathroom with a shower.

The only negative was the single glazed windows allowed alot of street noise in to the room but don’t let this put you off.

The rooftop bar with views of the Empire State building was closed due to the time of year but is open for you to go up at visit all year round.

The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Would stop at the Kixby next time we visit New York

title: 50th Birthday Celebration in New York ❤
text:
Thank you Kixby for making our stay in New York extra special...we booked through Expedia and added a note for the hotel to say we were celebrating my Wife's 50th. Check in was quick, and everything was explained clearly about the hotel facilities. We were given a voucher for a free continental breakfast, which was a nice touch.The hotel foyer was lovely and modern and the doorman was friendly. The best was yet to come, as we went to our room as we had been upgraded to a Lux room. It was perfect, we had a complementary bottle of champagne on ice with a birthday card. The room has beautiful decor, big comfy bed ( wish we could've taken the bed home with us), lovely bathroom with a double walk in shower, coffee and tea maker...the list goes on...everything you need. We were in room 703 which is at the front and could see the Empire State Building which just added to the experience. Yes there is noise from the street, but it's New York the City never sleeps, we didn't mind as we had jet lag and had walked many miles at the end of the day. The air con is loud but just turn it off...simple. 
Location couldn't be better, central to everything and the subway in easy walking distance. 
If we ever come back to New York, the Kixby would be our first choice to stay, fantastic hotel should be a five star hotel.

title: Great stay!
text:
It was our first stay at this hotel but definitely not the last!    A lovely clean room, great location and nice bar downstairs. 
The gentleman on the door (sorry can’t remember his name) was very helpful in getting to various attractions also!

title: Good location but average stay
text:
We arrived at the hotel and were pleasantly surprised by the recently renovated lobby area which was very modern and clean. Check in was easy and hassle free. 

We booked a classic queen room. From reading previous trip advisor reviews, we noticed many guests had been upgraded to these new rooms. We were hoping this would happen to us as it was my partners birthday whilst staying at the hotel however this wasn’t the case.

The room itself was spacious but very dated - carpet was grubby, curtains/blinds dirty and windows had clearly not been cleaned in a long time. The room is in desperate need of renovation however I understand the hotel is in the process of this. The room had many amenities including coffee machine, mini fridge, iron/ironing board, hairdryer and safe. However, there were no drinks in the mini fridge. The bed was comfortable but seemed small compared to other hotels we’ve previously stayed in in New York. However, one of the main problems with the room was the air conditioning unit. It was impossible to get the room to stay the right temperature meaning you’d go to bed freezing but wake up boiling. The AC unit was also very loud. In audition to this, the hotel lobby and corridors were absolutely boiling 24/7. Moreover, the room was at the front of the hotel meaning we had a lot of road/traffic noise which was extremely loud - if you’re going to stay here definitely ask for a room at the back of the hotel. 

The bathroom was extremely small and cramped with no room to move around. However, it had all necessary amenities including shampoo, shower gel, shower cap, cotton buds etc. It was clean and pleasant enough. 

On check in we were given a voucher for a complimentary continental breakfast - ?not sure why but was a nice touch. However, the breakfast was disappointing. There was a fairly varied choice of cereals, pastries, bagels/muffins and fruit - but the quality of these were poor. The milk was also more like water which put us off having cereal. We therefore didn’t eat here again - there’s plenty of places in New York for breakfast. 

The staff at the hotel were okay - not overly friendly and nothing special. Apart from the doormen who were always friendly and polite. 

Overall, great location for all of the main tourist attractions. The subway is 30 seconds away, Times Square 8-10 minutes, 5th Avenue 5 minutes, Top of the Roc 10-15 minutes etc. However, let down by dated room, poor AC unit and loud noise all night from nearby streets. 

Just to add there is a rooftop bar however due to going in March this wasn’t open during our trip. However, we did go up and take in the views of the Empire State which were amazing.

To conclude, we would stay in the hotel again as the location was amazing but not in a classic room, instead in one of the new renovated rooms (as long as the AC/windows were also upgraded).

title: Perfect hotel in spot on location
text:
This hotel was lovely. We had a spa issue king room with a large bed a fridge and a free safe. The bathroom was lovely with a great walk in shower. Fresh towels every day check in was quick and simple and the staff couldn’t help enough. 

Located within a two minute walk to a subway station where you can get just about anywhere. 15-20 minute walk to Times Square.

title: Profiles by rude staff
text: Went to the hotel bar last week and had a great time. Was in the area with my dad visiting so I wanted to show him how nice it was. When in the lobby he sat down on the couch and complimented it then a guy from the front desk came and asked if we were guests at the hotel. I said no that I wanted the show my father the hotel bar. The guy then proceeded to say we could go to the bar but couldn’t stay or sit in the lobby, we would need to leave. This was very rude and contradictory especially since I had just been there the previous week and taken a phone call on the exact same couch when the bar was to loud that evening.

title: Great location and nice modern hotel
text:
Check in was really quick, they do take a $250 deposit that I wasn't aware of so make sure you have enough in your account before you arrive, but it wasn't a problem for us. We were upgraded to a new room which was nice and modern but be aware they are very small, but enough space to sleep and get ready. Everything you needed in the room, iron, umbrella, coffee/tea machine etc. The bed was so big and comfy!
Our room was on the 5th floor facing away from the road so we didnt have any noise complaints apart from the a/c unit which does get very loud when on, but it didnt really bother us.

Location was great, 1 minute walk away from the subway and close to loads of shops and places to eat, empire state building less than 10mins away and times square about 15mins. 

Check out again was easy and they kept on to our bags for us, there is a nice lobby for you to hang about in, but it did get busy and there wasn't enough spaces for people to sit.

I would stay again for the right price if I was ever in NY again.

title: Great location
text: I stayed with my son on the 11th floor, huge room ,really comfy beds. I found the hotel nice and quiet, didn't hear anyone from other rooms. Amazing view from the rooftop.A bit disappointed that we weren't even asked if we had enjoyed our stay on check out. I would stay again though

title: First time in New York
text: What a great hotel this is. So conveniently located to get to all the sites this great city has to offer. Always a smile or greeting from reception as we went out or came in. Our rooms were standard rooms 1015 and 1017. But quiet at the back of hotel, no view, but you can’t have everything. For us rooms were everything we needed. Comfortable bed, good Wi-fi, clean, good shower, coffee and tea making facilities, fridge in room. View from roof top bar was excellent. Complimentary tea and coffee on the 2nd floor. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: What a great hotel
text:
Just arrived home after a short 4 night stay, cant say enough good things about this hotel. Lovely room, very stylish.. very comfortable bed and pillows. Complimentary soft drinks in the fridge and coffee water supplied too. Bathroom has a lovely large walk in shower and plenty of soft towels/flannels supplied. Toiletries werent to my liking but plenty offered too.

Perfect location too, just walk to the end of the road and Macy's is there, a few blocks and the Empire state building, a few more and Times square. Subway line at end of the road.

Stored my luggage on final day after checkout and they arranged for taxi at exactly the time I arrived back at the hotel. Perfect!

Will happily return to this hotel and I'd choose this over the crown plaza times square / Hotel Casablanca and the Renaissance times square all of which I've stayed at in the past.

title: Excellent location
text:
Arrived at reception and was checked in virtually straight away, they do take a £250.00 deposit but didn’t see this as a problem.
Room had no view but wasn’t really bothered as we thought a room with a view would be a room with noise. Room was very clean and modern, could of had more storage (three of us in room), coffee machine, good size safe, and fridge which had water and cans of coke/lemonade. Bathroom was a good size with all the shampoos, shower gels etc. Fresh towels every day if required.
Good controls for both heating  and air con. Bed side lamps had usb for phone charging and an electrical socket for any other appliances.
Location was very good, five mins to Empire State Building, 15 mins to Time square/Broadway, we also walked to Central Park which took less than 30 mins.
Bar was handy for a drink around 4/5 pm as it was happy hours (ask for separate drinks menu), bar staff were very good but did seem a little slow at times, this is probably due to the odd private functions in the adjoining room. Bar area is v nice but a little dark for me. Good selection of drinks and free nibbles.
We checked out at 11am and left all our luggage in hotel, all bags were checked in (tickets given) and the porter arranged for a taxi at our desired time (and told us the exact price to pay), returned about three hours later and collected all our luggage. Taxi arrived on time and porter helped us on our way.
Excellent hotel and would not hesitate to return, very good value.

title: 5th Visit
text:
First time staying here as the Kirby, stayed previously when it was the Metro.
Coming from the UK, I emailed in advance as we had an up coming big wedding anniversary and they came up trumps!
Bottle of champagne on ice and chocs waiting in our 12th floor room.
As others have said hotel is a great location, Macy’s just around the corner, as is Empire State Building and Penn Street Station a couple of blocks away and from there you can pretty much get anywhere.
Hotel staff are friendly and helpful, couldn’t ask for more.
100% recommended.

title: Clean hotel
text:
The hotel was very clean, room not to big but nice good bathroom good coffee machine and water left for it 
Very central position 5 minutes to times square and empire state building a minute from Macys staff very pleasant too

title: Great trip
text: Great hotel very friendly staff, clean and beautiful rooms. The bar at Lot 15 does great cocktails, ask Alex to mix you a Manhattan or even a last word gorgeous. Karl and Sophie will serve you your every need. Leo on the door is so helpful along with the girls on reception. Can’t fault this place will certainly be revisiting.

title: 16th birthday
text:
Booked 2 rooms for 5 nights..surprised I had to pay 2 lots of deposit on arrival. Disappointed that not even a card was left on a special birthday. Hotel was too HOT in all areas..rooms were of a nice size. 
Hotel I a good location.
I found he front desk staff to be very unfriendly . A smile a good morning or good bye cost nothing to be polite.
I would recommend this hotel on the basis of its location ONLY.
our room was very noisy from the air con unit.

title: Not what expected
text:
Our experience of the Kixby was not what we were expecting, very disappointing in fact. 
We booked through Virgin and were shown the renovated hotel which looked great. What we actually got was a very tired and scruffy room with stained carpets and shabby paintwork and an air-conditioning unit that didn't turn off. 
I asked for a quiet room but was given a room on the 12th floor next to the lift shaft from which a very loud rumble could be heard at regular intervals. I requested to move once I heard the noise but was advised there were no rooms to move to. 
We tried to turn the air con unit off but found the only way to reduce the temperature in the room was to turn it to cool which made it sound like a jet engine. Not pleasant or relaxing. The hair drier had less force than a hand held fan, this was changed upon request for a new one. The towels are tiny, they just about covered me and I am a size 10, there were no bathrobes however on Instagram they claim there are bathrooms in all rooms. 
After reading the amount of comments on here from people who have been upgraded or had complimentary breakfast vouchers I feel this is a different hotel to the one we stayed at. The staff on reception were not friendly or helpful, they could have made the effort to move us the following day when a room became available, but they did nothing. 
In short, it is in a good location and if you are lucky enough to have one of the new rooms and be chosen for special attention then it is probably a good hotel, our experience was negative and I wouldn't return or recommend it mainly due to the poor treatment by the staff.  There are many other hotels in New York, just as close to Times Square and subway stations to choose from.

title: Great stay for a 30th Birthday
text:
We booked this hotel for a weeks stay in NYC, firstly the location is amazing, very close to times square, empire state building and alot of major attractions. The hotel is situated close to subway stations so getting around is easy.
The hotel itself was great, on the first night we had a room on the 7th floor at the front,  it was too noisy for me and when i asked to moved room they were great in accommodating (we had to downgrade the room size but it was worth it!).  For anyone that needs peace and quiet request a room at the back (don't expect a view), it doesn't matter what floor you are on they are all quiet. 
The hotel staff left a note and some chocolates to say happy birthday which was fantastic. Great bar in the hotel called Lot 15 aswell (great for happy hour). 
Finally the beds were insane, the comfiest I have ever slept on. 
Great people, hotel, rooms and location.

title: Love Kixby 💕
text:
What a gem of a find this hotel was. The friendly staff, the beautiful rooms, the perfect location and amazing view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop.
We couldn't fault anything during our stay. Thank you so much for helping to make our holiday one never to forget and especially to Stan on reception for organising our upgrade and special treat for my hubby's birthday.
Do not hesitate to stay here, you certainly won't regret it. One thing, if you want a meal in the Black Tap, make sure you make a reservation as it's always busy but worth a visit.
Well done Kixby and thank you.

title: Nice hotel but housekeeping let it down
text:
We stayed at the Kixby for 5 nights celebrating my birthday but we didn’t get any upgrade or nice surprise which was a little disappointing having seen other visitors post this. 
Room was nice and clean, we stayed in a Queen Lux on the 2nd floor at the back of the building so although there was no view it was nice and quiet. 
Air con / heater was noisy when it was on but we didn’t need it on over night so not an issue at this time of year. 
One thing the hotel could improve in the room is that it lacked a mirror in the room itself, there were 3 in the bathroom but they are no good in there when the bathroom is in use. Would be good to have 1 in the room somewhere so others can use it to get ready. 
The convenience room on the 2nd floor was great for coffees and teas. 
Location of the hotel was brilliant which was a major thing when booking this hotel and they even sorted our taxi to JFK on our final day.
Finally, housekeeping wasn’t great, we were woken most days by vacuuming of the hallway outside the room around 8am, refills of the coffee machine was mixed -  some days we had 3 coffees, 1 tea, others we had a good mix, some days cups weren’t left so we got them from the convenience room and then the final day it wasn’t even topped up. We also kept finding her hair dotted around the room, ie on the bedding, by the sink etc. 
And on the final day, housekeeping knocked on 3 times before 11am to see if we had vacated, surely on your final day they would know to come in after the checkout time.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay again but in the hope housekeeping is improved.

title: can't fault it at all!
text:
room was perfect for 2. we stayed in a king lux, and the bed was huge. a little sitting area, desk etc. the bathroom was gorgeous, marble flooring, shower was great especially after a long flight. 

location was the major draw for us and ticked all the boxes. it's around a 8-10 min walk from penn station, 1 minute walk from 34th herald subway so perfect spot to get to anywhere quick in the whole city whether walking or taking public transport. 

staff were fabulous. all very kind, welcoming, said hello every time without fail walking in/out/past. rooms were kept so well, housekeeping did a fabulous job. 

only tiiiiny thing i would say though would be towels, if i was being picky. we would leave them on the bathroom floor to be changed as stated (as a few times they were soaked after reusing 2 times a day, then in the morning again etc.) and they were just hung back up. this happened for 3 days until we put them on the floor just outside of the bathroom, which is when they were swapped so could have just been us not doing it right but, thought its worth a mention if anyone else has the same thing! 

all in all, have already been recommending the hotel, and if returning to the city will not hestiate to book again!

title: A view of the Empire State Building
text:
We stayed at The Kixby Hotel for 3 nights and were exciting to see the hotel after it's re brand. The lobby was very modern, we were checked in quickly and also got a voucher for a free breakfast. 

Our room was a good size for the two of us with a big comfy bed and sitting area. The complimentary soft drinks and coffee were appreciated after a long journey. 

We could see the Empire State Building across the road from our hotel window, what more could you ask for? We could hear a lot of traffic and trash lorries in the morning which is to be expected of New York. 

A trendy choice for a hotel right near the popular sights.

title: Everything I wanted.
text:
This was my 1st trip to New York and I was not disappointed by this hotel. Not sure if I had an updated room but for the price it was excellent value. Clean room and bed sheets, coffee maker, fridge and Internet included.
Would I return? I already plan to. A big thank you to reception helping me to find my way.

title: Birthday trip
text: My husband and I have just got back from a 4 night stay at the Kixby Hotel.  We were here for my husband’s 40th birthday and  received a free room upgrade and a lovely bottle of wine on arrival. Our room was spotless and very comfortable. Staff were extremely helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the Empire State Building and Times Square, it is next to a bar called the Black Tap which we highly recommend. We had a couple of meals there which were faultless. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: A1 Location. A1 Hotel!
text:
Had the most amazing 5 nights at the Kixby. Echo the words of previous reviewers - the location really is perfect. Centrally located for pretty much everything! Room was 701 - had no issues with the elevators, always working during our stay. 
Room was pretty small - as was the bathroom, but it was spotlessly clean and had everything we needed. No view at all - but away from the road noise, although even with the air con on all night - you can still hear the sirens and bin men at 2am! It was no bother though. 
Staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The Blacktap restaurant next door was excellent - great food and reasonably priced. 
Liberty Bar a few doors down had a great HappyHour $8 Moscow Mules and $5 pints 👍🏻
Will definitely be returning to Kixby for our next visit to NYC. It really can’t be beaten!

title: Kixby, NYC
text: Had a great 4 night stay in this Hotel. Received a free upgrade when checking in. Room was clean and comfortable with free complimentary soft drinks. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location and our room was very quiet during the night.

title: Simply fantastic
text: We are a couple who spent 5 wonderful nights here, from the check in the staff could not do enough for you, be it the reception, door men, cleaners all departments were simply fantastic. The room was lovely and spacious, hotel situated between 5th Avenue and broadway so easy access to most of the tourist traps, highly recommend this place and when we go back to NYC we will be returning.

title: Nel cuore di Manhattan
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel nell’ultimo periodo di ristrutturazione, per il passaggio da Hotel Metro a Kixby, ma ne siamo comunque rimasti molto soddisfatti. 
Hotel che mantiene le stesse peculiarità del vecchio: camera spaziosa , pulita, bagno pratico e molto spazioso. 
Nelle camere è presente la macchinetta per potersi fare gratuitamente te/ caffè a piacimento. 
Oltre alla grande pulizia e alla modernità delle camere, il fiore all’occhiello dell’hotel rimane la posizione: situato a 30 m dalla fermata della metro e a pochi passi da Macy’s, Empire State Building , Time Square e 5th Ave. (La centralità della posizione è un fattore fondamentale in quanto essendoci mille cose da vedere a Ny ci ha permesso di ottimizzare tutti gli spostamenti e non perdere un solo minuto) 
Prezzo nella norma per la categoria. 
Nonostante la colazione offerta il primo giorno, questo servizio non è più compreso nel prezzo come avveniva con la vecchia gestione.

title: Great location and Hotel
text:
Have just returned from 7 night stay at the Kixby cant fault anything .......from the top to the bottom the staff are fantastic 
After reading some reviews I though wit have we done .....
The hotel is great......best location ive been to and ive been to NYC a few times, the room was big and the bed was really comfy. I will defenetly be recomending this hotel for lovely staff comfort and location.  Well done The Kixby staff.

title: Great spot
text: Really great hotel well placed by subway, Empire State & Macys.  Free tea/coffee from level 2 lounge was a nice touch.  Room on level 8 had no view but was sheltered from street noise, decent size classic room, good bathroom, really comfy bed & quality linens.  Check out the views from the roof garden - fantastic. Dinner in the Black Tap was fab but huge (milkshakes are a meal by themselves).  We bought breakfast from the vendors to the right of the hotel near the subway - all freshly made about $3 per roll (bargain! black tap was $15+tax for breakfast).

title: Excelente precio calidad
text: Nos sorprendió gratamente este hotel. Muy bien ubicado, con un precio adecuado, buena atención y limpieza, muy conforme y recomendables. Volvería sin lugar a dudas al mismo. A una cuadra de Broadway y 5 de Times Square

title: Birthday trip
text:
Fabulous hotel, recently renovated and very friendly staff.
Couldn't wish for a better location, walking distance to the empire state building and times Square
When we arrived we were greeted with an upgrade to a two bedroom suite 😊
Adjoining restaurant the Blacktap was also not to be missed, amazing food and OMG crazy shakes!
Would definitely book here for any future visits to the big apple

title: Great location
text:
Stayed for 6 nights. Perfect location - away from the crowds of Times Square but close enough to visit. Close to a subway too. 
Our only gripe was being right next to the service elevator and it sounding like someone was rearranging furniture every time it was used. (Or Maybe someone was just rearranging furniture on the floor above ALL the time?!?)
Overall, though, a great stay and would stay again!

title: Brilliant !!
text: My grandson and I had 4 nights in room 816 and were so pleased with it. All of the staff were so cheerful and helpful, the room was great with two large beds that were so comfortable. The whole hotel had a cosy feel and was central to everything we wanted to see. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to everyone.

title: Kixby Hotel
text: Stayed at The Kixby this weekend. First time in NYC. Location of hotel superb. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is immaculate and has recently been renovated to a good standard. If I had to pick a downfall it would be that the air conditioning is noisy throughout the night. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others

title: Kixby hotel lovely
text:
My daughter and I stayed here just over a week ago  one of the nicest hotels we have been in so far I have been to NY 3 times my daughter 5.
Recently refurbished to an excellent standard, the roof top bar, although not open out of season you could still go up and sit, looking out on the Empire State Building, a piece of tranquility right in the middle of the city.

We had a tea/coffee machine replenished daily, 4 complimentary cans of pop in the fridge.  The room was clean to a high standard, with lovely shower and toiletries. 

The staff were lovely and friendly, even the cleaning staff found time to say hello.

We were offered a complimentary breakfast at the Black Tap next store. You also got a discount there if you showed your room card, we had a meal there and is was very good.

The hotel also had it's own cocktail/shake bar which was nice.

Good comfy beds, nice clean linen and towels, no extra hotel taxes, brilliant place well worth a visit.

title: Loved the hotel and the lovstion
text: Love the hotel and my room and the location. I will be back if you will have me. My room at front of hotel and esb only a street away and Macy’s literally on your doorstop. Members of staff very polite.

title: Fantastic Location
text:
The location of this hotel is perfect. The first room we was put in was awful as after long flight from London and making yourself stay away till 21:00 NYC time we was exhausted. There was a horrible noise sounded like a fan unit on full blast literally metres from me. Called reception who sent someone up as I thought it was the air con unit, but no it was some kind of unit that was outside my window. Called reception back and they happily moved me to a room downstairs and the noise was still there slightly but no where as loud as the other room. I feel sorry for anyone who has to sleep in that room, my mum is partial deaf in both ears and she could hear it. 

Also I did let Virgin know it was my Mum's birthday and that was the reason of the holiday, they said they would let the hotel know but cant promise anything. Didn't get any messages in the hotel to wish my mum happy birthday but I didn't expect they would definitely, but from reading other reviews of others who have had chocolates and card this is quite disappointing as this would of been a special touch. 

The rooms are very clean and cleaned and beds etc changed daily, never had an issue with the shower always really hot. I would definitely stay in this hotel again just not that room on the penthouse floor. Staff were amazing especially Karina who arranged the move to another room, staff always polite and very helpful.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We stayed at the hotel in October and had a brilliant stay. The staff were so accommodating and friendly throughout out entire stay. The trip was a birthday present and the hotel upgraded us when we arrived! Would 100% recommend!!

title: New York trip
text: Well what can I say an absolutely fantastic trip the kixby hotel is fantastic everything you want and more and we couldn’t be more happier with our stay including a free room upgrade I couldn’t fault this hotel in any way the staff absolutely amazing just as New York is thank you so much to the kixby for making our time in Newyork as fantastic as this hotel is will definitely be returning in the future stay fantastic xxx

title: Great hotel, in a prime location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights. Staff were helpful & friendly.  Rooms are clean and comfortable. It’s in a prime location and ideal for getting out and about. I would definitely recommend it & would stay here again

title: Excellent
text: Kixby hotel is excellent. We had the great fortune of staying on the 11th floor. The view of the Empire State will stay with me forever. An outstanding hotel that I would highly recommend. Location is excellent also. Enjoy!

title: Lovely staff, lovely place
text:
I always read up on trip advisor before I book anything so I knew this place would be good, I’m not even sure if we stayed in a renovated room or not, we stayed on the 11th floor over looking a busy street and our view was the Empire State Building, the only thing I could moan about is the lack of sleep because the street is so busy constantly and I woke up all night.
I should’ve packed ear plugs.
The rooms are well equipped, hair dryer, iron , tv fridge, tea and coffee facilities... beds are super comfortable, the 2nd floor has a gym and also a room where you can make tea and coffee or stock up on tea, sugar and milk.
The staff are amazing!!! 
The bellboys, the reception staff I can’t thank you enough, you made our time there, so helpful 
Thankyou , I really hope to be back there one day

title: Excellent rooms and roof top
text: Had a nice little stay here the hotel is superbly placed, smack bang in the thick of it. the rooms are very modern and the beds are unreal the maids and cleaning staff do an excellent job and it's always spotless the staff at the entrance to the hotel are extremely polite and take time to talk and help with whatever you need. there is free coffee on the 2nd floor 24hrs which I thought was a very nice touch. 2 restaurants on the premises are very good the burgers and shakes are top notch. The roof top bar is a thing of beauty although we stayed in winter time when the bar is closed I found myself out there as much as I could day and night ..What a view it has. all in all a very good hotel with  excellent staff and a roof top to die for

title: Great Hotel
text:
Came to New York to visit my daughter. Stayed in room 507. Can’t fault the hotel. Room was lovely. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop with views of Empire State Building was awesome. Ate at Black Tap restaurant and found it very reasonable. My daughter and I shared one of the huge shakes with the cake on the top. 
This hotel is where you need to be. The subway is 30 seconds from the door. Macy’s is 2 mins walk away as are all the shops. Times Square  5 mins walk. Really can’t rate it enough. 
Room has fridge and a large safe. Dressing gowns, coffee maker, iron and ironing board and a hair dryer. 
I will definitely be back !!! 
Thank you for having me 
Anita

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC
text:
This our 3rd stay at this hotel but the first under its new Kixby name and we were not disappointed!
The hotel is situated in midtown Manhattan right next door to the Empire State Building and is within easy reach of absolutely everything with 34th St subway station a 2 minute walk away. 
Upon arrival the reception staff were as always fantastic and the whole check in process took no longer than 5 minutes and was super stress free.
Our room,a Lux King, was situated on the 5th floor.
The room itself was great, lovely modern decor and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in!
The room had everything you need including a very swish modern safe,a refrigerator,TV,iron and ironing board,coffee maker, loads of plug sockets and tons of storage.
We wouldn't hesitate to come back to the Kixby hotel and recommend it to anyone who is coming to NYC in the future.
Well done to the management and staff for making our trip a memorable one. 
Nick and Alyson

title: Excellent hotel and friendly staff
text:
We stayed here from the 25th-29th for our honeymoon. The hotel, on first impression doesn’t look too great from the street. Soon it was revealed, nothing in New York looked good until closer up - The hotel was excellent, clean and excellently decorated throughout. The rooms were clean, the service was excellent and we even had a bottle of champagne waiting for us with a welcome note and a congratulations. We did unfortunately have to move from our excellent room to a smaller one because of a burst pipe, which was annoying as the larger room was much fancier - but couldn’t be helped the the hotel, a burst pipe is a burst pipe! We never used the hotel bar or food as we were out each evening, so I cannot comment on these facilities.

The staff were very friendly, offering advice and going out of their way to help move stuff from room to room. The door staff were excellent too and always positive. With regards to location, the Empire State is a block over, Macy’s and further shopping is at the end of the street, the tube station is also a minute walk away from the front entrance, and finally, Times Square is a 10 minute walk away through some excellent shops and architecture.

Other than not staying in the same room we arrived at, the experience was amazing!

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text: Je me suis rendu dans cette hôtel, très propre et personnels très polis et serviable ! Concernant le petit déjeuner il est correcte età volonté !!  Très belle situation près du métro et à 2 min de Time Square ! Je recommande !!👍👍

title: Pleasant stay
text:
We arrived at the hotel after a long flight from the UK for 5 nights and it was our 1st visit to the big apple. Upon arrival we were greeted by two ladies who were pleasant enough but a smile and welcome to the city would have been nice. The concierge staff were super friendly throughout our stay though and always greeted us everytime we walked past them.
Check in was fast but I think $250 security deposit was a little steep in my opinion. We were given our room number and key and were pointed to the elevator. We had to figure out for ourselves it was the 11th floor. Coffee room with pods topped up daily. Again very appreciated. 

The roof top bar was closed but you can still go up to take in the view. Excellent view of the empire state building as it's one block away. 

The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be near times square but not in the centre of the noise. Its only a 10min walk away. We also walked uptown to central park by staying on 6th avenue. Quite a long walk but a great way to see buildings and shops. 
We then braved the subway and used the city mapper app to get around. Super easy to understand. 

On our last morning we took advantage of a free complimentary continental breakfast at the black tap restaurant right next door. The general menu looked really good but we didnt try it as we were out all day every day away from the hotel. 

Overall we had a pleasant and comfortable  stay and I probably would use the hotel again as it served our needs. The only suggestions I would make for management to consider is 1/ have city maps available for first timers 2/ invest in soft closing mechanisms for each door to the rooms. The heavy and loud closing of neighbours doors woke us up a few times. 

I will be recommending this hotel to friends and family and hope to come back again one day.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Very tastefull, staff were excellent,we were initially given room 507 a fab room but positioned to the front of the hotel, it was very noisy, they say newyork doesn't sleep but I believe it can't get to sleep because of the sirens and car horns continuously sounding, I mentioned the problem and without fuss we were moved immediately to room 710, lovely room and nice and quiet, the hotel is the cheapest place we found for a beer as residents received buy one get one free, total bargain! We were also given a complimentary breakfast for the first morning which was a very nice touch. Staff were very happy to help with anything you needed to know. The view from rooftop bar is a real wow moment. I would strongly recommend the kixby, staff, comfort and location are all excellent, I think we were very lucky to find this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay again if the opportunity arose. Thank you  Kixby for a wonderful weekend.

title: Lovely hotel
text: When we arrived to the Kixby hotel we had a lovely welcome from the staff.Our room was a very good size, clean, tidy and the bed was so comfy. The only small problem we had was the air conditioning. It was noisy especially when we didn't want it on during the night. We did report it to reception and they did send someone to the room to have a look but it was still the same.That aside this didn't stop us having a good holiday. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
We booked our stay for the Kixby in June 2019 under hotel metro, and were excited for our stay. When we arrived in January we knew it had been renamed the Kixby, and had some renovations. We were very pleased with our stay, nothing wasn’t too much trouble for the staff at the Kixby. We slept every night with ease and confront. Not 100% sure or not but the room we stayed in (816) was slightly, or definitely seemed outdated. We knew it was going through a changed but not 100% sure if the whole place had been completed. It was clean, tidy and really enjoyed our stay. I’d say the only downfall would be the noise (we actually stayed at the back of the hotel and I know this can’t be helped). The breakfast buffet available in the black tap was good, lots of choice and something for everyone. Evening meal & menu at the Black Tap was also very excellent, their Crazyshake menu is to die for!! 
This hotel is very central which we were pleased about. Not once did we catch a cab. Everything is in walking distance, shopping, Empire State Building (which if you go to the Pent House roof top at this hotel you will get an astonishing view!), Times Square and Broadway is all just a short walk. The subway is moments away within a 2 minute walk, with all the stops go from this route to the main places in NYC. 
I would rate this hotel 8/10 and would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in NYC, and would definitely come back here.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: The hotel is right near Macy's store. It's very clean and comfortable. We were in room 917, which didn't have a view of anything of interest, but it was clean, and big enough for us for a week. The staff are great, Leo, Kerwyn and Chris especially. They give us directions to the best eateries, subways, transport etc, anything you need was no trouble. They made us feel very welcome and told us about the city, the Knicks, things to do near and far. There is a help yourself to tea and coffee on the 2nd floor, an observatory on the 12th floor, you can see the empire state building. We had free breakfast on our first morning which was lovely. We will definitely stay again.

title: What a view!
text: My family and I just arrived back home after our stay here in New York, and I have to say it was one of the nicest hotels I’ve ever stayed in. If you ever stay here, travel to the top of the hotel, the PH floor, and have a look at the view of New York from the rooftop bar- it’s absolutely incredible. Would happily stay here again if I were to come back!

title: Beautiful, clean and in the perfect location!
text:
Myself and Partner stayed here from 23/10/2109 for 4 nights in a lux king room. Check in was very quick and our room was ready when we arrived at the hotel around 4:30pm. The room was beautiful and tastefully decorated in dark woods with all the mod cons. Great, clean bathroom and little cupboard/ walk-in wardrobe which was great for our suitcases and hanging clothes. Plenty of drawer space and the free coffee throughout your stay and complimentary refreshments on arrival were an unexpected but great addition. Would I stay here again, without a doubt. So much so, my partner made a reservation for myself and our daughter in a lux queen queen room through Trivago for another 4 night stay from the 2/3/2020 at a fantastic price using the early bird option once Trivago directs you to your own site. My partner realised he hadn’t entered his email correctly on the booking once it was confirmed so emailed yourselves to advise of this. As he had no reply he did call the reservation team just to check the booking did go through. Our booking was found and the lady asked my partner to check if the confirmation had came through once amended. On checking this my partner noticed
there was a difference in the price to what he had booked through Trivago . The lady proceeded to say that the booking wasn’t made through Trivago, but directly through your website. This was not the case ( Trivago automatically directs you through to your website). My partner had emailed a screenshot of the booking which clearly shows the price but is yet to receive a reply. As the price was different and there was little else we could do about it as we were told again” the booking was not made through Trivago “ we cancelled the booking. Very disappointed to say the least.

title: Great hotel
text:
I recently stayed in The Kixby Hotel last week with my mum for 4 nights. The hotel was perfect and I couldn’t fault it. Rooms are small but perfect for a city break as your only in your room to sleep. 
Hotel staff where very friendly & helpful. Hotel is in a perfect location with The Empire State Building around the corner, Macy’s the bottom of the road and Times Square a 10 minute walk. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Mr catling
text: An absolutely amazing hotel can't fault it in any way let's start with the rooms they were very spacious with tea and coffee making machines the bathroom was very big and a brilliant hower. The rooftop simply amazing the cleanliness of the hotel spotless. On the day we arrived we were given a complimentary breakfast.  The best bit was the staff truly amazing guys the doorman Christian(I think) was marvellous he was so friendly gave us information on where to go and how to get there. I was really upset when we left they made us feel like family and very helpful and polite I would recommend this hotel to family and friends and would stay there again.

title: Holiday
text: Lovely Hotel stayed here three times now , will be returning in September, the staff are friendly well spoken and well mannnered. My room was nice , very warm hotel and very clean , you could get tea and coffee off floor two next to gym.And i was pleased to see they was trying to cut back on water usage by asking guests to use towels for two days which leads to 15% off your next stay good idea . Only down fall i found the hair dryers in my room and my aunties room burnt out to quickly but i guess they are used alot . Hotel is midtowm with everything in walking .Love NewYork cant wait to go back.

title: Lovely and friendly
text: The staff were very lovely and welcoming. The rooms were okay. I think from reading the reviews I had expected it to be amazing, which it was more okay. Had a great view of empire state so can't complain. Location was brilliant.

title: First time in NYC
text: We're just home from four nights in The Kixby Hotel. It was our first time in New York. The hotel is centrally located, close to the Empire State, Madison Square Garden and other attractions. The hotel has recently changed its name and is undergoing refurbishment. The new reception is really lovely and modern. I don't think our rooms had been done yet as they don't match the photos on the website, however they were still absolutely fine; a good size, comfy bed, clean, and the bathroom was nice too. All the staff we met were really lovely and happy to help. They take a credit/debit card for security deposit on check in but this is refunded on departure. There were no other hidden costs such as taxes etc like I'd heard about in other hotels. There is a bar in the hotel and a bar/restaurant next door that look nice but we didn't have time to try them. There is also a rooftop bar that has nice views of the Empire State. It wasn't open when we were there, I'm not sure if it was due to be refurbished or if it only opens in warmer months. I really can't fault the hotel and would 100% stay again.

title: Fantastic hotel and location
text: We have just arrived back from staying 6 nights at the Kixby , our room was amazing -  decor of hotel was so smart. Lifts were working the whole of our stay , staff were  helpful and welcoming at all times of the day. Room was stocked well and great coffee machine. Fantastic location on Herald Square and the view of Empire on the rooftop was amazing.  Can't wait to return to this hotel ! No extra charge for looking after our cases after we did checkout and a big Thanks to Leo for organising transport to airport also .

title: Good location but tired rooms
text:
We booked 4 nights here in December 2019 and had booked the Premier Queen room. 
The room was on the 9th floor and definitely tired. Advertised USB port charging was not in the room and the bathroom was poorly designed with the toilet roll on the wall about 5 foot from the toilet. The toilet handle stuck against the sink unit when flushing.
Coffee machine was good and the view from the terrace of ESB was great at night although the bar was closed.
Plus points it was central and close to subway.
Negative points room and bathroom although only used it to sleep.

title: Très bien
text: Hôtel idéalement situé à deux pas de Times square et à un pas de deux stations de métro offrant un grand choix de lignes (+ juste derrière l'Empire State Building). L'hôtel est clean, chambre bien décorée refaite récemment, salle de bain petite mais grande douche. Le personnel à l'accueil peu sympathique mais "chasseurs" souriants et serviables (résa taxi, ...). Pour le petit-déjeuner, possibilité de le prendre dans le restaurant attenant à l'hôtel, mais seulement un choix de mets sucrés. Nous avons préféré le prendre dans la rue à l'angle (6th av.) où plusieurs échoppes proposent des petits déjeuner variés. Rooftop sympathique dont nous n'avons pas profité car voyage en décembre. Hôtel à  recommander

title: Perfect
text: This hotel was fantastic. Right in the middle of Manhattan with a roof top terrace with brilliant views of the empire state. The room had complementary cans of pop, tea and coffee. It was clean, functional and the staff were very helpful. No resorts fees and we could leave our luggage in the luggage room until departure. The burger restaurant next door was great and Irish bar further down also great. Couldnt fault the stay at all!

title: Good stay, friendly staff, convenient location
text: We were so glad we found this hotel when we were looking for accommodation in New York. I had mentioned to the staff it was my wife's birthday and she was happy to see a card and a gift of specialty chocolates in the room when we arrived. The staff at the desk were happy to help with any questions we had, friendly and we were also greeted as if we were returning home to a family. The toiletries provided were of very good quality and having the coffee machine in the room was good. The location was very convenient. The room was spacious, clean and welcoming. We were very pleased and have recommended it to our friends who are visiting New York soon.If we return to New York, we will definitely return and stay here.

title: Perfect in so many ways!!!
text:
Me and my wife stayed at the Kixby between then 3rd and the 6th January 2020, this was our first visit to the NYC. Having experienced a very bad flight with Virgin and then an awful transfer from JFK, we were welcomed with smiles by the reception staff at the hotel. They swiftly booked us in and on our way. 
The room was smaller than I expected but more than big enough for what we needed it for... sleep. The deco of the room was lovely and everything was spotlessly clean. The bed was delightful to sleep in, so comfortable and adequate covers and pillows provided. The bathroom was great, lovely shower which was always hot and nice shower head. 
The location of this hotel is the biggest plus, short walk to Time Square , even shorter to the Empire State Building and evening shorter to Macy’s. The roof top terrace bar was closed but we were allowed onto it and what great views it provided. 
Throughout our stay, we were always made to feel welcome and loved every bit it! We will 100% be visiting again and staying at the Kixby, such a perfect hotel for the perfect break!

title: Awesome hotel, great location and brilliant staff !
text: The brilliant and friendly staff make this hotel ! Always helpful and pleased to see you each day. Our room was stunning and spacious, the bed was too comfortable didn’t want to get up ! The location is brilliant. The views from the rooftop bar are worth the fee alone!  We had 4 nights in a king bedroom (free upgrade) and enjoyed every second of it ! We were so sad to leave, 1st time in NYC and we will definitely return. Thanks !

title: Amazing Experience at the Kixby
text: We found the Kixby by chance when we booked our flights to New York via Expedia - we were not disappointed. We called the night before we checked in to request a room off of the street (as it was Christmas in NY and it was bound to be rowdy), and the front desk staff were incredibly helpful in seeing our request through. We stayed on the twelfth floor, in an extremely clean, spacious room. Everyone at the hotel was extremely accommodating - especially Christian at the front door. He was the first person we met and the last person to see us off before we went back home. I would highly recommend this hotel as it is as charming as the people who keep it alive and it leaves you in the heart of somewhere extraordinary.

title: Great hotel!  Warm, friendly staff -- hotel is in the middle of it all!
text: We stayed for 3 nights after Christmas and this hotel was great!  There are a few loading zone spots in front of the hotel, if you drive, to park your car.  The hotel has someone that will take your bags from your vehicle up to your room for you.  The will also hold luggage before you check in, if you arrive early, and after you check out, so you can continue to explore before you leave.  We had the family room which has a private room, with door, with a queen bed and a huge room with 2 queen beds.  Much bigger than I would have expected for a room in NYC!  There is  also an extra sink near the front door.  There is only one bathroom however.  There are TWO mini fridges in the family room and they were both stocked with free beverages when we checked in.  The room was clean and great -- the stay was excellent.  The hotel is in herald square, footsteps away from Macy's and a few blocks from times square and rockerfeller center.  We'll definitely be staying here again in the future!

title: Excellent hotel in the middle of everything!
text:
Really lovely hotel. Modern and clean. Service from staff is second to none. Made us feel so welcome. In the room - HUGE comfy bed with loads of pillows. Coffee machine with plenty of pods etc. Complimentary cans in the fridge was very welcome after a long day travelling. The bathroom is beautiful- rainfall shower head with plenty of pressure and hot water. 
My only gripe is about the lifts. There are only 2 for about 100 or so rooms which is just about enough IF they are both working.... Which literally happened once in 4 days. The lifts are extremely temperamental - The right lift never seemed to work! Perhaps I was just unlucky :) 
The location was absolutely perfect - 35th street is very central, subway at the end of the street as well as lots of bus routes. Nothing is more than 15/20 minutes away by subway or bus. If I were to return to New York, I would stay in this hotel without hesitation.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Very, very impressed with this hotel and look forward to returning. It’s quite stylish in the lobby, and lends a cosy atmosphere, and the hallways are even warm which was much appreciated in the chilly weather. My room-1216- was huge and very well-insulated. I didn’t hear anything from other rooms. The bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable and huge as well. Plenty of outlets in the room, a flatscreen TV and toiletries. Great shower. Also appreciated how, when I notified the front desk about my broke hair dryer, it was replaced almost immediately. Finally, small but decent fitness center on the 2nd floor that was never occupied each AM that I used it. I look forward to returning here.

title: Lovely, updated hotel
text:
We stayed at the Kixby the weekend before Christmas. The location was perfect with Macy’s Herald Square just steps away! The hotel was updated and the staff was kind & attentive, especially Christian, the bellman! The room itself was amazing. It was HUGE by NYC standards. Ample room for our family & luggage & shopping bags! 
The only slight problem was that there was a pretty large gap between the wall & the hvac unit which let in very cold air. We like a cool room, so it didn’t bother us, but it might be an issue for some guests. Overall, a wonderful stay!

title: Clean tidy room, just need attention to detail
text:
Stayed here in Dec ‘19. Room was newly refurbished, so, although small, was clean and tidy. Beds super comfy. Bathroom again, clean and tidy and nice large shower. Few things made the stay a bit niggley - Bottled water left in room for 1st night, apparently you can’t have any more after that, so buy your own. Petty, but irritating. Would have liked proper cups and saucers to have a coffee in the room, not paper cups and straws to stir. No full length nitro in the room - would have been handy. The air conditioning unit in the room will drive you mad it’s so loud and woke me up continuously, but that’s not the staffs fault, so no point complaining.

We were leaving late evening & had to check out 11 am, which is standard. I asked a reception do they have anywhere to freshen up or could I hire a day room to shower and let my daughter, who was 27 weeks pregnant, rest and shower too. Apparently they don’t hire a day room nor do they have any facilities other than a restroom by the bar to freshen up. Perhaps this should be a consideration by the hotel to have day rooms to rent. We were soaked as the weather was horrendous and simply had to sit in our wet clothes at reception until the airport. I also went to reception to see if they could organise a taxi to and from a cruise we were going on at Chelsea Pier - again, absolutely no help and apparently didn’t know how to pre-book a cab to get us back from the pier late at night. I would have thought the staff at a central, large hotel reception would be able to advise.

In a nut shell, I wouldn’t stay here again simply because of the lack of help from Reception staff (although I will say the gentlemen at the door were very helpful).

title: Fantastic Hotel with super friendly staff
text: We first stayed at the Metro for my 40th birthday and returned for my husbands 50th. Upgraded to a king size on arrival and issued with vouchers for 2 free drinks in the bar. Complimentary drinks in the mini fridge. Absolutely wonderful room, large and spacious and very clean. The staff were very knowledgeable and when we required about the metro the gentlemen behind the desk gave us clear instructions and even gave us his metro card. Outstanding would definitely like to book again next Christmas x

title: Fantastic hotel.Highly recommend 😀
text: We stayed in early December for 4 nights . What a fab hotel. We were in a new room on the 4th floor. Loads of space , clean and super comfy bed. I know you don’t spend loads of time in your room when in nyc but sometimes it’s nice to recharge . We loved coming back after a busy day , making a hot drink and chilling out for a few hours watching the Christmas film Channel . Black tap restaurant next door is lovely too. I would 100% recommended this hotel . Staff , location and rooms spot on. Thank you we will be back in a few years and will recommend to friends and family x 👍👍

title: 2nd stay and loved it!
text: This was our 2nd stay, our first as the new hotel name and refurb and was upgraded to a king room on arrival. It was stunning. The whole hotel looked fantastic. Friendly staff and super clean. Black tap restaurant next door is great also. Already planning our 3rd trip and will 100% be staying here again

title: Excellent first New York trip!!
text:
Coming to New York as first timers we weren’t really sure what to expect from any hotels but can say for sure this definitely exceeded all of our expectations. From the front of house staff, bell boys and maids everyone is polite, welcoming and make sure everything is to standard. We got upgraded to a king size room when we arrived and the room was a very good size, with a large walk in wardrobe space, good size en-suite, fridge stocked with complimentary drinks and the most comfy bed ever.  The ‘penthouse’ on the 12th floor was amazing with breathtaking views of the Empire State Building which is next door and you can take drinks up there from the bar downstairs too!
We tried out it’s sister restaurant next door “Black Tap” - one of the best burgers we’ve ever had! 
They even booked our transport for us home and had it waiting when we arrived to collect our bags - we felt like celebrities🤣.
If anyone is thinking of booking here you won’t be disappointed. It’s central to everything, Macy’s just around the corner but with the added bonus of no resort fees. 
Can’t wait to return one day to this amazing hotel⭐️

title: Girls Holiday
text:
We’ve stayed at this hotel 3 times before it was called the Metro Hotel then. Hotel has been completely renovated. For me I can not fault this hotel! Extremely clean, staff are amazing so helpful always had time for us. Complementary drinks in the fridge, tea and coffee in room plus on level 2 there 24 hr hot drinks. As I was celebrating my 50th birthday my friend arranged a bottle of bubbly on arrival plus we was upgraded. 
Hotel is so close to everything Macy’s, Empire State and subway at end of street. 
Time Square is 5 minutes away, Andrews Coffee Shop is also 5 minutes. 
Will return to this hotel due to location, cleanliness and staff. 
Front desk, door man and housekeeping are all great.

title: Ótima Surpresa
text: Quando estava planejando conhecer Nova Iorque, uma das grandes questões era a hospedagem. Após muito pesquisar e ler aos comentários, escolhi este hotel e foi uma EXCELENTE escolha. Viajei em novembro de 2019 por uma semana e por todos os 7 dias tivemos os quartos perfeitamente limpos e arrumados, toalhas e amenidades trocadas - sem ao menos pedir. A calefação era ótima, tanto que estava fazendo um frio com vento arrepiante de 0º para menos todos os dias e eu conseguia sentir até calor à noite. O hotel é lindo, moderno e muito bem localizado. Ao lado da estação de metrô Harold Sq. e quase de esquina com a Macy's. Ao lado da Target, de Duane Reade, McDonalds, e muitos outros. Há cafeteira e frigobar nos quartos, ferro de passar, cofre. Não houve cobranças adicionais de taxa de resort ou outras taxas que vi em outros hotéis. Não tenho do que reclamar, só agradecer a todos os viajantes que disponibilizaram suas avaliações honestas sobre o hotel, e à equipe super atenciosa e prestativa que fizeram da nossa viajem uma verdadeira perfeição.

title: Comfortable, Friendly a few resolved Issues
text:
I stayed at this hotel mid November, for 4 nights and 5 days. The hotel was just finishing up it's refurbishing. The lobby was a warm inviting space, check in was efficient  and happily checked me in early. If this wasn't possible they were able to hold your luggage whilst you explored. The situation of the hotel itself is perfect. Two blocks away from the empire state building in central Manhattan most of the tourist attractions weren't too far away. 

We had a slight issue the first night when another guest of the hotel was assigned to my already occupied room which resulted in them entering my room. The staff were apologetic and rectified the situation accordingly. The also then supplied me with complimentary breakfast for the rest of my stay. 

The room was comfortable and cleaned daily, complimentary soft drinks were supplied in the room along with a coffee machine. Bathroom was clean and modern. 

The cleaning staff are eager to get on with their day so make use of the do not disturb sign. As on my last day i had 2 cleaners enter my room before 9.30am as i forgot to place the do not disturb on the door. 

All in all i had a good stay. However i have to say the highlight of my stay was a young man called Leo. He was concierge/doorman on most of the days i stayed. He was helpful and went out of his way to accommodate any questions or recommendations i requested. His attitude and work ethic was refreshing and honestly would leave me smiling after talking with him. I hope he manages to go far within your company as he is a fantastic member of your staff.

title: Great location for visiting New York
text: Recently renamed and refurbished this hotel provides a great base for exploring New York. The room we had was a reasonable size with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom and a good tv. There was a side unit with drawers and a cool box and a safe. There was a a nice Keurig coffee maker. The hotel staff were helpful and there is a nice restaurant/bar that is part of the hotel.  You wouldn't want to spend too much time in the room but it was good for what it is.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at the recently renovated Kixby. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the room was well appointed, and during our stay the final touches of the renovation were done (like upgrading the towels, complimentary toiletries, and in-room branding). Plenty of drawer and closet space. The bathroom was on the small side but very clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We ate at the Black Tap restaurant downstairs a couple of times and enjoyed that too (very generous portions!)
