The location is excellent for tourists: less than 10 blocks to Times Square, a subway station at the end of the street, and Macys and the Empire State Building only one block over.

My only request to Kixby management would be to reconsider the single-use toiletries that are provided, and maybe switch to refillable or reusable options. I can't help but think that a huge amount of plastic waste is generated from these and it could easily be avoided.

title: Very Comfortable Hotel
text:
The hotel is in a good location, we walked to Central Park, The Metropolitan Museum, The Harbour, The Intrepid Museum, Times Square and many other places. It is also very close to the subway. Our room on the 12th floor, was a good size, clean and comfortable. The hot drinks machine was great and the tea and coffee was very nice and was replenished every day. The fridge in the room was great and the complimentary drinks much appreciated. ALL the staff in the hotel were fantastic, very friendly and helpful.

Even though we were on the 12th floor we did find that there was a lot of street noise, both day and night. We do however live in a very quiet area so it could just be that we aren’t used to having any noise, especially through the night. The noise prevented us from opening the window so we had to use the air conditioning, which we found rather noisy. We were also woken at midnight one night and one o’clock in the morning on the following night by the noise of the bar furniture being dragged around in the room above us. The reception staff did tell us that this was, unfortunately, unavoidable but did offer us another room. We didn’t change rooms but we didn’t hear the noise again during our stay.

We did have a very enjoyable stay at The Kixby and can’t thank the staff enough for looking after us so well.

title: They made our 20th anniversary perfect!
text: Our stay at Hotel Metro/Kixby was amazing. The location is perfect, doorman (Leo and Christian) were so helpful and accommodating, also very protective of their guests, which definitely made us feel safe and well taken care of. The room is on the smaller side for a standard hotel room but from what I’ve heard that’s the norm for NYC. But, we had plenty of space for luggage and shopping bags. Shower was wonderful, good hot water and decent pressure. My only complaint would be that a light kind of shown through our bathroom (glazed, but still let light in)  window at night so the room wasn’t as completely dark as it could be since the bathroom door is also glazed and lets in light. Didn’t really keep us up much after the first night. Beds are soft and the blankets and pillows were comfortable. A/c and best work extraordinarily well. The hotel sent us a special bottle of champagne. The extra touches and thoughtfulness of the staff made this trip worth it.

title: Small but...
text:
Pokey little room and now view...

But that’s it! This is a fantastically located place to stay thats clean, convenient and has really friendly, helpful staff. 

Comfortable bed and a good shower. Yes, I stayed in a small room but wasn’t there most of the time and the storage was good in it too.

title: Amazing Hotel with Amazing Staff
text:
Hotel has a great central location. Rooms are clean and well equipped. Rooftop bar is great and has fantastic views of the Empire State Building. Staff are so very friendly and helpful.
All in all our first stay in New York was amazing! Thank you.

title: Amazing stay!!!!!!!!
text: We stayed during my sister’s 50th birthday....let me just start off with the staff were so AMAZING!!!! Our room was upgraded and they had champagne for us!! The room was gorgeous and super comfy!! They even had organic coffees for the Keurig (that was a super plus from me)! I can’t say enough good things about the staff, they made it a point to acknowledge you and were super friendly EVERY time you were in their presence!! Housekeeping did a phenomenal job as well! The rooftop bar had a view that was breathtaking!! The hotel was centrally located and was within walking distance to pretty much everything! If ever in NYC again, this will be our go to spot!! Loved every second of the stay!

title: A very good hotel
text:
It’s a very good hotel, clean and close to so many touristic places. The restroom is also big and modern.
The hotel will change its name very soon to KIXBY. 
They are renovating everything here!
No resort fee resort.

title: 5 giorni Top
text:
Hotel decisamente di alto livello.
Personale cordiale, disponibile e soprattutto professionale.
Camere ok in stile alberghi newyorkesi, caffè in camera.
Posizione top, a piedi si raggiunge velocemente qualsiasi meta, molto ben servito e soprattutto con una vista sull’Empire state Building da paura!
Niente da dire.
Per la mia esperienza, CONSIGLIATISSIMO!

title: Perfdct
text:
What a lovely hotel, ideally located go exploring Manhattan, rooms all recently renovated to a good standard. Our room was small but ample and very comfortable (it’s NYC, enjoy the city, the bedroom is irrelevant) the barroom was great with a waterfall shower, fridge with complimentary soft drinks and water. 

Although the roof terrace was closed for the season when we arrived you could still go up to have a look and bring a drink up from the bar. You are literally in the shadow of the Empire State Building. Will definitely stay here again..

title: HOTEL GUEST
text:
FANTASTIC SUPERB HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Superb location, LISA and STAN superb first class customer service and KERVIN very helpful!!! A wonderful memorable experience!!!!!

The room was everything you could wish for, clean, modern and user friendly and you could walk straight outside into central New York.

A return is on the cards!!!

Don’t hesitate to book this hotel.

title: Excellent hotel ideally located
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights and the entire stay was excellent.

It is located minutes away from subway/metro and walking distance to 5th and 6th  Avenues and all attractions. 

Good sized, comfortable rooms and despite being on a busy street I didn't notice any noise. 

Also a shout out to the adjoining Black Tap restaurant - fantastic food.

title: Nice hotel, newly refurbished
text:
Stayed here for three nights in November 2019. Has the new Kixby name on the outside of the building. Had just been refurbished. There is a BlackTap restaurant and a bar in the hotel but we didn’t use either.
On check in staff were helpful (and at other times when we needed assistance) and given an upgrade to a king room. We had a room at the back of the hotel on the second floor and had no issues with noise from outside. 
The rooftop bar was open to get a good picture of the Empire State Building but not to serve alcohol which is a shame really because with heaters etc it’ll I would buy a drink and sit up there in the winter. 
The only downside was the gym wasn’t finished yet, which I was planning to use as I was getting up at 5am each day due to still being on UK time. 
Good location, Macy’s at the end of the road, as well as a subway station.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: I stayed here for 3 nights for my first visit to NYC. Excellent choice.  This is a "boutique" hotel and it is very well located. The room was small but I only needed it for sleep.  The bed was very comfortable. The shower was amazing. It had a fridge but not a microwave. The customer service was also excellent. There is a rooftop bar with a view of the Empire State Building. Restaurant right next door. Plus everything in midtown is minutes away and the rest of manhattan just a subway ride away. Subway station a short walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

title: Love it
text:
We are currently staying at the Hotel Metro or as it’s now known The Kixby . The main reason we booked this hotel was because of the fantastic reviews of the Hotel , even so was still unsure as if it would be as good as the Reviews. 
We should not have worried as it was so much better than our expectations, the location is perfect so close to Macys and The Empire State. 
The staff are so friendly and welcoming and upon check in which was so quick we were upgraded to a Luxury King Rooms , Wow 615 & 617 which were beautiful and immaculate.
The rooms are kept immaculate by housekeeping .
 So to anyone luckily enough to be coming to this Beautiful Hotel on the near future , you will not be disappointed. 
I will definitely be recommending this hotel to my family and friends and when I return to New York , this is where I will stay .

title: Good Hotel,Excellent staff and Brilliant Location
text:
Good Hotel which was in a very good location. 
- very close to subway station
- right next to empire state building 
- Near madison sq garden and macy's
- 5/10 min walk to times sq

Recently changing to The Kixby which they have a big sign outside the hotel which was very handy to spot if you were comin up one of the avenues. 

Staff were all great and were always helpful and polite.

Only criticism was the noise, although most hotels struggle with noise as new york is so busy the hotel had work going on outside what was really loud at night when trying to get to sleep, Windows could of been a bit better i thought

Well priced and would visit again

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of October. This hotel is perfectly located and the newly renovated rooms are lovely and simple. The staff as the door were always really friendly welcoming us back or wishing us a good day.

title: Great Stay
text: Great location, spotless rooms and helpful staff. Special mention to Christian/Concierge, great guy and always good for advice to aid an authentic American experience. Christines genuine love, enthusiasm and knowledge of the city added greatly to my holiday experience. Hotel room was lovely and quiet at night which I thought amazing considering natural street noise. Only criticism is bar/restaurant, just did not like limited choice/taste of craft beers and found food menu advertised as luxurious a tad pretentious both were expensively priced. Really loved my stay and will be back

title: Excellent
text:
Wonderful hotel with an excellent view to the Empire State Building. Very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean, thanks to very courteous maids.
Perfect location right next to the Empire State Building and Macys.

title: Amazing
text: The most perfect trip! Staff very friendly and helpful, storing our bags and getting us a cab for our flight home. The rooms were immaculate and had the most wonderful Art Deco design. Perfect location to be able walk everywhere

title: Supert hotell, meget sentralt
text: Nyoppusset hotel sentralt i midtown. Rene og fine rom, og med en super service av alle som jobber der. Det som trekker litt ned er vel at det er endel støy fra gaten utenfor, men det må man forvente når man vil bo midt i smørøyet. Gratis wifi og muligheter for lading direkte i lampene ved sengen. Kaffemaskin, kjøleskuff og safe på rommet. I tillegg til rene håndklær og produkter for bruk på badet. Det var strykebrettet og strykejern tilgjengelig på rommet. Absolutt et hotell man vil bruke igjen.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: This place and the people who work here are first class. Can not fault anything about our visit. Hotel has just been refurbished and is great. Brilliant position for getting about a busy NYC. We were upgraded to a kingsize room and a bottle of bubbly as it was our anniversary. Great friendly bar. Perfect stay. Great views of the Empire State Building. Perfect stay

title: Huwelijksreis
text: Heerlijke tijd gehad in dit hotel. Geheel gerenoveerd en de naam word veranderd in Kixby. Prachtige kamers met een heerlijk groot bed. Douche was voorzien van een regendouche. Koelkast met frisdrank en elke dag werd de koffie en thee cups aangevuld. Rooftop bar was niet geopend wegens seizoen maar je kunt er wel terrecht om te genieten van het uitzicht op de empire state building. Vlakbij macy's en 10 min lopen time Square. Aanrader!

title: Aufgrund von Renovierung top!
text: Die Zimmer sowie das Hotel werden gerade renoviert - wirklich top. Anbei Bilder eines renovierten Queensize-Bett-Zimmers sowie 3 Bilder der Rooftop-Bar mit Sicht aufs Empire-State-Building. Auch der neue Barbereich im Erdgeschoss ist erst seit 2 Wochen geöffnet und sehr modern und schön eingerichtet.

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel recently refurbished - upgraded to family room which was superb two bedrooms lovely bathroom small kitchen area with coffee machine sink and fridge - tv in both rooms - fridge in main room - complimentary water and cold drinks on first night - stayed 5 nights - very friendly staff - maid service excellent only complaint would be better double glazing needed - don’t mind the traffic noise but renovations to a building opposite that lasted till early hours of the morning a little excessive !!! Excellent location right next to Empire State Building

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
Can’t fault it, staff friendly and helpful, room cleaned to a high standard every day, room large and everything worked as it should like Air con, fridge and shower etc. Nice coffee machine in the room and complementary drinks in the fridge on arrival. Brilliant location and 30seconds from a Metro station. 
Short walk to Times Square and Macy’s, plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. 
5* all round!

title: Thomas Cook went into administration
text: Perfectly based .. even though the hotel was under construction.. fantastic everything was so nearby even though we had a slight Thomas Cook issue ..  the staff worked with us .. cannot fault them   Would recommend

title: Excellently locates hotel with great staff
text:
Stayed here for four nights.
On arrival staff was friendly , professional and well presented .
Clean smart hotel , my room was on the 6th floor and was perfectly clean with everything I needed , good strong decent shower too.
Hotel is very close to Times Square and Madison square garden .
Lots of good bars and restaurants close by .
Would 100% stay here again .

title: Wont stay again
text: We have stayed at this hotel 5 times, recently the hotel has been what they call " refurbished " it should say "remodelled " as the name and everything have changed, although every where you look on line the pics are still of the old decor. For us the hotel has just become like every other one and thats why we continued staying as it was different before with some charm and art deco . We arrived and were upgraded which we were grateful for until we found out every one had been upgraded as they were still working on the lower floors. The newly decorated room was nice enough although the corridors were decorated in dark grey and black which was already looking tatty, the rooms were fine, good bed, fridge with complementary drinks and coffee machine, but thats where it ended. We were there for a week so not enough drawer space, towels tiny, lead on hair dryer not long enough to reach the mirror, mirror in bathroom couldnt get to as toilet and sink were infront off. Most annoying things was when housekeeping came in they lined everything up including my belongings😮, fancy gradient lighting that we struggled to get to work right, struggled also with shower as no instructions. The lift is an absolute joke. The roof top bar and internal bar are now updated and used by people who are not staying in the hotel so very rowdy. Breakfast was a rip off paid $14.95+ tax each for cold cereal, cold pastries and coffee much cheaper to go elsewhere. We didnt use the black tap burger joint next door. On this occassion we were dissapointed and will be choosing a different hotel the next time we visit NYC

title: Good Hotel
text:
We stayed here in Oct for a short break and arranged this hotel with our flight, it was a mid way price point and seemed to have good reviews so this filled me with confidence. I checked back on TA a few times before we went and noted that the hotel was or had been going through a re-furb so expected some disruption, but it was mostly completed when we stayed. We arrived slightly earlier than the stated check in time of 4pm but were able to check in to our room a few hours early. Our room was on the 2nd floor and had been recent redecorated. 
While simple it had everything, a large comfy bed, bathroom and space to unpack and store cases, we were easily able to drop our things and go straight out exploring. We had a very packed trip so were often up early and didnt return to late in afternoon, each day we had fresh towels, room cleaned and bed made. Decor was good and was in keeping with the revamped dark look the hotel has re-modelled itself to. The room does have air con which for us was a bit annoying and noisy on occasion, the temperature when we were there was mixed but in between 16-21 degrees. The things that we didn't particularly like were the size of the towels which were no bigger than a hand towel, a bath sheet size would've been better. The noise the toilet makes when it flushes and re-fills was so loud it reverberated through the entire room vibrating the desk in the room. I never heard a similar noise from other rooms, either its well insulated that you dont notice others or our neighbours were too polite to say 'what is that racket?' very noticeable in the middle of the night i thought. 
We stayed over a weekend and the friday/saturday evenings were pretty noisy, as were were only on 2nd floor any noise from the lobby or hall is easily heard at our room so a few nights, coupled with the jet lag the noise was annoying and kept me awake. 
The hotel was just doing the final touches to its re-furb which meant the main staircase was out of action so initially our only choice was the lift to our floor, further investigations discovered the service stairs which we ended up using all the time as the lifts were as others have note were slow, unreliable and frequently packed with other stayers. One occasion i jumped in at floor 2 after expecting to go to the lobby, it was filled with about 5 others who were a little flustered apparently trying to get to the higher floors. The lift then went to basement where one of the maids assured us we should just keep pressing the buttons till we get to where you wanted, fortunately its next stop was lobby so i nipped out and thought never again! 
The hotel is ideally located just behind the empire state building, for us this was a good base from which to explore NY. Black tap have recently opened next door which meant we didnt have to go far searching for food on our first night.
All staff were very helpful, including printing our boarding passes for our flights home and while we didnt use the doorman service too much we noted that the chap was very helpful and friendly

title: 70th birthday trip
text: Excellent experience for my 70th birthday celebrations with room upgrade & champagne on ice plus chocs 😁😆Hotel room spotless & quiet, lovely rooftop bar. Staff helpful & polite. Very close to all attractions, easy for walking. Thank you

title: Excellent et idéalement situé dans Manhattan
text:
Nous avons passé six nuit dans cet hôtel 
L’hôtel n’est plus en travaux 
Personnels chaleureux et à votre écoute 
Toujours prêt à vous rendre service bravo
Il est très agréablement décoré 
La chambre est petite mais avec un lit king size c’était parfait 
Les équipements correspondent à la description de l’hôtel 
Un bar en terrasse le lookup élabore des cocktails A déguster avec une vue magnifique sur l’Empire State Building 
Pour le petit déjeuné nous avons retiré des bons auprès de de l’accueil le tarif est de 15$ à prendre cher Black Tap nous rentrions dans le restaurant par la porte du hall
Nous avons très bien déjeuné 
bagels œufs confiture pâtisserie croissant pain au chocolat jus de fruits 
Idéalement placé à deux minutes du métro et à 15 minutes à pied de Time square
Seul désagrément est le climatiseur dans la chambre qui est bruyant nous l’ éteignons chaque nuit

title: Marked improvement
text:
Stayed here several years ago and it was dated but otherwise OK. It has recently been refurbished and is much  nicer. Our room was large with excellent HVAC and wifi. Spacious closet with real hangers, safe and small refrigerator round out the amenities
; however, the hotel will soon be rebranded as the Kixby. I have no idea if it will undergo further changes.

title: A Mixed Experience
text:
Two years ago, my wife and I passed by this hotel and were intrigued by its classic, art deco style. We decided on our next visit to NYC we would stay at the Metro. In the interim, the hotel underwent a major renovation and upon our return, the deco-style, elegant lobby we remembered has been replaced by a more contemporary design. The lovely cocktail bar/restaurant evoking a mid-20th century charm has become  a "fast-food" like eatery. We are guessing the hotel management decided the previous version of the Metro may have had a "tired" look and needed a face lift, of sorts. In my humble opinion, they made an error by not investing in a makeover of its original design, reminiscent of the days of Cole Porter. 

In addition, the management offered us an upgrade to a larger room. This was very kind of them, but they gave the room, in error, to a friend of ours who was traveling with us. It took two days to correct this mistake. The manager of the hotel at first advised us that it might not be possible to fix the problem.Then shortly afterwards, we were told we would be given the same upgraded room, one floor above, because our room was going to be used for a marketing event the next day. Our first reaction was why couldn't the hotel use the room one floor above for their presentation. The next day, the hotel apparently decided to do that, and we were able to stay in our original upgraded room. Overall, our room was comfortable and the bathroom great, very spacious.

With the exception of the first two days, the remaining eight days of our stay were pleasant. We were offered vouchers for complementary continental breakfast; very nice, but would recommend they add a hot option, for example scrambled eggs and bacon and extend breakfast an hour, from 10am to 11am.

title: 3 night stay
text:
Great location, near Empire State Building & Macy’s.
Clean room with fridge, complimentary sodas & tea/coffee maker, iron & ironing board. 
Roof top bar has an amazing view of Empire State Building but you pay for the privilege of looking at it - drinks are expensive.
No other bar or breakfast facilities, hotel is affiliated to a burger bar next door but they only sell burgers. 
Would have given 5* but for 2 points.
Bed was in wrong position in the room, literally 1 foot from the bathroom, not ideal for the person sleeping on that side of the bed. 2nd point is the WiFi - it’s rubbish, keeps falling off & you’re constantly re joining it.

title: Perfect mid town town
text: Can't fault this hotel, perfect location right near empire state building, ring near the under grounx so you get around the city. 5th ave and times square on your door step. The hotel was spotless, the bed was comfortable. The decor was a little dated but nothing drastic. The staff where incredibly helpful and the included breakfast was a perfect for people on the go lots of variety and I liked the self service option. All in all perfect hotel for a few days in Newyork. Will definitely return.

title: Very clean very friendly helpful staff
text: Great location great customer service. We had noise issues with our room we were moved no problems to a quieter room. Staff very informative and helpful. Hotel amenities spot on shower great beds very comfy. We will definitely be returning thank you. We received a complimentary bottle of bubbles from the hotel as we were on honeymoon thank you so much it was a lovely touch.

title: Nice hotel, convienently located
text:
Comfortable hotel, currently undergoing renovation & name change to the Kixby. In line with most New York hotels rooms are on the small side with not much of a view. 
Very conveniently situated next to Heral Square with Macy's just over the road & the Empire State Building.
No restaurant but there is a decent burger joint called the Black Tap next door and a rooftop bar (season/weather permitting).
Staff all extremely polite & helpful.
I would stay here again

title: A week in New York
text: An ideal Midtown Manhattan base for a week sightseeing in New York. We were given one of the newly refurbished rooms on the 7th floor, a lovely surprise on our arrival. Our room was spacious, spotless and smartly decorated and we had a view across to Macy's from one of our windows. The Reception/door team were super helpful and a credit to the hotel. We ate in the Black Tap one evening (recommended) and visited the rooftop bar on our last evening (wish we had visited more frequently!). Thank you to the Hotel Metro team and hope to return one day. Highly recommended.

title: Niente male per qualche giorno in centro a NY!
text: Ho alloggiato con la mia ragazza nel periodo natalizio 2018 in questa struttura e siamo rimasti soddisfatti su tutti i punti di vista. Pulizia e ordine nella norma, accoglienza e comportamento del personale buona e disponibile, posizione della struttura buonissima per visitare il centro e zone principali e più conosciute. Qualità prezzo validissima! Lo consiglio e ritornerei sicuramente mi capitasse di ripassare per New York.

title: First stay in NYC and we will be back
text:
Wonderful hotel. Great central New York location, beautiful rooms. Staff very attentive.
The rooms were very clean and well appointed, great shower, tea and coffee making facilities in room.
We were only on the 4th floor but we had no noise from the busy NYC streets.

title: Fantastic
text:
My mum and I   stayed here between 22nd September - 26th September, the hotel was clean, comfortable and well presented especially as they were in the middle of renovation. The hotel is in a fabulous location being one street away from The Empire State Building. Unfortunately our travel company went into administration during our visit. This was a learning curve for us all! The staff were helpful and sympathetic of our situation and we did manage to resolve this working together! Anu the Assistant General Manager kept us well informed of the situation and really did work with us to resolve the issues we were having. 

The concierge service at the hotel is impeccable even helping us grab a taxi on our first night in the City and carrying our bags on our departure!

Would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again when we return. 

Thank you for making what could have been a disastrous trip much easier!

title: Now called The Kixby
text: The hotel was in the middle of renovation when we visited so we were upgraded to a larger room which was fabulous. The interior areas were very dark. I think this was the new style. The attached eating area was a Burger Bar with craft beer. There was a rooftop bar which gave a fabulous few of The Empire  State Building, especially lit up a night. Buffet breakfast could be purchased in Burger Bar which was adequate. Some staff were very helpful. Ideal situation for midtown sites. Would stay here again

title: Brilliant
text: A lovely hotel with a great view of the Empire State Building and within a short walking distance to Times Square - with Macy's on the next corner as a bonus.  We were given an upgrade to a King suite and it was delightful.  Comfortable, spotlessly clean and with kind, helpful state who were eager to advise us on getting around. When we reported a minor problem with the room safe an engineer arrived within five minutes to sort it out.  This was our third stay in NYC and, while our previous hotels have been good, this is definitely the onel I would choose to return to.  I believe it is soon to become the Kixby hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it.

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
I booked this trip for my boyfriends birthday. We arrived to a very warm welcome and we got a free upgrade to a King suite. I booked the hotel as it was a central location but apart from that knew nothing else about it. I am so glad we did stay here. We were literally round the corner from the Empire State Building and we were ideally placed for all the usual landmarks all within 15 mins walk.
The rooms were small but very well appointed. There was a free safe, mini bar with complimentary soft drinks, tea/coffee machine, fabulous bathroom with power shower and complimentary toiletries. There was a hair dryer, iron and ironing board in the room and the lamps also doubled up as charging points.
I have to mention Kervin the doorman. What a lovely guy- nothing was too much trouble. There was a roof-top terrace that sadly we didn't see but the views are apparently lovely.
This will definitely not be our last visit to this lovely hotel. It was being renovated while we were there but there was minimal disruption. Just to mention as well the name is changing to the Kixby Hotel soon.

title: Barry Armstrong and Lynda Lyons.
text:
Just stayed at the Metro from the 18th until the 22nd September. Ideally situated near the empire state building. Always spotlessly clean and comfortable. 
All of the staff we came into contact with were extremely polite and courteous and eager to help. Two in particular, Kervin and Ben. Will definitely be returning.

title: Perfect location
text: The location of Hotel Metro is perfect for Macy's,  the Empire State Building and Times Square. Our room was very comfortable and spacious with a view of the Empire State Building too. Having stayed in NYC previously and experienced excess noise  from the traffic at night  we were delighted this wasn't case at Hotel Metro   and this is one of the few hotels i would return too.

title: Superb Hotel Comfortable Stay
text:
Quick check in and upgraded to a newly renovated premier King on the 6th floor. Really big room, massive bed, lovely walk in shower and tea, coffee provided. There was still renovation work going on in the hotel but did not affect our stay. Staff very friendly and great views of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar. 
Only one suggestion, it would be good if there was blackout curtains on the windows to dampen noise from 35th avenue which could be quite loud in the early hours of the morning. Refuse/ bin lorries could be nois.
Great hotel being renamed to the Kirby and a big thank you to all staff especially the front door porter who helped with luggage and called us a taxi to LGA early in the morning.

title: Super location and brilliant staff
text:
I chose New York as the destination for my 60th birthday and the reviews of Hotel Metro (now the Kixby) persuaded me to book - I was certainly not disappointed.

Fantastic central location, super friendly staff and a good sized (and spotless) room made our stay comfortable and unforgettable.  We will definitely be returning here on our next visit.

The renovations were just coming to an end when we left but the disruption was minimal and it quite interesting to see how it developed.

Special mention to Kervin and Christian who took the time to help us out and give us tips on the best places to go, etc.  it's the personal touch like this that makes a place special.

Thank you Metro for a great time.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Nos encantó el hotel, sin duda volvería a hospedarme ahí y lo recomiendo ampliamente. La ubicación es excelente, estás entre la 5ta y la 6ta todo alrededor hay tiendas.El Empire state en la calle de atrás y entrada al metro a pocos metros del hotel.
Los cuartos no son grandes pero suficiente para una pareja. La cama deliciosa, todo super limpio, se ve que acaban de remodelar los cuartos. El lobby estaba en remodelación pero no fue algo que me molestara.

title: Great location and staff
text:
Located within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Macy’s and the Grand Central Terminal. Room we had consisted of two bedrooms, three beds, two fridges and two televisions.
The room was recently renovated but still had a few older touches and furniture. The cleanliness of the room was very good and the cleaning staff excellent. The lift was frustrating at times with only one lift working. There was a staff lift but this was mainly used for the bar on the roof. Great views of the Empire State Building from the rooftop.
Doorman Kervin was a star and a breath of fresh air. No breakfast at the hotel but plenty of options in the area eg Brendan’s and Andrew's diner. Also only a few blocks to Best Bagels and Coffee. Great hotel will come again.

title: Don’t believe everything you read
text: This hotel is amazing perfect location right in the middle of everything rooms are bright,clean and fresh the maids most definitely work hard as do all the staff they were very helpful and pleasant and will go out of there way to help you....Thankyou to doorman for helping us with Uber’s....they are doing work at the hotel but this didn’t cause us any problems what so ever.....just one little downside there was no full length mirror in the room  but apart from that excellent stay.....looking forward to coming back.....

title: Brilliant
text:
Absolutely loved my stay here. The staff are friendly and very willing.
Yes it was being renovated but it didn't interfere with us in anyway.  The rooms were spotless and very comftable. I will definitely stay here again

title: First time in NY
text: Nice hotel with helpful friendly staff. We were upgraded to a refurbished king room when we checked in (Room 207). The rooms have most of the amenities you need, really like the coffee machine. Small issues are no full length mirror in the room, one could be put behind the door. The door to the room doesn't fit properly there's quite a large gap at the bottom. I noticed a few other rooms like this and it let's it light/noise etc. Noise was a small issue but I understand there's nothing you can do about the rooms being so close together. Guests really should be more considerate of other people at 3am! We didn't find the ongoing renovation a problem we would return if we were ever in NY again

title: This hotel is now called Kixby !!!!!
text:
A really nice  convenient hotel with friendly staff that cannot do enough to make you stay enjoyable.. The hotel is very close to subway 34th street taking you up and down town, 
I too suffered bites on legs and ankles after my recent stay. I was in room 916. 
Also on the last day the big red metro sign used to first locate the hotel at night was replaced with one calling the hotel Kixby, so take note if trying to find the hotel until the website and other literature is updated.

title: Rooms need renovation
text:
I stayed at Hotel Metro for 2 nights during Labor Day. I had one of the rooms at the roof (aka “penthouse level”). I thought my room was pretty old, with outdated furniture. The A/C unit is really loud and I had to turn it off at night. The hall leading into the room was unappetizing and drab. The bed is relatively comfortable, and the pillows huge! The positives include the large bathroom and nice amenities. The staff and location are great. It’s in the heart of Manhattan and close to the metro and Penn station (if coming from Newark airport). It’s also few blocks from Bryant Park.
Of note, there is construction/renovation in the lobby of the hotel, but honestly it didn’t affect me at night during my sleep.
I think that if my room and the overall hotel condition was better, I’d likely give this hotel more credit. Hopefully, the renovations in the lobby are only the start.

title: Can’t wait to go back!
text: Spent a few nights here for my husband’s 40th birthday. We loved the hotel. We had a newly refurbished room which was beautiful. The only downside and reason for 4 points is because the hotel was undergoing a refurb on the ground floor and the restaurant was closed. That was a shame but we understood it couldn’t be helped. We’ll definitely return one day.

title: Great place to stay
text:
The hotel, although being revamped, was amazing, close to everything, convenient for buses and subway. There was a restaurant attached and a fab place for breakfast just across the road. Staff were courteous, friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and comfortable. I must add that the bed was SO comfy My husband and I commented daily how restful our sleep was, I have never slept so well whilst on holiday. 
Excellent place to stay to get around.

title: Covered in bug bites after a two night stay!
text: I initially booked this hotel because it was in a good location and the reviews seemed positive. Firstly, there is construction going on in the main lobby. This wasn't a huge deal but it wasn't the most pleasant thing to walk into after a day or traveling. The worst part was the smell of the construction. Secondly, the hotel provides you with only two complimentary water bottles for your whole stay (not 2 per day). When we asked for two more bottles on our second day, we were told that they only provide two bottles of water  on check-in day and that we could go to the pharmacy down the street if we wanted more. Again, not a huge deal but I think that when you pay $200 a night and they charge a $250 security deposit, the least they could do is give you two bottles of water a day. The worst part was the bed bugs! We stayed at this hotel for two nights and after the second night our feet and legs were covered with red and itchy bites! The hotel seemed clean but I guess that wasn't the case. Would not recommend this hotel. There are many other hotels in the area so I would choose a different one.

title: Great hotel & location
text:
First time in NYC and i have to say that hotel choice was fantastic , great location , very closed to lot of attractions. We stayed here for 4 nights from the 30th of august , room 707.  The room was spacious , clean and a large , very comfy bed . There is a safe in the room and a coffee machine which was replenished every day. Good size shower / bathroom.
Nice touch from the hotel , as it was our 10th anniversary, a box of chocolate and a Happy Anniversary note was waiting for us in the room.
The ongoing works , were not a problem , as we were out all day long and never bothered us. 
Staff very friendly .
Rooftop terrace , very nice with a fantastic view over Empire State Building.
Overall , very nice place to stay in Manhattan.

title: Being Refurbished with Lack of Amenities
text: We heard that the hotel’s lobby including the bar area was being refurbished but had no idea that it would be in such a mess which impacted on the amenities available. As we entered the hotel up a ramp as the main entrance was closed off we were surprised to see the place was full of screens sheeting and building materials. We booked in and were again surprised when the staff just pointed towards a lift. We managed to locate our room which was No 511 which was located on the 5th Floor. The room was a reasonable size and was quite well furnished. The view from the room overlooked roofs. As the Foyer and bar was closed for refurbishment we decided to use the hotels roof terrace bar (the look up bar). We went there several times & were regularly hassled by the staff either trying to get us to order food order asking us to move seats stating they were reserved. On one occasion we and several others were told we would have to leave as there were going to be (unadvertised) private parties on the terrace/rooftop bar. We spoke to the Manager who surprisingly said that the bar did not belong to the hotel? It is my belief that the rooftop area was being reserved for select guests that included the users of the penthouses on the upper floors. The biggest problem was due to the refurbishment as to enter the hotel you had to pass through people queuing for next doors restaurant as the main entrance was sealed off. Also the foyer was of dust sheets screens and building materials. I do not believe visitors should not be charged full price during these building works.

title: Great roof bar
text:
Clean rooms with air con (a must have)
Good showers and friendly staff especially the maid. 
Down stairs was under renovation when I was there but wasn’t an inconvenience .
The roof top bar is great with brilliant views of the Empire State Building . 
Really enjoyed it hear and one day would like to return

title: Great location and staff
text: Stayed here for 5 nights on holiday, and it was our first time in NYC. Thought the hotel wasn't great on first sight, until we actually got inside, and it was truly fantastic. Refurbishment was undergoing on the lobby, but it didn't disrupt our stay at all. Check in was easy, and throughout the whole stay, staff around the hotel and at reception were very friendly and very helpful. The only way I could fault it is through the noise caused by the street even though we were 8 floors up.

title: Great location, friendly staff but noisy air con
text: We were aware that there were refurbishments going on here before we travelled so that wasn't an issue and never really caused us any problems. We booked 2 rooms and 1 of them was upgraded to a larger Queen room. Both rooms were near each other on the 7th floor at the back of the hotel. The smaller room was quite small and compact but the Queen room was quite large and comfortable but the air con unit on the wall was loose. However, the TV was large and good with plenty of channels to watch and the bathroom was cosy but adequate. The air con never kept me awake but you couldn't really sleep with it off as the room would soon get too warm. It does get very noisy when the fans kick in though, and although we could sleep through it, watching TV was almost impossible with it on. I didn't go to NY to watch telly though so it's not a big deal, but it would be too noisy for some. Very well located with a lovely Burger restaurant called "The Black Tap" attached and I think part of the refurbishment includes a breakfast bar behind reception. They used the service elevator to serve the bar when they could and we never waited long for one to arrive. The staff were always friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The bed was massive and very comfortable, the pilllow was the most comfortable I've ever slept on. There was a safe in the room and we were given a few soft drinks in the fridge on arrival but they weren't restocked after that. The hot drink machine in our room was replenished every morning though. All in all, a great location not far from Times Square and all that Midtown Manhattan had to offer and I would stay here again.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed there for 4 nights over labor day weekend and loved the location. The hotel is right next to Herald Square and the Empire State building. 

It is going under construction now, so the 8am not wanted wakeup call wasn't so nice. The room is fairly big for a NYC hotel with great amenities, including a large shower. 

The rooftop has to be the hotel's best feature by far, with stunning views of the Empire State Building. Breakfast wasn't included, but there were a ton of options within a 5 minute walk.

Overall, this is a great property in the heart of Manhattan. The room was clean, the staff friendly, and the amenities really decent. I'd definitely stay there again in the near future.

title: Great location
text:
Agree fantastic location for travel around NY.
Will be nice when the refurbishment complete.
Rooms very nice, modern, clean and serviced each day.
Didn’t like the noise at 4 am when the piles of black bags on the other side of the street were removed. We were on the 4th floor front, so may be best to avoid that.
Staff absolutely fantastic they get 5 stars.
Brendan’s across the road is a great bar and restaurant.

title: Lo recomiendo
text: Estuve alojada en el hotel durante 10 días. La habitación y el baño, muy bien, limpia y espaciosa. El personal del hotel es muy amable. La terraza de arriba, está genial. Es maravilloso cuando llegas de patear la ciudad durante todo el día, ducharte y subirte a la terraza, porque se ve el empire iluminado, y me recordo a las peliculas americanas. La ubicacion genial, casi enfrente del empire state. Quiero volver a Nueva York, y este hotel será mi primera opcion de hospedaje.

title: Well located good hotel
text:
We booked a mini room but were upgraded to a queen so thanks for that!
Hotel is being renovated but it didn’t really cause any inconvenience to us, I am sure it will look beautiful when complete.
Roof top bar has an amazing view of the Empire State Building, though I was disappointed with the value and choice of cocktails being offered.
Rooms were clean and serviced daily.
Good central location, I didn’t like the smelly piles of rubbish out on the street but I guess this is a normality in NY and not a lot the hotel can do about it.
Overall good value for money so would recommend.

title: Super
text: Nous avons séjourné 10jours à l'hotel et il est tres bien situé pour visiter. Les chambres sont tres bien, l'isolation est bonne et une machine à café est disponible dans la chambre. Le personnel est tres sympathique et serviable. Possible de laisser son bagage entre le check out et le depart pour pouvoir profiter des dernières heures sereinement sans bagages. Le restaurant black tap est collé à l'hotel pour déguster des burgers et des milshake délicieux.

title: Feeling NYC spirit
text: Hotel is in the perfect locations. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Even construction works going on, we didn't feel that at all.  And roof top longue.. This is unbelievable. Amazing plrace with great staff, drinks and lovely entertainment. Highly recommended!

title: Lovely despite the construction
text:
A warm welcome. Every single member of staff we encountered was informative and genuine.  We were lucky enough to stay in one of the newly renovated rooms. Spacious and well done, lovely welcome note and compliment water and coke. Off that the only mirror was in the bathroom but that aside a stunning room. 

We were on the 3rd floor and despite the rooftop bar being loud and very busy couldn’t hear a thing. Great location for getting around all of he major NYV attractions. 

Will stay again

title: Moyen
text:
Hôtel au final moyen :
Points positifs : emplacement proche station de métro (1 station de Times Square) - chambre joliment décorée - cafés offerts- roof top avec vue sur empire state building 
Points négatif : en travaux - ascenseurs compliqués car beaucoup d attente - climatisation ou peinture à revoir car nous avions des soucis à la gorge et aux poumons alors que tout allait bien ailleurs - frigo bruyant

title: Emplacement ideal
text:
Bon rapport qualité/prix. L’emplacement est idéal avec une station de metro centrale au bout de la rue ! 
Nous avons été dans une chambre rénovée très agréable. 
Café/thé à disposition. 
Le rooftop avec une vue sur l’empire State building est incroyable :)

title: Recomendable
text: Hotel en excelente ubicación a media cuadra de la 5a avenida, cercano a Metro, tiendas, lugares donde comer. El hotel esta en remodelación en estos días, por lo que hay que adecuarse a ello. Las habitaciones y baño muy buenas y espaciosas. Los puntos negros son los ascensores, uno no funcionaba y el bar del piso 12 que se llena todos los días al atardecer y produce ruido y mucho transito de personas ajenas al hotel, en algunos casos muy borrachas. La gente de la recepción no es muy amable.

title: Money value!
text:
This midtown hotel is not only well located with walking distance to Bryant park, Empire state building, Penn station, Times square, Macy’s, Rockefeller centre(a little longer walk to the latter, but it is the best money I’ve ever spent on a Hotel in NYC. The rooms are fresh, modern and newly renovated, with big comfy beda. You Get a mini fridge - which they don’t stock, but contained several complementary bottles of water and soda. I don’t know, though, if these gifts are standard or a consolation gift, because during my stay there were some inconveniances regarding renovating of the reception area. 
Furthermore, the room has a coffee brewer with tea and coffee that was refilled every day. That’s OK if you want to relax in the room without having to rush out for breakfast the minute you wake up. (Breakfast is not included in the price) There is a food cart a minute’s walk from the entrance - there they sell bagels, coffee and soft drinks. 
The housekeeping does a top notch job job, and all of the hotel straff is very friendly, helpful and sweet. 
There is also a wonderful rooftop deck, and they serve drinks from 4 pm.
The hotel offers free wi-fi.

title: Hotel centrale ma scarso
text:
La posizione dell'hotel è ottima,si raggiungono in pochi minuti time square ed empire state building. 
Le camere non sono come presentate nelle foto del sito:sono in realtà molto più piccole.
Il personale della reception è molto scortese e scontroso( soprattutto la ragazza bionda la quale risponde in modo inappropriato ai clienti). L'hotel è in fase di ristrutturazione, è imbarazzante trovarsi all'ingresso con calcinacci e transenne x incanalare gli ospiti. Di sicuro non tornero'!!!

title: Fantastic independent hotel but serious lift problem
text:
This was my second time staying at Hotel Metro, and some of the previous positives still stand: its location is perfect, the decor is classic and attractive, the rooms are quiet and most of the staff are superb (especially Randy, Lisa and the whole housekeeping team). I had to be moved from my original room due to a broken safe, but staff handled this efficiently.

The hotel no longer offers complimentary breakfasts, but that wasn't too much of a problem as rooms have fridges so you can organise your own; there are also good options locally (including the terrific Andrews Coffee Shop a little further down the street). They're currently renovating the ground floor, but other than a bit of noise and mess during the day this didn't really affect things.

The big frustration this time was the lift problem and the redesign of the roof terrace. One of the 3 lifts was out of order for the whole stay, and the 2 remaining lifts were slow, rather creaky, and sometimes too full of guests, staff, housekeeping trolleys and equipment to get on. When I stayed here last time I was on a low floor so just used the stairs when the lifts broke, but this time there was no access due to the renovations. 

There's now a very energetic rooftop bar open to non-guests, which is a shame as previously this was a lovely space with plenty of seating areas where you could read, relax or actually have a conversation. It was shut for private functions a couple of times during my stay, and on the other times I went there was loud music and so many people it felt like a night-club. I spent a lot of time there last time but unfortunately had to stay away this trip.

The other downside of the new bar is the number of non-hotel guests now using the 2 remaining lifts. It's a bit annoying when you can't get to your own room because you're at the back of a queue of revellers trying to get up to the Look-out. I lost count of the number of times random tipsy people asked me 'so what's the hotel like?' as they headed down from the roof. The lifts could have done without the extra traffic!

I'm very fond of this hotel and its lovely staff, location and style. Unfortunately getting to and from rooms was really frustrating this time, and selling the roof as a party destination for non-guests is a bit off-putting. I'd like to think I'll stay here again, but will probably be checking out nearby hotels too.

title: Small but Excellent
text: Small cozy rooms.  The price is right and the location is fantastic.  Super clean, and very cozy and well done.  There is no reason to not stay here if you are looking for a not so fuuuwwaaancEEy place to stay that will leave your wallet fat.

title: Nice Hotel near Penn Station and Empire State Building
text: This is a nice Hotel with helpful staff.  It is not too far from Penn Station, Empire State Building. Though price is bit on the higher side, convenience outweighs the price.  Soft drinks in the room are complementary including bottled water.

title: Money stolen from hotel safe
text:
We stayed at hotel metro in June as a group in 3 separate rooms. We were happy with our stay until we checked out and got to the airport and realised that money was missing.

We had a substantial amount of US dollars in cash in the safe in 2 rooms (the other safe wasn't working). As we travelled as a group we each took money out each day that I looked after. The rest of the money stayed in the safe. We all knew how much we started with and exactly how much we'd spent. At the airport we looked at how much money we should have left and it was out, for the whole group by $310.

We checked and re-checked, counted and re-counted and we all agreed that unfortunately there was no other explanation, the money must have been stolen from the safe.

When we got home I emailed the hotel explaining what had happened. They emailed straight back saying they take feedback very seriously and asked me to fill out an incident form. I did this and emailed it straight back. One week later I'd heard nothing so send another polite email chasing it up. Still nothing. Another 3 weeks passed with no reply so i emailed saying I was really disappointed no-one had even bothered to reply and I'd be writing a review on TripAdvisor. They emailed me back immediately (funny that!) saying they'd carried out an investigation and found nothing, and gave me the phone number of the local police department.

I realise that we won't get any money back, but I doubt they even looked in to this. We are very disappointed, we loved our first visit to New York but feel very angry and upset that a huge amount of money was stolen from the safe, and the hotel did not even care.

We obviously don't know which staff were responsible for this, but if you have already booked to go there, our advice would be not to leave any cash in the safe as it won't be safe there. If you haven't booked yet, do not stay at hotel metro!

title: Buena ubicación cerca del Empire
text: Estuvimos alojados tres noches en él hotel durante nuestra estancia en New York. Esta justo detrás del Empire State y tiene un bar-terraza en la azotea desde el cual se ve muy bien (recomendable de noche para verlo iluminado). Esta también cerca del Madison, a Times Square se puede ir andando en nada y a la zona del WTC tienes metro justo al lado del la puerta.  La habitación que nos tocó era muy amplia y la cama cómoda,  se descansa bien.  El trato del personal es bueno, sobre todo de los botones que te ayudan con las maletas.

title: Shame about the renovations
text: I stayed in one of the renovated rooms which was nice. I got upgraded from a premier queen to a premier king which was nice. The lobby area was still being renovated which was not great. The lifts were slow and one was not working. On arrival the check-in staff were not the friendliest but all other staff I came across were good. The Black Tap bar next door has good food & beer and friendly staff. Would stay again when the renovations are finished.

title: Everything we needed and more!
text:
We booked Hotel Metro through Virgin Holidays and stayed for 7 nights in February. Check in was quick and easy and we were informed we were upgraded to a king room on the penthouse level! The room was huge and extremely equipped. Everything was very clean and tidy. We had a fridge filled with water and cans of coca-cola and we also had a coffee machine with coffee stocked up daily. 

Me and my partner loved the rooftop where we spent lots of time admiring the empire state building!

The staff in Hotel Metro were very polite and helpful and we couldn't have wished for a better visit. In fact, we are returning in February 2020 and we're so excited!

Thank you for a wonderful holiday, we will see you again soon!

title: Very pleasantly surprised
text: The staff at Hotel Metro are superb. They checked me in slightly early & permitted me a 1pm check out. The room was clean. I read a review before booking that complained the aircon was too loud. It was a little noisy but the alternative is to hear the sirens & other sounds of the city so I didn't consider it a problem. The location is great. I had a really bad cocktail at the bar on the roof but the view was excellent. I was very pleased to see in room recycling for a change. Overall very pleased, very good value.

title: Très bien situé pour visiter new york
text:
Nous sommes arrivés par la gare de pen station , l’hôtel était au bout de la rue .
Qualités des chambres malgré travaux ,très bien , petit dej continental au top très copieux , serveurs disponibles.
Personnel de l’hôtel très courtois et disponible également .
Je réserverai de nouveau si l’occasion se présente .

title: Nice hotel - but renovations going on
text: Stayed here for a few nights in July - firstly location is great, and rooms are nice - recently renovated - a.c needs replacing though - sounded like a tank when on - really loud. The roof top bar is nice but not suitable for families which is a pain for hotel guests with kids as there is no where else to go in the hotel - the lounge on the 2nd floor looks temporary and is more like a doctors waiting room - not comfortable at all and hot - the ongoing renovations make this hard to call this a hotel - there are no facilities really due to the renovation - so if you just want a room - then its ok - but if you want some place to relax in and chill out I think you could probably do better. Staff were all excellent.

title: Great hotel in brillant location
text: This is a very nice hotel in a great location just above the 34th Street/Hearld Square subway station, which makes it so central.  Rooms are very big, comfortable and well equipped so no complaints at all.

title: great location - good value to monet
text: Rooms are not big, but well kept and clean. The staff is nice and friendly. Great location, close to the metro. Walking distance from many sites in midtown. Will go back for sure next time i am in new york

title: Fantastic hotel.
text:
For the 1st time ever I have travelled on my own. This hotel is just the best. I have stayed here before, which is why I came back. It’s in a great location, the staff are lovely, and Michael just can’t do enough. There’s a renovation programme ongoing but you would never know, disruption is minimal and noise level is non existent. 
I will def come back to New York and to this hotel. 
Margaret Bills—19-24/7

title: Functional; good value
text:
Stayed here for a night in transit to catch a morning flight from Newark Liberty International. The Metro is one of several hotels on 35th. It looks newly renovated. 

The hotel is two blocks north of the 34th St Herald Sq subway station. There are many eateries nearby including McDonalds. But I was targeting Five Guys for dinner before catching a musical. 

Check in and check out was fuss free. The room had hard flooring. Size was not bad. Bed was comfortable. Toiletries provided. There was an in room safe but I could not get it to work. Drinks in the minibar were complimentary as well. Nice touch. 

Directions from La Guardia - take the Q70-SBS Airport express bus from the airport to Roosevelt Ave Jackson Heights Subway and change to the F subway line to 34th St Herald Sq. For the Q70-SBS service, you need to get a ticket from one of the vending machines at the bus stop before boarding. It will work with a Metro card, and is free with the connection. You only pay for the subway journey. 

Directions from Newark - take the NJ Transit to Penn Station NY and walk. It is just 200m away.

title: So disappointed
text:
We were returning to this hotel, so wished we hadn’t.

We came to NYC to celebrate my daughters 21st Birthday and booked three room. The celebration was noted on the booking.

From the moment we arrived we were met with the most appalling service I have ever experienced.

The hotel is still undergoing a refurbishment so has a temporary entrance, several members of staff watched us struggle through this on arrival. After a long journey from the U.K. they couldn’t even provide us with some water.  Our rooms were not ready apparently no early check in request had been received, staff were very rude and on reflection this seems to be down to booking rooms with same sex couples. We were all allocated rooms on different floors, which I expressed dissatisfaction with as I wanted to be near my daughters, especially as we are in NYC to celebrate as a family.

They have failed to acknowledge my daughters 21st Birthday despite speaking with them.

We are on our third room due to excessively noisy aircon, how we will  manage with out it as it becomes hotter I have no idea, maybe this should have been a focus when refurbishing. You can also hear the toilet flushing in the other rooms. I travelled to NYC whilst living with incurable cancer, so the need for adequate rest is really important, having tried to explain this to the hotel we were told tough they became fully booked, that week l, we booked some time ago! One room is significantly smaller than the other two despite booking three rooms of the same type.

Each time we have moved room we have had to pack up and take all our luggage down to the lobby, no assistance was offered.

The rooms have no mirror at the desk/dressing table and plug sockets are poorly located.

The heavy drapes have been removed in favour of blinds, these do not block out the light. Windows let all the noise in even when closed.

title: Location, Location, Location !
text:
Hotel Metro may be one of the best secrets in mid-town. Located on 35th Street between 5th & 6th Ave. with a subway stop at the western corner near 6th Ave. Penn Station is an easy walk of maybe 3 blocks total. Keens Steakhouse is one block north and the Empire State Building is one block south. Plenty of bars, restaurants and breakfast joints within one block. You really can't beat the location. 
The hotel just completed the remodel of the adjacent restaurant and they are working on the lobby. The construction may account for the favorable room rates but the construction was NOT a problem in any way. 
The staff was great, including a very efficient doorman. 
The rooms were great and everything worked as it should.
NYC hotels are expensive but Hotel Metro was very competitive in terms of rates. 

We stayed at the Hotel Metro twice in the span of about two weeks, so this review encompasses both nights but the experience was very positive for both rooms. 

I would recommend this hotel to friends.

title: Muy recomendable.
text: El hotel está en obras, están modernizando el lobby. Aún así todo está muy limpio. El personal es encantador. Muy amables, simpáticos y siempre dispuestos a ayudarte. Nos ubicaron sin problemas antes de la hora de ingreso porque ya tenían alguna habitación disponible. Las habitaciones son suficientemente grandes, tienen un buen clóset, escritorio, dos cómodos sillones y cafetera. La cama es muy cómoda y el baño luminoso. En el segundo piso hay un sector con té, café y una computadora. El acceso a wifi es muy bueno. Hay una terraza con hermosas vistas y una confitería que funciona desde la media tarde. La ubicación es excelente. Tiene el subte a media cuadra. Está a la vuelta del Empire State, a metros de la 5th Avenida, a dos cuadras de Macy's y caminando una cuadras más se puede visitar la Biblioteca Pública y la Terminal Central de trenes entre otros atractivos turísticos. En los alrededores hay muchos comercios donde conseguir todo lo que necesites. Buena relación precio calidad. Que más se puede pedir? Si vuelvo a Nueva York no dudo en volver a elejirlo.

title: Unexpectedly perfect
text:
Recommended to stay in this hotel from Virgin Holidays.The hotel restaurant was under refurbishment at the time of our visit which didn't bother us at all so I'm sure it looks lovely now! Staff are extremely friendly and helpful, one provided us with a map of NYC where he highlighted the nearest metro station to us - literally most helpful guide! Our room was soooo modern, beautiful floor boards with comfy bed and v. modern bathroom. We were on the inside of the building ( building is shaped like the letter H). The room was cleaned perfectly every day.
Location is great if you want to escape the hustle and bustle of Times Square but is still every central to mid town. Macys is at the end of the block if you walk out and turn right, as well as the metro station ( 34th street) Yellow taxi cab to and from JFK cost rougly $70 (including tip) Visited for Easter weekend.

title: Céntrico y buen trato
text:
El hotel muy céntrico, limpio y con buena conexiòn a internet.
El trato muy bueno, y si llueve, os dejan en la recepciòn paraguas.
Con cafetera en la habitación, que de agradece.
No pudimos ir a la azotea, ya que estaban en reformas y era una de las cosas más impresionantes, porque se ve todo el Empire. Pero por eso, no voy a dejar de puntuar bien al hotel, ya que se lo merecen. Para repetir sin lugar a dudas.

title: Fantastic
text:
Arrived on June 28th for a double celebration.  My 60th birthday and our 40th wedding anniversary.  Check in was smooth and only took a few minutes.  On arriving in our premiere queen room, the hotel had left a nice bottle of champagne on ice for us, such a nice thought.
The room itself was lovely and had plenty of room and although we were directly opposite the lift, we didn't here any excessive noise. 
The hotel is on a busy street (every street in New York is busy) but again, you don't here any noise when in your room.
There are still some renovations being carried out but they do not affect any part of your stay.  The Black Tap bar should be open by now but we used Brendan's Bar opposite anyway.
Must say a quick thankyou to Stan, Rusa, Karina, Soni, Chris and Randy who always had time to talk and help with anything.  All of the staff were fantastic and you would be hard presses to find a better place to stay in New York.

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for a couple of nights and although there are renovations we weren't bothered by them during our stay. The location is great for Times Square and access to theatres and restaurants and there is a subway stop 1 minute's walk away. Staff are friendly and helpful. No ice machine but they are more than happy to bring some to the room.

title: Unimpressed
text: I walked past this hotel twice before I realised it was the one I was looking for. I had not been told it was under heavy renovation with all of the lobby and bar boarded off. Chose this hotel because if the beautiful lobby area I thought I could meet up with my visitors. No such luck. The roof top bar was closed too because of bad weather. The room was very basic and cramped and all in all it was an underwhelming stay. On check out the next day (I decided to move to Hilton next door) someone mentioned the temporary guest lounge. I had not been advised of this facility but when I went to have a look felt it was not not worth spending any time there as there was just over brewed coffee and hot water,and tea bags. If I had been advised in advance of the renovations and if their website had shown a picture of my actual room I would not have stayed there. The staff were nice enough but unapologetic about the state of the hotel.

title: Best hotel staff ever!
text: My brother and I were in town to bury our mother's ashes.  We were a bit down until we approached the front desk.  We were treated with warmth and kindness, even though the staff didn't know why we were there.  The two women at the desk were so helpful, Karina and Denisse.  Also helpful were Anu, Marcos (wonderful man) Lisa, Linda Davis (special thanks) and all of the wonderful men who helped with our lugguage, ordered taxis for us and delivered our ice!  Housekeeping, as well, deserves kudos.  Only one suggestion:  A light bulb in the closet would be appreciated.

title: Newly Renovated Rooms
text: Hotel Metro is in the heart of midtown Manhattan and you can see the Empire State building from the rooftop which is also a bar at night.  The room was quiet, comfortable (other than the pillows being too firm for me) and the employees were very helpful, professional, and friendly. The hotel is currently being renovated at the entrance and throughout, but everything works well and the room and bathroom was all nicely updated. We had a great stay!

title: Great Hotel
text:
We came to New York for my birthday on 28th March, The Metro Hotel was recommended to us and we are so glad it was, from the moment we arrived the staff were fantastic, yes there were renovations going on but no disruption to us.
Fantastic location, turn right out of the hotel and your right in the mix.
Our room was perfect for our stay.
We are planning another visit next February, and will be staying at the Metro.

title: Excellent hotel
text: We stayed here for two nights following a cruise through the Panama Canal and were made to feel very welcome. The reception desk was friendly and efficient and we were given a penthouse suite on the top floor. There was a rooftop terrace with excellent views of the Empire State Building, which is only five minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was well equipped with a very comfortable bed and a huge bathroom with all amenities. THere was free wifi and a well equipped gym on the top floor with elevator access to the foyer where free coffee was available. The hotel is ideally placed for walking around mid-town and there is easy access to the metro for travelling further afield. We had an excellent time and would certainly stay here again when in Manhattan.

title: Very good!
text:
Consapevoli dei lavori di ristrutturazione in corso, dato che era specificato in diversi siti, eravamo sinceramente un po' indecisi se procedere nel confermare o meno la prenotazione in questo Hotel. 
Dopo aver visionato ottime recensioni, abbiamo pensato che certamente non sarebbero stati i lavori di miglioramento dei propri servizi a rendere negativa l'esperienza in una struttura così ben qualificata. 
Scelta più che azzeccata per il nostro soggiorno a NY. 
I lavori che stanno effettuando si vedono, ovviamente, ma non influiscono in alcun modo con il soggiorno degli Ospiti in struttura. Non si sente nulla, la stanza era silenziosa e ben insonorizzata. 
La camera con letto king (enorme e comodo), era pulita, dotata di ogni comfort e molto spaziosa (dato non così scontato per essere a Manhattan). 
Tutto lo staff, dalla reception, alle signore delle pulizie ai piani e all'ingresso, molto gentili, disponibili e sorridenti. 
La posizione è ottima, a piedi si possono raggiungere tante delle principali attrattive della città o, in alternativa, ci si può spostare con la metropolitana (fermata 34th Herald Sq), situata a 2passi dall'ingresso dell'Hotel. 
Ottimo il rapporto qualità/prezzo. 
Da citare anche la presenza all'ultimo piano, della terrazza panoramica con vista sull'Empire State Building. 
Vista la nostra pregressa esperienza di viaggi all'estero ed esperienza nel settore alberghiero, la struttura è assolutamente consigliata, very good. 
In caso di ritorno a NY, alloggiare nuovamente all'hotel Metro verrà sicuramente preso in considerazione.

title: Emplacement idéal
text:
Nous avons séjourné 1 semaine à l’Hotel Métro et nous avons été satisfaits de notre séjour là bas. 

L’hôtel était en travaux mais nous n’avons pas été dérangé par ça. 

Les chambres sont petits mais espace suffisant pour le séjour à NY. Elles sont propres et la literie est très bien. 

Le personnel est très aimable et serviable. 

Le bar qui se trouve sur la terrasse de l’immeuble est génial car on a vue sur l’Empire State Building mais les prix sont exorbitants : 4 verres et un pot de popcorn 70$ ( hors tips). Je trouve qu’on aurait pu bénéficier d’une ristourne puisque nous étions résidents de l’hôtel. 

Comme je le disais, l’hôtel est très bien situé car vous avez un arrêt de métro juste en bas et une rue complète de magasin ! 
Pour le petit dej, je vous conseille d’aller chez Toast, qui se trouve à deux min à pieds de l’hôtel ! 

Bon séjour :-)

title: Fantastic hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate my 30th Birthday. On arrival we found out we had been upgraded to a premier king room, once in the room we were greeted by a bottle of champagne on ice! We had a fantastic room which was well equipped with everything you need include complimentary cans of pop in the fridge. All the staff were welcoming and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Rooftop bar is really nice and provides a great view of the Empire State Building. We would definetly stay here again. :-)

title: Fin du séjour désastreux.
text:
Certes la chambre est petite, mais l'hôtel plutôt bien situé. Il y a pas mal de travaux donc le lobby ressemble a pas grand chose...Notre séjour nous a plu dans cet hôtel. 
Le jour de notre départ, le bagagiste nous demande s'il doit réserver un taxi ; il avait l'aire de très bien connaître le taxi dans lequel nous sommes montés. Le taxi a prétexté que son appareil pour régler la course était défectueux, il en a utilisé un autre. Nous avons été débité du double de la course pour aller à l'aéroport...

title: Great location
text: Stayed three nights in this hotel, there were renovations going on but I heard no noise or felt any disruption. I would definitely stay here again, the location is great, close to Penn station, an easy walk to Times Square and in the next street to the Empire State Building (great view from the rooftop bar). Our room was fab - comfortable & plenty large enough with two double beds, We had a fridge stocked with complimentary drinks, coffee maker stocked daily with coffee, great bathroom with a rain shower, fresh towels daily, complimentary toiletries and a bottle of  birthday fizz (which we didn't expect, but was hugely appreciated) waiting for us. Friendly and courteous staff, no restaurant here at the time of our stay as it was under renovation but that wasn't a problem. Its a great place to stay in NYC!

title: Great location
text: We loved our stay here, although there was renovations going on we did not hear any noise. The rooms very small, but that is expected in a city hotel, modern, clean, well equipped. Beds were very comfortable,We slept very well espically to to be in a busy city. Staff very very pleasant & helpful. Great location, very central, subway at end of street. Would definitely return.

title: City break
text:
Booked this hotel through a deal with Virgin Atlantic and was not disappointed. 

We stayed in a queen room which was small but well kept with a fridge, coffee maker and a TV. The room was cleaned and coffee restocked every day and new towels provided. 

The hotel is being renovated but no noise/workmen disturbed our stay. 

The staff were friendly and attentive, and whilst the rooftop bar was busy on the night we went it was a great view of the Empire State Building. 

Very close to the main attractions of New York and the subway system. 

Would book again but maybe a bigger room!

title: Well Pleased
text:
We understand at the time of booking there were renovations being done to the property, with that being said we expected to see some of those things taken place. The staff was VERY helpful , courteous and friendly. The Room was nice and clean and had everything they told us .. We were not disturbed during the night or anything like we have experienced in the past at some other places, the wifi was great, cell service was great., and Great Working AC .

The view from the roof is amazing at night looking at the Empire State Building . We were pleased with the Trip in every way . The location was within a short walking distance to the subway which I would recommend as means of travel. Its much cheaper. The entrance  didn't look like a 5 star as someone mentioned before but it was a temp entrance . The location was perfect for us. Our first trip to NYC . You can walk to so many things or use the transit subway. We will be booking with them when we return Next year for Vacation !!

title: Excellent stay
text: Stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights in June .Found it to be very comfortable, very clean and in an excellent position to get around the City. The staff were very friendly, helpful and provided an efficient service. When we arrived in the afternoon our room wasn’t quite ready so the staff guided us to a rest room on the 2nd floor where we could sit and have tea/ coffee at no charge. The ‘Look out’ bar on the roof top is very good and a place to chill with a beer/wine/ cocktail after a hectic sight seeing day. Would have no hesitation in staying here on another visit to the City and would recommend.

title: Not what we were expecting
text: We were aware of the ongoing renovations when booking this hotel but where not prepared to arrive into a temporary reception which felt like going into a black hole with a welcome to match.  Had booked a premier queen room which on entering made us feel even worse.  Although the room was a newly renovated room it was so small and very dark with hardly any natural light it was not a nice place to be.  On going back down to reception to check we had been given the correct room we found ourselves behind another couple who I guess were in the same sort of room as they had the same complaints.  Our room did in no way match the description or pictures on their web site which is what we advised reception,  there were not interested in the slightest and we were brushed of with ‘our website has now been updated’ I have just checked and it’s still not updated.  We decided this would not spoil our stay in NY and got on with our day.  On returning to the hotel after our day out going back to the room we immediately felt the gloom so went back to reception and requested an upgrade and paid extra to move to a Premier King room,  there was absolutely no comparison between the two rooms , the Premier King we got was at least three times the size of the queen room we had and had much better light and we were very happy with this room.  Apart from the room the only other part of the hotel available due to the renovations was the roof top bar which appears not to be run by the hotel so if there is a private function hotel guests have no access to it, and outside guests have priority,  anyway although a lovely area it is badly run and very expensive. The doorman were very friendly.

title: Going to be great but ....
text:
This hotel is going to be great but is currently going through extensive renovations so we didn’t have access to the lobby or restaurant. To be fair we didn’t hear any noise from the renovation work. 

Be careful of selecting a room on the penthouse level though . The hotel has opened an awesome rooftop bar. We were shattered each day but couldn’t get any sleep before midnight due to the noise from the rooftop bar and we are not sure why but constant slamming of doors in the penthouse area. 

That all being said we had a great time. The location is very good and every member of staff we dealt with were exceptional. 

It is going to be a great hotel when completed.

title: WILL improve
text:
I'll begin this review by stating that most of the issues we encountered were the result of the ongoing renovations taking place at the hotel.
