In short: no exercise room (end of June was the expected date when we visited): no restaurant: lifts at times difficult to access: noise, dust - all things you expect but unwelcome all the same.
Most of the staff we met were absolutely lovely but some were stressed by the ongoing work and inconvenience and it showed. One in particular was downright rude and I wondered why she was in the hospitality industry at all. So on this visit I can't give this hotel more than an average review.
To end on a more positive note it is clear that the renovations are of a very high standard and when completed Hotel Metro will I'm sure be worthy of a 5 star review. It's in a perfect location and the amenities will match this very soon.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Absolutely fantastic hotel. Excellently located and amazing staff. 
Couldn’t fault the hotel itself however when checking out we were advised there was a room we could shower later that day before traveling home. There is no shower / courtesy room of any kind. It was a disabled toilet on the top floor we had to freshen up in. This is the only reason I have a 4 and not a 5 star.

title: non ci torneremo
text:
sono più' di 10 anni che veniamo al metro, ma questa e' stata l'ultima volta. Che caduta! I servizi offerti sono molto scarsi da quando stanno ristrutturando. non offrono più la colazione, non c'e' più' un lobby dove accomodarsi, ne tantomeno una poltrona dove poter aspettare in tranquillità'. Peccato che i prezzi siano rimasti uguali a quando questi servizi c'erano.
La posizione e' sempre ottima, ma questo e' l'unico pregio dell'albergo. Il personale non e' gentile, il bagno della lobby lo tengono chiuso a chiave. Quando ho chiesto di usarlo mi hanno detto di aspettare la persona che aveva preso la chiave. Dopo 10 minuti di attesa mi hanno detto di andare a cercare la persona !!!
Le stanze sono rifatte, ma non hanno uno specchio intero per controllare la mise prima di uscire, per vederti, devi saltare su e giu' nello specchio del bagno. Il riscaldamento non e' utilizzabile, e' talmente rumoroso che non riuscivo a sentire la persona affianco a me nel letto !
Cercate di meglio.

title: fabulous 13th birthday trip
text: The hotel was currently being renovated during my stay, but the hotel is in a fab location, the neighbourhood is safe and has direct subway access the end of the street. The staff were lovely and even gave my daughter a card and some chocolates for her birthday. We had a room upgrade for free too and the showers are fantastic. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone its just great.

title: Cute hotel undergoing extensive renovation
text: The location of Hotel Metro is one block from Herald Square, the lobby staff are fantastic, and the cleaning staff are simply superb. Our rooms (2) were booked for 6 nights and were attractive and fresh. The rates suggested good value when we booked the rooms, the rooftop terrace has a nice bar and a fantastic view of the Empire State Building, and clearly there is plenty to love. When we booked our room we knew of the renovation of the rooms being done one floor at a time - however at that time there was no mention on the website or on the phone about the lobby being a wreck, or the restaurant being gone, or that our two identically priced rooms were of completely different size. Or, that the showers were unbelievably slow to drain, the AC twitchy, and that we'd have to phone in a handful of bath issues in one of the rooms that should have been noticed by staff beforehand. I should mention in all fairness that the breadth of renovations are now disclosed on the website.

title: Fantastic
text: 3rd time to nyc and this hotel ::cannot fault it at all ,,ticks all the boxes and will be staying there again,really close to all the places you want to be, the staff and cleaners are second to none, cannot recommend this hotel more highly

title: Localização ótima
text: Excelente localização, muito fácil se deslocar para qualquer ponto de ny pois p metro fica a menos de uma quadra. Limpeza acima da média e bastante confortável. As únicas reclamações são que na reserva havia café da manhã (e na prática não tinha) e o staff da recepção da manhã que era bastante antipatico.

title: Fabulous!
text:
Can't fault it...
The room has just been refurbed
Everything brand new
So exceptionally clean
Room made up every day as we arrived back pretty much exhausted, so that was a real positive!
To say it's a busy area, it's so quiet, great nights sleep
Huge comfortable bed
Great air con
4th stay in New York and The Metro did not dissapoint 😊

title: Perfect for short stay
text: Excellent customer care, even though the hotel was in the midst of building work. Very clean and comfortable room with everything we needed. Hotel in perfect location for central New York and right next to Herald Square and Gordon Bennett's clock!  All staff were very friendly and helpful

title: Superb!
text: What a lovely hotel even though it is currently being renovated. We were upgraded to a beautiful room, the renovations are not heard at all, New York is so noisy anyway!  The rooms are a fab size, and to have a coffee machine in every room alongside a tea/coffee lounge was a life saver. The staff are always friendly. It’s in a great place, the rooftop bar is lovely and what a view of the Empire State Building. Our room was cleaned every day including new bedding and towels every single day. It was lovely to get back to such a clean fresh room after sightseeing. My only tiny weeny criticism would be the windows - my personal preference in a city is for blackout curtains, they have smart wooden blinds which look lovely in the decor of the room, but I am one of those people who waken with the smallest chink of light. Anyway, the bed was superb, so I had no problem waking early, it was pleasant to lounge in bed watching the tv, and New York never sleeps anyway!

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: I stayed here from May 17 until 20. The location is so convenient and feels safe. There is always people wondering around, and lots of restaurants. I rolled my suitcase to Penn Station. The staff at the hotel were friendly. Especially the bellhop. The people at the desk, not so much. The room also comes with complimentary water and pop. Good channels on the tv and very comfortable. My room was on the 12th floor. Every night it was loud at night. I think people from the bar at the penthouse were coming down? One night there was a lot of door slamming. I understand the sirens from outside, but I could hear people at the stairwell. Also my room was in front of the elevator. Overall, I did enjoy my stay and the room. The noise is the only thing but it was from other guests. The air conditioner is also pretty loud but I turned that off at night.

title: Perfect break during Manhattan trip
text: Great hotel in an excellent location, the front desk and the doorman were very helpful and did everything for us to improve our staying. The bed is super comfortable, and it was a great break after a long day of traveling in Manhattan.

title: Good location
text:
The hotel is well located around the corner from Macy's and near various cafes where breakfast is available (the hotel restaurant is currently being refurbished).  The staff on reception were helpful but not altogether friendly (typical of many in NYC) whilst other members of staff were more forthcoming.  Our Premier Queen room was sufficient for our stay; comfortable bed, safe and excellent coffee machine.  There was some noise from what we assumed was the air-con unit outside and the fridge inside the room, but not enough to interrupt sleeping.

We were keen to go to the rooftop bar opening night which we tried to access via the lift, however a member of staff politely guided us through another route.  On entering the bar, we heard another member of staff questioning why we had been let in, which made us - as hotel guests - feel like second-class citizens, especially as there was plenty of room at that point.  The rooftop bar provided excellent views of the Empire State Building and we ended up staying a lot longer than planned.  The staff in the bar seemed badly organised and there were a few errors, which were quickly rectified.

Overall, we would recommend the Metro Hotel.

title: Beautiful!!
text:
Hotel stupendo e centralissimo! Persoanle attento, cordiale e sempre disponibile! Abbiamo soggiornato qui 7 notte durante le vacanze di Pasqua. Ci siamo trovati benissimo..come a casa! Camere spaziose e pulite regolarmente ogni giorno, con frigo comodo per bevande e altro! Nella camera c'è una comodissima macchina per il caffè con cialde , zucchero e latte. Bagno comodo e efficente. La posizione è ottima e ti permette di organizzare il tuo viaggio e i tuoi spostamenti al meglio ottimizzando i tempi. Abbiamo chiesto di poter lasciiare i bagagli alla reception dopo il check-out per qualche altra ora e.. nessun problema!!
Grazie di tutto! una bellissima esperienza!

title: 4 night break
text: Great hotel in super location in midtown. Hotel was being refurbished but this did not adversely impact on enjoyment.  I had a super room on 10th floor which was very large for NY standards, spotlessly clean and I felt safe staying there on my own. I look forward to returning there when the renovations have completed - great staff on reception and kept bag safe on last day while waiting for airport transfer

title: Central Location in Midtown
text: We got a great deal on this place for a single-night stay (Sunday), and given its location in midtown, we couldn't pass up on it. The hotel itself was pretty simple, in that there was no breakfast, no extra amenities, but our room (a king suite, upgraded for free from a queen room) was quite spacious and very clean. As it turns out, our room provided an unbeatable view of the nearby Empire State Building. We took advantage of their left luggage service for both check-in and check-out. Note, the hotel as of May was undergoing extensive renovations, so it may be different in the near future.

title: This hotel was perfect for our visit to NYC
text:
He actually visited in July 2017 but couldn’t change the setting above.

The hotel is clean, quiet, staff are very friendly, food is amazing and ideally situated.

My husband booked this holiday to propose to me. He had told staff before we arrived. They were so accommodated and upgraded our room.

The roof top view of the Empire State Building is breathtaking and was so special for my engagement.

Breakfast is gorgeous and there is a wide variety of food. We made the most of this

The room was very clean. Couldn’t fault it.

I couldn’t complain about anything and this hotel made our visit to New York very special and one we will never forget.

title: Good deal in a central location
text:
I was able to get a good value on my room at this very well located (Herald Square) hotel. King bed is not always easy to find in NYC. Friendly service and conveniences nearby including restaurants, subway and pharmacies.

There is no area to sit at the main registration/entrance; you have to walk up to the second floor, but not really a big deal. Some street noise from the 4th floor could be heard early morning (after 7am). I may have been able to get a better deal than usual.

title: Pleasant stay in Midtown!
text: Had a pleasant stay in Hotel Metro for 2 nights. Staff were polite and welcoming, and location was fantastic. Room was well-proportioned and clean as well. The only minus would be the slow lift (waited nearly 5 min for one lift). Would recommend a stay there!

title: Good location and pleasant staff.
text: We stayed at the Hotel Metro as a part of a British Airways package, so the choice was not ours. However, the Metro is in a great midtown location, just one block from the Empire State Building, with very pleasant reception staff. The room was comfortable and roomy, and the bed provided a good four night's sleep. I would like to have rated the hotel four stars but no public rooms, such as a restaurant, were available because of on-going redecoration.

title: Updated Hotel, Friendly Staff
text: Great hotel within walking distance to many major attractions in NYC. Staff is very friendly and attentive to needs of all guests. The hotel is currently experiencing renovations, but it didn’t detract from the stay at all, you wouldn’t have known they were happening. Rooms are comfortable, and nicely updated. Bathrooms are very nice with waterfall shower heads. The rooms are small, but this is to be expected in NYC. Would certainly stay again.

title: Emplacement idéale pour la visite
text: Petit hôtel proche de tout. Macy's et l'Empire State Building se trouve sur la Street à côté. Chambre très comfortable, bonne literie. J'ai séjourné à 2 reprises dans cet hôtel et toujours très bien (Sept. 2015 & nov. 2018). Personnel très sympa.

title: Great!
text: Just got back from our NYC trip and have to give Hotel Metro a great review.  We spent 4 nights there and found the staff and facilities to be excellent!  They were friendly and professional in all their interactions with us.  When the desk agent asked if we were ever in NYC before I mentioned that we had been there 20 yrs ago for our 25th wedding anniversary and now we were back for our 45th.   What a pleasant surprise to find a chilled bottle of champagne in our room the next night!  Highly recommend the Hotel Metro!

title: Super hotel
text: Net terug van een weekje New York. We verbleven in Hotel Metro. Echt super hotel met heerlijke bedden. Bij aankomst was de koelkast gevuld met welkom drankjes en op de kamer is een koffiezet apparaat waar je thee en koffie in kan zetten. Verder een heerlijke grote douche en mooie schone kamers. Afstand tot Penn station is maar 8 minuten lopen. Hotel ligt mooi centraal. Medewerkers ook erg vriendelijk. Als we weer naar New York gaan dan zeker weer naar Hotel Metro.

title: Great location, great hotel
text:
I booked this hotel for my husbands birthday for 4 nights. Check in was easy and straightforward. Was upgraded to one of the new refurbished rooms and had complimentary soft drinks and chocolates. Room was spotless and beds were very comfortable. Hotel was in a fantastic location and easy access to subway and lots of attractions. Reception staff were great, helped us with information on the subway and gave us extra hour in our room as we weren’t being picked up until later in the day. We were then able to wait in the guest lounge with complementary tea and coffee until we were picked up.
One thing that could be improved were the lifts, quite slow and small. Even though there was building work going on, it was only in daytime hours and didn’t notice it much. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great stay.

title: Perfect Location
text:
My partner booked this hotel for our 5 night stay in NYC! The hotel is easily accessible, super close to Macy's and just one street away from the Empire State. The hotel itself has a roof top bar with the best view in the city! 
Rooms are spacious, lovely and clean, just perfect! The staff are all friendly and helpful the doorman especially who will take care of your cases on your final day until you need to go to the airport. We would stay here again on our next stay and recommend to family and friends visiting the city.

title: Lovely hotel - perfect location
text: This hotel is in a perfect location for some of the major sites. Times Square, Empire State Building are close by. Very nice clean rooms, comfy beds and friendly hotel staff. There is also a fab Irish bar on the same street that we frequented!

title: Great Hotel for good price
text:
Room was very big, upgrated, bath and shower place is clean, every day room was cleaned by personal. Now hotel is renovating and it will be nice rooms. 
Perfect location in midtown, close to metro station and PennStation.

title: Fab time in NYC
text:
This hotel was in a perfect location in midtown. Stones throw from rockerfella, herald square and Times Square. On arrival we were greeted but a friendly Gentleman on the door and another on the front desk. We were then also told we had been upgraded which was great as I was celebrating my birthday. The room was perfect. We had a refurbished room which was small but adequate. After all we only slept and showered here. Being the middle of winter the hotel was lovely and warm too. Roof top terrace is an extra bonus with beautiful views of the Empire State Building. 
Now we were unaware that we could get breakfast from nearby Toast included in our stay and unfortunately this was our fault as I only realised we had breakfast included until we got home. 
Tea/coffee and coffee machine in the room is a great little extra also. All In all I would highly recommend this hotel. Perfect location and pleasant staff which made our stay even more enjoyable. 
Thank you hotel metro

title: New York trip
text:
Had very comfortable stay here for for nights.Fantastic location ! 
On arrival we had lovely bottle of wine in our room due to trip being for my husbands 60 the birthday.The room was very comfortable  and we loved the huge double shower in the en suite.We appreciated the fluffy towels which were replaced each day.
Found the pillows a bit too high but that is just a personal preference.Could have done with a mirror in the room itself - there was only one in the bathroom.
Staff were polite and helpful, especially the lovely doorman .Would have liked  use of bar/ lounge facilities but fully understand  that hotel is currently  undergoing  a renovation at the moment.
Would be happy  to use this hotel for any future visits.

title: Appalling - Avoid. Worst hotel I have been to in the US this century.
text:
Air conditioning not working properly so you have a choice of baking or running a very noisy motor that keeps you awake. 

Mattress should have been replaced years ago as should the pillows.

Lots of electrical points, but nowhere near the desk. So anything being recharged needs to be left on the floor. 

Desk chair broken and TV not tuned to most of the channels listed.

Noticeable amounts of wallpaper peeling in common areas.

On the plus side well located.

There is a renovation going on, but until it is well finished this place should be avoided.

Overall impression is standards are so low a lick of paint is not going to hack it.

title: Ideal location, comfortable room
text:
Spent 4 nights here, and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a centrally-located, comfortable base . Two minutes walk to Herald Square/6th Avenue junction and Subway station, which is on the Yellow line that goes all the way Downtown. Easy walking distance to Times Square/theatres, Penn Station/ Madison Square Garden, 15-20 minutes to Rockefeller Centre.

As for the Hotel - only 4 starts for service - most staff lovely (the young man on the door was an absolute star and the housekeeping ladies were great also) but sadly we were not told on arrival about the free tea/coffee "lounge" on the second floor, only discovering it on our last day when a fellow guest mentioned it. Many previous reviews mention the offer of breakfast vouchers as their facilities are closed for refurb - however when i asked about this - I was met with  a very curt "we used to do that but don't anymore". 

Room was very comfortable, lovely big ensuite with double walk-in shower, firm bed, wardrobe, TV, fridge and safe.

If breakfasting out - both Brendans directly opposite (beautiful venue) and Andrews on the corner of 35th and 7th (good old fashioned neighbourhood diner, 3 minutes walk) were fantastic, 35-40 USD for two but enough to keep you going all day!

title: Second stay at this great location
text: Whilst improvements were going on at this hotel (breakfast area, ground floor bar and rooftop terrace were closed for refurbishment) - it in no way diminished our experience. Both our rooms were upgraded to (newly redecorated) queen rooms (which have not been photographed for the website yet) - these were great, with airy modern decor and wooden flooring (no more dark carpets or wallpaper) - although curiously only one desk chair in our room, despite there being ample room available for an armchair. I think they were down on capacity while certain rooms are still being renovated (there was some banging one morning) and the lobby was screened off on the last two days (free coffee/tea were relocated to a 1st floor room). As per our previous visit (March 2015) reception, concierge and service staff were all friendly and knowledgeable, which more than made-up for the works taking place. As always, the location cannot be beat - just look on google maps.

title: Pleasant and great location
text: Stayed between 24th and 29th March. Great location, very polite and pleasant staff, left us a bottle of wine and chocolate because it was my birthday and our anniversary. Room clean, bathroom clean. Pleasant stay overall. No noise factors. Walking distance to everything. Macy’s, subway, Empire State  and much more literally next door. Complaints mainly around the fact we are teetotallers and I asked if they could swap wine for something else but given the cold shoulder so was a little miffed as the gesture was wasted as I left the wine in the end as it was no use to me. Also tea/coffee facilities are wasted also because they expect you to buy the water from them. So we declined and bought from shop nearby. Not a great advert for them but as I hinted a great location and pleasant location if you are going to be out all day.

title: Unlucky with the timing of our visit...
text:
We had a 4 night stay at the Metro in March 2019. The location is fantastic - you are a stone's throw from the Herald Square Metro Station, Macy's and numerous shops and restaurants. The staff were all super friendly and approachable. Unfortunately though there appears to be a serious amount of renovation going on right now. Some floors are totally gutted, and the lobby was almost always full of building materials going up or down in the lift. Very courteous and friendly builders though! With the bar totally shut for the duration of our visit there was nowhere on site to wind down with a glass of wine which was a shame. Due to it being March the rooftop terrace was also shut which was unlucky for us. There was morning "serve yourself" coffee some mornings - and on some days not at all as there was too much building "stuff" in the lobby. 

The room itself was of a good size, clean and well kept. I would stay again simply for the location and would most likely up this score to a 7 or 8 out of 10 if it didnt feel like a building site on my next visit :-/

title: A Great Hotel in every way
text:
We first stayed at this hotel in 2007. Returned for a stay at the end of Feb, so pleased to say that it was probably better than we remembered.We had the end room on floor 11 and had great views of the empire state, it was huge and even though this floor is still to be renovated it was in great clean condition.
A superb location, 2 mins to Maceys and the subway, a street away from the empire state with some awesome views from the top of the hotel despite the cold and snow. Only 15 mins walk to Rockefeller plaza and times sq.
Staff were great and friendly, providing maps for the subway and walking around, happy to order taxis and make recommendations.
Coffee available in the lobby was always hot and nice to grab and go. The restaurant was shut when we stayed but we had breakfast in the room from walgreens everyday so saved ourselves money for shopping !
I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a stay in New York

title: Magnificent Metro
text:
We returned from New York just about a week ago, after another stay in the truly magnificent Metro!
When we arrived we were greeted by Lloyd the doorman and Stan and Karina on the reception desk. They were full of smiles and so friendly, showing an interest in our journey. We went to our room and were amazed, shocked, surprised and thrilled to find we had been upgraded to a suite! We had also been left a bottle of champagne and chocolates and a birthday card for me. I was celebrating a “big” birthday. This was my sixth visit to the hotel and my husbands fifth. 
Our rooms were cleaned to perfection every day by our lovely maid whose name unfortunately I never learned. Towels were changed, toiletries replenished and everywhere was spick and span. ( hope Americans understand that colloquialism)
The breakfast room and restaurant is being refurbished but there is still complimentary tea and coffee in the reception area. We heard no noise whatsoever from the building work. We occasionally met a work man in the lift and like everyone at the Metro they were very friendly. ALL the staff we encountered were unfailingly polite and friendly and happy to help in any way. It was so lovely coming back every evening after a hard day’s shopping or sight seeing to lovely smiley faces. We unreservedly recommend the Hotel Metro to anybody coming to New York. Apart from the joys of the hotel itself it is literally a hop,skip and jump from Macy’s and there is a subway station with connections to all lines about 200 yards away. There are also plenty of good quality eateries close by. 

Thank you to everybody at the Metro for making our stay Magnificent!

title: Great place, great location
text: While the hotel itself didn’t have a lot of amenities (restaurant, room service, etc.), the location made all of that irrelevant. There were stores down the street and restaurants you could walk to or that could deliver to you. The room was clean and comfortable. There was a subway station at the end of the block. The noise level was quite manageable on the 5th floor. Our only complaint was that it took about 15 minutes to get hot water on the first two days. By the third day it only took 2 minutes or so. It was a great experience and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay
text: This hotel is the perfect place to visit New York just off broadway next door to Macy’s five mins to Times Square lots of coffee shops bars and restaurants and fast food places. Subway station just outside. The staff were spot on nothing was a problem. The room had just been renovated and it was to a very high standard it was fantastic if you are planning a trip you will not be disappointed if you stay here

title: Nice surprise
text: Usually one to make all the plans, I let my friend book our hotel this time. The Hotel Metro is a win and I’m now giving up control! The rooms are newly...and poshly decorated with a modern sophisticated vibe. The mattresses are perfect. The room is large by NYC standards and I stay here frequently. The location at 35th and  5th is convenient to Grand Central, Madison Square Garden, Macy’s and a subway stop is on the corner. Many great restaurants like Trademark ad the Rooftop Refinery are within a couple of blocks. The incredible bonus was an early check in! Great hotel, rooms and staff.

title: Would happily stay here again (not for light sleepers though!)...
text:
Stayed at the Metro Hotel in the beginning of March 2019 for 4 nights. Generally, a good experience and if I find myself back in NY I will happily stay here again. 

Upon arrival the receptionist checked us in, very quickly and efficiently and gave us some general points, like complementary drinks we will find in our room, where the safe is, coffee facilities 24/7 in the reception area and so on. 

The hotel, I believe has 12 floors and our room was on the 10th floor. The hotel is still undergoing a massive refurbishment, however there was absolutely no noise of that at any point during our stay. We also noticed that although the rooms next to us on both sides were occupied we could not hear the occupants or their television in the evening, which for us was a really positive point.  Having said that though, although on the 10th floor the traffic noise unfortunately is very present and on a 24 hour basis. I didn’t mind it at all, however my partner found it very difficult to sleep uninterrupted and found himself awake quite a few times throughout the night due the traffic/sirens noise.  I will be completely honest and definitely not recommend this hotel if you want a quiet night’s sleep. In the hotel’s defence though, they are refurbishing so if the windows are changed, it will hopefully improve the outside noise situation. 

The room (and bathroom) was very neat and clean with the right amount of furniture and a very comfortable bed, beddings and pillows. However we did noticed that the room and bathroom were also very tired but again this will probably change once the refit is finished. Housekeeping did a brilliant job with keeping the room clean and tidy whilst there and although we were happy to use our towels more than once (so left them hanging on the hooks rather that leaving them on the floor) they provided us with clean, fluffy towels the entire time we were there. Only complaint is the temperature of the room, which we found to be too hot and when attempted to turn the heating down it would just default back to the set temperature. At the end we decided to just turn off the heating which dropped the temperature to a comfortable level. 

The hotel’s location is ideal in midtown Manhattan (Koreatown to be precise); there is a list of things to see/visit in walking distance ranging from 2 mins walk to one hour and 10 mins if you are brave enough to walk all the way down to lower Manhattan and Ground Zero. Also, it has a lot of amenities and places to eat in the area around it and as a bonus if you are lucky your room window will face the Empire State Building which is literally on the next block over. There is a subway station pretty much outside the hotel (100m on your right when exiting the hotel) and loads of cabs once you hit the avenues either on the left or right side of the hotel).

There is currently no offer of breakfast at the hotel due to the refit so cannot comment on that.

All in all a very enjoyable stay, a nice hotel that will happily book again and efficient, and in the majority, very friendly staff.

title: Lovely hotel, perfect weekend!
text:
Perfect central location, few minutes walk to Times Square. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the newly renovated rooms which was lovely, done to a high standard. Renovation works continued upstairs throughout our stay but we had no disruptions as this took part during the day whilst we were out and about! 
Really clean room & bed very comfy, the pillows were way to thick for me but that's down to personal preference. 
Only suggestions I'd have for the hotel is perhaps to offer an option for towels not to be replaced every day if not necessary (I like to try and be environmentally friendly where possible!) And also switch from plastic to wooden coffee stirrers in the room...
Overall a great hotel with friendly & helpful staff.

title: Disappointing
text:
Having read previous reviews, we wondered if we had come to the right hotel. 
Staff apart from the Doormen where indifferent and seemed have lost the art of conversation. We cancelled a previous hotel to come to this one......room was clean and was adequate comfy bed, 
No restaurant facilities or any chance of seeing the Empire State Building due to renovations in both areas. When booking this hotel we were not told of the work being carried out in the premises otherwise we would not have booked.
So I Need to speak to my agent on this count.
Over all this has been a disappointing experience, I hoped for so much and can’t quite get my head around the glowing reviews this place is getting 
Regrettably 
Me.

title: Mr Staerck
text:
Stayed at this hotel just arrived back the rooms are very modern and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Their are some work being carried out but you would never know, as the hotel is kept very clean and you can never hear any thing. Location is great central for everything. Including metro restaurants time square etc.

We will definitely be returning to this hotel for future trips.

title: Return Visit
text: Return visit to Hotel Metro even though the hotel is still undergoing refurbishment it’s still a great place to stay. Check in was quick and efficient and welcome was warm.  We were allocated one of the refurbed rooms and have to say they have done a good job. The bed was very comfortable and lovely white linen. Shower very good forgot my shower gel and was surprised not to find any. Coffee machine in room was also very good and there was tea also. The breakfast room was closed but vouchers given for deli round corner called toast. One problem was that the voucher is for bagel/croissant tea/coffee but as I am gluten free I asked if I could swap for fruit or yoghurt but was told no. So every morning I had to pay for my breakfast. On giving feedback to the hotel they apologised and said I wasn’t the first to say this. In that case then why couldn’t they arrange something with the deli and write on my voucher GF. All in all wouldn’t put me off staying again as the hotel is in a great position.

title: Near everything
text:
Large room, clean but very dated and rough round the edges, bed lovely and soft, had drinks water/coke in fridge only first day, would have been nice having water each day for the price. 
Staff all friendly and helpful. Would recommend.

title: Superb
text: Location, location, location! Brilliantly situated close to The Empire State Building,  Macy's , subway station. Times Square etc this hotel is a real gem. Beautiful Art Deco architecture, spotlessly clean , friendly, helpful staff this hotel could not be bettered for a visit to see all the main attractions of New York. Amazing value for money too and a huge selection of places to eat within easy walking distance of the hotel.

title: Great location
text: The hotel Metro is in a great location and is a 2 minute walk to Macys. Great roof top bar for awsome photos of the ESB. Located between 5th and 6th. You have a Duane Reade shop at the 5th avenue side for all you drinks and snacks. Subway station at the end of the street.  Hotel does breakfast included which was good. The room i had was on the small side but i wasnt in New York to stay in a room. Cleaned everyday and was fresh. I would stay here again no problem.

title: Metro for Me !
text: We had an Upgraded king room, which was very spacious,warm and nice., Good maid service every day, Safe, Fridge, hairdryer ,iron and coffee machine in room. The bar and roof terrace where under renovation but there was Free coffee and tea constantly available in the foyer, The hotel is in a good location as in only 5mins walk from time square. There's Irish pub and Thai restaurant either side of the hotel..

title: Très bien situé
text: Hôtel idéalement situé sur Manhattan dans le cœur de Midtown. Bouche de métro desservant plusieurs lignes. Idéal point de  départ.Chambre très confortable, bonne dimension.  La terrasse au dernier étage avec vue sur l’empire  state building est à couper le souffle.

title: 5 day visit to New York
text:
This was our second visit to New York, this time just as a couple. On our first visit we stayed in one of the larger hotels due to the renovation work that was being undertaken at the Hotel Metro.

The work was still on going during our trip in February with the restaurant being out of service and work still being carried out on some of the floors, however, the work did not impact at all on our stay and there are plenty of restaurants, cafes and other eateries nearby, the location of this hotel is great. 

We did have to request a room move, originally we were allocated a room on the front of the building, but not being city folk, the street noise was just too much, however, we were given an internal room towards the back of the hotel, with no fuss, which was much quieter, bear this in mind if you prefer a quiet night.  

The staff were lovely and friendly and very helpful, would definitely stay at this hotel again if ever in New York, a lot more personable hotel due to its smaller size.

The view of the Empire State building from the terrace is brill.

Would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: Emplacement idéal pour visiter !
text:
L'hôtel Metro est idéalement situé (derrière l'Empire State et à 10 min à pied de Times Square) pour visiter la ville sur quelques jours, le Macy's et surtout un Shake Shack juste à côté :) Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits, dans une chambre rénovée, belle décoration, sobre et moderne. Un vrai plus pour la literie, parfaite ! Pas de resort fees et cela devient de plus en plus rare en ville. 
Petit bémol, l'insonorisation, c'est un problème aux USA en général et à NYC en particulier, mais les boule quies sont indispensables pour bien dormir. Le personnel est sympathique globalement (petit plus pour le portier et petit moins au lobby ou un sourire ne ferait pas de mal).

title: Still a Gem!
text:
Every time I go to New York City I stay at this cute boutique hotel! They are finishing some renovations and I can’t wait to see it all finished on my next trip! 
Great staff and a fab location I really couldn’t ask for anything more from a cute hotel like this! 
They have a cool rooftop terrace where you have amazing views of the Empire State Building, and only a couple of blocks from MSG! So a great place to stay and not far to head back after a Rangers game!

title: Hotel Metro | NYC - Perfect Central Location
text:
Booked this hotel as a couple. My wife booked this hotel for a 5 night stay to celebrate a significant birthday week - what a choice this was. 

Was a little nervous hearing that this hotel was undergoing some renovations in the lead up to our break, but when we arrived we were provided with a room (306) which had been recently completed. The room was on the small side but for the length of time we spent in it, wasn’t really a problem. 

The new decoration was great, the room was clean and the housemaids were in every day to remake the bed and replenish towels. 

The facilities in this room were all excellent: 
Coffee/tea making - pods were refreshed daily, iron/ironing board/hairdryer, safe and mini fridge were all new. Large shower - was great. 

Huge bed which was very comfortable. 

Hotel reception staff were all excellent. Helped wherever they could to assist, not that we needed much. Always welcome you back when we’d been out for the day. 

The hotel is perfectly located in midtown, with an easy 10 minute walk up into Times Square in the evening for eats/drinks. 

Most tourist attractions are walkable - Empire State Building (2 mins), Flatiron (10 minutes) and we walked up to Central Park in around 20/30 minutes.

title: Fab hotel, fab location
text: Myself and my partner stayed at the hotel metro in Feb 2019 for 3 nights. We had originally booked a contemporary queen room but on arrival we were advised that we had complimentary been upgraded to a suite which was beautiful, separate living room and bedroom and 2 large TVs .the fridge was also stocked with complimentary arrival drinks! The hotel is in a brilliant location and is right in the middle of everything so no really long walks to get anywhere! Finally, there were some renovations taking place whilst we were guests at the hotel which we knew before hand as the airline had already advised us, we were quite concerned about this due to noise etc. However we could not complain, we were out all day and there was no noise at all at night! All in all an excellent hotel with lovely staff situated in a great location! Would definitely recommend!

title: Quiet and relaxing spot
text: We stayed here for the last week. What a great location.  Easy walking distance to most midtown locations and theatres.  Staff are all welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The building staff (Hotel undergoing renovations) were very friendly and always happy to offer advice on our trip. The welcome bottle of bubbly and room upgrade was welcome as we were celebrating my wife's birthday.Hotel is clean and relaxing. Aircon/ heater units take some getting use to as the fans are loud.  Once you get used to it you dont notice the noise. After a full day out in NYC we felt we were returning home to chill and recharge for the next day.  We will be back here again.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: Arrived at hotel Metro.  Staff were very helpful and friendly and happy for us to check in as soon as we arrived early. The rooms have been refurbished and are lovely simple modern and stylish  fresh and very clean. Had everything we needed. The refurbishment is still being completed so we got breakfast vouchers for “Toast” (a delicatessen round the corner) which was excellent. The location of this hotel is excellent and we had a great trip. Would certainly recommend this for city break. Excellent

title: Super hotel In a great location.
text: A super boutique hotel with friendly helpful staff.  We had a beautiful well appointed room with crisp white bedding, fluffy towels and a great coffee machine - we will definitely use this hotel again on future visits to the city

title: Ideal location
text:
My husband & I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Metro. We were quite nervous as it was our first time in New York, but on arrival at the hotel, the staff put us at ease. Easy check in, welcomed at the door by a friendly doorman who took our cases to our room. We had a free upgrade from a Premier to a King room plus a bottle of champagne in the room as it was our wedding anniversary. The room was quite small but it had everything we could need. You don’t come to New York to run around your hotel room! Comfy bed, lovely bathroom. The heater seemed a bit erratic & noisy at times but it didn’t ruin our experience. Only down side is the hotel is currently being renovated which should have finished in December. The room has obviously been done up recently so fantastic, but they are now working in the bar & restaurant area. Although we didn’t hear anything from our room, it did get quite noisy when walking through reception. Plus it would have been nice to have been able to have a drink &/or meal in the hotel but unfortunately, this was not an option. 
Great location, one block from the Empire State Building & plenty of shops around.
Thanks to all the staff at the Metro, reception, doormen & should all be very proud!

title: Un très bon hôtel au cloeur de Manhattan !
text:
New-York est une ville folle qui vit 24h sur 24 et les images mythiques se succèdent quand on se promène dans les rues aux gratte-ciels immenses.
L'Hôtel Metro est idéalement placé, à un prix raisonnable pour N.Y.

title: Great Location
text:
My wife and I celebrated her 50th birthday  in New York staying at the hotel Metro
Great location Close too lots of attractions  the staff were very friendly , and helpful 
The rooms are very clean comfortable 
Would certainly reckoned the hotel Metro Great memorable stay

title: Clean and comfortable
text:
Just finishing a 3 night stay here in New York at Hotel Metro. We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade and ended up in a lovely room away from the busy street out front. Not much of a view out the window, but who comes to New York to sit in their hotel? The bed was very comfortable, great after a busy day sightseeing and the rooms were clean with everything you need. Only issue was a noisy aircon unit, but that was remedied easily by switching it off at the wall. 
All in all, very good.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter in law on our first visit to New York. Initially we thought the room was a bit small but it was fine & we had a huge bathroom plus walk in closet. The coffee/tea maker was ideal plus you could always get drinks in the lobby. Useful to have fridge & safe. Only negative was the heater which was very noisy & a bit erratic, usb adaptors in lamps was a brilliant touch. The view from roof was great but due to ongoing work wasn't open very much. We had to go to Toast for breakfast which was why I only gave a four, it was very basic & not much choice shame we weren't able to experience the hotels breakfast. Staff were excellent & very helpful, special thanks to Rosa ( think that was her name think she went off sick) who sorted out bus trip for us. All in all a very good first stay in NYC. Thank you

title: Amazing hotel and location as always
text:
We always choose to stay at the hotel metro because of its location and it’s lovely staff, it’s situated a couple of blocks over from Times Square and a 15 min walk, at the end of the road there’s a subway station as well so it’s prime location.

Me and my mum stayed here for our birthday and we normally come at this time of year, the hotel has recently done up the rooms and the rooms are amazing everything in the New rooms I loved, they now have bed side lamps with plug sockets and usb sockets in!! Definitely come into the 21st century here hotel metro.

We got a welcome birthday chocolates in the room which was sweet.
Oh and make sure you check out the rooftop it has amazing views of the Empire State Building and I love sitting up there in an evening time unwinding watching the sites.

I would 100% recommended staying here 

Well done hotel metro once again well impressed

title: Great room, great location
text:
A beautiful hotel in midtown, very close to Penn Station, Times Square, Broadway, and many subway lines. A nice bagel store was right around the corner to get breakfast too. 

We had a king bed room, which I thought was spacious for Manhattan. We had complimentary check in beverages in our room, which was a nice touch. The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. A little loud from noises outside, but that's to be expected in the city. Would definitely stay here again, as it was a bargain for the niceness and location.

title: 4th stay at this wonderful hotel
text: Just returned home yesterday from my 4th stay at the hotel metro. I emailed prior to my trip to tell them I was staying for a 5th time and that the trip was for my 50th birthday. We were given a complementary upgrade to a lovely 2 bed room on the 11th floor and a card and bottle of bubbly. The staff as always are so nice and very professional extra shout out to the two young ladies on reception. Think they appreciated the english chocolate I gave them! Renovations are still taking place but we heard no noise from this and there is still free coffee in the lobby. The room we had was huge and included a fridge(with coke and water) and coffee machine. I can't speak highly enough about this hotel and the fact that I have stayed 4 times speaks volumes. The location is excellent few minutes from subway station and Macys. The view from the roof of the ESB is amazing, even better on valentines day when it was flashing red!! Thank you again to the fabulous staff hopefully see you next year.

title: Perfect in every way
text: The Hotel Metro is perfect.  It is a perfect for location for exploring NYC, perfect for comfort, perfect for the amazing view of the Empire State Building, perfect for service, perfect staff, helpful and friendly.   This hotel has it all, including beds that are so comfortable.  You will not be disappointed staying here.

title: Amazing hotel and location
text:
Booked a flight and hotel package with virgin who recommended the hotel metro.
Before we travelled I checked trip advisor and was pleased with all the positive comments. Before travelling to New York I contacted the hotel to ask a few questions the staff at the hotel were very quick in responding which was great.
When arriving at the hotel the front desk staff and the staff who work at the door entrance we’re all very friendly polite and informative which was great for us.
We was given a premier queen room which was really big and cosey, the shower was very powerful the bed was comfy.i was in New York celebrating my 40th birthday so it was a nice surprise  Was left a box of chocolates and a card saying welcome to New York & happy 40th this was a nice gesture. 
The hotel is within walking distance to time square and the metro stations. I Would most definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: We stayed here for four nights. The location was perfect for us as we did not want to stay in Times Square. We were upgraded on arrival, the room was clean, spacious and bed extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times and the views from the roof top are fab!

title: Perfecte locatie - goed hotel
text:
Ieder jaar kom ik in New York voor een beurs. Dit is de 3e keer op rij dat ik dit hotel kies. Goede prijs kwaliteit verhouding op een perfecte locatie. Kreeg een upgrade naar een suite , dit was helemaal top. 
Het restaurant wordt verbouwd en was helaas dicht. Personeel is allervriendelijkst en service gericht. Volgend jaar weer :-)

title: Ignore any negative comments, this hotel couldn’t be more perfect!
text: Even though we are only on our first full day of our week long trip to NYC, I felt compelled to write a review to give credit to this hotel and the staff that work here. Before arriving, like most others, I kept checking in on Trip Advisor to see what other travellers had said about Hotel Metro. After reading negative/average reviews I was slightly apprehensive about arriving. I genuinely have no idea why anyone would want to moan about this hotel. Upon arriving, extremely late due to the fact British Airways delayed our flight, the guy on the desk at 2am couldn’t be more polite, friendly and helpful.. even during the middle of the night he managed to make us feel welcome and well informed. We were also able to get up on the terrace when we arrived to see the Empire State Building which was incredible. We were delighted to find we had been upgraded from a premier queen to a premier king room and we couldn’t be more grateful. I’d mentioned that it was my 7th anniversary with my husband on email conversations with Hotel Metro some months before arriving and they still left chocolates and a note in our room which was such a lovely gesture. The room itself was an upgraded room on the 2nd floor. Extremely comfortable, good size, quiet and clean. The package we booked included breakfast which we were able to get from ‘Toast’ around the corner. Portions are huge and I think it’s incredibly considerate of the hotel to ensure the guests are able to get food still during the renovations which by the way we haven’t heard/seen once. The location is absolutely perfect and a stone’s throw from the subway. We’ve had no issue accessing loads of tourist spots today and found many places to be well within walking distance! All in all this hotel and its staff is worth every penny we spent on this holiday. They absolutely work hard to provide great customer service and this shows in all the little extra’s they ensure you have on your stay! Keep up the fantastic work and we can’t wait to continue on an amazing holiday!

title: Amazing return visit
text: After visiting this hotel back in 98 for our first wedding anniversary, it was the obvious choice for our return visit to New York and we could not be more happy we went back.  Even though the hotel is under going a renovation you would not even notice any disturbance.  Our check in was quick and although our room wasn’t ready, there is an area where we refreshed and then hit the streets of New York.  The room was larger than last time, very clean and enough amenities for our two night stay.  We had a coffee machine, rainforest shower, mini bar with coke and water in which were complementary, private safe and views of the block behind us.  Although would’ve have loved an Empire State view room and a newly refurbished room we were happy with the choice given.  Also because  of the renovation there’s was no breakfast like last time but there are plenty eateries around the area with a Starbucks on nearly every corner too and the hotel does offer free coffee etc in the reception area for guest to enjoy.  If in fact we do go back to New York again we will definitely book the Metro, it’s so central being in Midtown with Times Square, Empire State and shopping on your doorstep and downtown and Central Park a small cab ride away.  Thank you Metro once again.

title: A fantastic hotel.
text: This is the second time we have stopped here and we were not disappointed again.  We chose the Metro mainly for the location which is close to Macy''s the Empire State Building and 5th Avenue/ Times Square, as well as having a great bar and restaurant over the road at Brendans.  We were greeted with a warm welcome and advised we would be in one of the newly renovated rooms on the second floor.  This was excellent with great facilities and a very large bed which was really comfortable.  The concierge was very helpful and recommended good restaurants and things to do.  We had a problem with our travel agent who had made an error involving onward transportation, the hotel, front staff, security and porters could not have been more helpful .... storing our luggage for free and letting us use all the facilities whilst we were sorting everything out.  The only slight issue is you are in the middle of Manhatten which is a 24 hour city that never sleeps and sometimes the noise proves that, however clearly outside of the hotels control. A must is to check out the view from the roof top terrace which is brilliant.

title: Ideal Location
text: Fantastic location, staff excellent and very helpful. probably the best view of the Empire State building from the roof top seating area of the hotel.. you will struggle to find a better view of it. 5 minute walk to Times Square and Broadway plus the subway in at the end of the block $3 gets you anywhere! We were upgraded to a King suite - Room 508 it was quite small to be honest and the view wasn't cracking from the window we had. However for the time you spend in the hotel it was more than enough. Bathroom and Shower was large but the shower wasn't powerful and it was -15 wind chill outside so this was a bit of a pain!! - Highly recommended this place... try the Monarch rooftop bar at the night just a few doors down its good.

title: Great Location for Sightseeing - Would Recommend!
text:
This hotel is in a very convenient location and feels very central to all the typical sightseeing spots. The staff are friendly and helpful but we didn't really spend a lot of time in the hotel.  The free wifi is good and its easy to sit in the small lobby when getting picked up but besides this there are no communal areas (I think we've read  that there are renovations under way - but we were not affected by any of this). We planned to use the Gym but unsurprisingly ended up far too tired from all the walking..!
We were on a lower floor so we really didn't have much of a view but we appreciated not being able to hear the traffic and it was great to be able to go up to the 12th floor to take in the sights of the empire state building. We also appreciated the free tea and coffee.
In terms of constructive criticism, the heater in the room was quite loud and either way too hot or just off altogether and there appeared to be a buzzy fan-typed noise that we could hear all of the time.. perhaps it was coming from somewhere else in the hotel.
We also struggled with having just one mirror in the bathroom, an additional mirror in the bedroom would have been much appreciated because it meant getting ready took longer.
We also felt some hooks on the back of one of the doors would have helped, we had big bulky coats and no where to out them! There is one slim, short wardrobe so we mainly used the drawers underneath this.
A final positive is that the bed is big and soft!

title: Just checked in Queen Room
text: So we checked in last night and got a newly renovated room. Staff are friendly and the beds and pillows are super comfy! we also were given free tea and coffee in the room as well as 2 bottles of water, 2 diet coke and 2 regular coke. (no milk for English breakfast tea).The location is amazing just by Times square. There are 2 Irish bars in this block and you are looking at about $8 per drink but the measures are good! So far so good!

title: Friendly
text: Lovely medium sized hotel to return to after a hard day pounding the streets of New York.Staff friendly and approachable especially the three doormen. We had a contemporary queen room which was a perfectly adequate size,great shower and a super comfortable bed, very clean and fresh. The hotel is in a great location just round the corner from the Empire State and a 10 minute walk to Times square. Tea and coffee available in the foyer was a welcome touch and well used by us. Renovations were being carried out during our stay but can honestly say they didn't disturb us at all. Hope to be back next year when the Metro Grill will be open for the convenience of a meal and maybe a nightcap before bed.

title: Place to stay
text: First time in New York and don't think we could have a better hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The location was superb only 10 min walk from Penn Station. Nearest Subway Hearld Square on a minute away. Empire State 5 mins, Macy 2 mins . The room was excellent, it was clean and obliviously just been up graded. The only signs of the renovations  was an odd builder in the lift.If you're think of going to New York I would definitely recommend staying here

title: 2nd visit
text: I stayed here for the second time within the space of 2 years. It's not a 5 star hotel but there were improvements from last year. There were refurbishment works and the hotel is starting to belong to this century. The beds are extremely comfortable, a dream to sleep in. The rooms look much nicer but the finishes leave a lot to be desired and, if you're a clumsy person, you could easily break things that are literally hanging on for dear life like the thermostat on the wall for example. The housekeeping is great, as are the housekeepers. The rest of the staff are nice enough. Now, when we booked this hotel we weren't aware we wouldn't be able to have breakfast in the premises and instead we'd be given vouchers for a deli around the corner. The breakfast selection was one of the reasons why we chose this hotel again so this was a let down as you're only allowed a bagel/muffin and an orange juice/coffee. The service at this place isn't great and the ordering system is confusing to say the least. Also, you may be used to be let into your room earlier like many hotels would allow you to - forget about that here. Not a single minute earlier than 4pm (at least!) so don't rush here from the airport thinking you'll be that lucky. All in all it is an average hotel, which is good and it I'd say it is good value for the low price you pay.

title: 2day stop over
text: perfect location great hotel beds comfy nice breakfast. closed to time Sq, nice Irish bar next door. taxi service avail to JFK. nice bday gifts left in the room for us would defo go back soon for a visit

title: amazing city stay
text: me and my friend had an amazing 5 night stay at this hotel from 1st feb. we had a brand new renovated room which looked insane. especially the bathroom. was extremely comfortable. had 4 complimentary cans of coke and 2 bottles of water on arrival in the fridge. reception,doormen and housekeeping staff were delightful. the view of the empire state on the rooftop was amazing especially at night when it was lit up. absolute central location. in my opinion this hotel is 4 and half stars easily. i will definitely be coming to stay again in the near future!

title: 5th visit, Great as always!
text: My daughter and I stayed for five nights to sightsee, visit friends and of course do a bit of shopping. The Metro although still undergoing renovations is a great place to stay with friendly and helpful staff. Although we missed out on the wonderful buffet breakfast as that area is still being upgraded the breakfast from Toast, just around the corner, was ok. Already looking forward to returning next year to see the upgraded areas.

title: Short Break
text:
The hotel is ideally suited to New York’s attractions. 1 block away from the Empire State Building. The room was a good size and newly decorated, the shower room was small but again very clean and usable. The bed was the best I’ve ever slept in. Overall a great little hotel. The scores would be a perfect 5 but for the closure of the hotel and bar. Also little in the way of communication in regards facilities. 
A great place to stay

title: February 2019 visit
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of February and have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We were celebrating and when we arrived they upgraded our room to a king room, and put chocolates in our room with a card, such a nice touch. We were on the 5th floor and the room was brand new, USB ports in the lamps so no need to use adapter, which was helpful. Nice fridge, and awesome coffee machine. 
The rooftop bar was amazing, you could bring your own drinks up there and the view of the Empire State Building was amazing and so much better than in the pictures. 
Our room was always made up immaculately every day, and the front desk and doormen were always very polite and helpful. 
Would like to visit again and would definitely stay here again, the location was perfect for us in midtown and a short walk to Madison Square Garden. Very impressed.

title: City Break
text:
We recently had a good stay at the very good Hotel Metro. The Hotel is in a great position Midtown and in a great position if traveling from JFK Airport. The views from the roof terrace are very good and Complimentary Hot Drinks in the Reception are a nice touch.
Check in was quick and friendly as all the staff were during our stay and the Doormen were very helpful in helping with luggage and taxis when needed.
Our room was a refurbished Queen Room and was slightly on the small size, although it was well furnished with a great bed and bathroom.
The refurbishment did not give any problems and the work never started before 08:00 in the morning with little noise coming from the work.
The only thing stopping this being an Excellent review is the heating in the rooms! Whilst we visited New York was hit by the Polar Vortex and temperatures below minus 16!
The heating unit doubles as an Air Con so it is too noisy to have on whilst sleeping so in the morning the room was Artic especially with the draft through the window.
The bathroom didn’t have any heating so was freezing and the window actually froze on the inside on the last day.
Some heating the bathroom would be nice.
If stoping at the Metro I can recommend Andrews Dinner which is only two blocks away and was excellent.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
We stayed at the Metro for five nights and would definitely go back.
Although they are still upgrading the hotel you do not see any of the work or noise from this.
The room was decorated well, and very clean. Each day we had clean towels and on return from our days out the bed was made and the room tidied.
The bed was very comfy and the pillows were great.
The shower and bathroom facilities were very good with a big walk in shower. Shower gel and shampoo provided. Complimentary cokes in the fridge and a safe is available.
The roof terrace is definitely worth going up to as you have a fantastic view of the Empire State.
There is a gym on the top floor for guests to use.
The staff were friendly and helpful particularly the doormen.
There is a subway close by making it easy to get around.
Thank you For taking care of us, we will be back.

title: Fabulous
text: We stayed in a Queen Room which was fabulous. More than enough space, modern lighting, great shower. We did not want for anything, coffee/tea making machine in the room.  The staff were great, very helpful and friendly. It is well situated for seeing the sights and a Metro station on the corner. Because the refurb was not quite finished we did not see the dining area but we were given vouchers for breakfast to take to Toast which was a lovely eating place. Very reasonably priced and great choices of food.

title: Great hotel
text: We visited late January for my husbands 40th. New York is something we both always wanted to do and it did not disappoint, nor did the hotel, it was lovely and staff were very polite. We had an issue with the heater in our room when we arrived but they quickly sent up an engineer and swapped our room no problem. The rooms are very clean and modern with comfy beds and I would definitely recommend to anyone and 100% would stay here again myself. Great location with Times Square within walking distance and the Empire State Building just a block away. The hotel was having some renovations in the restaurant while we were there but you wouldn’t have known, no noise disruption at all. We would love to stay here again on our next visit.

title: my new york experience
text: this hotel is definitely worth a stay from great staff to great rooms to great location best hotel I have stayed in in New York will definitely be returning in the future ,The room was very spacious with every thing required for your stay .one of the best located hotels two minutes from 5th ave and two minutes from Macys and just five minutes from the empire state building

title: Fabulous stay
text: We had a lovely room on floor 9. Chocolates & card for my birthday. Coffee/tea pod machine in room. Water & pop on arrival. Fridge & safe in room. Rooms cleaned & towels changed daily. Great centre location. Free tea & coffee in the entrance lobby. Restaurant/bar closed for refurbishment but so many bars & places to eat close by. We bought a hop on hop off bus ticket which included boat trips- really worth while.

title: Great Hotel
text: Really impressed with this hotel, the rooms were fantastic, with plenty of space and all the amenities you would need. Rooms were spotless and cleaned up everyday. Fab decor in the room on floor 3. Roof top had a view of the Empire State Building. Staff were excellent and tried to help whenever they could. Enjoyed the free tea and coffee. Ideally situated within the city as within walking distance of most attractions. Overall really surprised with the quality.

title: Beautiful Art Deco Hotel In Fantastic Location!!
text:
The Hotel Metro is a fantastic hotel located in the epicenter of NYC and Midtown Manhattan with an amazing view of the Empire State Building especially from the roof top terrace. Within walking distance to all New York’s major tourist spots and conveniently located a few hundred metres from the subway which is an absolute breeze to use, simply purchase a metro card and keep topping up as you need! 

We paid to upgrade to a newly decorated premier double room and would highly recommend. The little chocolates and note for my birthday was very cute. We did have issues with the heating on the first night but were moved into a new room within 10 minutes of me calling down to reception for assistance. The only complaint I have is that the heaters are incredibly noisy so for a light sleeper it proved a problem, nothing major but if like me you are a light sleeper I would recommend taking ear plugs. 

The restaurant is closed for refurb but you’re so close at the hotel to hundreds of amazing places is doesn’t make a difference. Would recommend Hard Rock buffet breakfast just a short walk away at Times Square or Applebee’s! 

We will be back!

title: Bueno
text: Bueno en general. La ubicación es maravillosa, las habitaciones hay de todos tipo. Me han tocado super grandes y otras muy pequeñas frente al elevador, supuestamente para 3 o 4 personas. Está actualmente en remodelación, por lo que no hay servicio de restaurante ni baño en la recepción. La gente es amable, el servicio es bueno, bien en limpieza. A veces muy caro, depende la temporada

title: Convenient boutique hotel in the midst of Manhattan
text: This was my 4th stay at Hotel Metro. I was upgraded to a newly renovated front room due to multiple visits and my lengthy 2 week stay. The hotel is great, my room excellent, and reception staff very friendly! It was really good to see a few of the staff members still working there, over 20 years of service each! Wonderful to catch up with them yet again.

title: Fantastic hotel great location
text: Fantastic hotel right in the centre of attractions ie Macy’s n Empire State Building etc we stayed mid January when is was due snow and -15c the hotel was a great choice rooms very good the restaurant was closed when we were there as still doing work on it but plenty of places to eat the staff here are always friendly and helpful if you need help getting around would recommend a stay here and as a bonus they have a rooftop terrace where you get a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and the city

title: Great location yet quiet and very clean
text:
We had a great stay at Hotel Metro.... Despite being close to Broadway, Macys, etc we weren't disturbed by noise at all and the blackout blinds are a brilliant addition! 
The room was well presented, a good size and very clean and housekeeping did a great job of keeping it clean and well stocked during our stay. The view from the rooftop of the Empire State Building are fantastic.

title: Great hotel fantastic location
text:
Booked through Virgin Holidays and got a yellow cab from the airport to the hotel cost around $65-70 dollars, straightforward.  We were told the restaurant was being refurbished, however we were not disturbed by this at all either during the day or at night.  Hotel staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and there is always a warm welcome when you enter the hotel.  Check in was fast and easy.  

We were in a queen room which was more than adequate for our stay, complimentary water and soft drinks in room on arrival, use of fridge, in room safe and coffee making machine, also nice toiletries supplied regularly with clean towels.

The location is excellent with Empire State Building literally round the corner along with Macy's, do forget to look upwards!  Madison Square Garden and Time Square/Broadway all within a 10-20 minute walk.

For the dates we travelled very reasonable price for hotel, would not hesitate to stay here again as hotel clean, central location and importantly friendly helpful staff.

title: Fab hotel
text: Just spent a week here lovely hotel really friendly helpful staff room was spotless ideally placed for sightseeing nearby and further afield with subway 2 mins away plenty of bars and restaurants nearby 👍👍🗽🗽

title: Great Hotel and Ideal Location
text: Stayed here for 5 nights in January. Despite undergoing renovations we hardly saw any disruption. Ideally placed for all major tourist activities. Subway station at end of street. Bedrooms a good size and very well maintained. Roof terrace was a gem. Looking up at the Empire State Building from roof terrace was a magnificent sight. Thanks to all the staff that made our stay amazing.

title: Perfect Location
text:
The hotel is probably one of the smaller hotels in New York but it is in what I would say is the ideal location. A 10 minute walk from Time Square or one stop on the subway. The hotel is right near a subway stop also. 

The hotel was going under refurbishment at the time so the bar and restaurant were not available. 

The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: Second visit - says it all!
text:
Another wonderful stay at the hotel metro! Me and my husband stayed from Christmas to New Year and we had a great time.  You made it special from the moment we arrived and the bottle of champagne to commiserate me turning 30 was gratefully received!  

All of the staff are a credit to the hotel, everyone is friendly, happy and smiley at all times of the day and it really does make a difference.  We did have issues with our first bathroom but we were very swiftly moved to a different room which was equally comfortable.  This one was at the front of the hotel but didn’t notice any disturbance from the street.  The beds and pillows are heavenly, so comfortable! 
 
Thanks again for great stay and hope you all have a great 2019!

title: Honest Review
text:
We booked a Premier Queen Room.  Hotel is superb! Staff friendly and polite. Complimentary tea and coffee in reception which can be obtained 24/7. We were allocated room 1204 which is on the... 12th floor right next to the stairs to the rooftop lounge. Can be a bit noisy when the door to the roof top slams shut, but other than that it’s lovely. It’s a lovely spacious room with Queen bed,which is really comfortable  4 pillows, coffee machine (6 pods supplied daily by maid) plenty of plug sockets, radio alarm clock/docking station with a usb charging. Wardrobe in the wall which conceals an iron/ironing board, and standard safe. Also a small fridge which is stocked with 2 cans of coke, 2 cans of Diet Coke and 2 bottles of water which are complimentary on arrival(these are not restocked). There are 2 tub chairs with pouffe and a small table if u choose to sit in and watch tv. The bathroom has a single sink, toilet and a large shower unit. The shower has 3 options: rainfall shower, wall mounted and detachable flexi hose. The aircon is window mounted and can be quite noisy, but we just unplugged it. There would only be one complaint.. and that would be.. the towels are tiny.. I am a plus size lady who likes to wrap and dry naturally.. 🤪 No chance! The bath towels are the size  of a good hand towel. I usually bring my own towel when we travel as the towels are normally a bit small for my size but these are TINY.. so next time I will bring my own.. but on a whole it is a fantastic hotel! Spotlessly clean and well maintained. At the moment they do state that there are renovations taking place. We haven’t experienced any disturbance at all. The bar/grill is being renovated and that’s all we have seen. 
We would highly recommend this hotel.. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Lovely hotel great location!
text: Initially put off when Virgin told us there was refurbishments going on and the bar and restaurant would be closed. However so glad we didn’t change hotel! We were in one of the newly refurbished Premier Queen rooms and it was lovely so clean and fresh and bright and spacious for a New York hotel. Could not tell there was ongoing works so do not let that put you off! Perfect location plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby! Staff were also fab and extremely helpful and friendly. Would really recommend.

title: Hotel centrico con habitacion acogedora y una terraza con vistas al Empire impresionante.
text:
Hotel muy centricio con habitación muy acogedora, limpia y agradable. 
El staff muy amable, con un trato exquisito y siempre ayudando.
Cafe gratuito en la recepción. Muy conveniente por las mañanas.. :-)
La terraza es increible con vistas al Empire S. impresionantes. 
Como comentario a mejorar, sería ideal si la terraza contara con una cubierta (ya que si llueve no hay nada donde resguardarte y hubiera sido el máximo si hubiera alguna estufa de exterior que te permitiera disfrutar más tiempo de la terraza. 
Nosotros estuvimos en fin de año, con muchísimo frio y el no tener un "techo" donde resguardarnos de la lluvia ni algun tipo de estufa de exterior nos hizo no poder disfrutar de la terraza tanto como huibiesemos querido.
Como comentario tambien a tener en cuenta por algunos viajeros, nosotros reservamos 4 habitaciones y ninguna tenía vistas. Todas daban a patios interiores (que no es muy importante si lo que quieres es "patear" NY). 

Pero, lo importante, es que el hotel NOS ENCANTÓ y VOLVERIAMOS sin dudarlo.

title: Lovely hotel!
text: Hotel Metro is an excellent hotel in a great location for a stay in New York, everything is in within walking distance. Rooms were very clean & nicely decorated. Staff were all very helpful I would definitely recommend staying here whilst in New York.

title: Staying over NYE.
text:
Just got back from a 4 night stay from Dec 30th till 3rd Jan. I and my GF are disappointed in this hotel, we stayed in the Wellington last time where the location was so much better and we expected the rooms there to be basic. This hotel we booked and knew the location wasn’t the as good but, I thought the rooms looked really nice like the photos online. After looking at the website photos and we booked through Virgin with a Premier Queen room. I think the room that we got was the Contemporary Queen or a Mini Double since the pictures didn’t match online photos, the bathroom was tiny and the room was small as well.

They told me the rooms sometimes look different but if you advertise a room with photos which people go off and then give something totally different then expect to be questioned.

Overall, would I come here again? Probably not, location is ok but not the best and I believe we didn’t get what we booked. The hotel had nothing due to renovations other than the rooms.

Photos attached of what is apparently a “premier queen” which I believe isn’t.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We’ve visited New York countless times and have always found you have to compromise something when choosing a hotel. Not in Hotel Metro. Fantastic location next to numerous subway lines, huge rooms by NYC standards, modern clean bathrooms and excellent value for money. Couldn’t recommend highly enough

title: 7 night stay, ideal.
text: Situated very close to the empire state building, and 2 minutes to Macy's, this hotel was ideal, staff were helpful, double room was clean and the only problem was the restaurant being refurbished, hotel guests can use the gym and sit on the roof, great place to stay while visiting the big apple.

title: Definate recommendation
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights. Room very airy and clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. Used towels replaced every day. Cannot comment on the restaurant (that is why I have not given 5 stars), as it was being refurbished while there and not being used. We were given tokens to go to a local deli around the corner for breakfast. We were aware of this before the trip and had the option of changing hotels if we wanted. 
Ideal situation for Macys and Empire State Building as both only a short walk away. Would definitely recommend.

title: Nice friendly hotel
text: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. We were not informed that the hotel was under renovation (we found out on here) and although the restaurant being closed was disappointing, overall the renovation did not affect our stay. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, as was Matthew on the door. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. My partner enjoyed using the gym facilities and I enjoyed the free tea/coffee! The hotel is in a good location, near Macy’s and we used the nearby tube station to reach the 9/11 memorial and the Statue of Liberty easily. Would recommend!

title: Value decreasing but good location
text: Third stay at this hotel, primarily due to location. Restaurant closed, under renovation. No breakfast vouchers, previously continental breakfast was provided. Due to renovation half the lobby that used to be available was closed. They had small tables and seating areas that were great if you brought in food from elsewhere, wanted a good place to read a book, or enjoy a complimentary tea or coffee , or just hang out. That space is missed. While our room looked recently renovated, the chairs were old and worn. The bed mattresses were lumpy too.
