It is obvious the room renovations have a way to go, if still in progress. Workers for renovation were very respectful of guests. Rooms were clean. Location is great. The front desk manager was very helpful, but the other staff at front desk seemed only to do the minimum. When present, the bellman were very friendly and helpful. Great location for subway. Due to increasing prices at this hotel, and increasingly less value, we'll be looking at other options for our next NYC visit.

title: Great location! Great price! Great hotel!
text: Teffircally convenient hotel. Newly renovated. Totally reasonable rate! Check in was quick and pleasant. Booked this on hotel.com. Although the hotel was still a little raw from its recent reno, the newly redecorated room and bathroom were spacious for a Manhattan hotel. Free NY Times and coffe/tea in the lobby. Just perfect for what we wanted to do: have dinner, see a show, stay over. Perfect!

title: Good choice
text: Great location.  Room was small but very comfortable and had been modernized.  They were upgrading many of the rooms on our floor.  Only drawback to our room was the design of the shower.  Contained a wand and overhead which is great except that it's not very inuitive as to how to use it.  Also, there was a gap between the glass shower door and the threshold.  Consequently, lots of water ended up on the bathroom floor.  We had to mop up after every shower.  Otherwise, the accomodations were great and loved the retro lobby.  Would stay there again.

title: A lovely, homely, hotel with amazing views of the Empire State Building!
text:
A wonderful hotel which provided a great central base to walk anywhere we needed in the city. The beds were comfy, the showers were strong and really clean as well as the team working there being friendly and attentive at all times. Our room was overseeing the courtyard and although overlooked by another hotel, this option was better than a road view as it was a lot quieter! 

There was works going on at the hotel during our visit but we didn’t hear anything, just occasionally bumped into workmen in the lift, and the breakfast vouchers for the cafe around the corner were great as it got you up and out ready to start the day. 

The view from the rooftop is nothing short of spectacular and as it is open 24/7. You can admire it day or night! We took a bottle of wine up and spent an hour or so chatting and admiring the view.

title: Magical Time In NYC!!!
text:
First impressions of the hotel were good.
As we arrived we were greeted at the entrance and the staff at check in desk were friendly and polite. 

Allocated a room on 6th floor. Now, we’ve stayed in newyork before in a different hotel, and know that hotel rooms in newyork aren’t the biggest, but our room was very compact. My boyfriend went down to reception to ask if another larger room was available.

We were quickly moved to the room next door which was much better.

Rooms were clean but tired/dated however they are in the middle of renovating the hotel. 
(Didn’t bother us while we were there, although corridors and lift had a little dust)

For breakfast we were given vouchers each morning to go to the nearby TOAST cafe. A bagel & coffee each morning was just what we needed to start each day and very tasty! 

We found the hotel to be a perfect location! We had no problems getting round the city, walking or by subway.

If you want late checkout be sure to head down early in the morning of your departure as we were told it was unavailable due to a number of other guests already requesting late check out and our flight wasn’t until 8:55pm! 

The City is magical this time of year and we had an amazing time!
 
We will definitely be heading back to New York at some point in the future, I’m unsure if we would return to this hotel.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Stayed here for 4 nights from Dec 8th 2018 and was highly impressed with the hotel. Renovations were being done bit didn't hear a peep from the workers. Our room was surprisingly big and was immaculately clean. The view from the roof has totally won me over and being back home 1 day I'm missing it already. The guy who checked us in, Stan, was very welcoming and friendly and we were in our room in no time. Loved everything about this hotel but I've got to give special recognition to Matthew the doorman as he was an absolute star. Made us feel welcome instantly and was a truly lovely guy and very helpful. I'm planning another new york trip in 2020 and this will be the hotel that I choose again. Thank you for making our 1st visit a great one :)

title: A hotel under renovation that I would like to come back to... but...
text:
The Metro hotel has a great location, with an easy access to any place in the city.  In addition, the  top deck provides a spectacular view on the Empire State Building. We had a nice size room, comfortable and very quiet,  with a modern bathroom. The hotel has charm and I can imagine that after the renovation is completed, it would be one of the top choices for me to stay in the city. I give the hotel 4 stars (instead of 1 or 2, as I was originally tempted), because I hope that the Metro hotel can become a perfect place, despite the problems that we experienced.

Something is happening with aging, otherwise attractive hotels  in Manhattan. They lately became more expensive than usual (maybe because of the renovations). Most often the heating/AC does not work ( as it was the case with our room at the Metro), the electricity in the room may go off (it happened to us, too,  at the Metro, but it was fixed twice and immediately).
 Hotels under renovation/that are aging, must have staff that will be willing to make up for (temporary) shortcomings, to make guests comfortable and welcome.  They should train staff to be polite and accommodating. When we complained about "no heating" in our room, a repairman was sent and became skeptical about fixing it. I asked if he could bring a portable heater, he said yes, and he left, and did not come back. After a while I was in the lobby and complained about the broken heater, the front desk person said categorically:
 "we do not have portable heaters", 
then I asked:
 "could I have then a new room"?
she answered: 
"you were in the room for many hours, and our staff that makes the rooms is gone, and if we move you, then we cannot make your room. We cannot give you a new one"...  what a ridiculous explanation...
hmmm, I said "what I can do, I can write a bad review on Tripadvisor",
 she said "you can write any review you want"...
I went back to my room, and I called the hotel asking for the manager:
"the manager is gone for a day" - another front desk person replied.  I demanded a solution, and complained about the lack of staff that could be helpful; he finally said: "a portable heater is being sent to your room"...  I asked " what was the story about not having portable heaters", he answered: "we are not supposed to make them available but we are making an exception".  An exception? A hotel that has broken heating system, should have a storage full of portable heaters. In a few minutes a portable heater was brought in... 

Still, the unnecessary, upsetting interaction will stay in my memory. Metro hotel, you can do better. I wish you better. Please pay attention to better training of your front desk staff.

title: Great return visit!
text: Stayed here for a week last year, so when arranging a 4 day trip this year with my daughter, didn't hesitate to book again.  Arrived earlier than expected but was still able to check in. Delighted to be told that our room had been upgraded to a suite! It was lovely with 2 bedrooms (one huge with 2 double beds & one with a queen bed), bathroom, kitchenette, couldn't ask for more. Staff as before were extremely helpful, pleasant and welcoming. Only downside to our stay was that the lounge area was closed as it was being refurbished, which meant that the complimentary breakfast was not available (although the hotel did offer a voucher for a nearby coffee shop).  It was a shame though because their breakfast certainly sets you up for the day. I was a bit surprised that this work wasn't delayed until perhaps a quieter time in the new year. That said it has by no way put me off this hotel and if I am  fortunate enough to return to New York, I will definitely book to stay here again.

title: Good stay, Good location
text:
We were here for a week during our first NY trip.
The hotel is in a great location with everything within walking distance.
The hotel itself has an old world charm. Perfectly adequate, a typical NY hotel. Rooms are small but functional and the washroom well appointed. 
The best part is the adjoining bar/diner that serves discounted breakfasts for guests. Its sumptuous and convenient.
Overall, nothing to complain about our stay here.

title: 1st time in New York
text: Great base for central New York. Hotel rooms are very compact bed & shower clean.  The safe broke and they replaced it immediately.  Complimentary teas and coffee any time at reception.  Hotel is currently undergoing renovation work therefore weekdays you hear the workman 7:30.  Due to renovations complimentary breakfast is offered in a cafe (Toast) around the corner.  Penthouse floor you can see the Empire State Building. It took us 45minutes to get to hotel from JFK and 25minutes when we returned.  In a yellow cab it is a fixed rate of $60.

title: Great stay and perfect location.
text:
Just not long back from my stay at Hotel Metro. The hotel itself was very nicely furnished .
My room was a lovely size with a king bed. It was very comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping. The room had all the amenities one needs for a pleasant stay. I have stayed in NY twice before and this room was one of the biggest ones I have stayed at in the city. Although the bathroom had a extra large walk-in shower with triple shower heads it would be nice to have a bath as well. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Sehr Empfehlenswert
text: Dieses Hotel hat Charme, ist sehr sauber und die Angestellten sind alle sehr zuvor kommend. Es macht die Reise nach New York noch ein weiteres Stück speziell. Man fühlt sich ein Stück weit zu Hause. Wir kommen wieder!

title: Hotel mitten in Manhattan
text: Schlichtes Hotel für Kurzurlaub gut geeignet, U Bahn station direkt an der Ecke. Es wurde renoviert aber es war nicht laut, dadurch gab es im Hotel selber zurzeit kein Restaurant. Das Empire war eine strasse entfernt und von der dachterasse gut zu sehen.

title: Classic Bait and Switch
text: Be very careful, this hotel does not provide rooms as represented on website. I booked Premier King. Website advertises large room with granite desk and ergonomic chair. My small room is nothing like what is described. Compare photos to website Premier King. Front desk claimed this was the advertised room. Look at the photos. Also very noisy overlooking street. Don't book!

title: I used to love this place.
text:
I have stayed at Hotel Metro every time I have been to NYC. It’s not often but on the whole about 10 times over the years. No matter if the room was large or small it was always well designed for the space and made for a pleasant stay. I also enjoy the rooftop deck and midtown location. The staff at the front desk were always gracious and friendly and the breakfast light but good.

This trip has been a disappointment. 

The room is fine except for the bathroom. The shower has a slow drain. There is no hook on the door. There is no separate place to store clean towels. Other rooms usually have a shelf. In this case all clean towels are on the one rack leaving no space to hang towels in use. The flush handle on the toilet is hard to reach. The toilet paper holder is loose.

Oh, and the pillows were neck breakers. No soft alternative.

There has always been light breakfast offered. We received notice that the restaurant was not open but nothing was said about no breakfast. Even though the restaurant is closed we thought breakfast would have been provided because no cooked food was ever offered. Breakfast was usually yogurts, fruits and muffins.

Our biggest problem was the supervisor at the front desk. But first let me give a short review of what happened with our reservation made through Tripadvisor and Booking.com. 

We made a reservation for two nights and got a great deal at $441. Booking.com brought up a credit card, likely the last one we used. I didn’t pay close attention to the number because Booking.com said they would not charge the account till we were at the hotel.

Two days before our trip I got an email notification that the reservation was canceled due to an invalid card. Several months ago my bank replaced two cards due to a fraud alert. I figured it was one of those cards and called the number in the email from a Booking.com to get it straightened out. The number was actually the Hotel Metro and they refused to assist. Said I had to call the third party who booked the room. It would have been helpful if Booking.com had included their phone number in the notification.

Concerned about getting rooms, I went onto Booking.com trying to reach someone and couldn’t figure out how to get help so I just made another reservation for Hotel Metro. Didn’t get the same good price. Ended up with something like $553. I grabbed a card, in this case a debit card and made the reservation. Again, it said they would not charge the card ahead. 

I was surprised then to see an inexplicable $397 hit my debit card that day. I figured we could sort that out when we checked in.

After a long train trip we arrived and asked about the $397. Turns out Hotel Metro now has a $250 security deposit and the $397 first night with tax etc. I was confused because I thought the price quote from Booking.com included tax. I will go back and check.

Anyway, not wanting the rest of the room charge and security deposit to go on the debit card, we gave a credit card. The supervisor at the front desk put the entire amount on the card $825. After we realized she had done that we asked about reversing the charge to the debit card. She was cold, unfriendly and showed no empathy about the fact that we had been double charged and might not get the resolution that day as it was the weekend. 

Turns out we did get the credit same day but her attitude was just unacceptable for the hospitality industry.

title: Good Location but overall a dissappointment
text: Stayed here for 7 nights in a contemporary queen room on the 6th floor, room size was ample although decor was poor / tired and in need of redecorating which I suspect will be soon given the renovations were up to the 5th floor on our visit (workmen tended to start work approx 7.15am which you could hear, drilling and hammering).   Bed was comfortable but the heating ~ air con unit was extremely noisy so tried to avoid using this.  The bathroom had no fan - extractor and it wasn't possible to open window,  there were 2 occasions when hot water wasn't available.  There's a small safe and fridge (apparently some special guests receive complimentary cans of Coke, I was later informed by a member of staff - I'm not sure what constitutes as special guest, we obviously were not) .  There is a roof top terrace with good views of empire state (shame hotel don't make more use of this space).  There is a small gym if you have energy or time after your daily exploits of NYC.  Breakfast vouchers are issued for deli around the corner which was ample.  Hotel location is good 1 minute from Macys. 10-15 from Times Square, subway stations are close by.   Reception staff were mixed, some pleasant some miserable.  I did enquire if another room was available as we were disappointed with the position and quality of the one allocated to us, given we were there for 7 nights, but received a cold unhelpful response stating nothing else would be available during our stay.   The website photos of the hotel make pleasant viewing and I had high expectations as I always read trip advisor reviews prior to booking holidays, however this time I/ we were disappointed.  I do think that once renovations are complete the rooms will be pleasant, it's just a shame that all guest don't appear to receive the same level of hospitality.

title: Short Trip to New York
text: The Metro Hotel is perfectly placed for visiting New York.  Just south of Central Park, very close to the Empire State Building (which you get a lovely view of from the rooftop terrace).  Rooms a good size and lovely and clean.  We were in 816 which is at the back of the hotel.  No view from window - just nextdoor hotel and there was some noise from air conditioning units in the alley but this was not really a problem.   ALL the staff were lovely and cheerful and very helpful.   Restaurant/Bistro being refurbished when we were there and was closed but we were fully informed before booking.

title: Almost a 5
text:
We recently stayed for 7 nights and had a room on the 11th floor.
Our room was nice a little dated but I am sure they are getting to that with their renovations.  The room was serviced daily by friendly housekeeping people.
The renovations did not impact our stay and were surprised when the lift doors opened one day to a level (unknown) that was being renovated itself as we never heard any noise and it did not impact our stay, nor did the fact the restaurant was temporarily closed either with so many places to eat close by.
It was in a great location just down the street from Macy's and the subway and within short walking distance to other sights.
Most of the front desk staff were friendly and helpful however two younger girls seemed to be uninterested, slouching on the counter and gave you a sense that you were interrupting their day when we asked them a question of where we could print something out, which was responded to with a finger pointing to near the tea/coffee area.
For everything else at this place we couldn't fault it.  We would be happy to come and stay again.

title: Un po di tempo fa
text: In realtà sono stata alcuni anni fa in questo Hotel, ma riguardando le foto del viaggio a New York, mi è venuta voglia di fare quella recensione che all'epoca non avevo fatto! Hotel centralissimo , vicino a Times Square, ottimo in tutto! Per prima cosa la posizione, le camere, l'altezza e l'indubbio fascino di vedere quando può essere piccola una persona se la guardi dal 22'piano. La gentilezza e professionalità di un grande albergo, il cliente accolto con formale eleganza, un soggiorno che vale la pena vivere.. Vorrei tornare presto!

title: Almost a Five
text: I actually really liked this hotel, which is currently being refurbished, and the location is fantastic. We were upgraded when we got there, and the room was excellent; a good size, neat bathroom, and well furnished. However, a small problem required us to move out to an un-refurbished room, which was okay, but nothing like as nice, and on night three, we moved back to a refurbished room, again very, very nice, although a little smaller. Nice filter coffee machine in each room, nice towels and sheets, and friendly staff helped to make it an ideal spot. The breakfast room/restaurant was also being refurbished, and the voucher allowed us a (very nice) danish and either coffee or fruit juice from a deli around the corner; nice but not really adequate. This will no doubt be sorted once the restaurant re-opens. It’s a difficult time for the hotel, but breakfast aside, they tried their best to make us comfortable, and succeeded. I really do think that once the refurbishment is complete it will be hard to beat for comfort, location and staff. We will definitely stay there again.

title: First Visit...but will be back
text: I just randomly choose Hotel Metro for a quick 2 night stay in New York.  I am very happy with my choice.  The hotel is in a great location, close to the Empire State Building, within walking distance of the Theater District, close to Madison Square Gardens and close to 5th avenue shops.  There is a great restaurant right across the street.  The hotel is clean, comfortable, updated, with a helpful staff.  Bed was really comfortable.

title: Great location
text:
Just leaving after 6 nights here. Initially a little disappointing as felt very dated but the room we had on the 8th floor was really spacious and very clean. Everything serviced daily, great toiletries , clean beds and towels so we couldn’t ask for more for our first stay in New York. The location is amazing and we were able to walk nearly everywhere or use the metro at the end of the street.
Yes the restaurant closed but we ate at toast for breakfast like most people and that was a good start to the day. Very fresh food there. So thanks to the metro...a great stay.

title: Superb hotel
text: Just leaving hotel metro and what a great stay we had the rooms are fab lovely and clean the staff down on reception wer lovely and friendly  always a smile to welcome us back will defiantly use this hotel again thank u all for making our stay so great

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Lovely hotel in an amazing location, only a block from the empire state with a great view from the rooftop terrace. Also subway at end of the block as well as Macy's and lots of other major shops. Room was very comfortable and clean, customer service was excellent too. We were very happy to have stayed at Hotel Metro. Having read another recent review that mentioned renovation work, it might be worth enquiring about getting a room away from the floors being renovated. We were on the 8th floor and were unaware of any work going on, apart from the metro grill being closed. This wasn't an issue as there is a great place for breakfast (toast) right around the corner.

title: Currently undergoing substantial renovations! Dusty, noisy, indifferent staff, Give Metro a miss until Summer 2019
text: Hotel Metro came highly recommended by Trailfinders in the UK who were trying to make amends for booking us into another NYC hotel in 2016 which was being used as a homeless shelter... (See my review of Hotel Excelsior). The travel consultant was very enthusiastic and so were we when we saw the convenient location, a few blocks from the Theatre District and practically next door to the Empire State Building. Sadly, she either was not aware or neglect to mention that the hotel is undergoing complete refurbishment. We ended up on the yet to be renovated 6th floor, so the dust, noise and pungent chemical smells of the 4th and 5th floor works permeated 24/7. The room itself, although  very compact, was reasonably well-equipped and proved adequate to our needs for three nights. The lower floors which were already finished looked far more modern and it would have been a reasonable gesture to move us when I complained about the early noise, smells and dust. The Metro's own restaurant was closed during the works and FWIW, the top floor gym and roof terrace (with its view of the ESB) were also fairly shabby. Perhaps as a result of this hotel half life, we found the staff very disengaged and disinterested in our experience of our stay? With the exception of porter Shawn, even our cute five year old found it hard to raise a smile - something we had never experienced in many years of staying in NYC. Our final morning proved the nadir as I asked for written confirmation that the hefty US$250 credit card deposit for incidentals (where they might have come from with no mini bar and no breakfast restaurant, I'm not sure?) This was not possible and at time of writing I am still waiting to see if this large sum makes it back onto my card? When I asked the duty receptionist for the name and email of a manager, he demurred, only when pressed scribbling something on a card which was crossed out several times and finally illegible. Another word of warning, the complimentary wi-fi was NOT a secure network and my email has been compromised several times since logging on via the Metro. If you don't want to start receiving tons of spam, better stay safe and don't even log on. The Metro may well improve once these renovations are completed - I was told spring or summer 2019 - but even then, we found the lack of guest engagement surprisingly poor for a Manhattan tourist hotel. Cannot recommend a stay here and would also be very interested to hear the views of manager, Mr Anu Malhato/Mulhou/Maltou/Mahotta/Malahro who was too busy to see me during our stay itself.

title: Amazing!
text: If you are looking for a small, friendly, cosy, central hotel, then look no further, this is the place to be in!!! The staff went out of their way to help you. We were upgraded from London because our agent phoned and asked if we could have tea/coffee facilities in our room & because of this we were given a two bedded room which was lovely & so comfortable & clean. The hotel is central to the buses & metro & to the hop on, hop off buses that are available. Yes, the place is being upgraded but this didn’t impact on us at all. We had breakfast in a lovely place called ‘Toast’ around the corner, this was a pretty basic breakfast, but to add to it wasn’t expensive at all 😊. Oh & to add to this from the rooftop there is an amazing view of the Empire State Building & Macy’s. Thank you guys for an amazing stay 😉

title: Not bad at all!!
text: Simple hotel with great staff who were most helpful and courteous. Room is clean and bed was mega comfy to two very fussy people! No bar or restaurant which would have been nice. Right by maceys and a fab view of empire state from the roof... Would stay again with no hesitation!!

title: Would not stay anwhere else in NYC
text:
This was our 4th stay at the Metro and we would not stay anywhere else when we visit New York, the hotel is undergoing some modification and I have taken this into account when scoring and still rate it as excellent! We stayed on the 6th floor in a Queen Room and whilst they are compact you don't go to NYC to stay in your room and the rooms are priced accordingly, so we knew what to expect. Rooms are clean and comfortable, and even though building work was taking place on the floor below us we heard no noise, other than external AC units from a building next to us.

Beds are comfortable and rooms well equipped for their size. We had an issue with the safe which I reported to reception (the previous occupant had locked the safe) and it was rectified in minutes.

We were aware that the buffet breakfast was hosted off-site due to the building work and we were given vouchers to take to a nearby deli, this was disappointing staff were mercenary and food at best mediocre, but there is nothing the Metro can do about this and it would be unfair to adjust the rating. Although all staff at the Metro were friendly and efficient, Stan on reception was extremely helpful throughout our stay.

The hotel is well located for everything and when we return we will of course book the Metro

title: Short break in October 2018
text:
Spent 5 nights in this hotel to celebrate my partner's big birthday.  Couldn't have been a better choice!  The location is excellent and the staff could not do enough.  The renovations going on didn't cause any problems at all - whilst it was a shame that the Metro Grill Restaurant wasn't available, it is well worth visiting Brendan's just across the road for an excellent lunch or dinner and I am sure that when all the building words re completed the Metro Grill will be great!  The hotel organised a simple continental breakfast just around the corner which was a good start to the day.
The room, a King Contemporary Room, was spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed.
Would strongly recommend this hotel - perfect location just a short stroll from many top landmarks and very close to the subway.

title: What a great hotel
text: Arrived from JFK and was instantly made welcome by the check-in staff. Our pre-arrival requests had been actioned and they had even upgraded our rooms free of charge. Great location, clean, comfortable and welcoming.

title: Lovely Hotel/Great Location
text:
Stayed in premium room on the 11th floor with a great view of the Empire State Building.
Room had everything you needed including a fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer, iron, safe. We had welcome soft drinks in the fridge when we arrived which was a nice touch. Beds are comfy, and housekeeping kept everything tidy and clean. No bath as in most central hotels but the shower had 3 shower heads! 
Free coffee and tea are available 24hrs in the reception which was great, as others have stated the breakfast atm is from a deli around the corner called toast, we went every morning collected the fruit juice and pastries and popped them into the fridge for later. You have a large choice of pastries to choose from or plain bagels/cream cheese or egg. 
The room terrace has amazing views of the Empire State Building and you have access 24hrs, there a few chairs and tables to sit at, so you can take your own food/drink up and soak up the noises, atmosphere. There’s also a gym up there which we never used.
Location is great too, easy walk to Times Square, Macy’s and Empire State are on you doorstep with lots of places to sit in and eat or take away around you too. Subway is a minutes walk away which we found easy to use having never used any before!
With the hotel’s bar/restaurant being closed for refurb we tried the Irish bar down the street and enjoyed the cocktails. 
The hotels refurb didn’t impact or stay at all, you barely know it’s happening. Only clue is occasionally a workman got in the lift!
Staff at reception were helpful and welcoming. Thank you!

title: Overall - Amazing !!
text:
What a Fab Stay here ! just came back from our weekend away here ... 

On Arrival had been upgraded on our room stayed in a premier twin queen room ! So clean .. maids were fab and friendly.. tea and coffee free in the lobby was a little touch of extra.. the beds were so comfy so sleep on.. 

location was brill... 2 min walk from macys and empire .. easy to get to from subway and timessquare without getting lost.. 

staff were really friendly.. 

only thing was breakfast free was given a voucher for a restaurant around the corner that was just bagels... so ended up eating else where but still no horrible looking! 

overall stay amazing !!! 

i will return and recommend

title: Fantastic
text:
Fantastic stay for our first trip to New York, would stay here again, the rooms are clean, spacious and welcoming, the bottle of wine for our 30th anniversary was a lovely touch although I think it was meant to say 40th birthday but the thought was still there. 
The staff are amazing, very helpful and welcoming and nothing’s too much trouble 
The location is also good, right next to Times Square, you can catch the underground tube almost right outside the hotel
We are only half way through our break away and look forward to enjoying a few more nights staying in this lovely hotel

title: Visit to New York
text:
Dear Metro Hotel, 
Thank you for making my first visit to New York that bit more special, thank you for the bottle of wine for my birthday which was enjoyed on the roof top terrace, and thank you for the complimentary tins of coke.  We loved the hotel thought it was very retro and gave us the romantic feel of New York back in the 40s and 50s, the staff were always polite and helpful. The bed was comfortable, very clean and house keeping was impeccable. I enjoyed reading the complimentary copy of the New York Times each day, we would definitely stay with you again.

title: Désastreux
text:
Chambre minuscule et salle de bain ne correspondant pas à la publicité! L'hôtel étant en réfection il n'assumait pas les petits déjeuners il fallait marcher au froid env. 300 m. pour que le patron du toast café nous octroie une minuscule bouteille de jus d'orange et un muffin pas frais en sachet! Nous devions demander chaque jour un bon le personnel n'acceptant pas d'en donner pour la totalité du 
séjour payé hélas d'avance! Le jour du départ il n'y avait pas de salon où patienter jusqu au moment du départ en fin de journée! 
Nous ne pouvons pas recommander cet hôtel! La publicité des 
catalogues ne correspond pas aux prestations fournies .

title: Me gusto mucho
text:
Al llegar nos atendieron increíble muy amables, el check in es a las 16 hrs así que Floyd se encargó amablemente de nuestras maletas, está muy bien ubicado aparte de tener el metro a un lado, la habitación era enorme y por cierto muy limpia
Lo recomiendo ampliamente!

title: Great hotel, great staff & great location!
text: Stayed here for 3 nights - big rooms, comfy beds - had a great nights sleep every night, it was quite. Hotel lobby staff were great, the hotel was clean, complimentary tea/coffee in our room & we got a complimentary breakfast token for the coffee bar around the corner that got us a drink & a bagel. The rooftop bar doesn't actually have a bar - but you can take your own! It has an incredible view of the empire state building from the rooftop bar (See photo!)

title: Perfectly located hotel to explore the sights of Manhattan!
text:
The Hotel Metro is perfectly located to explore Manhattan.  From our bedroom window we looked out to Herald Square and Macy's.  We could also see the Empire State Building which is just one street away.  Times Square and Broadway are just about a 7 minute walk.  We walked from the Hotel down to Battery Park to take our boat over to see the Statute of Liberty.  This gave us a wonderful chance to see everything along the way and take in the feel of the city, and explore squares and streets we perhaps wouldn't have had if we'd taken the bus/subway.  Nothing is particularly far from the Hotel and well within walking distance.  

Upon arrival at the Hotel we were upgraded to a suite which was a lovely surprise, particularly as we'd gone for my husband's birthday.  This was a real bonus.  The beds are incredibly comfortable, shower very efficient and there is lots of space in the room for luggage.  There is also a safe for valuables. 

The Hotel itself is very clean, well tended and whilst they were having renovation works it didn't affect us at all.  We were given breakfast vouchers which we used really as a snack as there is so much choice of eateries from the second you step outside.  The hotel cleaning crew were meticulous and our towels changed daily, everything was spotless.  The reception staff were very helpful and able to offer assistance and advice when required.  There were tea and coffee making facilities in room as well as in the reception area.  We did go up to the terrace area a couple of times to take in the view and relax.  

If we were to visit NYC again we'd definitely stay here.

title: Great Hotel located ideally for exploring City attractions
text:
We made two return stays either side of a cruise out of Brooklyn which worked out perfectly to prepare for and wind down after the cruise in a very relaxed hotel environment.
Rooms provided were outstanding in both decor and cleanliness and staff could not have been more courteous and helpful.
Although the adjoining bistro restaurant is currently closed due to a major refurbishment, but which was un-noticeable in terms of noise disruption, the hotel has helpfully made alternative temporary continental buffet breakfast arrangements at a nearby deli.
The hotel’s location affords easy access to Herald Square and Times Square is within reasonable walk distance. Subway access is available at the next intersection making access  to the rest of the City within easy reach.
A roof terrace affords outstanding views of the nearby Empire State building and a well equipped adjacent exercise room is available to help burn off some of the easily acquired extra calories!
The hotel remains a firm NYC  favourite which never disappoints.

title: The Highlight of trip to New York
text:
Got a really cheap deal to stay here for a few days whilst touring USA, probably as the hotel was under renovation at the time so some facilities such as the restaurant were not open at the time.

This hotel was probably our favourite part of staying in New York. Great location, beautiful art deco interior, immaculate, and the roof terrace was wonderful. Breakfast was good and drinks available all day. Ice bucket and fridge in room, along with a safe for valuables. Great stay.

title: Lovely hotel
text: stayed at the metro back in May 2018. First time to New York and the USA.  I wasn't disappointed.  Lovely hotel and room was clean, tidy and comfortable.  Loved the roof top terrace, was up there every night for a relaxing sit down and drink after a mad busy day exploring the city and for a fantastic view of the Empire state building.  The hotel is situated in a great area too, great array of shops inc Macy's, Pandora and much much more.  plenty of places to grab a bite to eat and there was a lovely little pizza/pasta place a few doors down from the hotel plus subway at the end of the block. Definetly somewhere I would stay again :-)

title: Gem of a hotel
text: We are sadly leaving this excellent hotel today after 4 nights here. What a find! Fabulous location, comfortable and spotlessly clean room and bathroom. Complimentary tea and coffee machine in room. Friendly and helpful staff.make sure you don't miss fantastic views of the empire state building from the roof terrace! Unmissable!

title: Perfect location
text: We got a warm welcome soon as we stepped out of a taxi. Checking in was a breeze with a lovely young lady.  We were also given a free upgrade to a premier room free of charge. There is 24 hour reception, so there is always someone to help with any problems if they arise. It also offers room service too. Its clean and has maid service everyday. The door staff always had a welcoming smile for us as we were coming and going throughout the day. Great location for visiting all attractions. Great view of Empire State Building from the roof terrace bar. Its near the subway so getting round is so easy. Macy's is on the same street. I loved it. We will certainly stay at this hotel on our next visit to Manhattan.

title: DISAPPOINTING
text: Could only open bathroom door about a third  as it was hitting the bed. Insufficient room for  second suitcase. Room was noisy from people walking around upstairs and street noise. Keycard states complimentary breakfast but this was not included. Restaurant was closed for renovations, and they could not provide wine glasses only paper cups. Only assistance front desk could offer was to upgrade room at an additional cost. The only good thing about the hotel is the location and the rooftop.

title: Great location
text:
Metro hotel is in an ideal location for visiting attractions, close to Macy’s and Empire State Building.
Room well appointed bed very comfortable 
Housekeeping service excellent. Some parts of the hotel are being refurbished including the dinning area however this caused no disruption to our stay.
Reception staff and door staff extremely helpful through out our stay.
Roof terrace is an excellent feature with views of the Empire State Building where you can take yours drinks on an evening.
Due to the referbishments breakfast vouchers where available from reception every morning to use at the Toast Deli round the corner from the hotel. Options a little disappointing as voucher only entitles you to a bagel or muffin with a coffee or juice. The store has a large variety of other hot and cold food which is excellent quality so we would advised skipping the breakfast option when booking as there are plenty of other places close to the hotel with lots of choice.
We had s fantastic stay and will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to New York.

title: Celebrating a special occasion
text:
The hotel could not do enough for my special occasion. They up graded our room and left a bottle of bubbly to enjoy.
We have stayed before in this hotel it’s very central clean and just what you need. They also have a roof terrace that you can see the Empire State Building magical.

title: great location
text:
we stayed here for 4 nights in april.  i had been previously and stayed next door at the hilton garden inn.  in terms of rooms, the hilton was much nicer but during our stay they were upgrading rooms.  this was one of the few hotels where they didnt charge additional tax which was why i chose it for our trip.

this hotel is so well placed to get around, macys is just over the road, have the subway at the end of the street, and down the next block andrews coffee shop which is a must visit.

the room itself wasnt anything special it was clean, but small as you will find in nyc.  on the first night we were awoken at 3am with works going on outside....i went downstairs to the nightporter and we were moved quickly to another room without any questions.  this room was slightly bigger and for all the time you spend in your room whilst in nyc it is more than ample.

on a few occassions we took advantage of breakfast and took some muffins to go but mostly we ate at andrews for breakfast

if i go back to nyc i would stay here again due to the great location.  there is also a rooftop terrace with amazing views of the empire state building.

for a good no frills, well placed hotel you cant really beat this

title: ＮＹではコスパ最高
text: みなさんお書きの通り、立地が良く朝食付きでこのお値段はマンハッタンでは他に見つけられないかと思います。近くにコリアンタウンもあるので、美味しい韓国料理がいただけるのも魅力です。コスパ重視という方にはオススメです。

title: Not as good as it was
text: I have stayed in Hotel Metro four times over the last couple of years. Unfortunately my most recent stay was not as good as previous stays. Due to renovations metro grill is closed and there was no breakfast available. Breakfast was always provided previously (the keycard also stated a complimentary breakfast was provided). However despite this we were informed that it was not included ( we booked a deluxe room). I am not sure if this was just due to the renovation work and if it will return when work is complete. Reception desk staff were not very friendly this time and there were no restrooms in the lobby area ( due to renovations). Location is very good but there are several other hotels nearby.

title: A little disappointed......
text: This was our second visit to NY and decided to stay at the same hotel given our previous experiences ! Although we booked our week long stay in April, we were only notified of works to be carried out in the Grill/Pantry areas in July, as well as refurbishment of the 2nd/3rd and 4th floors of the hotel. These works will be continuing till the end of 2018. Although the noise was never intrusive it was was a disappointment that the Bar/Grill was available as the food was superb when we stayed previously. We are obviously aware of New York never sleeps but try and avoid a road facing room if possible - it is noisy all day apart from a quiet spot between 2am and 4.30am !! Reception staff not very interactive but the various doormen on duty were very pleasant and helpful. The continental option for breakfast was obviously not available whilst refurbishment and we had daily vouchers for a diner around the corner called ' Toast ' - not the best in terms of quality. We had occasion to walk down the stairs as the lifts were busy and seen the quality of the restyle of the rooms being worked on due to the doors not being fitted yet and l have to say they look very very good ! In terms of an all round package as a hotel l would probably have avoided until the works are completed and the Bar and Grill reopened based on our previous experience had we had the option but we had already paid in advance with no option to cancel without loss of monies. Would certainly stay again as location is good !

title: Très bien situé
text:
Séjour de 4 nuits en avril 2018

Bon rapport qualité/prix, avec un service de petit déjeuner, ce qui est rare pour New York.

Personnel sympatique, chambre de taille correcte et propre. Décoration typique et bonne literie.

Très bien situé en plein coeur de Manhattan, juste en face de l'Empire State Building : les attractions phares de la ville sont accessibles à pieds.

Cette situation centrale implique du bruit nocturne : pensez aux boules quiès en cas de sommeil fragile ...

Nous sommes satisfaits et reviendrons certainement dans cet hôtel.

title: Buena relación calidad-precio y excelente ubicación.
text: Lo elegimos por su ubicación cerca de la estacion y tambien por el precio. No nos arrepentimos: justi al lado del Empire y una buena habitación a pesar de tratarse de un edificio antiguo y con decoración clásica.  Una sorpresa bastante agradable fue el desayuno, pues pensabamos que no estaba incluido, aunque es en un establecimiento justo a la vuelta de la esquina. También  hay café y té gratis en el hall,  además de disponer de csfetera en la propia habitación.  Ha sido mi segunda visita a NYC y no queriamos pagar tanto como la anterior, pues íbamos además a Chicago. No nos arrepentimos.

title: 30th birthday trip to NYC
text:
We stayed at the Hotel Metro in Mid March for my 30th birthday. We were there for a week in a queen room with a view of the Empire State. It was absolutely breath taking. The hotel is Art Deco in style, nicely maintained and in an excellent location extremely close to Macy’s and the Empire State. The hotel has an excellent roof top terrace which we didn’t get round to seeing until the last day (big mistake) and lovely communal areas. 
Make sure to take advantage of the wine tasting evenings when you’re there, best value glass of wine we had in all of NYC and decent too. 
The breakfast was a life (and money) saver buying us valuable time to explore NYC. Breakfast consisted of bagels, muffins, toast and cereals with water, fruit juices, tea and coffee. Excellent range of breakfast items and all very fresh and delicious. 
The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful going out of their way with recommendations of places to eat when we were stuck one night and leaving chocolates in our room for my birthday.
The only reason for my four star review was our room was a little small and the light switches/plugs kept giving us little electric shocks. It would be a 4.5 star review if TripAdvisor allowed it. 
New York City is an exceptional place that we fell in love with and would not hesitate to stay at the Metro when we return. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a central location and comfortable stay.

title: Semester
text: Va här 2015, vi trivdes bra nära till allt. Rooftop va lite risigt ,men skulle åtgärdas nästa år. Frukosten va helt ok, dom hade precis börjat med den. Nu återvänder vi 2018 till ett hotell som är som en byggarbetsplats,  utan vår vetskap 27000kr mer kostade rummet denna gången. Frukosten fanns inte , fast vi hade betalt för en Continental frukost . Vi fick en biljett och fick gå ut på stan till ett ställe och käka. Där fick man välja på en muffins,  beagle eller en äggmacka. Till det kaffe eller en liten juice thats it . I 11 dagar skulle vi äta det, vem äter en super söt muffin till frukost ? Klagade gjorde vi till ingen nytta personalen behöver nog gå en charmkurs. En ung kille som va portiär va väldigt glad och trevlig så han fick dricks. Vi kommer tillbaka till New York  men inte till Hotel Metro.

title: First visit to NYC
text: Stayed here for 4 nights, lovely hotel, perfect location. Staff very friendly and helpful only drawback was the breakfast due to having renovations (which didn’t affect us) the breakfast wasn’t available so we had to go to a place round the corner called ‘Toast’ which wasn’t very nice and had to have the same thing everyday no variations the staff followed us round in case we had something which wasn’t on the menu for the hotel. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Hotel Metro, in the shadow of Empire State Building.
text: This was our HQ for 5 nights. We took the train from Newark to Penn station, 10 minute walk from there to the hotel.  On arrival at the hotel we were checked very quickly and with a warm smile from the receptionist. Bedrooms, comfortable  but need updating, which is currently under way. Restaurant and bar were under refurbishment, so hard to judge service levels. Roof top area has a great view of the empire state building. The hotel is very close to Times Square, Grand Central, 20 minutes from Central park. Location is spot on. If you like walking, you could walk to most attractions in 30-40 mins, no better way to see the city. Very close to the Korean district, there are great places to eat with a few bars for a quick pit stop around as well. If I make it back to New York, this hotel will be top of the list. Its a good spot.

title: Hotel très bien placé
text:
Le grand point fort de l'hôtel est probablement son emplacement qui vous positionne au coeur de New York.
Les chambres sont très spacieuses (50m2) même si la décoration mériterait peut-être d'être un peu plus moderne.
Buffet déjeuner varié et conséquent
Au global, je le qualifie de bon rapport qualité prix avec un positionnement Intermediaire+

title: Must stay in New York
text: Lovely, classic New York hotel in the heart of Mditown. Minutes form Macy's and Fifth Avenue, with rooftop terrace views of the Empire State building (Which you can also walk to quickly). Lovely helpful staff who were caring and great when I needed them. Restaurant was closed but had vouchers at lovely local brasserie for breakfast and plenty of restaurants nearby. Lovely quite room with fridge, safe and amazingly comfortable bed. Tea and coffee as well as welcome drinks and toiletries. Didn't want to leave x

title: 2 Pleasant Nights
text: I spent two nights at this hotel.  On the first night I stayed in a room with a single queen bed.  It was small but comfortable and well maintained.  The bellman was cranky and rude but we didn't have to interact with him much so that was okay.  The second night was in a room with two beds for an upgrade fee of $60us.  It was more spacious and equally comfortable.  This room had a window in the shower which was nice.  The bath faucet handle was broken but the faucet itself still functioned.  The restaurant was closed for renovations so I can't comment on that.

title: Excellent location, spotless
text:
We are just after checking out of hotel metro and were delighted we stayed here. We normally don’t stay in 3 star but to my surprise this was excellent. Firstly the location what can I say excellent, right off 5 Th ave and herald square less than a 2 min stroll this is where Macy s is for all the shoppers. The hotel is 10 min walk to Times Square and Broadway. It has easy access to metro at 34th herald square or easy access to metro penne station which will bring u direct to Times Square, 50 Th street for broadway show, 66 Th lincoin Centre for century 21 & Central Park! 
Hotel is spotless, Hats off to the staff, they supply free coffee/ tea making facility in lobby. They also upgraded us to queen room on 12 floor and left 2 bottles water & chocolate for our wedding anniversary (thank you). The hotel is 30-45 mins from JFK depending on traffic and will cost $70 in a taxi.
If we return to NYC we will stay here again excellent value.

title: Holiday
text: The hotel was lovely and had a great roof top with views of The Empire State Building. However, the kitchen was being refurbished so we couldn’t get any breakfast and there was no bar available. Not what you need when you’re on holiday. Moreover this has not stopped me wanting to go back I loved my time in NYC and can’t wait to be back there.

title: Excellent!
text:
My boyfriend and I had been stayed here for 7 days at the beginning of August. 
Very clean hotel, friendly staff, rooftop with a wonderful view, great breakfast included and location top to visit NYC ... EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!

title: Nice hotel and location
text: Nice hotel, not very fancy but it doesn't matter. It is located just a 15 min walk to time square and cirka 30 min to central park. One block away you have very nice shopping, like victoria secret, target etc. This hotel has a roof top were you have a great view over empire state building, it is right next to the hotel. Nice and clean room. Overall a good stay

title: Long weekend in New York
text: A great hotel with very friendly staff. Fantastic location. There are some renovations on going in the hotel but it’s not affecting guests. The roof top terrace is great too. Breakfast is served around the corner in a cafe during the renovation to their restaurant. This is not a problem either.

title: Hotel in Top-Lage mit toller Dachterrasse
text:
Das Metro ist ein mittelgroßes, klassisches Hotel in perfekter Lage in Midtown Manhattan. Derzeit wird renoviert, aber wir haben die Arbeiten nicht als störend empfunden. Das Personal im Hotel war durchweg freundlich und hilfsbereit, die öffentlichen Bereiche sind gepflegt und attraktiv gestaltet.
Gebucht hatten wir einen Contemporary Queen Room für vier Nächte - zu einem unschlagbaren Preis. Vor Ort erhielten wir ein überraschenderweise riesiges Familienzimmer, das aus zwei Räumen bestand und jede Menge Platz bot. Die Einrichtung war etwas veraltet (die Renovierungen stehen ja zum Teil noch an), aber funktionell und ordentlich. Wir haben uns überaus wohl gefühlt! Im Zimmer standen Kühlschrank und Kaffeemaschine bereit. In der Lobby konnte man sich außerdem rund um die Uhr einen Kaffee oder Tee holen. 
Statt Frühstück im Hotel gab es einen Gutschein für ein Frühstück im nahegelegen Toast Café, vermutlich wegen der Renovierungsarbeiten. Der Gutschein beinhaltete einen sehr großen Kaffee (mehr als ein halber Liter - willkommen in Amerika!) und wahlweise einen Bagel (mit Frischkäse oder Ei) oder einen Muffin. Wir waren damit durchaus zufrieden. 

Neben der tollen Lage und der ordentlichen Ausstattung ist die Dachterrasse das Highlight des Hotels. Wir haben es sehr genossen, hier an den lauen Sommerabenden den Tag ausklingen zu lassen und den wunderbaren Blick auf das Empire State Building zu genießen. 
Fast schon schade, dass das Metro renoviert wird - so wird in Zukunft ein Aufenthalt sicherlich weniger erschwinglich sein. Sollten wir es uns weiterhin leisten können, gerne wieder ;-)

title: Superb Location - Best Value in new York
text: Without doubt  - the hotel choice for the smart traveller in Midtown Manhattan. An unbeatable location, art deco style and ambience, great service and in the Summer the roof top terrace is amazing with incredible views of the Empire State Building. There is no such thing as far as New York hotels go but this is as good as  it gets when you compare price and  location

title: Sympa
text:
Nous avons passé 4 nuits dans cet hôtel, qui est très bien situé. La vue sur l'Empire State Building depuis le toit est le point fort de cet hôtel. En revanche, nous avons dû aller chercher le petit-déjeuner dans un commerce à côté (à cause de travaux) et ça ne vaut pas le coup. De plus, le personnel à l'accueil n'est pas spécialement sympathique. En revanche, les femmes de chambre ainsi que les portiers sont très agréables. 
Concernant la clim, elle ronronne effectivement assez fort mais on peut tout de même l'éteindre.

title: Mittendrin und grundsolide
text:
Preis-Leistung ist hier überragend, die zentrale Lage mit der Subway Station am Herald Square in 50 Metern Entfernung ist superbequem, um die Trips zu beginnen. Das Hotelpersonal ist sehr freundlich, wir mussten wegen Renovierungsarbeiten in einem Deli frühstücken, was auch reibungslos funktioniert hat...
DAS Highlight ist die Dachterrasse mit direktem Blick auf das Empire State Building. Hier kann man nach dem langen und kilometerreichen Tagestrips schön runterfahren und das Erlebte revue passieren lassen. 100% Weiterempfehlung 👍

title: Great location
text: We spent six days at this hotel with friends and we’re not disappointed. The hotel is ideally situated for visiting all the major attractions of New York City. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and well equipped including coffee making equipment. The restaurant and breakfast room were unavailable as the hotel is undergoing renovations however, this did not affect our visit in any way. We will certainly visit the Metro again when we come back to New York. A big thanks to all the staff for making our stay so memorable.

title: Not as good as last time
text:
I don't like leaving negative reviews but I was disappointed in the hotel this time and I think the feedback is important as most of the things are small enough to have something done about them. We knew the restaurant / bar and lounge area was closed. Yes, this is a bit inconvenient at times (esp. when you are required to leave a credit card deposit behind the desk but there is nothing to buy). In saying that there are loads of bars and restaurants (and we really like Brendan's across the road for service and atmosphere) so whilst a bit of a pain this didn't really bother us. Yes, there are several floors that are being worked on but we didn't hear any noise. Granted we were out much of the day but we have the occasional late start and we did not hear any drilling or noise. The door boy and the cleaning staff are very good. The front desk, however, is another matter. We were greeted in a very perfunctory manner by the woman who checked us in. No welcome back, or have you stayed with us before, nothing. Basic information with no smile or anything. It then turned out she had given us the wrong room key (back up and down to the 8th floor). Generally over the course of the week (we were here seven nights) only two of the front of desk staff actually went out of their way to acknowledge us (and it was just an acknowledgment). The hotel was not especially busy and mostly the desk staff were just stood around chatting amongst themselves so we found this disappointing. On check out we simply got a 'that's it, nothing to pay' (as I said before there is nothing to buy as far as we could see!) There was no have you enjoyed your stay, have a safe trip, although the door man did say have a good journey (credit to him and shame on the front of house staff). This seemed very different to how the hotel was last time we stayed and whilst it wasn't really a major problem as such it was a bit annoying. I did begin to wonder if there was an issue about the staffing related to the hotel refurbishment as none of them looked very happy! On the positive side the location is great and the hotel does have a good internet connection (which you would expect in NY but don't always get). The thing that really made our stay was the roof terrace. The views of the Empire State Building are nothing short of spectacular and watching the sun go down there is pretty special. They do not have a roof top bar but you can take your own drinks up, which we did several times. An absolute gem, although I do have to add the terrace looks a bit less pretty pictures on the web. There are a few chairs and tables that look quite old and nothing much else. It didn't really matter as we were there for the view (as were many others) but they were short on seating and the terrace could do with some TLC. It really wouldn't take much to make the place feel cared for and cared about.

I rarely stay in the same place twice but we chose to with hotel metro as we were so impressed the first time around. Would I choose to go back? I wouldn't say no, but I would certainly look elsewhere next time

title: Not a bad little Hotel
text: Was in New York for two nights and had booked this hotel as part of a package through Trailfinders. Our room was big enough for our short stay but the bathroom was a bit of a struggle with its layout !!! Shower,sink and toilet all squeezed into a very small space.Our stay was B&B but hotel restaurant was closed for refurb so we were given a voucher each morning from the hotel reception to use in a diner around the corner!! Nothing special coffee,tea or OJ with either a bagel or muffin .If your in NYC for a short stay this hotel is fine, central location free WIFI and a roof top terrace with views of the Empire State Building

title: Enjoyable stay!
text: My son and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel Metro. Excellent midtown location, convenient to subway, Macy's, and a glorious view of the Empire State Building from the deck on the 12th floor! We would like to give a shout out to Day Manager Natasha, who was very professional and accommodating, and to our doorman Shawn! Thanks for everything!

title: Hotel muy bien situado
text:
Pasamos 5 noches el pasado mes de Julio con mi pareja. Yo lo recomendaría una y otra vez.

PUNTOS BUENOS
* La ubicación es muy buena, permite acceder andando (10-15 min, que eso en NY es cerca) a muchos de los sitios de obligada visita. Al estar bien situado, también permite que los desplazamientos en taxi (nosotros usamos Uber que es más barato y fiable) sean más cortos y por tanto más baratos.

* Tiene una terraza acondicionada con mesas desde donde se tiene una vista precisa del Empire State, tanto de día como de noche. Además puedes coger algo de cenar en los restaurantes-bares de alrededor y tomarlo en la azotea, con unas vistas únicas del Empire.

* He de decir que nos hicieron un upgrade de habitación, ya que la nuestra estaba en obras (ni nos enteramos de ellas) y por tanto la habitación era muy espaciosa. El baño estaba totalmente reformado y la cama era muy cómoda. 

* Debido también a las obras, no se podía desayunar en el hotel (éste es de los pocos hoteles que tiene desayuno incluido en NY) y nos mandaban a un 24h que estaba al girar la esquina (2 min andando). Este sitio estaba genial y nos sirvió como idea para cenas ya que tenían de todo.

No sabría destacar nada malo del hotel.

title: well situated
text:
was put on 10th floor under gym and was disturbed by people using running machine and weights, complained to front desk and was moved next day to 4th floor. Very well situated for walking to most of Manhattan and subway very near. Staff very helpful and friendly and rooms clean and well appointed. Not a great selection of eateries nearby but enough for a short stay, but plenty if you go a bit further afield. Roof terrace is great especially if they have wine tasting about 5pm in breakfast room and you take your glass up. Night view of Empire State building and Macy's great. Breakfast adequate but had short wait to get seat when everyone came at once.
Would stay here again.

title: City trip
text: Mooi gerenoveerd hotel met rooftop waar je uitzicht op empire state bulding hebt vriendelijk behulpzaam personeel ontbijt is niet zoveel centrale ligging zeer drukke stad 3 dagen is wel te weinig om alles te zien zeker naar top of the rock gaan daar heb je uit zicht over Hans New York en centraal park ook de moeite

title: Nice, but...
text:
We have stayed here several times. First. The pros:
1. Location. 
2. Great cleaning staff
3. Roomy

Cons:
1. Endless renovation. Several floors completely inaccessible. 
2. Restaurant closed. Had to go up the street for ONE bagel or muffin  and drink. 
3. For the first time the staff. Typically they are jovial and very helpful. This time they were preoccupied and unfriendly. The doorman never even opened a door!?

If you want a hotel that’s conveniently close to everything. This might be your place. But don’t expect them to go the extra mile for service. Not even the extra half mile. Hell we would have been satisfied with a 5k for service.

title: Hôtel en rénovation
text:
Bonjour,
Nous étions à l’hotel métro de New York pendant une semaine.
Excellente localisation, les chambres au décor art deco se fait un peut vieux (rénovation en court). La clim ronronne toute la nuit. 
Pour le moment il n’y a pas de petit déjeuner à l’hotel. Si vous avez réservé une chambre avec petit déjeuner vous obtiendrai un voucher à la réception.
Ceci est le gros point négatif de cet hôtel. Normalement le petit déjeuner continental est proposé dans un Lounge à côté du Lobby. Maintenant à cause des travaux le petit déjeuner se prend dans un local situer à 5 minutes à pied sur la sixième avenue, au toast café brasserie, et ce ne sera plus un buffet mais juste un café et une viennoiserie.
Donc si vous avez réserver l’hotel avec petit déjeuner, vous pouvez le faire enlever car un café et une viennoiserie c’est juste la valeur de 5$ et non 25€ comme c’est facturé chez certain tour opérateur. 
Le mieux c’est de réserver cette hôtel lorsque les travaux serons fini, c’est à dire l’année prochaine en 2019.

title: Terrific location, service and value
text: This hotel is an absolute gem!  Its location near Herald Square allows easy access to anywhere in the city.  The service is excellent and immediate.  The beds are comfy, the rooms are well appointed and the price is definitely right.   It’s undergoing some renovation at the moment, which means little regarding the overall experience.  I look forward to my next stay!

title: Great location, service and breakfast!
text: We stayed here on our honeymoon and we were greeted by a lovely card and bottle of fizzy wine in our room. I personally loved the bagels at breakfast, they tasted like NY! The rooftop terrace is a huge feature of this hotel as its spectacular view of the Empire State is well worth a look. We recently booked to visit again in January and we're pleased with the price for the quality of stay we knew we were getting.

title: Terrible, did not want to honor Priceline reservation, smelly, old, yuck!
text: We tried to check in at midnight and the desk guy said he'd never heard of Priceline. We gave him the confirmation number, and showed him the email confirming the reservation and the fact it was paid in full. He said the hotel wasn't on Priceline and he never even heard of it! After standing around for twenty minutes arguing, he grudgingly gave us the room we paid for. We got in and it's old (circa 1990s) with a terrible Lysol stench and mold in the bathroom. Hair on the pillows, stains everywhere. Just disgusting. View of an alley. And we paid $250!! Never, ever again. Avoid this place.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We visited for 6 days and our stay was almost perfect. Rooms are small, but very clean and the hotel location is great. The roof terrace is lovely to take your own drinks of an evening. The only thing which slightly let us down was the breakfast that we paid for with our stay. We were given vouchers for a very limited breakfast in a cafe around the corner, so we ended up paying for Starbucks every morning.

title: belle prestaton et très bien situé
text:
Nous avons séjourné à l'hôtel METRO du 3 au 10 juillet 2018. La situation géographique permet de de déplacer aisément dans Manhattan (à  pied ou pour accéder aux transports en commun). L'entretien de la chambre est très bien fait. Notre chambre disposait d'un réfrigérateur.
Allez sur le toit pour la vue sur l'Empire State Building.
Des travaux étaient en cours pendant notre séjour. Par conséquent le grill n'était pas accessible. Le petit déjeuner est un régal de bagels :-).

title: Well placed hotel but reception staff were poor
text:
The hotel itself is currently undergoing reservations and is run down and certain floors are completely being redone and you can see all this being done as you walk up and down the stairs and go in the lifts. 

The breakfast was good for a 3 star hotel with fruit, yoghurts, cereal, toast and bagels (sometimes muffins depending on how early you got there) however it could be a 5-10 minute wait to get a table most days and we were lucky that the roof was open so we decided to eat up there on a lot of occasions. 
The reception staff are really quite unhelpful and not very welcoming and just seem more interested in gossiping or looking at their phones with each other than actually helping their guests. They were quicker to respond to room issues and the other staff working at the hotel who fixed our air conditioning and safe for us were very helpful and the maids did an excellent job of keeping the rooms clean. 
The hotel is in a fantastic location, the views from the roof terrace were amazing even though we were told a month or so before travelling it was shut (it wasn’t). The rooms themselves are basic and small which we didn’t find an issue really as we were out of the hotel most of the time. We had a room that just looked out into walls and windows but it meant minimal road noise so that was good. The air conditioning unit was horrendous it was SO loud so if you’re a light sleeper bring some earplugs. 
I’d definitely stay here again and the hotel is fine if you’re not really bothered about the 5* hotel experience and just want a base from which to explore.

title: Perfect for a quick stay
text:
Stayed here at the start of July for a birthday trip and can fully recommend. 
Hotel is located in midtown in an excellent location close to lots of tourist sites and is very close to a subway. 
The hotel itself is decorated in an Art Deco style the rooms a pretty decent size for New York! Clean and staff welcoming. 
There’s currently building work going on to refurbish the restaurant but we found it to be unobtrusive although I’m sure some rooms may hear more than others. 
All in all I would stay again.

title: Gute Lage
text: Kleines Zimmer, enges Bad, grosser TV. Das Hotel ist etwas in die Jahre gekommen, liegt jedoch zentral (Subway mit diversen Linien in unmittelbarer Nähe), deshalb gut geeignet für einen Städtetripp. Frühstück dürftig, deshalb haben wir meistens nicht im Hotel gefrühstückt. Schöne Aussicht von der Dachterasse.

title: A real gem!
text: Check in was very efficient and even better when we were advised that we had been upgraded to a suite! Room 1204 which we think must be the best room in the hotel! We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building from our bedroom which was only topped by the view from the roof terrace! Room was clean and kept clean by the amazing housekeeping team! Breakfast was absolutely fine, with 9am being the busiest time. The hotel is in an excellent position for Times Square and obviously EBS, together with Macy. There is a subway station at the end of the street which is a great way to get around. Surprised how cheap the taxis were too, from Macy’s to Washington Square Memorial was $9 with tip. Recommend Andrew’s Coffee Shop for an all American breakfast! Would definitely stay here again and would recommend.

title: Great location, good size rooom
text: This location is perfect, bang in the middle of everything but not too noisy or busy. Could walk everywhere in nyc from this hotel. The rooms are a little dated but are currently under renovation. They were impeccably clean and the bed was very comfy. Bathrooms good and again very clean.

title: Viaggio a New York Fantastico
text: Tutto perfetto, pulizia giornaliera, personale cordiale, la posizione è veramente ottima, a pochi passi dal centro è vicinissimo alla metro, peccato solo che la colazione ci è stata servita in hotel solo 3 giorni, gli altri giorni ci hanno mandato in un posto lì vicino con un voucher dove ci facevano prendere gratuitamente un muffin e una tazza di caffè. Consigliatissimo !!!

title: 5 star experience
text:
We just stayed at the hotel for the last 3 nights and this is definitely the place where I will stay when I come back!

It is super clean, bed is super comfortable, staff really helpful and the location is just the best! 

I can only recommend it!

title: Excellent location, clean & friendly hotel. Added bonus of rooftop terrace facing Empire State building
text: Quick and efficient check-in with the pleasant surprise notification of a complimentary wine tasting each evening and continental breakfast included along with tea/coffee facility 24/7.  Neither of these additions were advertised or marketed as benefits when I booked so this is a very nice touch. Premium twin room was large, clean, had very comfortable beds and was quiet. The breakfast was a lovely touch, with tea, coffee, yoghurts, cereal, muffins, toast, and bagels along with cream cheese available.   it is easy to access subways, Penn Station, Times Square, and stops for the hopon hopoff bus routes making it a perfect location in midtown for a base. I would definitely return with the family as the double double rooms are perfect for a family of 4.

title: Great location, reasonably priced, needs some improvement
text:
Pros: Great location, comfy bed, clean, fridge, tea/coffee machine in room, fresh milk available from breakfast room (available 24/7) and fridge to keep it in, in room safe, efficient wi-fi and air conditioning (but v noisy), few steps from metro station, no noise experienced from renovation work, resolved problem with air conditioning quickly, chocolates in room on arrival and happy birthday message.
Cons: steps up to door, no one to help with luggage, was told by one member of staff that the hotel could book a helicopter trip but they couldn't, breakfast very basic with plastic cutlery (was free though and not offered by many hotels), during renovation work breakfast room has halved in size but same number of guests so have to queue to get in at most popular times, no bar, one of the lifts has a hole in the floor.

title: Very conveniently located.  Overall, a very positive experience!
text: We go to Manhattan somewhat regularly to visit our daughter.  Because we generally need easy access to both Penn and Grand Central Station, we try to stay in the same area.  This was our first experience at Hotel Metro.  All went quite well!  The staff at the desk were extremely nice and helpful.  The room was nice size (for NYC) and clean.  It was nice having access to a cup of hot tea (free) in the afternoon.  Overall, we'd definitely will stay here again.

title: Perfect hotel for family vacation
text: We stayed in a Contemporary Family room and it was perfect for our family of four. The kids each had their own double bed, and there was a queen size bed in another room for the adults. Both rooms were large, and we had plenty of room  and were very comfortable. The bath was also a great size, and there is a separate sink and mirror outside the main bathroom. The hotel was very quiet. We never heard any other guests. The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff did a great job every day. The room was clean,; towels were replaced each day, as well as toiletries. We never had to ask for anything. There is a safe in the room also. We  received a complimentary breakfast each morning. It consisted of bagels, toast, cereals, yogurt, fruit, and a good choice of beverages. The hotel is in a great location. The subway stop is at the end of the block. Overall, the hotel was perfect for our stay, and would be my top choice of hotels if we return to NYC.

title: Schönes Hotel in zentraler Lage!
text:
Haben eine Woche in New York City im Hotel Metro verbracht.
Grundsätzlich können wir das Hotel empfehlen. Da während unseres Aufenthalts Renovierungsarbeiten durchgeführt wurden, konnten wir das zugehörige Restaurant nicht ausprobieren und die Dachterrasse konnte deswegen ebenso nicht genutzt werden.
Generell sind das Hotel und und die Zimmer ordentlich eingerichtet und vor allem sauber. Zimmergröße ist OK, allerdings haben wir hier für Manhattan auch keinen Vergleichswert. Leider war die AC relativ laut, lief daher nur tagsüber, wenn wir nicht im Hotel waren, zum schlafen haben wir sie meist deaktiviert. Hatten allerdings ein noch nicht renoviertes Zimmer. Hat sich möglicherweise gebessert. Zimmerservice stets gut und auch freundlich. Am Empfang war das Personal ebenso freundlich und hilfsbereit. Vom Frühstück darf man eigentlich nicht viel erwarten. Selbst für ein continental breakfast kennen wir aus anderen US Hotels ein größeres Angebot (Gab Bagels, Toast, Muffins, Joghurt, Butter, Marmelade, O-Saft und Kaffee). Leider müssen wir unseren Vorrednern recht geben, Nachhaltigkeit ist nicht gegeben, daher auch ein Punkt Abzug. Haben daher auch öfter mal um die Ecke auswärts gefrühstückt.
Die Lage ist bei dieser Preisklasse einfach der Hammer! Größere Metrostation direkt vor der Tür, Time Square in Laufreichweite, Restaurants um die Ecke, Empire State Building in der nächsten Querstraße.

title: Worst customer service experience
text: I came here to stay with my girlfriend for one night after pre-paying online at an incredibly reasonable price. When we arrived, the hotel looked lovely on the inside and parking was within walking distance. However; the staff was incredibly disrespectful, rude and unwilling to help. After some confusion with the booking, we were not given a room and told to find another place to stay. We asked for help and were told that they "didn't know what we should do" and basically told good luck in attempting to find a room at 4:00 on a Saturday night in New York City. We were not given our money back up front and ended up paying for a room triple the price a few blocks over. I do not recommend this hotel and will never attempt to stay here again.

title: Hotel Metro Surpassed All of Our Expectations!
text: Last September, I took my Mom on a trip to NYC to celebrate her 88th birthday. I chose the Hotel Metro because of its proximity to Macy's, my mom's favorite dept. store which she frequented thousands of times when she lived in New York. I never thought that this hotel would surpass all of our expectations, but it certainly did! We absolutely loved the accommodations! The staff was so kind! They added to the festivities by upgrading our room and delivering a special treat with a personalized greeting. Even without the extras, the Hotel Metro's regular amenities such as the nice breakfast and the upscale yet cozy ambiance of the hotel were very pleasing to us. The next time we plan a stay in midtown Manhattan, the Hotel Metro will be top on our list! Thank you for helping to make my Mom's birthday vacation a complete success!

title: Amazing hotel
text: We had an amazing stay at the metro hotel. It’s in a great position for visiting many of the sights. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was just what was needed; cereal, bagels, muffins, toast yoghurt mmmm. It was really reasonably priced, so had more to spend on other things. I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

title: Loved It
text:
I stayed in this hotel in February 2014 with my friend Penny Dabell for our 50th Birthdays and we loved it. The staff were friendly and helpful. Yes our room was a bit small but we only slept there. The beds were amazingly comfortable.
We are coming back in December and can’t wait to stay in this lovely cosy hotel.
.

title: Great hotel
text: Just returned from a recent holiday in New York staying at The Metro, upon arrival our room was ready and a nice touch with the chocolates and card in the room for my birthday.  The fridge was a blessing due to the weather being brilliantly hot.  The  room was a good size and cleaned every day by friendly hotel staff. The roof terrace was a delight to sit in at night admiring the Empire Building and relaxing after a busy day taking in the sites.  Reception and breakfast staff were very friendly and willing to help.  Breakfast was fresh and adequate to set you up for the day ahead. Well done everyone at the Metro.

title: Awesome hotel
text: I’ve been meaning to write this for a long time as this hotel is fantastic. It has personality and is in such a great location. This was my third visit and they upgraded us to the penthouse suite. Staff were great and the breakfast perfect. Do not hesitate to book.

title: there s better
text:
