The only good thing I can say is that the beds are comfortable, which is important, so if you think comfortable beds are a priority this is a good hotel for the price range. 
 If you think breakfast is important I would not recommend this hotel 
I can also not compare hotels cause it’s the only one I went to in New York 

Breakfast: only sugars/ carbs available ( bagels, cereals and muffins..) and some fruit and one type of yogurt, no eggs or other proteins , no peanut butter , only whole milk available, coffee does not taste great. This is really too bad because I do like a good breakfast before I start the day. 

Rooftop ; you can see the top of Empire State Building, unfortunately the rest has buildings in front of it so not much of a view 

Fitness ;has weights and cardio equipment ( everything you need) ( I had to go twice back to the lobby cause the locker didn’t work ( I only went twice and the lobby s 12 levels down .. there is an elevator lol) )

Rooms :clean but very small , comfortable beds , , plugs behind the nightable are a mess ( kind of dangerous) , air conditioner does it’s own thing.., , roommades move all your personal things around when they make the bed ( and don’t put it back, they roll everything together in a mess ( pyjamas- T-shirt- sweaters all together )  , hairdryer does not work, the soap holder falls appart

title: Get for a weekend getaway!
text:
Clean, no bedbugs, decent breakfast, great location close to shopping, empire state and restaurants. 
Elevators are a bit slow and the AC had a hard time keeping up with the heatwave but overall, happy we chose this hotel! Nice little rooftop that is good for a few minutes of downtime and quiet.

title: Lovely hotel. Great location
text: This hotel is ideal. Rooms are very clean and staff are very helpful. Breakfast is a great touch to set you up for the day. The roof terrace is great with good views of The Empire State. Excellent location and central to 5th Avenue & Broadway.  Would certainly recommend

title: Great hotel, great staff and perfect location
text:
We booked the hotel through virgin holidays and I contacted hotel in advance as it was a special birthday, on arrival we had been upgraded and a lovely note and gift in our room. The location is perfect for exploring and roof garden lovely at night to listen to the city move below you.
Staff really friendly, knowledgeable and always on hand to help. Some refurb work going on including door locks but not noticeable or noisy during our stay.

Definitely would recommend if you want to be close to broadway, 5th avenue and in the heart of the city, we were street facing but didn't find it noisy at all

Thanks hotel metro for a great stay

title: Well done
text: Have had a great stay here from. The moment we arrived to when we left rooms were spotless bigger then most New York rooms all staff were excellent helpful and polite also near everything and no noise at all

title: A great Hotel
text: This is such a fab hotel, great location, and the view from the roof top terrace is outstanding. We have no complaints about the room, the staff or the breakfast. We would recommend The Hotel Metro, and should we be lucky enough to return to New York we will be booking a room here.

title: HOTEL SUPER BIEN SITUE +++
text:
Nous sommes partis à New York du 21/03/2018 au 25/03/2018 et nous avons séjourné à l’Hôtel Metro (45 West 35th street, 10001 New York).

L’hôtel est vraiment très bien situé et facile d’accès. Les chambres sont très propres, il y a du Wifi gratuit dans tout l’hôtel. Il est l’un des rares hôtels à proposer un petit déjeuner. Celui-ci est vraiment de qualité mais vous ne trouverez que du sucré (pas d’œufs, fromage, …) mais bon ce n’est pas très grave car nous n’étions pas à New York pour rester à l’hôtel mais pour voir un maximum de choses. Cependant les muffins qu’ils proposent au déjeuner sont juste exceptionnels! Il y a une terrasse sur le toit avec une vue magnifique sur l’Empire State Building.

Au bout de la rue, vous trouverez l’accès au métro. N’hésitez pas à le prendre, il est très sécurisé (n’ayez pas peur ) ça vous permettra de faire New York d’un bout à l’autre.

Il y a beaucoup d’endroits pour manger tout autour de l’Hôtel : Mc Donald, Starbucks, Burger King, Subway, restaurants, … tout est situé entre 1’ et 15’ à pied pour manger. Vous êtes également au coin de Macy’s (super pour le Shopping).

L’hôtel est situé à 15 minutes à pied de Times Square, c’est juste incroyable !

Je recommande cet hôtel : 
- Personnel attentif
- Chambre propre
- Localisation de l'hôtel au TOP

title: Klasse Hotel, perfekte Lage!!!
text: Die Lage ist einfach unglaublich, besser geht es nicht, nur 100m zur Subway Station Herald Square. Zimmer und Bad waren sauber, Frühstück geht in Ordnung, Dachterasse ist ein Traum (hier kann man entspannt rauchen und ein Bierchen trinken mit direkter Sicht auf das Empire State Building). Sehr nettes Personal!

title: Utmärkt
text: Hotellet är mycket bra. Läget är suveränt med nära till mycket sevärdheter. Man bor nästan granne med Empire state building, vilken är vacker även i mörker, från hotellets takterrassen  som även den är ett plus. Rummen och personalen är utmärkta på alla vis. Bra frukost.

title: SITUATION AU TOP POUR VISITER CENTRE DE NEW YORK
text:
Situation central idéale pour visiter New-York, à coté du métro, de la 5ème avenue…
Hôtel simple, propre, chambre avec literie à l'arrière, calme  correcte et grande douche. Personnel très bien.
Négatif: petit déjeuner, salle seulement avec 15 petites tables donc file et buffet très sommaire, pendant 9 jours même confiture, même pain, Filadelfia fromage et rien d'autres...   
Restaurant fermé en travaux ainsi que la terrasse sur le toit!!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: I have stayed at the Metro several times, and visited again this year after a few year's break. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building. This means that Macy's and the clothing district are near by. The hotel is of an Art Deco design, and is in a good state of repair, thanks to a recent refurbishment. There is an airy reception, and the hotel also has a small bar where one can get a bite to eat and a drink. There is a business suite up the stairs on the first floor which is accessible on request of the key from reception. Rooms are of a good size and will appointed. They are kept to a high standard of cleanliness, and offer a large TV, Air conditioning, and en suite facilities. Views are variable, so try to request a city view when booking if that's what you want. Prices are typical of any hotel mid town Manhattan, and the size of the hotel means it is often fully booked, so reserve a room early to avoid disappointment. If I have one slight gripe is that you'll spend a fair bit of time waiting for the lifts!

title: Great place to stay
text:
Found this hotel on hotel.com and booked it due to location and reviews. 
It is a great location and the hotel itself is wonderful. Clean room, comfortable bed and great toiletries. 
Free breakfast which I wasn’t expecting and free wine daily which again I had no idea was included. 
Roof top patio great to hang out on between the days activities and dinner with your glass of wine.
Highly recommended and will stay again.

title: Lovely hotel right in the centre of Manhattan.....
text:
This was a great hotel located a block away from the Empire State Building; it was central to everything we wanted to do and the subway and many bars and restaurants were close by. The rooms were very clean and typical of New York, quite small but adequate. The buffet breakfast was good serving a selection of muffins, bagels, fruit and cereals. There was always coffee and tea on tap all day. We had a room near the top floor and went out to the roof terrace and the views of the Empire State Building was amazing (especially at night as it all lit up).
Would certainly recommend this hotel.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel with friendly staff. Brilliant location and a subway at the end of the street. This was our second stay and would highly recommend. Rooms are very clean. Breakfast that is provided in the morning is muffins, bagels, fruits and yougarts.

title: Birthday visit
text: Just come back from our stay at hotel metro I can honestly say this hotel is perfect. room was superb, bed so comfortable, nice big shower and coffee maker in our room. Breakfast was included with our stay and had a great choice cereal muffins bagels toast yogurt and tea coffee or juice a great start for the day. Metro Grill was closed for renovations while we were there so can’t comment on that roof terrace has a great view of Empire State Building

title: Super situation
text:
Hôtel au charme un peu désuet mais idéalement situé pour passer un bon séjour à New York...
Joli rooftop avec vu sur l'empire state building.
Literie confortable après des journées bien remplies...
Le petit moins: le personnel de l'accueil pas toujours très compréhensif et les resto de l'hôtel fermé lors de notre visite et la clim vieillotte et donc bruyante

title: Perfect Lication
text:
Nice hotel in the most perfect location. Close to everything and easy access to all attractions and underground. We stayed in a newly renovated room which is small but you only really sleep there.
Free wine tasting at night is very good. Breakfast is excellent.

title: Un bon hôtel situé au cœur de Manhattan
text:
Pour notre premier voyage à New York, nous sommes partis avec l’agence belge Connections qui propose cet hôtel comme étant l’un des préférés de ses clients ! Cet hôtel possède beaucoup d’avantage. Très proche du centre et des curiosités, ligne de métro à même pas 100m ainsi qu’une incroyable terrasse avec une vue imprenable sur l’Empire State Building. 
Nous avions une chambre « Contemporary Queen » qui donnait sur l’arrière de l’hôtel ce qui nous a permis de très bien dormir car très peu de bruit. La salle de bain est petite mais fonctionnelle, un petit rafraîchissement serait le bienvenue. 
Le petit déjeuner proposé est modeste : kellogs, pain, muffins et bagels. Rien d’autre toujours le même durant notre séjour et le café est bon 1 jour sur 2. Mais il est possible de trouver un bon café pas cher partout dans la ville.
Le personnel est très sympathique et toujours prêt à vous aider. 
Si je dois retourner à New York je retournerai certainement dans cet hôtel !

title: Getting married in NewYork
text: The hotel with its retro style and super staff was perfect. The way we were greeted was great and the free sparkling wine for our upcoming wedding was very kind. The staff helped us with all they could and we couldn’t have asked for more. The breakfast of bagels yoghurt fruit toast and coffee or tea was a god send and very unusual in Mew York to be included. On our wedding day the hairdressers Dorinda was so wonderful and she did my hair beautifully, and even waited for us to leave so we could take these photographs! They helped us with taxis, directions and the only blip was that we had to come back half way to the clerks office as we had forgotten the rings!! All in all a wonderful stay. The renovations going on there didn’t disturb us at all and though the restaurant/grill was closed there were plenty of places to eat. Although this isn’t in central New York Times Square we found it easy to get anywhere and there was a subway station at the end of the street- although we didn’t use it. An amazing experience and one we will never forget.

title: bon hôtel,très bien situé, personnel sympa.
text: Chambre pas très grande, salle de bain un peu etroite douche, tv, bonne literie.airco bruyant , moquette.femmes de chambre efficaces.Chambre arrière très calme.Rooftop :vue imprenable sur ESB. beaucoup de restaurantsdans la rue et à deux pas Macy's

title: Great stay!
text: Great location, friendly staff, clean and well located. Plus convenient parking down the street for a reasonable price (get your card validated at the hotel). Rooftop lounge is awesome!  Seriously, I couldn’t ask for more for the price. Great value!!!  Comfy bed and super shower.  Will definitely stay here in the future.

title: Breakfast Issue
text:
I haven't stayed in this hotel yet, but I'm writing this to alert everybody that there may be issues concerning whether breakfast is included in the price of the room.  The Tripadvisor write-up says that it is.  Taking this into consideration, I booked the room with penalties for cancellation. The payment was charged to my credit card account on 4/30/18.  

I telephoned Hotel Metro to confirm the reservation details.    I was told by the hotel that BREAKFAST WAS NOT INCLUDED.  I contacted Tripadvisor about the misleading write-up and they wouldn't get involved in the dispute, saying I should contact the booking agent.  The booking agent was "getaroom."

I made my complaint to "getaroom" and was told on May 6, 2018 that I'd get a good will refund of 10%.  As I write this on June 9, 2018 I haven't received my credit, even after contacting "getaroom" about it.

I notice that Priceline is now the booking agent and that the write-up still says that breakfast is included.  Before making a reservation, I'd suggest you confirm this with the Hotel and/or Priceline.  I should have done this, but I trusted the Tripadvisor write-up.

title: Excelente. Hotel  desde varios puntos de vista
text:
Estuve  nueve noches , alojada ,  20 a 29 mayo, lo había estado. en estadias  anteriores
, se realizaron varias modificaciones que mejoraron la calidad del alojamiento.
Una habitación en piso superior , excelente en cuanto al mantenimiento y limpieza y corrección.
Destacó la Amabilidad,  excelente colaboración frente a cualquier duda.
En cuanto recepción menciono a  Rosa Liza Shawn Natalia  Soni   Jonathan    Floyd  Arnold Andrew, Stan ,  y CEO Anu
Con un desayuno aceptable , la dedicación de Sandra Janeth Elizabeth y sus compañeras,.
Maravillosa vista desde su Penthouse.

MAGALI , 1111

title: Great stay !
text:
I stayed with my parents for a week, the rooms are spacious, a bit dated but fine, very clean, very comfort bed. we love the toilet amenities very much. Wifi has a great connection and high speed internet 

The choice of breakfast is limited but we could make additional order in the hotel restaurant. For coffee lovers, the breakfast lounge offers coffee and tea to go 24/7, awesome ! 

The location was great, short walk to Macy's, empire state building and metro station. So many shops and nearby restaurants, in walking distance to time square and other areas in NY

My advice for all travellers, for your convenience, pay your booking in advance, since the credit card machine in the concierge did not work very well, therefore we have to go the nearest ATM and pay them in cash.

title: Fab hotel
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights, excellent service, rooms are a little dated but fine.  It's was my mum's birthday whilst we were there and they left a lovely gesture.
Great breakfast just what u needed to start the day

title: Pas mal de charme dans cet hôtel niché en plein centre-ville
text: Bel hôtel typique style New York des années 50. Bonne connexion wifi gratuite. Ambiance musicale jazzy très agréable. Chambre bien aménagée et propre. Literie très confortable. Salle de bains un peu petite mais correcte. Bonne insonorisation. Staff inégal : certains sont serviables, d'autres sont désagréables. Hôtel très bien situé près de Penn Station (+/- 10 min. à pied) et de Grand Central Station (+/- 15 min. à pied). Rue calme avec quelques bars et restos sympas aux alentours. Quartier proche très animé notamment avec l'énorme magasin Macy's et Madison Square Garden à proximité. Dégustation de vin gratuite de 17h à 18h30 dans l'hôtel. Le petit-déjeuner n'est pas bon : quelques pains et des bagles infects, de la confiture, du fromage fondu, des jus et du café. Ce n'est pas digne de cet hôtel mais c'est souvent comme ça à New York (mieux vaut aller déjeuner dans un delicatessen ou à Grand Central Station par exemple, il y a beaucoup de choix et c'est bien meilleur). Il y a un rooftop pour admirer la ville et on peut s'y installer avec ses propres boissons si on le souhaite. Bref, une bonne adresse en plein centre-ville et surtout un endroit bien propre ce qui est loin d'être le cas partout à New York...

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
We stayed at Hotel Metro to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary.  It is a lovely hotel, and the staff are fantastic - everybody was so helpful and friendly.  The breakfast was good, the coffee available all day was very welcome and we enjoyed the wine tasting several times during our stay!

The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Times Square and there is a subway station at the end of the street so it is really easy to get around New York from there.

The hotel is art deco style which gives it a character we loved.  There was renovation work going on during our stay but I can honestly say we didn't see or hear anything apart from a section of the roof terrace being roped off and some scaffolding outside.

I contacted the hotel several times before our stay and always received a quick and helpful reply.
 
We would like to thank Hotel Metro for the upgrade of our room.  It really made our stay for our anniversary special - as did the lovely bubbly and chocolates that were waiting for us on our arrival.  We had them on the roof terrace with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building.
 
We would not hesitate in recommending Hotel Metro and will certainly stay there again if we visit New York in the future.

title: Still very good
text:
We're not new to the metro, we've stayed several times before - i would reccomend this place to friends and family.

We had the premier king room, and this was the best room so far. good size bathroom, great size bed. room was on penhouse floor - we heard no outside noise. Air con wasnt much cop but we're not really air con people.

The hotel is being renovated and whilst there was no noise or distubance from this, the capacity of the breakfast room has been reduced by 2/3, to allow for the renovations - thus meaning there can be quite a long wait to get a table at breakfast, but you can just grab and go, perhaps take it to the roof terrace. That said the breakfast staff are absolutely amazing, especially Sandra. It's a shame they no longer offer the muffins as they were legendary.

The hotel has the most amazin location 5 mins walk to either chelsea or times square, 

We still love the Metro, and we are due to visit again early next year. I'm confident that any miniscule snags we experienced will be sorted with the completion of the refurb

title: Birthday
text: Just got back from this hotel. It's absolutely  gorgeous. Staff are helpfull .It's clean always. And the view from the roof is fantastic 😁🤗 it's in the perfect place to find everything and the view from the roof .is the empire  state building

title: Weekend in Manhattan
text:
Clean, large corner room facing the back yard no noise from the busy street, kingsize bed very comfortable. Perfect location. Continental breakfast is included.
My only complaint is the front desk person that was away from his station at Checkouts time fulling around with another employ. You should put a bell on the counter in order for guests not to go around to look for assistance.

title: Perfect hotel voor een citytrip
text:
Een uitstekend gelegen hotel vlak naast Macy's op Broadway en op 50 meter van de metro, dat zijn prijs meer dan waard is. 

Na een verblijf van 4 nachten heel tevreden over de kwaliteit van de nette en frisse kamer (dagelijkse schoonmaak), de vriendelijkheid en behulpzaamheid van het personeel (zelf een paraplu gratis kunnen lenen). 

Ontbijt is inclusief, maar verwacht er niet teveel van. Lees verschillende bagels, fruit en yoghurt met granen. Niet heel uitgebreid maar goed.

Absolute aanrader voor mensen die New York willen verkennen vanuit hartje Manhattan!

title: great value
text: stayed at this hotel from the 20th may for four nights and could not fault it.the room we had was a queen room on the fourth floor which was more than adequate.the room was quiet, bed v.comfy,shower was great, and the air con worked a treat.the room and the hotel in general was immaculately clean.the hotel has a 30,s feeling to the decor which is a nice touch.the staff are very pleasant and polite.breakfast is continental but very good.free tea and coffee all day.free wine tasting between 5 and 7 every day except sunday.the hotel is centrally located and is only about a ten minute walk to times square and maddison square gardens with the tube just a couple of minutes away.all in all a wonderfull short stay at a very nice hotel.certainly worthy of a better rating.would highly recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: Had a great time again. Staff all helpful,friendly, nothing to much trouble. Location is great. We were lucky enough to be upgraded on check in. There are renovations going on but you wouldn’t know it apart from metro grill being closed but the hotel recommended a few close restaurants to try and to be honest your in New York the world is your oyster . Room was great. Roof terrace with amazing view of Empire State Building. Beds are ultra comfy. If your going to New York the Metro is a great choice good value for money. Breakfast was included continental. Was just right to start the day. Tea and coffee all day. Wine tasting in the early evening. Go and enjoy. This would always be my first choice. Thankyou all at the Metro.

title: fabulous- 25th Wedding anniversary trip
text:
we visited for our silver wedding anniversary, and albeit the restaurant was closed we had a fabulous stay ( free wine from 1700-1830 helped.) Excellent location for New York- lovely staff- clean and well kept - breakfast is basic- bagels etc

Lovely bottle of wine left in room and anniversary card- comfortable and reasonable size rooms.
Would definitely stay again.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text:
Location was brilliant. 10 min walk from times square and very handy to get around new york using the subway station just outside the hotel at Herald Sq. You will also find Maceys there for some shopping.

You also have the empire state building, madisson sq garden, and a nice little park named Bryant park close by.

Continental breakfast served each morning is perfect to set you up for the day of sightseeing to take in. be sure to head down early as it can get quite busy.

staff are very friendly, and always trying to help out. 

View of the empire state building from the rooftop is worth a look

title: Hotel metro in new york
text:
Hotel located in a perfect place between 5th and 6th avenue. The hotel is really nice our room was clean and comfortable.
The staff was helpfull and carefull.
From this hotel u can walk to all important sites to visit, as Central park, Times Square..............
Just a comment about about the breakfast coz we ve been there between christmas et new year and the cafetaria was closed at this moment so the breakfast was a little bit "poor"

title: Au cœur de Manhattan
text: Un hôtel au charme fou. Déco rétro à 5 minutes à pied de Time Square. Chambre spacieuse, soignée, accueil très professionnel et prévenant, équipement complet... Un endroit où il fait bon revenir le soir après une journée de visite éprouvante...

title: 가성비 좋은 호텔!
text:
맨하튼에 입성하기엔 주말이라 다른 호텔들이 너무너무 비싸서 그 중에 저렴한 호텔을 찾다가 예약하게된 메트로 호텔!
조금 오래되긴 하였지만 친절하고 방도 화장실 샤워실도 쾌적하고 좋았다.
일단 접근성이 좋은 호텔이라 가격대비 너무 괜찮은 호텔이라고 생각!

title: 25th wedding anniversary trip
text: Booked Hotel Metro for our 25th Wedding Anniversary trip. A perfect location so close to so many attractions. Lovely gesture too as hotel provided a complimentary bottle of fizz and greeting card (thank you x). Renovations are bring carried out but at no point did these disturb us. Hotel staff are lovely...special thanks to housekeeping and concierge form their attention. Would have no hesitation staying here if visiting again. Thank you very much x

title: Great location. Perfect for a short stay in NYC
text:
This is a great location for a short stay visit to NYC as a base to see everything the Big Apple has on offer.
Within walking distance to all the major attractions in Manhattan.
Staff were attentive and extremely helpful too.
Breakfast is limited and super busy, but it’s one of the few hotels that offers a bit to eat before you venture out.
Rooms are more than adequate and clean.
The Grill was closed for refurb so I can’t comment on the food but who wants to eat in a hotel when in NYC! 
Probably a little old fashioned and traditional for some, but the price is very reasonable for midtown.
Nothing flash but recommended for the location with a nice roof top terrace opposite the Empire State Building where you can sit and relax with your favourite tipple!

title: Breakfast
text: Hi my daughter and myself stayed at your hotel last we found i every thing beautiful the staff the bedrooms. The breakfast was gorgeous it set us up for morning.   we really enjoyed our stay with you. We have just booked with Thomas cook to come back next year but there is no breakfast  which is very disappointing. Is there a reason. Thank you see you next year can’t wait x

title: HOTEL METRO NYC
text:
Su gran atractivo es la excelente ubicacion a la vuelta del Empire State.
No obstante es un buen hotel, el edificio es antiguo y lo estan recliclando. 
Hay personal que habla español, destacamos a Jonathan que ha colaborado con nosotros. Si se busca comodidad no vayan a las habitaciones mas economicas del hotel porque son pequeñas.
El desayuno está bien, cafe, te, panes para tostar, manteca, queso y mermelada mas jugos y frutas. 
Al principio teniamos una habitacion de las pequeñas, pero pedimos un cambio y siempre se mostraron colaborativos para ayudarnos.
La limpieza esta bien.
Mi critica es sobre alguna de las personas que brindan el servicio de desayuno, el primer dia nos dejaron sin desayunar porque a las 10 en punto cierran el salon.
Estabamos en la conserjeria gestionando el cambio de habitacion y nos demoramos algunos minutos, suficientes para que nos cierren y no nos dejaron hacer ni una tostada. Con  el paso de los dias las observo y siempre estan mirando el reloj y parece que disfrutan cuando a las 10 menos un minuto cierran la puerta.
Una lastima, empañan el trabajo del resto.
Es una buena opcion, a media cuadra del metro y de Macy's.
Entre la 5ta y la 6ta.

title: Anniversary visit
text:
Exelent position for all the attractions hotel clean staff friendly rooms looked much bigger in photos 
However plastic cups plates knives forks and spoons and no where to sit for breakfast were quite unacceptable as was $250 we were asked to leave on a credit card in case of breakages Wi-Fi had for one evening no choice for breakfast 
No bar which would have been nice to sit on the roof top area with a glass of wine looking up at the Empire state building we will return to New York but not to this hotel

title: Greay hotel
text: We come here on our honeymoon in April, the hotel offered a complimentary upgrade and bottle of fizz. Both were very much appreciated and made out experience even better! The free wine tasting on an evening was a great end to the day and start to the evening. Breakfast was small but filling and a great start to the day! We loved the tea and coffee that was also available all day! The rooms were kept clean and the staff were always very friendly ! Only criticism was I had taken my own face cloth which had been taken away when the roon was cleaned. I went to reception on the evening to mention this and j didn't feel she would do anything about it ( I didn't get it back ) this didn't defer from our experience at all and I would highly recommend the hotel metro

title: This is one to use.
text:
Passing on a recommendation - worth passing on.
All prices are high but this keeps you in the centre of New York, at the foot of The Empire State Building with very, well furnished, comfortable rooms and breakfast to boot.
Staff are most helpful and friendly.
No point over stating anything.  Suffice to say, we would book here again on a return trip.

title: Hotel HORRIBLE!!!! NO LO RECOMIENDO
text: Yo estuve alojada en el Hotel Metro durante 6 dias, fui con mi hermana. Es un hotel horrible. No vayan. Cuando llegamos nos atendió una Señora muy maleducada, fue una pena que ya habíamos pagado toda la estadía, porque si no,  nos íbamos a otro hotel. NO NOS QUISO DAR LA HABITACION, nos dijo que SOLO la otorgaban a las 16 horas. No nos hicimos problema, es New York…nos fuimos a la Estación Central a pasear y volvimos a las 16 horas. Nos cobraron 75 dólares por 2 cajas que llegaron a mi nombre…una estafa….la habitación malísima. Horrible, vieja. El desayuno…horrible. El trato del personal fue malísimo. Nos trataron súper mal. NUNCA MAS VUELVO A ESTE HOTEL. Ya fui 6 veces a New York, y es el peor hotel en donde estuvimos alojadas. Cuando ya nos íbamos del hotel, estábamos esperando el transporte, vimos que llegaba gente y hacia el check in y LE DABAN LA HABITACION y a nosotras NO. Era la misma hora que habíamos llegado nosotras. Claro. Nosotras somos sudamericanas. ARGENTINAS. Una vergüenza. Y encima, los días en New York estaban súper fríos y NO HABIA AGUA CALIENTE PARA BAÑARSE. Una vergüenza. Que ya lo iban a arreglar. Por favor, tuvimos que salir a pasear sin habernos bañado. Un papelón. Ya van varias veces que escribo el comentario. Siempre lo borran, porque les daña la imagen. Entonces nos prometieron un “descuento” en la tarifa que habíamos pagado que NUNCA LLEGO. No contraten este hotel ni el desayuno se salva, no tienen ni leche caliente. HORRIBLE. Lamento haberlo contratado. La gerenta...que solo habla Ingles, te dice todo que si y despues no te dan nada. Como te cobran por respirar, les pedi que nos descontaran por no tener agua caliente...era lo correcto. Pero NO. Solo nos dijeron que no querian comentarios negaivos y que nos iban a devolver un 15% de TODO lo que habiamos pagado. Pero no. No contraten este hotel. New York tiene mil hoteles mejores.

title: ELEGANT HOTEL WITH GRET STAFF
text: Spent a week  in this great art deco hotel . Friendly efficient staff and a great location. The concierge team of Arnold Floyd and Jonathan where all wonderful cheerful and helpful nothing is a problem to these chaps. And if you want anything in New York city these guys can either find it for you or make it happen. The reception team lead by Mrs Malhotra are both efficient helpful friendly and always cheerful. Natalie Lisa and Rosa not only know the city well they also know where the best places to eat shop and relax are as well. Playwrights bar is just a short step from the front door offering  decent beer great food and a safe environment for relaxing eating or just soaking up the whole new York experience., The Hotel does have some regeneration work going on but I never heard a thing from the builders, The maintenance man Raymundo was very helpful and  seems to be able to fix anything while remaining happy cheerful and like all the staff from the maids to the waiting staff  very polite. The free wine in the early evening is a welcome relaxing experience in the wonderfully retro and tasteful art deco restaurant. The roof top  garden offers a great view of the empire state building and Macys is just  a hop skip and a jump from the Hotel. The tourist shop next to the mill café on fifth avenue is ran by a wonderful Tibetan man who not only stocks and extensive range of memorabilia he has a cheery disposition and very reasonable prices, This was my first visit to new York and after talking to the Hotel Manager and being assured the staff will stay the same after the refurbishment that is currently taking pace I will return again.. While the standard of service rooms and food and drink where all high. The wine tasting that happens each night is not only friendly and relaxed it has some great wines served in an informal and happy way.  The man who pours them not only knows great wine he knows how to get the best from it for his customers. As it is staff who make a hotel a good experience and staff that keep it that way.   The staff in this one not only rise to the challenge they surpass it as a standard. Ultimately it is  they who Make it such  a great place to stay.

title: Great hotwl
text: This hotel is perfect, great location close to Empire State Building. Time square and other sights within walking distance. There was some renovation work going on to the premises when we arrived including scaffolding surrounding the exterior. But we never heard anything the whole time we were there. Room was a good size including mini fridge to store your own items. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We had asked about booking a taxi, but the checkout attendant offered us a bus transfer for half the price. The porter at the lobby was more than helpful, storing our bags and his regular greetings as you returned from your day exploring. Would book again if we return to NYC

title: great hotel
text:
this was our first visit to new york and must say the hotel metro was fantastic staff were allways helpfull room was exellent the hotel is in a great location breakfast was nice just enough to set you up for the day roof terrace was an added bonus great to sit out looking up at the empire stae building and watching the night life this is one of the best hotels ive have stayed in 
i would like to thank all staff for making our stay in new york a great experiance and will deffinatly vist again thanks again mr and mrs kirkham

title: Third visit
text:
This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and it remains our favourite hotel in New York.  It is perfectly situated for both exploring on foot and by Metro. Our room this time was a little smaller than the other times we have stayed but was still bigger than some other hotel rooms in New York.  Everywhere was spotlessly clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly.  The bathroom, although small, was very clean and the shower worked well.  There were good quality complimentary bathroom products in the room and plenty of clean towels everyday.  There were 2 bottles of water left in the room for us plus a small box of chocolates. There is also a coffee maker in the room but as coffee is freely available from  the foyer all day we did not make much use of it. The beds were comfortable.  The hotel is a little outdated but is currently being renovated so the restaurant was closed.  We did not hear any building noise while we were there.
The only small niggles are that the lifts are very slow, the air-conditioning in the bedrooms is very noisy so you have to either put up with this or turn it off which means that the room gets very hot during the night.  Was disappointed that the muffins at breakfast are no longer available as these were the best part of breakfast and were the best muffins we have ever tasted.  Wi-Fi connection is free and good  but you have to log on to it every 24 hours which is a bit of a pain.
Free wine every night (except Sunday) from 5-6.30 is an absolute godsend at the end of a busy day.  Roof terrace is worth a visit for the great views of the Empire State Building and Macys.
Luggage can be stored free of charge before check in and after check out.  Staff ordered a taxi for us to take us to the airport.
We will definitely be returning and really would not consider staying anywhere else in New York.

title: Anniversary visit
text: Stayed at this hotel from 2nd May till 8th May for our 13th wedding anniversary the hotel was in a good location just what we wanted. Reception was okay they asked for $250 on a credit card in case of breakages quick check in. Our room was basic looked smaller than the photos we had seen the shower had three shower heads not too good if you wanted a quick shower. Breakfast was very basic with plastic knives forks and spoons paper plates and dishes seating was very poor in breakfast area. No bar which would have been nice to sit on the roof top area with a glass of wine looking up at the Empire state building. We will be going back to New York but not to this hotel

title: Spot on
text: Great location for us- you are in walking distance of Times Square and all the key attractions however because you are not on Times Square’s door step we found it apt quieter. The room was well equipped and spacious the cleaning was spot on and couldn’t fault that at all. Yes the breakfast is a little basic however given that it’s free and included can’t really moan, it’s fresh but basic. Highly recommend this place

title: Great location, nice room, poor breakfast
text:
Great location, has everything close to it including restaurants, bars, and more attractions. Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. Value for price.
Breakfast was very poor.

title: Amazing stay yet again!
text: I visited this hotel again for the second time in Feb 2018. When I booked for New York again I just straight away came for this hotel. The rooms are just lovely and clean, it’s a great location, I absolutely love the slow walk to Times Square from here. Breakfast choice again, everything you could want from a continental option. We also used the coffee in the breakfast room throughout the day very often it came in really handy! All staff were really friendly and helpful too. Would definitely come back (again).

title: Short break
text:
For a short break in New York and for somewhere comfortable, safe and an excellent location then this is the perfect hotel. There are flaws as people have
mentioned in their reviews, 
-the breakfast is bland and paper plates, cups, cutlery and self service and a weird quiet atmosphere
-the hotel is slightly dated, the aircon is loud and temporamental, no easy access plugs beside beds

To be honest though other than that you can’t complain, I had a lovely time and they upgraded our room complimentary for my mums birthday. Staff were very lovely and helpful. Duvet was the softest I have ever slept in.
Location was perfect right next to Macy’s.
I do recommend highly and would return.

title: Exceeded Expectations!
text: My husband and I stayed two nights. Even though they are doing some renovations, I did not notice. We arrived 2 hours prior to check-in and the room was ready. We booked a Queen Premier room and it was perfect. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean and it had everything one needs, a safe, ironing board, hairdryer, refrigerator, and in-room Keurig coffee maker. Prior to coming I called the hotel and I was told no breakfast was available, but when we arrived we were told a continental breakfast was available every morning. The breakfast included bagel and assortment of bread for toasting, cold cereals, instant oatmeal, coffee, tea, juices, milk, yogurt, cream cheese, jams, and a variety of fresh fruit. We didn't spend much time in the room because there is so much to see in NYC. The hotel is so close to Macy's and a bit of a walk to Times Square, but very ideal. I highly recommend it.

title: Nice hotel, great location but one indiscutable thing
text:
We stayed 3 nights last month in the Metro Hotel, NY. The hotel is very close to the Times Square, the staff is really nice and the hotel is clean. BUT the breakfast is a no-go. I don't care, if the breakfast tastes horrible or has a poor selection, but what I saw in this hotel is indiscutable.

Every thing is packed individually in plasticand everything was a one-way item. Plates, knifes, forks, cups, glasses - everything (see picture). 

It is even bad for US standards, which are the lowest I have ever seen. We traveled from NY to Costa Rica and that is at least 20 years further developed. We find there hardly any plastic and 6 different types of trash cans. In the Metro Hotel, NY we found one trash can for everything. Plastic, paper, food - everything in one bin. A hotel in Europe would have been closed down immediately for this kind of behaivior.

The other US guests seemed not to care, but for an European it was quiet shocking. 

I hope someday the US will join the rest of the world in the year 2018. It is about time!!

title: Glad we didn't change hotel
text:
Booked this hotel with Virgin and a couple of weeks later were told the hotel would be undergoing extensive renovations whilst we were there. We were told the restaurant and bar as well as the roof terrace would be closed and some floors would be closed off to minimise the noise of the work. I was worried about this and looked for an alternative hotel. However due to the extra cost, which we couldn't afford at this late stage, we decided to stay with The Metro. And we're so glad we did. 
Restaurant, bar and roof terrace all remained open during our stay, which was great. The floors that were closed meant you couldn't take the stairs and needed to use the 2 lifts. ( one was out of order for the whole of our stay). This meant that you could be waiting quite a while for the lift to come during busy periods.  This was the only negative point. 
Room was nice but window overlooked building and not much natural daylight. Quiet though. Staff were polite to us. Check in and out was quick. Breakfast was fine. No frills but did the job. Wine tasting was great, not really wine tasting as you had a choice of several bottles and just asked for a glass of which one you wanted. Then the man serving came around and topped you up! All for a few dollars tip! Fab! 
This hotel is in a great location and we would definitely recommend to others and would stay there if we ever visited New York again.

title: Good Choice
text: We stayed for 6 nights and found the location and hotel to be great. Even though there were works going on the disruption was minimal. Roof terrace remained open although it looks like work will be carried out here soon. Had the wine tasting a few evenings which was a bonus. Breakfast was enough to keep you going but they cleared it away very quickly even before 10 sometimes. Our room was very dated but no doubt will be renovated soon. Subway outside hotel goes to all main routes.

title: Great location
text:
We booked this through Virgin Holidays and overall were pleased with the hotel. We stayed mid January 2018.

We arrived at about 13:00 to be told our room wasn’t ready which we were disappointed about (every other guest that checked in after us went straight to their room). The receptionist kindly offered to switch our room to one that was ready, which we we’re very grateful for. 

However we had to wait 90mins for the room to actually be available, the receptionist was disinterested in following the situation up which was very disappointing and not a great first impression of the hotel. This was the only downside to this hotel. Better communication from staff would have changed this experience.

We were on the 11th floor, however street noise was still very loud and the window appeared to offer no soundproofing or protection from the freezing cold weather outside! I think this could be improved. There was a heating system that was intermittent. However these gripes aside the room was a good size, enough space for two suitcases to be laid open. The bed was a double and comfortable. Bathroom was shower only with three separate shower heads. Water was hot with good pressure. Towels were changed daily, the bath towels were on the small side.

There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, it was not very powerful, if you have long thick hair, I’d recommend taking your own!

Complimentary water and coke provide in the room on arrival and the hotel had kindly left a bottle of bubbles in the room as we were celebrating our anniversary and my birthday.

The complimentary breakfast consisted of bagels, pastries, muffins, cereal, yogurt, fruit, tea, coffee and juice. You served yourself and could have as much as you like. As breakfasts go this wasn’t bad especially as it was included in the price.

The hotel offers free tea and coffee 24/7, and there is free wine tasting between 17:00-18:30.

The hotel was easy to find and has a subway a stones throw away. We got to the hotel using the air train from JFK to Jamaica station ($5pp) then the LIRR to Penn station ($7.5-$10pp depending if travelling in peak time).

We walked from the hotel to all usual NYC tourist spots, however we did get the subway to the Statue of Liberty ($3pp each way).

Overall we were very happy with our stay, location excellent for exploring, room comfortable, breakfast good to set you up for the day and staff friendly. Would stay again.

title: My favorite hotel
text: 2nd time me and my wife have stayed at this hotel, Great location virtually opposite the empire state building and central to a lot of attractions, Very good staff, lovely old art deco style rooms and lobby. Great hotel.

title: Great location, but with room for improvement
text:
Lots of good things about the hotel, in particular its central location which gives easy access to all parts of the City. The lobby, lounges and restaurant are decorated in an art deco style which works well but looks tired and dated when it comes to the rooms and corridors - more 1950s Blackpool then 1930s Miami !
The room was small and the bathroom very cramped - just not enough storage or space for two adults with luggage - there were just two drawers in the room for clothes so we half lived out of suitcases !
Breakfast was fine - and a special mention for the Muffins which were the best Ive ever tasted. 
the attached restaurant was great, a nice atmosphere, good food and good service - recommend the pork steak stack !!
The roof terrace was disappointing - it was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel but it was half cordoned off and theres no service here - suggest you get drinks from the free wine tasting (5.00 - 6.30) and take them up to the roof. When youre there though the view of the Empire State building towering over you is fantastic. The hotel should make so much more of this feature.
Overall there was a clear need for the hotel to upgrade - one of the lifts out of action the whole time we were there, air con that had a mind of its own and just a general feeling of tiredness. 
If the few (relatively minor) issues were fixed i would stay again - although I'm not sure how they could make the rooms big enough to be adequate !

title: Perfectly located hotel near many attractions.
text:
They told us that the hotel was a bit older, but has not lost its charms yet. The old glory time are still clearly present. In terms of location you can not be better. Close to Time Square and other todo attractions. 

From the roof terrace you have a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Especially highly recommended during the night.

We had booked a standard room and got an upgrade free of charge. The room had everything we needed. Only one negative point was the heating which made a lot of noise and maybe a small bathroom. But what do you want in the city where space is expensive? Furthermore, the room was very quiet, have not even heard noise from the corridor or the neighbors. 

There was free breakfast. Simple but good. And free coffee and tea all day.

title: A bit disappointed
text:
With all the fantastic reviews this hotel has received I expected more than we got.
Reception staff were totally disinterested in us , felt that by checking in we were causing them an inconvenience 
Furniture in reception area tiered and in need of repair 
Our room on the 7th floor looked directly into other hotel rooms. 
On the up side it was a great base for exploring,conveniently located to subway and Penn station.
Breakfast and wine tasting were a great bonus

title: 60th birthday treat
text:
We stayed at the Metro the first week of April. At first I wondered if I had made the right choice, to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday at this hotel. My first impression was of a small and gloomy hotel,  but this is not the case. 
We were welcomed by friendly staff, who told us that our room had been upgraded. 
We stayed in room 601, which had recently been redecorated, with a lovely shower room, tv, tea and coffee making and a lovely bottle of champagne and box of chocs. 
Tea and coffee is available 24 hours a day in the lounge area and breakfast was a good variety of toast, bagels, cakes, muffins,  croissants and more. My only complaint about breakfast was the use of plastic cutlery. I am not against plastic cutlery and paper plates, but hundreds of pieces. Of plastic,being used every day in the hotel-does little for 
those of us who are concerned about the worlds disposal of plastic.
The hotel is ideally suited for all major attractions, the subway, buses, taxis, shopping, Times Square, Empire State is so close you can touch it. 
The hotel was the quietest hotel, I have ever stayed in. I hate noisy hotels. In the five days we were there we heard nothing. Bliss
If you are looking for a excellent, friendly and centrally located hotel in New York, that is reasonably priced with breakfast included, then this hotel is the one you must consider

title: Didn't live up to expectations
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights after staying here 4 years ago.

Our last stay was excellent which is why we decided to stay again. The staff went above and beyond what we expected, were so attentive and helpful and genuinely wanted to answer any questions. The room on the 9th floor was really spacious and so beautiful also.

Negatives 

However this time round things were much different. On entering the hotel we didn't receive a particularly warm welcome despite the hotel being very quiet. The lady on the front desk was trying to quickly sort out our room and send us on our way. I had to repeat myself 3 times as she was looking at the computer whilst I was talking. 

We would not expect a member of staff to hold the front doors for us at a normal hotel. However Hotel Metro set very high standards during our last visit. The older gentleman who worked there held the door for guests day in day out and was always so positive and asked questions about our day. He was greatly missed this time and obviously hasn't been replaced.

We were allocated a tiny room on the 5th floor which was very dated. The safe had been left locked therefore we couldn't access it straight away. The engineer who came up to fix it was quite rude despite this being a mistake made by the hotel.

Every time we wanted to go downstairs we waited around 5 minutes for the lift to arrive. Of the 2 lifts that were working, 1 was so rickety and old and I did not feel comfortable at all inside it. 

I was so disappointed to see that there was no water available at the breakfast buffet after feedback multiple times last time. I do not drink coffee/tea/fruit juice. I was shocked to hear that water could not be made available at breakfast time.

Positives 

The bathroom was beautiful with thick marble features and was really clean.

The location of the hotel is excellent. It's far enough away from Times Square and not too far from the main sights and restaurants. Subway stations are also located within walking distance.

Breakfast options are good and muffins are always fresh and tasty. 

The guy who stored our luggage on the last day was extremely polite and helpful. 

The renovations being carried out did not affect our stay at all apart from the issues with the lift.

Last time we rated the hotel 4 out of 5 as we never give 5 out of 5. For the reasons mentioned above we have rated lower than last time. Some might say that the positives weigh out the negatives which may be true for some people however we were so impressed last time by such high standards and polite and kind staff that we were so disappointed this time round. Despite the hotel's excellent location we will not be returning to Hotel Metro when we return to New York in the future.

title: Great location and good value for money
text: The location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping, only a few yards from Macy's and a subway station. Round the corner from Empire State Building. Facilities are good though decor us a little dated. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The inclusive breakfast was good and tea and coffee are available 24 hours.

title: Birthday gift
text: Arrived at this hotel the day of my birthday , check in was quick and easy , was happy to see a note and chocolate in the room wishing me  happy birthday , room was amazing nothing I could fault until night time the air conditioning was so load even when knocked of , breakfast was a lovely bonus esp when u had a late night , due to weather conditions in Ireland we had to stay an extra four nights which the hotel where very helpful and acomadated us with rooms , I will stay in the metro again when I visit nyc , the staff are so pleasant and always willing to help u ..

title: A hotel that grows on you.....
text:
I stayed at the Metro from 20th March for five nights. To be honest at first I wondered if I had done the right thing. The allocated room on the 5th floor looked a bit dated, the wallpaper grated at one place where someone had put something against the wall, and the carpet looked as if it could do with a good clean. However, as soon I got used to it the room became okay.
The up sides are:
Location, just a stones throw from Macys. Decent size bed. Okay bathroom. Gym on the top floor. Irish bar staggering distance from the entrance. 6th avenue around the corner. Plenty of okay eateries in the vicinity. Decent heating in the rooms (it did snow one day, all day). Breakfast okay. Roof garden with stunning view of ESB. Friendly approachable staff. 
Downsides. One lift off limits, possibly due to a hole in the floor. Small lifts. Noisy guests coming in at 4am after a night on the razzle. Street noise, typical New York!!
Internal safe didn't work, despite assurance it did!! Small gym, some of the equipment was faulty.

title: Great hotel in superb location!
text:
Stayed here for a week with my husband and daughter - this hotel really contributed to us having a brilliant first visit to New York! Its location, right in the heart of everything, is pretty much perfect for sightseeing - many of the big sights are within easy walking distance and there is a subway station less than 100m away. It's also only about a 5-10 minute walk from the LIRR station for connections to JFK airport. 
Anyway, apart from location, the hotel itself has so much going for it! On arrival, we were delighted to find that one of our rooms had been upgraded so that both rooms were on the same floor - a considerate touch. Both (premier) rooms were a good size; the queen room was normal city hotel size, but the double double room was spacious! Both had small bathrooms, but the showers were excellent, as were the toiletries, and plenty of towels were provided. The beds were extremely comfortable, some of the best I've ever slept in! 
Having a fridge in the room was a nice touch, and then we discovered complementary water and coke for our arrival, which was really nice. We didn't ever use the coffee machines in the rooms as tea and coffee were available downstairs at all times anyway. 
Having breakfast included in a US hotel is a real plus - saves that extra cost and bother of going out for breakfast - and yes it was simple but still good, with several different bagel types, bread, muffins, pastries, yogurt, fruit and juice on offer.  
The hotel is currently undergoing renovation/redecoration work, so two of the lower room floors were not in use whilst we stayed, as well as one of the lifts, but there was no noise or disruption on our floor and our rooms had a very good standard of decoration and cleanliness. I hope that they do give all the lifts a major overhaul, as that was the only downside to the hotel - the lifts were very very slow (but essential when on the 8th floor, as we were, or higher!) and you could end up waiting around for quite some time for one to arrive, especially in the morning.
Overall, this really is an excellent hotel, especially for the price, and I would definitely both recommend it to anyone else and also stay again myself in the future.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
I have a big birthday coming up and my daughter turned 21 in February - her birthday wish was to visit NYC, and she certainly wasn’t disappointed.

I emailed the hotel as I received notification that there would be renovations going on during our stay.  They responded promptly and reassured me that it would be ok.  On arrival we were asked to wait in the lounge whilst our upgraded room was checked for us. A lovely surprise when we got to our 9th floor room - complimentary champagne and a personal message!

All the staff were so helpful and engaged in conversation, giving out tips and advice.

Complimentary breakfast set us up for day - variety of muffins, bagels, fruit, yoghurt, cereals and bread (toasters) plus juice, tea and coffee all unlimited.  There is an option to upgrade to a cooked breakfast,  it we didn’t. Evening wine tasting was a pleasant opportunity to sit and chill before we heading out each night.

In the room:
The huge Shower was great, powerful and hot.  Nice toiletries are supplied. (The towels could be larger, but not a big deal).

Queen bed was comfy, pillows were bit lumpy,  but we still managed a good sleep. (We didn’t need extra covers but didn’t see any so guess would have to request them if needed.). TV had a good choice of channels but we didn’t know what was on so was pot luck when we turned it on (jet-lag friend!)

Hotel is ideally situated to get where we wanted either on foot or by subway (even tho we got it wrong twice!) close to Macy’s, short walk to time square, grand central station, Chrysler and Empire State Buildings.

Only downer - and there’s nothing the hotel could do - there’s lots of street noise.  Garbage collected early hours each night, and across the street another renovation was being carried out with dumpsters being filled throughout the night.  And we even got used to the car horns!!

The Metro was perfect for our 4 night stay and we would choose it definitely next time.

title: Excellent!
text:
We booked this hotel via British Airways. We chose it due to the location being in midtown and as it was our first visit to NYC we wanted to be central. Hotel foyer is small but clean. Friendly staff booked us in and we had been upgraded free of charge. The room itself was clean. Bathroom was lovely. There was no bath but the shower was excellent. There was a rain forest type head; a power shower and a detachable shower head. Great water pressure and very hot! There was a fridge with complimentary water and pop; a keurig coffee machine,that was topped up daily. We bought some extra tea, coffee and cream pods from target. We didn’t need to as there are hot drinks available downstairs. However, we couldn’t be bothered going up and down for them and I’m a coffee snob. A hairdryer ( actually quite good) and a full sized iron and board. Our room was at the back so the view was of a lift shaft! Having said that, we were rarely in so this wasn’t an issue really. At first, I was a bit unsure as the hotel is next door to a few small Korean restaurants. The cooking smells wafted up into our room if we left the window open. We soon learned not to do that! Just glad it wasn’t the middle of a hot summer. Bed linen was changed daily as were the towels. 
Breakfast was just fine, other reviews have grumbled about the lack of choice. I think they’re just being picky. Not many hotels in NY offer a breakfast so we saw it as a bonus. The muffins were huge and gorgeous. Lots of cereals and bread including gluten free. Just have to time it right as there appeared to be limited tables when we went. Some guests ( noticed to be the Americans) were noisy when returning to their rooms at night but they’re on holiday too and I was a grumpy Brit with the outbound jet lag. 
All in all I would highly recommend this hotel without any reservations!

title: Good choice
text:
Great location, great kitchen, but the hotel needs to be renovated. Furniture, carpets and the elevators are all in need of renovations. The only elevator that was in function during our one week stay was working over its capacity and didn’t feel reliable.
In the evenings the hotel had wine tasting, it was so nice to sit and relax, enjoying the wine served by the very kind and always happy Fausto, we really miss him and he will be a nice memory from our stay at Metro.

title: Made our holiday!
text: Stayed in NYC for 10 days and the hotel metro was perfect.  We got married whilst in the city and informed the hotel before we arrived and they very kindly upgraded us to a premier king which was lovely and spacious! The bed was so comfortable and the pillows the same making late night catch ups with pictures and planning easy.  They were very kind to help us prior to our stay as well with advice on travel and tickets for events in the city.  Breakfast included was a great bonus so we started most days with a bagel and a muffin! Don't miss the wine tasting held every night at 5pm, has a lovely selection of delicious wines and without doubt spend some time on the roof for a great shot of the empire state building!  We loved the city so will defo be back and will be back to the Hotel Metro when we do!

title: Great find
text: This was a great find! I booked this hotel last minute and wasn’t disappointed. It is close to everything. I walked from Penn Station in about 8-10 minutes, to Central Park in 30 min. Lots of different eateries nearby. The hotel is very pleasant and clean. I enjoyed complementary breakfast, coffee, water bottles, and nice toiletries. The staff were polite and friendly. Highly recommend checking out the rooftop terrace for a beautiful view of New York skyline.

title: Great Hotel & Location
text: Located on 35th St and 5th ave, you can't really get more central. Empire State, Macy's, Times Sq, MSG all less than 10 min walk away. Two hot subway lines just minutes away too and Penn Station a few blocks away. Hotel is on the traditional style, little bit art-deco. Rooms spotless and spacious, serviced every day. Free continental style breakfast. Free tea and coffee all day. Free wine tasting 5-7pm. Rooftop space with views of Empire State. You probably won't find better location wise for the price. Fast free WiFi too. Good spot for couples or friends on holiday or for business travel too.

title: perfect location and hotel
text: Booked as a package in the UK. Perfect location, just 5 minutes walk to Empire State building, 15 a the most to Times Square. We walked everywhere while here. Room was just right for the 3 of us, comfy beds which are cleaned every day. lovely big bathroom. well equipped  The rooftop terrace was amazing, perfect views of ESB .Breakfast was great,cereal, toast, muffins, bagels fruit along with juice and hot drinks, only possible issue is not always enough seats for everyone, although we were always lucky to get on. Coffee available all day . If we  go back to NYC which we hope to one day would definitely stay again

title: Wedding holidau
text: We decided to get married in NYC, my wife mentioned this and they very kindly upgraded our room for free! Breakfast was good, fresh bagels and muffins for a quick bit of energy as we walked a minimum of 8 miles a day visiting as many attractions as possible. hotel metro is a short walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building it was perfect, there’s also a subway entrance just down the street too. Their bar and grill was amazing the steak was the thickest I’ve ever had and it just melted in the mouth and the Mac n cheese was so good we ordered it twice, if you order room service ask for a tray as they didn’t bring one up so we balanced our plates on the bed other than that a fantastic place to stay and I’d recommend it to anyone staying in New York.

title: Viaggio a New york
text: Di buono c'è la colazione compresa poi per il resto un po vecchiotto dovrebbero risistemare un po. E in un ottima posizione centrale vicinissimo all'empire state building. Metropolitana accanto appena 20 metri.

title: Lovely hotel great location
text:
We spent 4 nights in this hotel on our visit to New York and had a wonderful stay here. The hotel is centrally located just off 5th Avenue on 35th street 
The room was spacious and clean with coffee making facilities and juice and water in the fridge. The continental style breakfast was nice. All the staff were very friendly and the rooms cleaned daily. The view from the top of hotel was stunning looking in to the empire state building. The restaurant/bar downstairs served lovely food as well. If I return I would stay here again

title: Etwas in die Jahre gekommenes Haus mit bester Lage
text:
Wir wohnten eine Woche in diesem Hotel. Die Zimmer waren geräumig (Queen Contemporary) und sauber. Das Bad hatte eine schöne große Dusche.
Die Lage des Hotels ist für die Preisklasse unübertroffen gut! Macy's 3 Fußminuten, Time Square 10 Minuten, 5th Avenue 2 Minuten, Ausgehviertel Hells Kitchen 12 Minuten, Flat Iron Building 10 Minuten, Empire State Building 5 MInuten, Penn Station / Madison Square Garden höchstens 10 Minuten. Besser gehts nicht!
Minuspunkt ist das Frühstück aus zwei Gründen: 1. Schlechte Speiseauswahl 2. Einmal-Besteck und Wegwerf-Becher ... alles was fürs Frühstück gebraucht wird landet in der Tonne. Absolute Öko-Katastrophe...

title: 2nd visit
text: Stayed at the hotel metro for the second time from the 5th till the 10th of march 2018. Staff were fantastic as they were on our 1st stay, the breakfast is perfect for a long day sightseeing. Complementary soft drinks and water in our room was an added bonus. Free wifi always helps, facetime home etc. The hotel is fantastically located, a stones throw from the empire state building and a 10/15 min walk to times square. The view from the rooftop area is one to be seen. Will be staying at the hotel once again on our next trip to NYC. Highly recommended

title: Vacanza a New York
text:
Il nostro soggiorno presso l’hotel Metro in NYC è stato favoloso. Posizione del hotel perfetta (vicino alla metro ed in un punto strategico). 
Bella vista e bel hotel, colazione abbondante e personale davvero cortese. Pulizia sempre in orario e davvero impeccabile!
Non potevamo chiedere di meglio.

title: Great hotel in NYC!
text: Went here for a weekend stay with a friend! Fabulous! Great location. Room was gigantic. We actually had two bedrooms. Amazing full breakfast. Very nice staff. They checked us in super early. Very clean. Decor was up to date. Very clean bathroom with separate second sink outside shower. We were really very pleased with our stay and great rate. Also, we absolutely loved the free wine and rooftop view. Definitely made our stay special!

title: Perfect as ever!!
text: My 5th stay at the Metro Hotel and it is as brilliant as ever! From check in to check out the staff are just lovely! Denisse and her colleagues on the desk were so helpful, particularly when we were delayed coming home due to snow. Great location, clean and welcoming. Breakfast is plentiful, all day tea and coffee and the wine tasting from 5pm is just great, gives you a chance to socialise with other guests too! I really can't praise this hotel enough.

title: Good hotel. Great location.
text: This is a very good hotel and very well priced. It's best feature is its location. Just a couple of hundred yards from Macy's and the Empire State building. It's a short walk to the theatres of Broadway and just a short walk on from that is Times Square. You can access the best of midtown easily from this hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated and ours was a good size with good facilities. Breakfast is continental, so no bacon and eggs, but they do have gluten free bread and cereals, should you need them. Staff are efficient but not the happy, smiley types you'll find in Florida. But most New Yorkers seemed to be like that. My big issue came upon leaving. I did my usual check under the beds for any dropped items and found quite a mess left from previous guests. So, note to housekeeping, clean what you can't see as well as what you can. The hotel is being refurbished in 2018, so that will give them chance to have a good clean up. The refurb made no difference to our stay, so is very wel managed. All in all a good hotel in a great location.

title: molto confortevole
text:
è un albergo che merita. camere ampie silenzioso. pulito. posizione ottima. colazione buona e compresa nel prezzo. servizio di deposito bagagli gratuito. ottimo anche per famiglie. personale gentile e sorridente. molto disponibile
per informazione e chiarimenti

title: Fab stay !!!!
text: We only stayed one night as we were trying to save money and this was one of the cheaper hotels close to Times Square. We found the hotel after going to the wrong one with almost the same name around the corner. The lady on the desk was really nice no wait either, we were given our keys and told what time breakfast was (its free) bonus ! Plus we were told there was free wine if we gave a small tip to the person serving. We sat and had one glass before going to our room. We didn't have the best views only a brick wall but it didn't make any difference to us as we didn't go to the big apple to stay in a hotel room ! the beds were comfy and the room was really clean and warm it was February and freeing outside so very welcoming. The room also has a free safe so we felt happy we could lock our money and passports away while we were out. The bathroom was big enough with nice toiletries if you have forgotten to pack some. Breakfast was just enough to start the day, hot drinks, real orange juice, cereal, toast, bagels, cakes and some fruit. I would defo stay in this hotel again the second night of our stay we stayed in a nicer hotel but the Hotel Metro was closer to all the sites and I cannot see the point of wasting money when you spend so very little time in your room. The Hotel also has a gym and great views of the Empire State building on the roof terrace.

title: Parfait
text:
Hôtel parfaitement situé à côté de Time Square. Nous avons quasiment tout fait à pieds, Time squares, high line...
L’hôtel est dans un pur style New yorkais (l’image que l’on a des films). Chambre spacieuse, propre et literie de qualité (queen size).
Le roof top est génial pour siroté une bière de brooklyn avec vu imprenable sur l’Empire.
Le petit dej est bien et copieux.
Petit plus, la bouteille de mousseux à notre arrivée dans la chambre avec des vœux pour notre honeymoon !!!

title: Great Hotel and Great Location
text: I stayed at this hotel for 7 days at the beginning of March and it was fantastic. Free breakfast every morning with a great selection. The rooms were lovely with big comfy beds, and were cleaned daily to a high standard. The location is the best part, you're right in the centre of NYC so getting anywhere is a breeze (subway station less than a minutes walk away). Id definitely come back to stay here again.

title: Goede uitvalsbasis
text:
Vlakbij Broadway, Times Square op loopafstand. Dit hotel is een goede uitvalsbasis voor een trip naar New York. Een net hotel waar je kamer elke dag wordt schoongemaakt. Het personeel is behulpzaam en vriendelijk. De kamers netjes en de bedden zijn goed. 
Het ontbijt is prima in orde. Niet zeer uitgebreid maar goed genoeg. 
Op een paar meter afstand van de metro ingang en uitzicht op de Empire State Building. 
Het hotel beschikt over een dakterras en een fitness die er prima uitzag. 
Verder zijn de kamers uitgerust met een koffiezetapparaat, koelkast, bureau, zitje, kluis, televisie, wekkerradio, genoeg kastruimte en een badkamer met douche. 
Het hotel heeft ook een restaurant en bar: Metro Grill. Goed eten en gezellige bar. 

Kortom, dit hotel is een aanrader!

title: Amazing stay
text: Loved this Hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay in value for money hotel. Great location, friendly staff.  Breakfast included and wine tasting in the evening all make for a welcoming stay.

title: My perfect New York Hotel
text:
I felt welcome from the moment I walked into the reception. I was also lucky enough to arrive in time for the daily complimentary wine tasting, very nice. Oh, and on the subject of welcoming and complimentary, the soft drinks found in my fridge were both!

The room was decently sized for NYC and the bed was very comfortable. On the top floor there's a nice rooftop terrace, it was nice in the sun even if the weather was rather cold.

Breakfast was the typical - cereals, bagels, muffins, coffee/tea and juice. It was served in the lounge, so it didn't feel as crowded as some hotel breakfast rooms might feel.

Located on 35th Street it's close to everything (at least for me) and enough far away from the noisier area around Times Square. I didn't notice any noise at all from the street (could be I was on one of the higher floors).

I will definitely make this my first choice of hotel for my next trip to NYC!

title: Excellent Hotel in Midtown Manhattan
text: My friend and I stayed two nights here last November when we came to NYC to see "Downton Abbey: The Exhibit".  The hotel is located in walking distance from New York Penn Station so if you take Amtrak to get to the city, it's perfectly located.  The room was large and clean and while the bathroom was a bit on the small side in comparison, there was still room to maneuver.  The service was attentive and when we checked out Sunday, they stored our bags while we went out for breakfast and look around once more.  And best of all, if you go up to the roof, you can get a spectacularly close view of the Empire State Building!

title: Excellent location
text: Brilliant hotel for a short stay. Stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are extremely small nut in NYC this is not a problem. Staff were all very friendly and the rooms were extremely clean. Breakfast was included but we never used it so cant comment on that. The rooftop terrace and view was fantastic. Would be lovely in the summer with a drink. The location was the best part. Ten minute walk to times square and subway station right on the street. Would highly recommend and would stay again.

title: Great Location - Room Deposit not Refunded
text: Hotel has an amazing location, a block from Empire State Building and Macys.  Rooms are very small and breakfast is basic but adequate.  Biggest disappointment however the room deposit that I paid to the hotel has not been refunded despite by staying being in Nov 2017.  On check out the hotel said that a refund would be given, however this was not the case and despite calling many times they have been unable to resolve this.  Please beware - this is probably illegal too!!!

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
Lovely Hotel just a stones throw from Empire State Building, if you go up to the roof of hotel you get anamazing view of the ESB.
Would def go back to this hotel.
Great variety for breakfast & hot/cold drinks available 24/7. Great location for everything

title: 4 night stay
text: Art Deco style interior,rooms were a little dated but comfy beds and clean and warm. Perfect location with Empire State on the next street and Macy’s at the end of the road. Friendly staff with 24 hr tea and coffee available in the dining room,breakfast is a bonus and perfect before hitting the streets.The free wine tasting offer was perfect for that relaxing end of a busy days walking.

title: Great location
text: Spent 3 nights here, friendly staff room was clean and comfortable. Room didn’t have tea or coffee but this was available 24 hours a day in the room where the breakfast was served, all though breakfast wasn’t what we would go for the concierge recommended a great place down the street. The hotel was only 5 minutes from Maddison square gardens and a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Plenty of great restaurants also in the local area. Would recommend anyone to stay here.

title: Wonderful stay for my Mum's 60th birthday!
text:
This is rather late and my apologies but I took my mum to New York for her 60th birthday. I chose Metro Hotel on a recommendation from a friend and we were not disappointed. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will certainly be back on our next visit. The hotel is immaculately maintained with nothing to fault. The rooms are cleaned every morning. All the staff were so friendly and welcoming. We arrived early and the staff kindly stored our bags till our room was ready. 

While booking the hotel, I mentioned that we were in New York to celebrate my Mum's birthday and on check in we were informed that we had been upgraded to the premium suite. We were overjoyed at this! The staff were so thoughtful and even left is a bottle of champagne in our room with a lovely note! 

The suite itself was beyond superb. We had a lovely double bed in our room. We also had a living space with a sofa, dining table and study desk. This was particularly handy as my mum was able to come back to our hotel and relax on the sofa after a long day of walking. Not to mention the huge tv! The suite was perfect with a view of the Empire State Building from our window. 

The suite also had a little kitchenette with a fridge and complementary tea, coffee and coca-cola. 

The bathroom was far bigger than we expected with our favourite feature being the waterfall shower! 

The rooms have air-conditioning and heating which work perfectly. It was particularly warm at the start of our stay and it was so nice to come back to air-conditioning in our suite. 

Every morning from 6:30 to 10am a continental breakfast was served wth a huge variety of bagels, pastries, muffins, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, tea, coffee and juice. These are regularly replenished. 

The hotel also has a roof top area with a lovely view of the Empire State building which was perfect for an afternoon break. 

A massive thank you to all the staff for making our stay memorable.

title: Mixed bag
text:
Spent 4 nights at the Metro, but thought it was a mixed bag.
Location superb, Metro Bar and Grill very nice. Staff were helpful with any questions, thought the breakfast a great way to start the day.
However a little disappointed with our room on the twelve floor stains on the carpet and the bed very uncomfortable. 
Hopefully the works that are progressing will sort out the negatives.

title: Another amazing stay!
text:
Just returned from another great holiday in NewYork, made amazing by our stay at the Metro. This was my fourth stay and my daughters second. We had a room on floor 10 and looked out onto the Empire State Building, what a view! We were lucky enough to have 2 lovely sunny days at the beginning of our stay, allowing us to go up on the roof and take it alll in. Our room was not huge but certainly big enough for us and our vast amounts of shopping and the shower was fabulous. The bed was extremely comfortable and sleep came easy! The coffee machine was such a lovely bonus and of course coffee and tea available free of charge 24 hours in the breakfast room. The breakfast was included and was very fresh every day, bagels,   
cereals, croissants, muffins, yoghurt and fresh fruit. This was constantly topped up by the lovely breakfast servers.  
The wine tasting in the early evening was a fabulous treat, we only made it back 2 of our evenings but it was greatly appreciated as where the canapés that accompanied it. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, and our questions where answered in a very polite and positive way. We never met our maid but she did a beautiful job keeping our room clean and the bed freshly made.
