Our room key failed a few times and we had to pop to reception to have it reset but really this was nobodies fault and didn’t detract at all from our great stay. The position of the Metro can’t be beaten, a subway entrance just a few yards away which we used copiously, and so many things to see and do in the immediate area. 

The Metro will always be our first choice when visiting New York! We hope to see you all again soon. Thank you for our stay.

title: Mum’s 60th Birthday - great week
text: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Metro at the beginning of February. The hotel staff could not do enough for us, and made my mum’s birthday extra special. Very clean, comfortable and the free breakfast was excellent with more than enough choice and we really appreciated the free tea and coffee after a cold day of sightseeing! Extremely good location with access the subway and a wide variety of food places nearby. Would highly recommend to all - we have visited NYC a number of times and stayed at different hotels, but we would definitely return to Hotel Metro!

title: Sauber, zentral, aber Nachhaltigkeit ein no-go! Daher keine Empfehlung
text: Das Hotel ist sauber und super gelegen. Das Personal überwiegend anteilnahmslos, eine Begrüßung/Verabschiedung erwartet man schon in einem Hotel wenn man rein- und rausgeht. Die Zimmer waren sehr klein, und als sehr störend empfunden haben wir die Heizung/Klimaanlage. Laut und wirklich blöd zu bedienen, da es ein sehr altes Modell war. Wir waren im Winter da, daher können wir zur Klima nichts sagen, aber die wird wohl auch laut sein. Das größte Manko war allerdings das Wegwerf-Geschirr beim Frühstück. Es waren zwar umweltfreundlichere Pappteller statt Plastikteller, aber dass es das überhaupt gibt, ist wirklich nicht nachhaltig und daher für uns ein no-go. Jeden Morgen wurden Berge an Müll produziert, das lässt sich mit einfachsten Mitteln (ein kleiner Raum, Geschirr und eine Spülmaschine) lösen. DAher würden wir das Hotel nicht noch einmal buchen.

title: Lovely Hotel and great staff
text:
Spent 5 nights there in February 2018. The hotel is really nice. Nice decor and furniture in the lobby. The staff were fantastically helpful. Especially Anu, she helped us with options on how to get back to JFK airport for our return. 
The room was more than ample in size (we had an upgrade to a Premiere Queen room) and was meticulously clean and the beds made each day. 

It’s ideally located quite centrally for nearby attractions with Empire State, Penn Station and Madison Sq Garden just 5 mins walk. A few doors away are Cafe Rustico where you can sample NY pizza which was gorgeous and The Playwright Bar is well within staggering distance and is a great Irish bar to start and finish the night off. All in all it’s one of the nicest hotels I’ve stayed at and would definitely recommend it. Photo shows the view from the roof terrace.

title: Birthday Visit
text: We stayed at the Metro for 4 nights. Hotel really nice with free breakfast which will keep you going. Rooms comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. It was my husband's birthday and a personal birthday wish and a bottle of wine is a thoughtful touch. Location fantastic. Definitely recommend

title: Great location
text: Was a little bit worried when we received an email saying there would be renovations going on during our stay but actually we never even noticed. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the room was great except the net blind in the window which was very yellow and had a lot of holes. Really, with such a great view I would just take it down! We could see the Empire State from the window, it was really close. There’s a subway on the street too. Free wine in the evenings, you just need money for tips so that was great. Breakfast was okay, there’s toast, bagels as different huge muffins. Cereal, yogurt and fruit but you eat from paper plates and plastic cutlery also the room gets full and the tables are all different so you could end up eating from an armchair over a low coffee table. I’d still recommend though for the good price and good location.

title: Birthday Treat
text:
Lovely stay. Hotel clean, warm and inviting. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Enjoyable evening especially with the free wine tasting in the evenings.
Would recommend this hotel as well positioned for the sightseeing.

title: Fantastic Location..
text: Can't recommend this hotel enough. The staff went above and beyond. While the rooms may be a little outdated, everything else is perfect. They allowed us to check in extremely early, offered a great continental breakfast (fantastic muffins), and even had a complimentary wine tasting in the evening. On top of that, an ideal location for those visiting Broadway, Central Park or Times Square.

title: Super
text:
Nous avons dormi 4 nuits dans cet hôtel situé sur la 35eme rue à un quart d'heure à pied de Times Square.
Le point fort de ce dernier est sa position idéale, entre la 5e et la 6e avenue, aux pieds de l'Empire State Building.
La terrasse au 13ème étage (toit) offre une fantastique vue sur l'Empire State Building .
La chambre est de bonne taille pour une grande ville comme NY. Il y a un petit déjeuner ce qui est extrêmement rare à NY. Je le recommande fortement

title: Amazing hotel and city
text:
I’ve just checked out after our five night stay at Hotel Metro. I had never visited NY before and was just taking a leap of faith when booking this hotel because I had no idea how close it was to the attractions etc but the reviews were good so I went for it. I am so glad that I did! From check in to check out Hotel Metro and its staff have been brilliant. The rooms are small but comfortable with everything you need- there is no tea and coffee facilities in the room but they are in the lobby 24/7 anyway. The shower in the room was amazing and so was the bed- I slept like a baby. The breakfast was lovely with everything from bagels and muffins to cereal and yoghurt and fruit and you could fill yourself up before your long day ahead. The wine tasting in the evenings was also brilliant (who can say no to free wine?). The free WiFi was also essential to keep in touch with home and extended to the rooms with no trouble.

The location was great as well, 35th street which was only a few blocks away from Times Square and Broadway (walking distance) and only a short subway ride away from the 9/11 museum, Brooklyn Bridge and the Statue of Liberty. The hotel is right next to the 34th Street Subway station and it is therefore extremely easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan, Brooklyn or even Queens and the Bronx if needed.

The staff were friendly, always saying hello whenever we entered and goodbye when we exited. They were also happy to help if we had any queries regarding restaurant suggestions or  to help you navigate the city. All in all I am so glad that I stayed at Hotel Metro during my time in New York and I am already wondering when I can come back! Very happy indeed.

title: Mrs Lesley Punter
text:
Wonderful holiday made better by the fabulous staff at Hotel Metro. Rooms are small and basic but lovely comfy bed and very clean. No tea/coffee facilities in room but available downstairs 24/7 plus free wine tasting every evening at 5pm.
The hotel is Art Deco/gatsby style and has a warm welcoming feel when you enter the lobby. Well situated for Macy’s, Time Square Broadway etc
Staff are lovely and will respond to any requests efficiently and politely.
We will definitely be returning and would recommend Hotel Metro to family n friends.

title: Outstanding
text:
I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this excellent hotel!
This hotel is at a brilliant location on 35th street, with all of the tourist attractions closeby. Upon arrival we were greeted by some very friendly reception staff and a gentleman who carried our bags and held the door open for us. 
As we were going to this hotel for a birthday the hotel upgraded our room and even left a little box of chocolates which was a lovely touch! 
The breakfast was continental with a great range of foods and tea and coffee. The seating area for breakfast was only small, however we managed to get seated all of the time.
There was also complimentary tea and coffee throughout the day and night and wine tasting in the evening. 
The rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. We also had two rows of complimentary cans of coke in our fridge and bottles of water.
The staff were very helpful and offered directions as much as they could to try and help us find our way around the city. 
Location wise if you are to walk-
Times Square- 10 minutes 
Ground Zero- 1 hour
Statue of Liberty- 80 minutes
Chinatown- 45 minutes
Macys- 2 minutes
Shops, cafes and restaurants- 1 minute
Central Park- 45 minutes
Empire State Building- 3 minutes
Rockerfella Centre- 15 minutes

I would definitely recommend this hotel and certainly go back here! Overall it was a brilliant stay!

title: A good hotel - excellent location & cleanliness - but unwelcoming staff & budget breakfast
text:
First of all, the location.
If you haven't been to New York before (we hadn't) & a well-located residence to explore from is top of your list, this attractive Art Deco hotel is perfect.  Absolutely perfect.
Macy's, Grand Central, Times Square & of course the Empire State Building are all within a 5 to 15 minute walk away.  Lots & lots more too.
If you want to use the subway, the nearest is just 40 steps or so from the front door.
Our 7th floor room - & it's cleanliness & daily service - was excellent.  A large double double with an effective en suite & a free-to-use fridge & small safe provided an excellent crash pad.  The only negative about the room as that the air-con unit was relatively noisy.  Bearable though.
It was really quiet too - rear-facing meant a non-existent view, but road noise was zero.
Negatives are relatively few, but just might be important depending on what you look for in a hotel.
The reception team were oddly disengaged.  No welcome.  No goodbyes.  No 'have a nice days'.  You really did feel like you were disturbing them when you needed their help.  As I say, really odd given the high level of customer service throughout the rest of the city.  Our limo driver later told us that our experience was consistent with other feedback he had heard.
The breakfast.... a real mixed bag.  A fairly good selection for a continental brekkie - a variety of individually packaged cereals, juice & fairly good coffee.  A great choice of breads & the high-end muffins were delicious.....
.... but.  Plates, bowls, cutlery & cups were all disposable, which gave a cheap feel to things.  Worse still was the environment.  Even thought the breakfast rooms were quite atmospheric, the furniture was a 50/50 mixture of standard restaurant-height tables / chairs, & low seats & sofas. This meant that half of the diners had to sit down low, balancing paper cereal bowls on knees.
This leant a really cheap, functional feel to what otherwise would have been an acceptable breakfast experience.
So, if you need to be pampered over breakfast, this is not a hotel for you.
Likewise, if poor, unfriendly front-of-house service ruins your day, avoid.
However, if you can live with this, the incredibly well-sited hotel is a really good choice for the New York tourist with sizeable, quiet, well-fitted & clean rooms.

title: Amazing Hotel and Location
text:
Once again was fortunate enough to stay here for our holiday. This great hotel has lovely spacious rooms with everything that you need!!. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful as they always are.
The location in Midtown Manhattan is fantastic and only a stones throw away from Empire State Building (which the hotel has a great view from there roof terrace) and Macy’s Department store. Also 5th Ave is 1 minute walk away. Times Square is walkable distance too.
I will definitely be booking again and advise you to do the same!.

title: The mixed metro
text:
Mixed feelings  about this hotel , on the plus side a good location and value for money. 

Negatives - the room was a miss mash of furniture old and new with  ripped net blinds in them, however was clean , and was cleaned thoroughly.

The breakfast was free but couldn’t possibly charge for it as eating off plastic paper plates and plastic knife and forks isn’t my idea of a good breakfast with just bagels muffins toast and cereal to name a few , to choose from - more of a self service affair. - but as said again , is free. 
Also very poor furniture in the breakfast room again with ripped seats and grubby looking chairs.

The main bar area was nice  and pleasant had a drink there but never any food.

A little disappointed considering all the good reviews it has.

title: Spacious
text: Nice to be in a hotel room where you can move around.   Location is good (just off 5th Avenue).  Maid service is excellent.  I prefer feather pillows and missed having those.   Their breakfast is continental and not really worth going to unless on the run.   They have free NY Times on the counter for guests, which is nice.

title: Great hotel and Great location
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights and booked the trip for our 40th birthdays. I was pleasantly surprised by the fantastic location of this hotel. We were a short walk away from Times Square and The Empire State Building. The rooms were nice but does need a good refurb which Ive been informed is happening this year. The breakfast is ok with a good choice of bagels and pastries. (Good to stock up on first thing before heading out early) 
Wine tasting happens every evening which is lovely after a long day out and about. We didn’t eat in the restaurant but did order cocktails on arrival and nearly fainted at the price. 70 dollars for 4. This seemed to be standard in most bars as we came to realise.  The concierge was great. He booked us a taxi to the airport, helping with times etc. 
I would definitely stay here again x

title: Interesting remodelled art deco hotel - close to Empire State Building
text: Was assigned this hotel by the airline and requested and got a room with two beds, but amazed to get it on the top floor- pent house. Interesting decor and very friendly staff and good housekeeping. Has  roof terrace with good view of the Empire State Building one block south. 2 blocks from Macy's for those keen shoppers and within walking distance of many attractions. There is a continental breakfast which is mostly wheat based although some fruit and yogurt are available. On weekdays the restaurant provides a cooked breakfast for a modest amount. Each evening there is wine tasting which was fun. Would recommed this hotel and would stay again if in New York

title: Good hotel at a perfect location
text:
I visited this hotel last year since a business relation from Sweden stayed at this hotel.
Location is perfect and I was very lucky to get an upgrade.
Price is reasonable/good.
Staff is super friendly, the best one I ever experienced in New York (I visit a toyfair every year since 2000). 
The hotel is an old hotel, which also has its charmes.
Breakfast is very simple, but you do not have to go outdoors.
The restaurant (not open in the weekend) is great.
I will probably try to book this hotel next time again.

title: Great location
text: Just got back from a 5 night stay, had a wonderful time. Check in was swift and professional, our room was on the 6thfloor. On arrival we found a bottle of fizz waiting for us with a welcome note. Room was large enough, bathroom compact but with everything you could want including shower gels etc. Continental breakfast was ok but very basic. Staff friendly and professional. All in all a great stay, if I went back to New York I’d definitely stay here again

title: Best location!
text:
This hotel had the best location. Times Square was about ten mins walk away and the Herald Street 34th Subway is a very well connected line! 
Hotel was fine. Comfy beds, free breakfast and free tea and coffee (not in rooms unfortunately)
Would definitely stay here again!

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights in Feb 2018 with my partner and members of her family (2 rooms).
Our room was the smaller of the two but more than adequate for a couple.
Room was very tidy and well equipped with fridge, tv, coffee maker, a 2nd hand basin area seperate to main bathroom, iron, hairdryer, free safe and even an umbrella (that you could keep as a souvenir for $25).
Bed was extremely comfortable (Queensize I think). Initially the room seemed a little noisy from traffic outside (New York drivers love to sound their horn), but in all honestly we stopped noticing it very quickly (if you do New York properly you'll sleep through anything!!😊).
Hotel lobby and lounge are beautifully decorated in golden and black tones in an art deco style.
The roof terrace on the penthouse floor was a little chilly to enjoy in this trip but provides brilliant photo opportunities as it is overlooked by the Empire State Building.
We weren't expecting breakfast to be included in our deal but were informed on arrival that it was. Breakfast is continental with food on offer including fruit, cereals, bagels and bread (toasted yourself on rolling toasters), muffins, yoghurt and spreads. Fruit juice and hot drinks are available from urns and dispensers.
The coffee urn is available and free 24/7 during your stay.
During our stay the hotel were offering copious amounts of free wine in the guise of wine tasting for differing lengths of time between 5.30-7.00pm. We thought this was an amazing bonus from a hotel we were already impressed with!!
We ate 3 times at the Metro bar and grill (1× breakfast, lunch and evening meal) and would highly recommend you try all three. Guests of the hotel enjoy a 15% discount on food.
I recommend the Boston Lager that's on tap at the bar, a lager with hints of an IPA imo.
All the staff were extremely professional, polite and friendly at all times.
We found the hotel to be perfectly placed for the sights of Manhatten.  Turn left and within minutes you're on 5th Avenue. A few minutes more and you're at the Empire state building. 
Turn right and you're just minutes from Maceys store. 10-15 minutes more an you're in Times Square.
Nearest subway station is very close (34th St station).
If you're making your own way from Newark Airport, Penn station is very close too with just a couple of blocks and corners to navigate (we did).
This was our first trip to New York, but it will not be our last. We see no reason not to return to this great hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel and lovely staff.
text: We have just returned from New York and we stayed in the Metro for 5 nights. We knew several people who had stayed here and had loved it so we had high expectations. We were greeted by the lovely reception staff, it didn't matter what time of day it was, they were all lovely. The inside of the hotel is beautiful and spotlessly clean. The rooms are really nice, not the biggest of rooms and the bathroom was very small, but worth it for being in such a great location. There is a free safe in the room and lovely toiletries, there's also a hairdryer and an iron, no kettle but there is a coffee machine, larger bath towels would be a bonus though! Breakfast is included which is great! There is a great selection of bagels (which are huge and very fresh) fresh fruit, and cereals. There's tea, coffee and fruit juices too. You are allowed to help yourself to the tea and coffee 24 hours a day which is really handy. Every evening around 5.30 for about 90 mins they serve complimentary wine in the lounge area, we never got the chance to experience this but it looked very popular!. When we needed to check in online we were allowed to use the conference room to print everything off. The hotel is in the most perfect spot for seeing all of the sights, it has a subway station literally 1 minute from it's front door ( which was really easy to use once the receptionist explained it to us!) and at the end of the street is Macy's. Time's square is literally about a 15 minute walk away and central park is also within walking distance. We walked to the financial district one day and it took about 1 hour and 40 mins! A bit further than we expected! When you arrive go straight up to the Penthouse floor and go out onto the roof top bar, there is the most amazing view of the Empire State building! The Metro is very close to it, it's literally around the corner. When we checked out they allowed us to store our luggage until we left and the lovely doorman ordered us a car, which cost the same as a tax,i to take us to the airport   When we come back to New York we will definitely be staying here again. .

title: Great location
text: Perfectly placed for subway,Penn Station,Empire State,Macy's and lots of nice restaurant s. Very clean and has a bit of character. Complementary breakfasts are basic but enough to set you up for a days sightseeing. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Most enjoyable stay at the Metro
text: Spent four lovely nights here in January, and really, we couldn’t have asked for a better hotel. On the edge of Herald Square, and walkable from Times Square, we couldn’t get over how central it was. There is a subway station just down the road too. Check-in was prompt, and our room was large, clean and comfortable, with a coffee machine (pod type) and a welcome pack of soft drinks and water – very nice touch. It’s a pity there was no kettle there to make tea with, but it didn’t upset us too much! Bathroom was spacious and clean, and well stocked with toiletries and towels. We also had an in-room safe which was great for leaving passports and other important documents in, and we were supplied with an iron and ironing board (not that we used it on holiday!). There is free wine tasting in this hotel every evening at tea time and we took part in it on our first evening. A nice way to unwind after a very long journey from Ireland. We went for a walk-about and up onto the roof garden on the 12th floor – wow, what a sight – there was the Empire State Building looking down at us! It is a magnificent sight, whether in daylight or at night when the stars are twinkling, and the moon is out. There is also a gym on the top floor of the hotel, for the more energetic, but we didn’t see anybody in it whilst we were there. We dined in the Hotel Bar & Grill and a separate review will be done for this, but we did think it odd that it didn’t open at the weekends. Breakfast was very good – self-service style with dispensers for fruit juice, boiling water, milk and coffee, and tea bags. There was fresh fruit, yogurt, breakfast cereals, different types of bread and pastries and several types of bagel that were already sliced and ready to be toasted. There was cream cheese, butter, and jams for the bagels, so all we had to do was choose! Any staff we encountered, we found to be very courteous and helpful, and we recommend The Metro to anyone who is considering visiting this great city. If we are ever back in NYC this is where will stay.

title: great hotel right near the Empire State
text: nice hotel, clean well presented. staff great! polite and very helpful. breakfast lounge good food, help yourself drinks all day, relaxing rooms clean decor nice, comfortable beds, nice shower bathroom. great gym equipment, roof deck view is to die for! awesome close up view of the Empire State building!  close to Times Square, Maceys, Broadway, 5th and 6th ave. subway close, use it! its great! the best location! great places to eat, not all very cheap, but reasonable. Dallas BBQ in TSq has fantastic food and atmosphere! recommended. a very exiting trip, made all the more better by the Metro Hotel 35th many thanks

title: What a DUMP!!
text: Room was filthy with stained cigarette burned carpet, worn out furniture and a dirty shower. It felt like something was crawling on me and biting me in the bed. Argued with the rude unhelpful desk clerk about checking out early. She tried to tell me there was no one to check me out until Monday. Really... no guests at a HOTEL ever check out on a weekend? I’ll dispute the charges rather stay here another night. HORRIBLE!

title: Super hotel
text:
Réservé avec promovacances,  l'hôtel est génial pour une semaine à New York. Nous avons eu la chance d être surclassé. 
Chambre spacieuse, confortable et très belle au 11ème étage. Seul bémol le bruit de la rue. Mais on est en plein centre de new york. La localisation est sûrement la meilleur. Le métro est à 150 m et de nombreuses lignes y passes.
Le petit déjeuner est parfait, manque un peu de salé.
Salle de sport et vue sur l'empire state building au 12 ème. 
Accueil et personnel chaleureux.

title: Ok...
text:
So, let's get the pros out of the way first: the guy at the door and the housekeeping team are absolutely amazing! Very helpful and accomodating. The hotel is well located with plenty of shops and places to eat around. The closest entrance/exit for the subway is literally a minute walk away.
The room where we stayed was not huge but ok for two people. The heating is quite noisy and, once you turn it off, the room goes cold very quickly. Almost as if you have a window open, which was not the case. We were on the 7th floor just by the staff elevator - it's very noisy and used very often. At first it sounded like building works or people dragging furniture around, then we realised it was the lift. Breakfast is included, enough variety for my liking but everything from cutlery to plates and cups was either plastic or paper - a bit unusual for a hotel.
The impression I'm getting is people on package holidays (like me, from BA) don't get the best deal. I was placed in a room against a wall with no view whatsoever.
All in all it was very average but there's definitely better value for money out there.

title: Great Independent Hotel
text: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now. The Hotel Metro is located in mid town Manhattan, just a few minutes walk from the Empire State Building, Macy's and the shopping district. The decor is art deco, and various room sizes are on offer. The idea a bar/diner off the lobby, and a breakfast room. A business lounge is available, and in summer months, the roof top is also open to use. I find the rooms to be very well kept and clean. Free and fast WiFi is available throughout. Most if  not all rooms have a TV with cable channels, an ironing board and iron, safe, and writing desk. There are plenty of power sockets to use as well. The bathrooms are well appointed, and include hair dryer and a magnifying shaving mirror. I found the bed to be comfortable, and has lovely soft white linen. If I had to give any negatives, they are as follows. The air conditioning unit can be a little noisy, and as the windows are not double glazed, there can be a lot of noise from car horns, police sirens etc. But hey, you're in the Big Apple - the city that never sleeps, so you wouldn't be minding that too much, right?

title: Great hotel for exploring NYC
text:
Stayed for 7 nights, staff were friendly, helpful and the hotel itself is spotless.

Location is great, subway station just outside, and room itself was clean, decent size and couldn't be faulted.

Free WiFi, great rooftop area to see the empire state building, good continental breakfast as part of the deal, and a good bar with happy hour from 4pm til 7pm.

Would definitely return and recommend if staying in Midtown.

title: Just a touch away from being a 5
text:
Great hotel in a great location for seeing the best of NYC and much more. We do a lot of walking on holiday and found this a good place for wandering back from Downtown or Chelsea, or exploring the rest of Midtown/Central Park.  
A short trip on foot to the beautiful public library, Bryant Park and Grand Central etc and of course a stone's throw from the Empire State and Macy's. 
The breakfast was plentiful and a good selection - the huge muffins were to die for. 
Service at reception and by the doormen was brilliant. We happened to be 'upgraded' to a large room with two double beds instead of the small room we had booked. There was no view to speak of from our room, which didn't bother us, but might be important for some. 
A couple of minor negatives - the rooftop terrace seems a little over-sold - yes it has a great view of the Empire State, but we visited in Summer and it still felt a little sad and dingy up there - some flowers in pots would perhaps perk it up a bit. 
It would have been good to have coffee/tea facilities in the room - although these were always available downstairs, it's not too convenient to wander to the lobby in your PJs!
Also, the rooms were a bit dated - although still functional and good, with a clean bathroom.  
All in all, a good stay and we would like to return someday. 
PS - the Metro Grill is really good - we had a great (and inexpensive) late lunch here before our taxi collected us for our return to JFK.

title: Great location
text:
5 night stay to celebrate my birthday and a nice welcome of note & chocolates when we checked in. 
Location is superb, very close to Macy’s, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Korea Town and around a 10 min walk from Times Sq. 
Rooms are typical for NY, a little cramped but well equipped and fine for the amount of time we spent in the room. 
Bed a little soft for my liking, but comfortable enough. 
The continental breakfast is an unusual inclusion for NY hotels and the pastries were very good (shame the tea is Lipton rubbish). 
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend.

title: Great hotel
text:
Just returned after a 6 day holiday. This is our 4 th stay at this hotel.
Great staff
Upgraded to the penthouse for our anniversary was given a bottle champagne .
The rooms are very clean beds changed everyday 
Toiletries replenished everyday
Every evening for guests there is a free wine tasting from 5/6.30 great place to meet other guests.
Staff serving are very nice always making sure you have a drink and snacks.
Breakfast is good ,bagels,bread,muffins pastries, yogurt,fruit,cereal,juices,tea and coffee. You also can get free tea and coffee 24 hrs
The bar attached to hotel has a great happy hour and appetisers from 4/7pm but not weekends.
Hotel is very central to 5 th ave,Times Square,Bryant park Macy's ,Central Park is a 10 min walk,grand central also a short walk.
Ww will be back next year
Mary and Brian gallscher

title: She said Y.E.S
text: The best thing about this hotel the location and the cleanliness the better changed every day when I hear from time to time the hot water would go off but they were happy to sort out straightaway breakfast was okay but I felt from time to time they needed a bit more options as it became slightly Boring Eating the same thing every day once again thank you for a great holiday and we look forward to seeing you again in the future

title: NICE HOTEL "HIDDEN COSTS DISGUSTING"
text: In December 2017 we had a family holiday in New York, my husband and our 18 year old daughter.  We had booked it all on line in Australia and confirmed by email the costs and taxes.  The hotel was okay, there was no room service and no place to have meals.  They had a dining room for a continental breakfast only.   The rooms were comfortable, we were upgraded because of a mix up and a mess that occurred when we arrived.  They had a restaurant next door that they recommended, they have a full breakfast and other meals.  We had a breakfast that was so disgusting, my husband looked at it and got up and walked out, he just went back to the room rugged up and had his breakfast elsewhere.  He said he could not eat reheated food, eggs that were supposed to be sunny side up was just mush in the middle of the plate and bacon that looked like strips of leather.  The toast was cold and our muesli was just awful, it was like eating cardboard.  The room was comfortable as it was -12 outside so we came back each day to a warm cosy roomThe day we booked out all hell broke loose as they had charged us higher rates than we were quoted, plus the higher rate was the Christmas period.  We had booked all this in March 2017.  There was no point arguing because the tiny writing on the bottom said it all. The view out of our window was a back alley and it was full of rubbish and disgusting bins piled high. The staff who cleaned our room were so nice and friendly we tipped them well, but the staff on the desk should not have been in customer service as one woman was so rude I nearly fell over at her comments.

title: Alt, aber top Lage!
text:
Das Hotel ist eines der ältesten in NY, aber hat eine top Lage. Direkt am Macy, ein paar Minuten vom Time Square oder einer Metro-Station. Und die Aussicht auf das Empire State Building von der Terrasse ist gigantisch!  
Die Zimmer waren nicht die größten, aber sauber. Man verbringt ja auch kaum Zeit im Hotel. Das Frühstück war völlig ausreichend, wer es süß mag! Käse und Wurst gab es nicht.

title: Great, Affordable spot
text: Nice hotel in a great location.  Small room with full bed, others on my team had larger rooms.  Free breakfast was lacking, but happy hour with wine made up for it.  Connected restaurant was a very affordable breakfast and great service. Will stay here again.

title: Nova York, coração do mundo
text: Visitar NY foi uma experiência incrível. O mundo se encontra lá. Fomos em dois casais e nosso foco era vivenciar NY, por isso andamos de metrô, comemos nos parques, andamos muito a pé e isso nos deu uma baita ideia de como a cidade é heterogênea e diversificada. Não tínhamos o intuito de comprar e sim de passear. por isso planejamos com bastante antecedência, elaboramos um roteiro bem detalhado, nos habilitamos com todas as informações possíveis e acreditem, não tivemos dificuldade alguma nem quando alguma coisa dava errado. O hotel é muito bem localizado e isso favoreceu e muito nossa locomoção. O café da manhã não é excepcional, cumpria seu papel. Havia também no final da tarde, degustação de vinhos, o que era um ponto final e tanto no dia de passeio. Vale muito a pena conhecer NY.

title: New York spot to be.
text: The metro,on first view a nice,well presented retro hotel.polite people helpful people and well placed in midtown.the food we had at the hotel was all of the best quality and well presented.all in all a good value for money hotel.also with free wine tasting.but there was no bar at the weekend.

title: Perfect
text: This hotel was just perfect with a nice 1920's decor with  friendly and helpful reception staff. The rooms were very clean and spacious with a daily maid service. There is no charge for the room safe or the airconditioning/heating. There was a small but more than adequate gym on the pent house floor which impressed me. The roof top terrace boasts an amazing back drop of the Empire State Building. There is a complimentary continental breakfast with a selection of bagels, muffins, Danish pastries, cereals, yoghurts and gluten free options too. Teas and coffee were free 24hrs and every evening from 5 - 6.30pm there is free wine tasting with a very good selection of red and white wines. The 3 stars does not reflect the great service, cleanliness and services offered from this hotel which is perfectly situated in midtown Manhattan.

title: Great stay
text:
We visited last April and had a wonderful stay. The staff in the hotel are friendly and helpful at any time of day and the breakfast was just what we needed before heading out to explore the city. Our room was clean and had everything we needed. The hotel is in a central location, and with a subway  station less than a minutes walk away, it was really easy to get to everywhere we wanted to visit. 
We stayed here on the recommendation of my parents and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC. In fact, my mum and I are coming to visit again in February for my birthday and we are looking forward to staying at Hotel Metro.

title: Une magnifique vue
text:
Je me suis rendue deux fois à cet hôtel, nous avions pris la même chambre, nous étions contents de l’accueil et des prestations, à proximité de la 5ème rue et de Macy’s. Le restaurant est très bien! Le seul bémol c’est le petit déjeuner, un peu plus de salé serait mieux. Comme énoncé dans le titre, si vous vous rendez à la terrasse, il y a une magnifique vue sur l’Empire State Building ( avec chaises, table basse ...) l’accueil de l’hôtel est toujours à disposition, ainsi que le journal. Je le recommande, si vous voulez être près des magasins et au centre de Manhattan. 

I have been to this hotel twice, we had taken the same bedroom, we were happy with the home and the amenities, close to 5th street and Macy's. The restaurant is very good! The only downside is breakfast, a little more salty would be better. As stated in the title, if you go to the terrace, there is a amazing view of the Empire State Building (with chairs, coffee table ...) the reception of the hotel is always available, as well as the newspaper. I recommend it, if you want to be near to the shops and Manhattan’s downtown.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Staff were lovely. Rooms were so clean and spacious. Brilliant location. Breakfast was good and perfect for what we needed - quick and easy. Free Tea and Coffee facility was great bonus too!! Would defo stay here again.

title: Well placed
text: A good hotel, staff helpful, good reception, room was a little ‘tired’, the complimentary breakfast was good and tea/coffee on tap 24/7.  Being only 5-20 minutes walk from Times Square was well placed for a visit to NYC worth a punt !

title: Central hotel
text: Independent hotel.  Staff. Very helpful.  Rooms a bit dated but acceptable.  Had a free upgrade to a larger bed.  Quieter in the back on a high floor.  Fridge in room and tea and coffee machine   Room heating a bit variable with poor thermostat control.  Very good continental breakfast  Towels and soap changed every day.-a waste of resources.  Very near Penn station and link to JFK with the E train

title: Comodo e centrale - ha tutto ciò che serve
text:
Ho passato 4 notti in questo Hotel e davvero non mi posso lamentare. Certo l'ho utilizzato solo la sera per lavarmi e dormire (e per fare colazione la mattina) ma non è mai mancato nulla. 
Staff cordiale, camere spaziose e comode e l'hotel è situato in posizione molto centrale. 
Per visitare Manhattan la posizione è più che ottima e il prezzo che abbiamo trovato era davvero un affare!
Per l'uso che ne ho fatto, basta e avanza

title: 2nd stay - great location!
text:
This is my second stay at Hotel Metro and it didn't disappoint! I stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend. 
Location: It is situated right next to Macy's, 5th Avenue, Empire State Building and a short walk away from Times Square, with the subway at the end of the street.
Room: The room was large and spacious. It's very clean and kept that way with a daily visit from the maid. The view from the window isn't anything inspiring, but if you're lucky you can see the top of the Empire State building. The beds were huge and very comfortable, making it difficult to get up and out early!
Facilities: We had the breakfast every morning. There were various options of dry foods such as bagels, toast, muffins and cereals as well as juice, water, tea or coffee. It can get quite busy and there are a limited number of tables and chairs, so you many chair with other family, but this didn't bother us. There is a rooftop bar where you can get a great view of the Empire State Building. There is also a gym available, however we did not use this facility. 
Staff: Staff were very friendly, especially when checking in and out. The concierge helped us out a great deal with bookings for Broadway shows, but they are pricey. 

Overall, this was my 2nd stay at this hotel and I will definitely be returning on my next trip to NYC.

title: Excellent location
text:
This hotel was located 5 minutes walk away from Macys in the heart of Manhattan and very close to the subway as well. The room that I stayed in was very small however it was very clean as was the bathroom. My room was located at the end of a corridor and around a corner so the wifi was unreliable however in the common areas it was very good. The breakfast provided was poor but free with just some pastry and fruit or yogurt.
Rooftop deck was amazing however (and surprisingly the wifi here was strong) with a beautiful view of the Empire State building. The deck is just a couple chairs and benches with nothing on sale but please bring something to eat or drink and enjoy the view. 
Check in and checkout was smooth and staff friendly.  Overall good value for money in a excellent location.

title: idéalement situé
text:
dans le cadre d'une réservation avion + hôtel, le rapport qualité/prix était excellent pour cet hôtel idéalement situé
Nous avons été surclassé dans une grande chambre, vue sur la rue un peu bruyant mais qui ne nous a pas gêné, propre, bien entretenu, personnel agréable et très réactif. Excellente literie.
le roof-top offre une vue directe sur l'Empire State Building
un petit-déjeuner simple (muffins, pain, fruits, yaourts ...) est inclus, seul bémol, la salle (petite) est vite remplie
Je recommande cet hôtel à 100%

title: A charming hotel in a fantastic location
text:
We stayed over Christmas this year and it was excellent. Rooms are super clean and a good size too.
Breakfast is included which is unusual for NYC, continental breakfast was toast, bagels, yogurt, huge American muffins, pastries and fruit. Lush coffee including decaf, tea and fruit juices.
Quiet at night so we slept well in very comfy beds.
Hotel restaurant/Grill served tasty food too.
We will definitely go back

title: Réveillon 2017/2018
text:
Estivemos lá por 7 dias. Hotel hiper bem localizado: metrô a poucos metros, lojas gdes tipo Maci's, vários restaurantes legais. A vista da cobertura é linda, dá pra ver o Empire State.
Café da manhã básico, igual todos os dias. Pouca variedade de frutas, um monte daquele tipo de pão redondo que eles gostam. 
Ofereceram vinho a tardezinha.
No último dia, nosso vôo saía às 22:50hs e pedimos para ficar um pouco mais, mas só liberaram até às 13hs sem ônus. Para ficar até às 15hs, cobrariam $90. Achei mesquinharia, pq como não ia entrar ninguém no nosso quarto, poderiam ter nos oferecido sem custo.
Oi pessoal da recepção achei bem seco. Conversamos com 2 delas e as duas não foram simpáticas, apenas profissionais.
Sem dúvida qdo voltarmos ficaremos lá.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità - prezzo
text: Hotel stile "vintage" in pieno centro di Manhattan a due passi da macy's e dalla fermata della metopolitana di Herald Square. Camera con doppi letti, confortevoli, ben pulita. Bagno spazioso con due lavabi. Colazione continentale ben assortita con ottimi muffins. Caffè e thè a disposizione in qualsiasi momento della giornata: ottimo per quando rientri dalle fredde giornate newyorkesi . Terrazza al 13 piano dalla quale si può ammirare una splendida vista dell'empire state building, sembra quasi di toccarlo!!!!. Personale, per il poco che ne abbiamo avuto bisogno, disponibile. Ottimo servizio di deposito bagagli e prenotazione taxi per trasferimento in aeroporto. Unico neo: moquette nella camera e tessuto poltroncine da cambiare o da smacchiare con cura.

title: excelente ubicación, buen precio
text: Excelente ubicación, con restaurantes y metro cerca. El servicio de recepción muy amable, nos dieron upgrade de habitación a una de reciente remodelación y fue muy cómoda, amplia, limpia, tiene todo lo que necesitas, cafetera, servibar. El desayuno es simple pero muy completo con fruta, yogurt, plan, cereal, café, jugos.

title: Awesome location - Good Free Breakfast.
text: This establishment makes a great home-base for any guest interested in the conveniences of staying in Midtown.  The location to the 34th street subway station and the cool Herald Square (owl gate!) is ideal.  We were here almost two weeks and really appreciated the location, complimentary breakfast, and room.  A word of caution: the internet was very unreliable, therefore our data took a large hit.  Obviously, you don’t want to spend your vacation in the hotel, but planning routes, connecting with family back home, and researching restaurants takes a toll!  Wine hour and the penthouse views were the best!  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente atendimento e ótima localização
text: Hotel muito bem cuidado e com excelente localização. O café da manhã incluso na diária ajuda bastante quando vamos com crianças no inverno. Chegamos bem cedo por causa do vôo, e nos ofereceram o café da manhã, mesmo com o check in sendo à partir das 16h (aliás, gentilmente anteciparam nosso check in). Os funcionários são cordiais e muito atenciosos. Quarto espaçoso, camas confortáveis, ótimo serviço de arrumação. Mesmo localizado em uma região bem movimentada, não tivemos problemas com barulho à noite. Recomendadíssimo.

title: Amazing location
text: This is a really great hotel for visiting NYC.  I stayed with a friend and we shared a superior double room with two double beds.  The location is amazing in midtown for all the attractions and 75 metres from the subway.  It was quiet and comfortable.  I would really recommend staying at the back of the hotel if there are rooms available as my friend had a street room which was really noisy.  This can't be helped though in the middle of a busy city.  The room was really clean, beds comfortable and nice in warm in December.

title: 40th Birthday & Wedding !!
text:
We went here for my partners 40th  birthday , on arrival they upgraded us and a gifts were waiting in our room ... fantastic .

Been here twice before, exactly the same experience, consistently excellent .

Friendly staff, great rooms, very clean hotel and the included breakfast is great ... especially the Cheese Bagels & Vanilla Milk for coffee !!

Probably the most perfect location of any midtown hotel, stunning roof terrace view of the ESB which towers right above you .

Walking distance to almost everything with Herald Square & Penn Stations just a couple of minutes walk if you want to use the Subway .

O’Reillys Bar ( our favourite ) just four doors down, a great little pizza place called Cafe Rustico II that serves the best pizza ( & beef pies !! ) in New York almost next door and Keens Steakhouse right around the corner .

Oh, and we got married at City Hall whilst here, just the two of us, no guests ... the hotel were again fantastic and we took wedding photos on the roof terrace .

Fantastic hotel, definitely will be back .

title: Amazing hotel - great location
text:
This is our 3rd trip to NYC and each time we have stayed at the Metro, the hotel is beautiful, it is in the best location, either for getting around on the bus or subway or for walking. Many of the biggest NYC attractions are within at 10 - 15 minute walk of here. 

The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful, we always feel incredibly welcome at the hotel, this trip they left a box of chocolates and a note welcoming us back to the hotel. On our last visit we were on our honeymoon and the left us a bottle of fizz. 

The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which is great the breakfast rooms at peak times do get busy so sometimes you may struggle to sit down, however you can grab breakfast to go and have it in your room, or choose a different time to go for breakfast. Tea and coffee is available 24/7 which is great, we would often grab a cuppa to go in a morning and pop in on a way by for another during the day.

The hotel has a roof terrace, due to the times of year that we have visited the terrace hasn’t had the bar open however you can go up and enjoy a drink, the hotel restaurant allows you to take drinks to go if you are staying in the hotel. The views of the Empire State are amazing and you can see right across to herald square.

The hotel is clean and the rooms are well serviced each day. The only thing I would criticise is that you get powered milk in the rooms for the drinks you make using the coffee machine, I don’t know d powered milk/whitener in coffee but it just isn’t the same in tea. It would be nice if “real” milk could be provided.

The showers in the hotel are just fantastic, the water pressure is great and they are really relaxing after a long day. My only other criticism is the size of the towels, I am used to large bath sheets so do struggle somewhat with the small ones provided (this is just a personal preference)

Overall this is a great Hotel and I always recommend to friends going to NYC.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff and Wine Tasting!!
text:
Fantastic location a block or so from Macys, a couple of block from Penn Station so really easy transportation.

Our first room wasn't so great, moved for our second and subsequent nights no problem.

Free breakfast buffet - not a huge choice, BUT everything was really tasty, the place is spotless and everything topped up regularly.

Every evening, free wine tasting - some great wine and really nice guys that ran it - also a good way to catch up with other guests and a conversation on the "I recommend this restaurant, bar, attraction!!"

title: Excelente ubicacion
text: Lo mas importante en NY es la ubicacion y este hotel tiene la mejor. A pasos del subte, muy centrico. Habitaciones comodoas. No lujosas pero confortables. Ademas cuenta con un buen desayuno, variado y rico!

title: Second stay at Metro, Brilliant Again!!
text: This is the second time we've stayed here, so we knew exactly what to expect. Hotel Metro is lovely, and in a great location - it's very easy to get to most places from here. 10 minute walk to Times Square, right on the doorstep of Macy's. With plenty of places to eat around too(the pizza place a little bit down the block is amazing, to the left as you leave the hotel.) The rooms are a little small, but this is the same everywhere in NYC. The staff are friendly and helpful - this is the only place we would recommend in NYC.

title: A stay on 35th St.
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Metro for five nights in late November. The hotel is located on West 35 St. Which is not the most attractive part of Midtown Manhattan but in terms of geography enjoys a convenient location. Herald Square and Macy’s are just a five minute walk as is the Empire State Building, Penn St.subway is a mere two minutes, Times Square and Broadway are approximately fifteen minutes.
 
There are undoubtedly many more luxurious hotels in Midtown but we found the Metro to be functional, clean and comfortable.The buffet breakfast of Coffee, croissants, bagels toast etc. Provided all the carbs & caffeine we needed to get us into gear each day for a hard days sightseeing.

On the occasions we asked the reception for any advice or information we found the to be most helpful.

All in all this hotel is good value for money and is a good base for exploring Manhattan.

title: Mr G
text:
Hotel metro is a very nice hotel and perfectly situated for visiting all of Manhattan. Rooms were very clean and tidy and staff were always very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast is included in the price and was very nice with a good range of food. The hotel also has its own restaurant, my partner and I dined there twice and can say that the food and service was excellent on both occasions. If I was to ever visit New York again I would certainly stay at hotel metro again. All in all it was a very enjoyable experience.
The picture below of the Empire State Building was taken early morning from the hotels roof top terrace.

title: Ok hotel with High value and great location
text:
Ok hotel with High value and great location.

A little run down interior, but anyway nice.
Friendly staff , fantastic location especilly for shopping . Two minutes from Macys and many restaurants and shops.
Walking distance to Penn station which is convenient for transport to JFK airport. 

Breakfast is very basic, but it is there.

You can walk to Central park from here, and still have restaurants and shops with reasonable prices .

Easy easy easy holidays with this hotel.

title: Hotel Metro - отличный выбор!
text: Отель расположен в пешеходной доступности до  5 Авеню, Таймс Сквер, многих достопримечательностей, которые так любят посещать туристы, рядом есть станция метро. Мы жили в пентхаусе, на этом этаже находится фитнес-зал и балкон с видом на Эмпайр Стэйт Билдинг. Шум улиц не слышен. Сейф, кондиционер, фен. утюг, кофемашина- все работало. Wi-Fi- бесплатный. Завтрак включен в стоимость проживания- йогурт, сок, кофе, хлопья, фрукты( бананы, апельсины, яблоки), тосты, масло, джем. Лифт работает медленно, скрипит- спускайтесь по лестнице- будет быстрее и интереснее- на стенах висят фото Голливудских див-что создает атмосферу данного отеля.

title: Ok
text: Ideale per visitare la città. Nelle vicinanze della stazione di Penn Station. (Ottima per i transfer dall’aeroporto). Buon rapporto qualità prezzo, anche grazie alla colazione inclusa. Necessiterebbe forse di una rinfrescata. Se riuscite sciogliete una camera ai piani alti, la zona è molto trafficata e rumorosa.

title: The PERFECT location!
text:
We visited here in February 2017 for 10 nights for our honeymoon, we loved it so much that we are returning in Feb 2018 for our anniversary! 

The hotel is perfectly situated in the city, we never caught the Subway, everything is within walking distance (but we do enjoy long walks, I think it took us 5/6 hours to walk from the hotel to Brooklyn and back!). The Metro Grill which is attached did the most amazing burgers, which we had on mulitple occasions. The room was more than large enough for the two of us and our suitcases, and the bed was so comfortable. 
When we first arrived, we were given so much information by the man on the reception desk, he helped us find all of the places we wanted to go on the map.

The breakfast was a simple continental - but I have never had such a nice bagel! I never realised what the big deal was, but they were fresh every morning. And the muffins were literally the size of my head, there was plenty to give you energy to start your day right!

So excited to be going back!!

title: Weekend in the city
text: Staff was friendly. Nice location. Room was very small but clean. Breakfast consisted of coffee juice cold cereal bagels fruits and yougurt. Discount overnight parking nearby was a plus Would return .

title: Alexg3bml
text: Stayed here for a few days room is a bit small and it is just a bit of a walk to get to time square ect but it is clean with helpful staff and I would stay there again . Breakfast is included in the cost here and they have a great choice for you to start the day

title: Quick Weekend
text: We were in New York City, first time, for a short weekend. First, the location of the hotel was excellent.  West 35th is kind of in the middle of Manhattan. We were able to walk to almost everywhere we wanted to visit. When we arrived at the hotel ( 9am) our room was not ready. We fully expected that. The hotel provided a secure location for our luggage, while we started to sightsee. By the time we got back to the hotel, we were able to easily retrieve are luggage and take it to our room. There was someone to transport our luggage to our room if we desired, but they were not pushy about it. They upgraded us with out being asked. The room was small, but I’ve been told that all New York Hotel rooms are small and for as much time as we spent in the room, it was more than adequate. The was clean, well decorated and had the amenities we need. We chose Hotel Metro, first because of the price and second because of the reviews it’s received. The hotel offered free wine tasting in the evening and and free continental breakfast in the morning. I would recommend Hotel Metro to anyone.

title: Great Find
text: Hotel Metro was an unexpected great find, and I am happy to share my pleasant experience staying there.  I live in the Boston area so  when I visit NYC, I prefer taking the train.  This hotel is located near Penn Station in NYC- a very manageable walk, close Macy’s.  The convenience to the train station was what convinced me to book a room for the weekend.  Anyway, the hotel itself is very cute.  It is a budget bargain 3 star boutique hotel.  All reservations come with complimentary breakfast which includes bagels, toast, and muffins, juice, fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee and tea.  Cream cheese, butter, jelly, peanut butter is also provided.  I was very pleased with our room.  We had a king-sized bed, a flat screen TV, a mini fridge, alarm clock with convenient USB ports, free WiFi, nice toiletries, and a freshly renovated bathroom with a shower with a rain-head.  Also the hotel provided complimentary bottled water as well as soda.  Our room also had an individualized thermostat for both AC and hot air.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were fine.  Additionally, our room was very quiet.  There is a restaurant attached to the hotel, but I cannot comment on it since we dined elsewhere.  The entire staff was super accommodating and nice.  I am very happy to have stumbled upon this little hotel, and I know we will return again.  If you travel by train and are looking for a place to stay while visiting NYC, check this place out.

title: Great Location
text: Just back from staying at the Hotel Metro for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is great just 2 mins away from Macy's and about 15 mins  walk to Times Square. Metro stations very close. The atmosphere in New York City was lovely they know how to celebrate the Christmas season. The complimentary breakfast was good and set my friend and myself for a day of shopping plenty bargains. It was lovely on arrival at the hotel to be told we had been upgraded to a family room we had 2 bedrooms, tea and coffee machine, and a large bathroom. Would come back to this hotel and definitely would recommend.

title: Brilliant place to stay !!
text: Hotel is central to a majority of the attractions in the city!! Which makes a impact on travel cost while on holidays!! The staff are very helpful and friendly!! Anything we needed they tried and helped us out ! Our room was spotless and was cleaned every day! Would recommend to people traveling to New York as it’s central and away from the hustle and bustle!!

title: Fabulous hotel
text: 5day stay at this hotel, brilliant. Centrally located, Free upgrade to superior family room, fresh continental breakfast each morning, free wine early evening, friendly helpful staff. What more can you want when staying in New York. Highly recommend

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: Stayed at the Metro for 7 nights in a Premier Queen room. Amazing view from room of Empire State Building! Location of hotel is perfect if you don't want to be in the heart of the hustle and bustle, however, it is literally only a few mins walk to Macy's, 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building and no more than 20 - 30 mins walk to most of the numerous attractions in Manhattan. We only took the Subway once and that was just to experience it! The rest of the week we walked everywhere. Staff were pleasant and very helpful. Complimentary breakfast was ideal to get your day started, basic but filling! Tea/coffee available 24/7 and 90 mins of complimentary wine tasting every evening, which was very pleasant after a hard days sightseeing!  Room was reasonable size.  Bed and pillows very comfy. Bathroom nice size with huge shower. Rooms cleaned daily. Great views from rooftop terrace. Could not fault anything about this hotel and would highly recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a brilliant location.  If we ever do a return trip, will definitely book this hotel again.  Thank you Hotel Metro for a great week!

title: Holiday
text:
Good location for city. A little expensive butyou expect that in a city. Comfortable rooms with good facilities. Bar area very good with a good range of drinks.Reception very helpful staff very friendly with good knowledge of the city 
Would stay here again.

title: New York stay
text: We stayed at the Metro for 4 nights on our visit to New York, it is an ideal location walking distance to many of the tourist spots very close to the Empire State Building. A plus is the free complementary continental breakfast, and tea and coffee 24 hours, with the wine tasting every evening. Our room was to the rear of the hotel on the 12th floor there was some noise from outside air conditioning motors, it could have benefited with better double glazing. All the staff were very friendly and helpful

title: Vorweihnachtszeit in NY
text: Ziemlich alter Kasten aber zentral gelegen. Zimmer PH 03 im Penthouse alt aber sauber, nach hinten heraus gelegen daher relativ ruhig. Klimaanlage nicht abzuschalten und laut, aber in NY ist alles laut. Von den 3 Fahrstühlen funktioniert einer richtig einer teilweise und der letzte gar nicht. Schlichtes Frühstück im Preis enthalten. Das Personal ist sehr hilfsbereit und freundlich

title: Great place to stay.
text: Great base for exploring New York City. And the bagel and muffins at breakfast fill you up and saves you money having to eat out! Great view of the Empire State Building from the roof terrace. Room was nice. Had room at the front of the hotel but never had an issue with noise as was always asleep as soon as the head hit the pillow from all the exploring. Amazing shower in the room as well. Checked out the little Korean restaurant just down from the hotel which is amazing. And always seemed to be fully sat.

title: Great hotel in a good location
text:
Lovely hotel in an area located about 10 minutes walk to Time Square which makes it very convenient.
Staff were lovely but we were a little upset that after having tipped our doorman in the morning to book us a taxi at 5pm he had forgotten - which made us late for our flight! 
The safe in our room never worked but we were told it wouldn't be fixed unless we were present in the room during the day.  This proved a little difficult as we are always out and about, so we didn't have a safe while we were there.
The breakfast was plentiful and the coffee and orange juice were great.
The complimentary wine was a welcome pleasure after a hard days walking!

title: Good base for exploring
text:
An excellent base for a week's exploration of NYC. We were on the 12th floor, a flight of stairs away from the gym and the room terrace which provides excellent views down 35th St and of the Empire State Building. The room was compact but comfortable and clean. Complementary water, coffee and tea in the room were welcome but coffee and tea are permanently available throughout the day in the lounge.  In the early evening, free wine sampling takes place and tended to coincide with our return to the hotel. There's free wi-fi and a business centre where online tickets and boarding passes can be printed out. 
  The included continental breakfast included an array of muffins and bread products. There was also fruit, yogurt and cereal.  We found the associated bar/bistro nondescript.
 Nearest entrance to Metro is at the end of the street. Time Square and Herald Square are an easy enough walk away. Some relatives who arrived at Penn Station were able to walk to the hotel with their luggage which had to beat the 90 minutes it took us to taxi in from JFK.
  Staff were always helpful. We'd use the hotel again.

title: Excellent location
text: We got upgraded to a premium queen room, as I had emailed ahead and informed the hotel we were here to celebrate a birthday. Room was great, tea/coffee machine, lovely shower that actually got really hot, and very comfy bed. Staff are very friendly and the free breakfast will set you up for the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel as central for all attractions and excellent value for money

title: Great hotel, well situated
text:
This is my second visit to the hotel. Not disappointed. Room was good and staff really helpfulness . Would definitely go back again. Near Macys and Empire state.
Handy for all transport, but most attractions within walking distance.

title: Second stay _ honeymoon
text: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We stopped off in N.Y. after spending 3 weeks travelling around the states. The hotels location is fantastic. The rooms are a grand size but a little dated. The rooms are comfortable after a long day in N.Y.but the bed clothes you would know these are old. Also the noise from the street drive me crazy! I barely slept for the 4 nights so clearly the Windows in the hotel arent double glazed or suitable for the noise of N.Y. city. I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Excellent location
text: The hotel is situated between the Empire State and the Rockefeller very close to maceys  we had a room at the back of the hotel tenth floor not a lot of noise considering your in the heart of New York the room as everything you need a big comfy bed air conditioning a good shower clean the hotel his a retro hotel which gives hit character the breakfast his included which his continental  perfectly adequate the wifi was also free which his an added bonus overall a very enjoyable stay many thanks to all the staff from the cleaner right through to th concierge

title: Very Good One Night Stay
text: The hotel is very well located near Penn Station and Herald Square. My room was clean, relatively spacious for NYC, quiet, and well-priced. The wifi is quick. The continental breakfast was pretty basic, but I'm not complaining as it was included in the price. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Location location location
text: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Metro in New York, location was great subway just down the street.  Hotel was very quiet, housekeeping was good and efficient.  The free breakfast was very good, we never made it to the wine tasting.  We splurged and got the Superior King, room was very big, for a city hotel, my only complaint is the bathroom was soooo small I had to put some toiletries on the desk in the room. But it was a very pleasant stay.  I would stay here again.

title: Went for a four day visit to celebrate my brother and his wife's 50th bd.
text: I was very disappointed with this hotel. It was noisy as the room we had overlooked the air con shaft and there wasn't any way to stop the constant noise. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was that it offered breakfast but the breakfast was very poor. There were muffins, more muffins, toast and very limited cereal. It was self service but what was worse was the fact that the crockery was paper plates, cardboard bowls and paper cups, plastic cutlery. I have never stayed in a place in which food is served on paper plates. The breakfast staff are unfriendly. There isn't a bar and you have to take your own drinks to the rooftop terrace which isn't as nice as it looks. I would not recommend this hotel, I've stayed in better travelodges.

title: Fantastic Location
text:
We stopped at this hotel in March 2017 for 7 nights as a couple. 

The rooms are fairly basic but have everything you would need for just using as a base.  There is room for improvement and various things in the room seemed a little on the shabby side. Our room didn't have any views, it faced into other windows/courtyard.

The breakfast was included in our package which was excellent for a continental. Bagels, cereals, muffins etc.  Great for on the go or just before going out exploring. 

The hotel has a great rooftop which has amazing uninterrupted views of the empire state building. We went in winter so there was nothing else up there but a few chairs. But still very impressive. 

The hotel itself is in the most perfect spot for exploring New York. Right next to the Empire state building and Macy's.  With only a 5/10 minute walk to Times Square and 15 max to Central Park. 
We walked everywhere and it is achievable to go down to battery park and Brooklyn bridge, just be prepared for sore feet! 

Overall the hotel itself could use a little TLC but for the price and location I would definitely stop here again and always recommend the area/hotel.

title: The High Life!
text:
Had a cheeky 6 days in NYC, which included our stay at this hotel, easy check in, had upgraded our room to a queen size, which was OK,  clean and a decent size, coffee maker, hairdryer, standard stuff included,be aware that the noise can be a problem, even though you know you are in a busy city, the noise level is quite high, we stayed on the 6th floor, front of hotel and very aware of traffic, especially at 3 in the morning!! Tipical continental breakfast,  bagel, fruit, toast, could be more varied but ok, downside is the tables and paper plates.
Staff were friendly and helpful,  hotel was in need of a bit of an update, but to be fair very comfortable bed and hotel.

title: 4 noches en NYC
text: Hotel muy bueno, relación calidad y precio. Muy limpio, en un lugar céntrico, con paradas del metro importantes cerca. Además el desayuno incluido ( desayuno básico) panes, muffins, quesos cremas, frutas, yogurt etc. No huevos, ni salchichas ni bacon. Pero muy bueno igual. Lo recomiendo!! No es un hotel de lujo, pero para su precio está muy bueno, limpio y cómodo.

title: Excellent No Frills Hotel
text: This a hidden gem.  Small hotel in a great location in midtown.  Older property with art design.  Great customer service.  Rooms and common areas clean.  Rooftop and gym are good amenities.  For the leisure traveler, not business conventions.

title: Art Deco Glamour
text: We spent a week in this boutique hotel in a great location on 35th. I loved the old style Art Deco especially the lobby. The room was lovely, plenty of space, spotlessly clean. East checkin/out, very friendly staff, great location. The bar and grill is really good, we had Thanksgiving dinner last year.

title: Ideal
text: Nous avons séjourner 4jours dans cet hôtel au mois de juillet nous avions réserver une chambre contemporary King et à notre arrive nous avions été surclassé par l hôtel nous avons eue droit à une chambre premier King au penthouse chambre spacieuse propre avec tout le nécessaire ... sublime vue du rooftop, l hôtel est très bien situé en plus il y a le petit déjeuner compris ce qui est un gros must pour NYC nous retenons l hôtel pour notre prochain séjour à NY

title: Comodo e centrale
text:
Hotel datato, ma con un suo fascino; ottima posizione (Empire State Building, Bryant park e Macy sono a 3 minuti a piedi; fermata metropolitana con molte linee a 50 metri). Non lontana da Pennsylvania Station.
Ambiente confortevole, servizio buono.

title: Evolving gem
text: Great location.  Close to time square, Bryant park,  Penn station and shopping! Friendly staff. Great rooftop terrace has excellent view of empire state building. Continental breakfast is standard. Could use more protein options. 24 hours free coffee and tea a plus!

title: Very convenient, clean -- just noisy
text:
Was staying in NYC for one night for a work commitment...the hotel is conveniently located near to Penn Station and Time Square, with lots of things to do nearby within walking distance or subway, and many places to eat...
The room was small but clean and I was upgraded to a room with a mini fridge and.a coffee pot, so that was nice. ny only issue was the street noise, even from the 11th floor..maybe ask off an interior room that doesn't face the street??
The rooftop terrace would be nice in more pleasant weather.
The breakfast was fine, although I personally think they should have more dining tables as it was hard to manage sitting at a coffee table. 
I can't comment on the price since my room was paid for through work,
I was able to store my baggage while I was at a meeting and could retrieve it later after check out, so that was very helpful..
I would recommend stating here.

title: Nice stay but had better in New York
text:
We’ve stayed in New York a few times but this time decided to bring our two young children. We booked a family suite and were allocated one on the 6th floor...after two nights of very little sleep due to the noise of fans outside and the busy road (coupled with windows that do nothing for noise) we asked to be moved to a quieter room. This entailed paying £35 a night extra for a premier room and waiting around for hours until one became available and we could move but it was a great relief to be on a higher floor (10th) and also to have a bathroom without peeling wallpaper and rooms that were a little less rough around the edges.
The breakfast was nice, difficult with two children eating at a coffee table but we managed however don’t try to sit in the library after 10am as you’ll be ordered to move! The roof was great, amazing to show the children the Empire State Building when we got there and overall it was a nice hotel but just a few niggles that made us wish we’d booked elsewhere. Having said this the location is great, door staff really friendly and some reception staff helpful, room service keep the room clean...i guess it depends what you want but if you’re after sleep and great customer service then perhaps look somewhere else. For those looking for a nice hotel with breakfast in a great location and with a great view from the roof...this is the place!

title: Great visit
text: We stayed in a family suite. It was perfect for the 4 adults. This was the first time staying south of Times Square. The elevator was slow, and we had a few episodes with it having to reposition. The hotel was clean. I think it is a good hotel for the value.

title: Ideal location though traffic noise an issue.
text: Decent hotel with a great breakfast. As many bagels, muffins, toast yoghurts, coffee/tea as you could wish for. The only issue is the noise from the street. Windows weren't good enough to keep it out unfortunately. I know it's New York and it's a busy bustling city but it took the edge off the stay a bit coz we got v little sleep. Happy to stay again but only if we got a room towards the rear of the hotel.

title: Perfect Location
text: Just spent a long weekend here in the family room.   The location is great as there are lots of eating options all around.   Breakfast was a fairly simple continental but they kept it well stocked with fresh bagels, Danish, bread and yogurt.   Tea and coffee 24hrs a day.   That was really ice as there are no facilities in the rooms.  All the staff we came in contact with were very friendly ( a plus in NYC).  Only thing I was not thrilled about was although it was a 2 bedroom - 1 room had no doors so really it is a 1 bedroom where the second bedroom was likely a living room at one time.   If you are travelling with kids then this is perfect.  Will definitely come back here

title: Okey but not very special
text:
The rooms are clean and the hotel location is great - 2 minutes away from macy and 5 minutes from timesquare - next to empire state building. 
The breakfast is not the best and the rooms are very old. 
For a cheap NYC trip its more then okey.

title: Not a good experience
text: I did not have a good experience with this hotel. I arrived early at 10 AM knowing that likely I would not be able to check in. However most hotels can accommodate most travelers in the morning. When I was not able to check, I was not that surprised and left my bag. I was told to return at 2 PM to check in. I was exhausted and really needed to rest before I went out again. When I arrived at two I was still told that my room was not ready and that check in time is at 4 PM.  This to me is way too late and unacceptable since it takes very little time to clean a room. However I waited. I also asked if there’s another room and I was told that since I requested a high floor, quiet room I need to wait. I was sitting at the lobby just waiting. They knew I was there and didn’t say anything. I finally went up an hour later and ask if there’s any room available. I was given a room not on a high floor facing the shaft. It was certainly not worth the wait and I was very disappointed with the terrible view and the low floor.. The room was spacious by New York standards but the bathroom was outdated with fixtures that were rusty and old. I had very little time to rest before I went out again which ruined my evening.  I’m very unhappy with my experiences this hotel.

title: Fabulous Find!
text: So many reasons to rate this place highly: convenient location; clean facility; friendly helpful staff; upgrade to a King room; spacious room by City standards; coffee/tea available 24/7; breakfast with plenty of bagels, muffins, yogurt, fruit, juice and cereal; GREAT lighting in the room--a comfortable chair with a nearby lamp plus overhead lighting and bedside lamps; comfortable bed with lovely linens; beautiful outdoor terrace above the penthouse floor with a terrific view of the Empire State building; a well appointed fitness center and.....wine tasting at 5:00 in the afternoon.  What more could you want?!

title: Best deal in NY
text:
Ho soggiornato per 5 notti in questo albergo a Midtown.
Appena arrivate ci è stato fatto upgrade da camera matrimoniale a camera premier queen. 
La grandezza della stanza era normale, così come le dimensioni del bagno (magnifica la doccia con 3 soffioni!!!). 
Ottima la pulizia!
La colazione è più sullo stile europeo che americano (disponibile a $5 in più). Ottimo il succo di mela e il latte, deliziosissimi i muffin. 
L’hotel dispone di una fantastica terrazza vista Empire (oserei dire mozzafiato!). 
La posizione è davvero ottimale, vicino a linea della metro e moltissimi negozi.
Direi che allo stesso prezzo è molto difficile trovare qualcosa del genere a NY. 
Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo

title: Great
text:
Booked here for 4 nights not the most salubrious hotel but it’s clean and friendly in a great location,decor is dated but not shabby.
My only gripe was the breakfast not great selection,croissants were frozen in the middle and the waitress laughed when I asked for dairy replacement! But it was fair price considering the marathons is taking place on the 5th November.
Would I stay again ? Probably not but that’s just my preference.

title: magique
text:
merci pour cette judicieuse proposition de voyage !
très bien organisé, hôtel très propre et tellement bien situé
petit déjeuner moyen nous aurions pu nous en passer et aller le prendre ailleurs
à refaire encore merci

title: Comfortable Hotel and pleasant staff
text: We stayed 5 nights at the Metro, our visit was to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday. On hearing the reason for the stay the Hotel upgraded us and left a nice bottle of Champaign on ice in the room for us to enjoy. The only down side of the Hotel is the set up for breakfast, while the food on offer is great there is limited room and we had trouble finding a table on two mornings. Overall the stay was great and the location is fantastic for the tourist.

title: Great hotel
text:
The Hotel Metro is a great place to stay, with lovely staff who are very friendly which nothing was too much trouble, we are planning to go back to New York next year and will definitely go back.
The roof terrace is great, we would wake up early and go on the roof terrace with a drink and watch the sun come up, and we got some amazing pictures of the empire state building and the city skyline, (bear in mind it was mid october and was getting light at 06:30 with warm days/clearskys).
