The breakfasts was great (inclusive), continental with pastries and muffins, and what was a really nice touch was the free tea coffee that was available 24 hours a day as night we went down at 3 in the morning as our body clocks was still on UK time and had a drink chatted to the door man at reception.
The only disappointment was the restaurant on Saturday and Sunday was closed, we ate in there Friday night and thoroughly enjoyed it. 
A big thank you to the staff and the Metro Hotel for making our first trip to new york memorable 

Many Thanks

Mr and Mrs Richard Marsh

title: Good value Hotel in great location
text:
This is in excellent location just 10 mins or so from Times Square.
Very comfortable . We had a family room that included an extra bedroom , which was ideal as Dad was on holiday with adult son and daughter.

Decent breakfast included.

On the whole staff good although did find the concierge desk not particularly helpful
but small criticism to what was a great stay

title: Hôtel trèas bien placé
text:
Malheureusement personne ne parlait le français, donc impossible de communiquer avec le personnel de la  réception.
Déjeuner au minimum du possible (confiture - fromage)
Vaisselle, services, en carton , jetable

title: Amazing
text: Just came back from nyc stayed in hotel metro for 4 nights. Very welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. We stayed for our honeymoon and was very happy to be offered a free upgrade. We walked from penn station to the hotel quite easy to find. Our room was 611 on 6th floor. Had a huge bed and perfectly sized bathroom with shower. Housekeeping came in everyday and replaced what was needed. We didnt really hear much noise from the streets just a few car horns but we did so much walking we were so tired we slept quite nicely! One real gem of the hotel is the roof terrace, just take the elevator up to the penthouse and you'll be rewarded with an amazing view of the empire state building! Make sure you go up at night too to see it lit up. Diane from the concierge desk was amazingly helpful! Thank you to everyone who made our stay a special one

title: Great location
text: That hotel is in a great location and Have lovely staff.. it was lovely sat on the roof terrace in the morning when we was there we had four lovely days of weather ... One block away from the Empire State Building and not  far from Time Square... we will go back to this hotel . We had amazing time in New York 😊😊😊

title: Highly recommanded
text:
excellent location , near Empire state building, Times Square 10 mn walking , tube station 50 m. Roof terrace facing the empire state building . Very good customer service.
We stayed 4 nights and we will go back again to this hotel the next time.

title: A lot of good things about this hotel
text: Stayed at Hotel Metro Oct 26-29 2017 and so glad I did.   It is in a great location, close to time square but far enough away to be a bit quieter.  The hotel is old but well kept and clean.  The decor is roaring 20's with old movie star pictures, art deco decor, marble stairs and the rooms have high ceilings and large bay windows.   The rooms are fairly large and clean with updated bathrooms.  There are lots of perks - free continental breakfasts with bagels, muffins yogurt and fruit, free glass of wine in the evening.  Coffee and tea is free all the time too.  In the room was complimentary pop and water in the fridge!   One of the nicest features is the rooftop terrace where you can sit out and look at the empire state building.  It was lovely sitting out there as the weather was unseasonably warm for this time of year.  The people at the desk and concierge were very helpful with finding places to eat and how to travel on the subway (which is only 1/2 block away)  Would definitely come to the Metro if I returned to NYC.   Beds are somewhat firm but comfortable with multiple pillows.

title: Great choice in mid-town; really super!
text: Staying here was a great New York experience.  My room with taxes was under $250 and breakfast is included.  There is even free wine in the evening!   The room was clean and comfortable.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of Penn Station and is a great choice for using the subway around town.   I will definitely stay here again!

title: Des Plus et des Moins
text:
Nous revenons d'un séjour de 7 nuits dans cet hôtel et notre avis est assez mitigé.

Le point fort de ce dernier est sa position idéale, entre la 5e et la 6e avenue, aux pieds de l'Empire State Building , proche de deux stations de métro reprenant les principales lignes et à proximité des principaux centres d’intérêt de midtown et nord Manhattan.

Les points faibles sont les suivants : accueil assez froid (ne cherchez pas à parler français), petits déjeuners succincts dans une salle ou il y a peu de place et où le plus souvent il faut prendre son repas sur des canapés et des tables basses.
 De plus NY étant la ville qui ne dort jamais, ceci est particulièrement ressenti au Métro dont les chambres ne sont pas insonorisées !;
Enfin notre chambre ne ressemblait pas du tout à ce que les photos communiquées pouvaient laisser espérer.
Donc 3*** pour la situation, 2** pour le reste pour un hôtel dont les prix sont relativement élevés

title: Hotel Excelente!
text:
O hotel é ótimo! Mega bem localizado, com uma estação de metrô praticamente na porta. Quartos limpos e confortaveis. Equipe atenciosa e educada! 
O café da manhã é simples, mas atende super bem. 
Ficamos 10 dias e não temos do que reclamar. 
Com certeza voltaria a me hospedar nele.

title: Испорченный сон
text: Отель Metro очень удачно расположен. В самом центре Манхэттена, рядом станция метро 34 Penn Station.  Он находится в 5 минутах ходьбы от Empire State Building, в 15 минутах ходьбы от Таймс-сквер, в 35 минутах ходьбы от Центрального парка. При заселении в отеле взимают депозит $250. В стоимость размещения входит бесплатный завтрак. Помещение для завтрака очень маленькое. Образуются очереди. На крыше отеля есть смотровая площадка с видом на Empire State Building.  В отеле бесплатный хороший Wi-Fi. В номере есть кондиционер, телевизор, фен, утюг, гладильная доска, зонт, небольшой холодильник.  Я останавливался в отеле в конце сентября. В Нью Йорке стояла тридцати градусная жара. А температура воздуха в кондиционере не регулировалась! Шум из окна мешает спать. Сейф в номере был сломан!!! Все это очень сильно испортило впечатление об отеле.

title: Amazing 😍
text:
This hotel was amazing staff was lovely and the free breakfast 👌 loved it would recommend this hotel, and would defiantly stay again for my next return! 
It’s close to everything so I could walk there ❤️

title: Location location with perks
text: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Metro and could  not fault this hotel at all. It is ideally located for all of the sights in New York located Midtown with subway stations nearby, Macys and Herald Square at the end of the road and many eateries within walking distance. First perk a free breakfast in New York what more do you want - a good substantial breakfast set us up for the day consisting of cereals, yoghurt, bagels, toast, cakes fresh fruit, juices and tea or coffee. We never had a problem finding a table, though we did get up early so as to waste any minute in the city. Check in was very easy and we managed to check in early which was very much appreciated after a long flight. The hotel were kind enough to fulfil our request for a low floor and we were allocated one on the third floor - a large and comfortable room with a Queen size bed unfortunately the pillows were a little uncomfortable for our liking. Safe, ironing bard, iron and umbrella are all provided in your room for you to use. Second perk free wine tasting on an evening from 5 - 7 was very relaxing after a long day sight seeing around the streets of this amazing city. We managed to see all of the sights on our wish list and ate in the Metro Grill on our first night, substantial portions, though look out for the service charge; Stella34 Italian in Macys and O' Sullivans on 35th were also  very good value for money. Do not forget to go up to the roof terrace to admire the view of the Empire State Building maybe take along a glass of wine and nibbles. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating nothing was a problem and help was always at hand if you needed it. We can wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Metro and if we return to New York this will be on the top of our list for accommodation. Thank you for making our celebration one to be remembered.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Myself and my friend booked in and were given a room upgrade free of charge. We had a two bedroomed room which contained three double beds. The beds are extremely comfortable and are changed daily. The bathroom is a good size with a powerful shower. Again towels are changed every day.
The staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to assist with any queries.
Hotel Metro is in a brilliant location and so handy for everything. The view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop terrace is breathtaking.
The breakfast is fantastic...choice of bagels, bread, muffins, pastries, cereals, fruit and yoghurt. Staff are continually filling up supplies so the choice is always available.
The wine tasting in the when I g is a very relaxing experience. A glass of good quality red or white is offered.
The only negative, and I have had to struggle to find one, is perhaps the noise from the street, but hey you're in New York
So you expect noise.
I can't wait to go to New York again and would definitely stay in this fabulous hotel again and again.

title: Will not stay here again
text:
First the positives: 
-Good location on 35th between 5th and 6th right off of Herald's Square 
-Subway less than half a block away
-Free continental breakfast
-Free wine "tastings" each evening from 5pm-6:30pm
-Free coffee and tea 24/7
-Decor is kind of charming
-Both doormen we encountered were very nice and helpful.
-Beds were very comfortable.

Next, the neither completely positive nor negative:
-The free continental breakfast is mostly carbs - toast, muffins, bagels, some small cups of yogurt, and apples/oranges/bananas if you're lucky and there's some left. As many have mentioned, there is not nearly enough seating but I'd rather take it to my room anyway.
-They had the same exact wines all 5 nights of the wine "tastings". You get a full glass and as many as you want (I think - I maxed at two), but I'm pretty sure there are supposed to be different of varieties of wine for you to, you know, taste.
-Some of the front desk staff were rude, but some were nice and helpful.
-Room was old and could have used some freshening up.
-No view but wasn't expected.

Last, but not least, the negative:
-Housekeeping stole some of my personal items. No, it wasn't high value, but it was 1) intrusive, 2) inconvenient as I had to go out and buy more, and 3) the front desk girl just stared at me and then said she'd leave a note for the manager. I don't know if she did because I didn't want to spend my precious NYC time talking to the manager the next day. 

No matter, you'll just never get my business again and I have told all of my friends and family. I will never recommend your hotel to anyone.

With the plethora of very nice hotels in NYC, I don't understand why a hotel wouldn't strive to give it's very best service. I have plenty of other, better, choices next time!

title: Excellent sauf le petit déjeuner
text: Très bon accueil. Personnel aimable et serviable. Il y a un desk exprès pour les excursions avec une dame très compétente et aimable. Par contre, le petit déjeuner est minable: les pâtisseries sont dures, il n'y a pas de chocolat chaud. Le café vient de la machine et il n'est pas bon. Heureusement qu'il y a de la confiture et du pain qu'on peut toaster, si le toaster ne prend pas feu (j'ai vu de mes propres yeux qu'il prenait feu).

title: Excellent location.
text: Lovely hotel in an excellent location. Beautiful room with high spec bathroom. Lovely roof top terrace with a brilliant view of the empire state building. Staff very friendly and helpful. Close to subway stations but easy walk to most sights. Plenty available for continental  breakfast, toast, bagels, pastries, cereal, yogurts and fruit. The only downside was there was only disposable plates, cups and cutlery but while walking around it seems as though this is the norm for all hotels in NYC. Plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. We will definitely be returning.

title: Ideal location
text:
This Hotel is on a quiet street midway between Macy's on 6th avenue and 5th avenue and close to Times Square, and all the places to visit as a tourist in mid town can be walked to. The Hotel offers a free continental breakfast or you can pay extra for a cooked one. Hot drinks are free all day and the rooms were clean and a good size.
We would recommend staying here as a first time visitor to New York and look forward to returning.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here for a week in July for my 50th and it was a very nice stay. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the room was adequate. They only served buffet style breakfasts but you can go to their restaurant for a cooked one for a discounted price. I would say they perhaps need more seating as breakfast time was a bit of a squeeze no matter what time you went down. The view from the roof terrace was amazing, especially as the Empire State Building was literally next door. Lovely photo opportunity especially when it's lit up at night. All in all a good stay.

title: Marvellous Midtown Metro.
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in September(during a spell of very hot weather.) After a hot and tiring journey into the city ,we were very pleased to be checked in quickly by a very nice receptionist called Soni. He also informed us that we'd been given a complimentary room upgrade which meant we had a lovely big room on the 12th floor, partly overlooking the street far below. There was also a bottle of fizz waiting for us too. The room had plenty of wardrobe and draw space and included a safe, coffee machine, fridge (stocked with some complimentary cokes and water) and air conditioning. The bed was large and really comfortable but, unfortunately, I found the pillows to be rather lumpy and not comfortable at all. The bathroom, whilst being a tad on the small side, was perfectly adequate and had a fantastic walk in shower with 2 facing shower heads and 1 deluge shower head from above. We found the sleep quality really good but be warned, don't expect too peaceful a night, this is New York after all, and even being 12 storeys up, we could still hear sirens, horns, air conditioning units humming and the commotion that is New York!  Ear plugs help!
Unusually for a New York hotel, the Art Deco style Metro includes breakfast in your stay. It's perfectly adequate offering cereals, pastries, muffins, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, juices, yoghurts and tea and coffee, (the T and C are available 24hrs free of charge and are most welcome after a hard days sight seeing.) Also, for a small charge, you can upgrade your breakfast to a cooked one which is eaten in the main restaurant at the front of the hotel. In the early evening, the hotel lay on a wine tasting session. We only managed to do this once but it was a very nice, relaxing hour and a tip to the bar person is all that is required.

The Midtown location of the hotel is spot on, being only a minutes walk to Macey's dept store, numerous good restaurants of varying cuisine, Fifth Avenue,Broadway and the all important Herald Square Subway. The Empire State building is only one block away too (you will want to visit it after viewing from the Metros roof terrace, so close you can almost touch it.)  A little further, but still walkable, is Times Square, Bryant Park, The Flat Iron Building and The National Library.

On check out (by 12pm), the hotel will store your luggage if required and you should ask the doorman to secure a fixed rate yellow cab to your departure airport. 

So, to summarise. Great hotel, friendly staff throughout and perfect location. Should I ever return to New York City, I would definitely stay here again.
Thank you Hotel Metro.

title: Great place in midtown
text:
This is my third stay at The Metro.  Very nice, very clean, comfortable.  The beds are so so comfortable!!!  Coffee makers in rooms are a plus.  Also, free, help yourself coffee and tea all day in the lounge.  

My only grumble is the free breakfast.  Apart from some cereal, bananas and apples, the rest of the selection is carbohydrate central!!  Muffins, pastries, bread, etc.  Would have liked to see fruit salad and other less bad-for-you food.  However, with the size of dinners that NYC restaurants serve, I am never hungry until after noon the following day 😊

There is no longer a bar on the roof terrace but it is still open to guests so you can take a drink or snack up.  There are still tables and chairs there.

title: 4 night stay in New York
text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights great location, reception staff  very pleasant and informative , on arrival told we had been given an upgrade and although room was at back of hotel very comfortable great walk in shower and fantastic view of empire state building , continental breakfast choice very good , wine tasting at 5 o clock, tea and coffee available all day. The hotel also has a roof terrace with great views of the empire state building .Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: hotel stile art deco
text:
Questo hotel l abbiamo scelto mia figlia ed io su trip advsisor. L abbiamo trovato
come dalle nostre aspettative.Ci hanno dato la camera ai piani alti e dalla finestra
vedevamo l Emprire State Building. Avevamo una suite composta da 2 camera, con 2 frigo, macchina caffe un bellissimo bagno. La colazione del mattino, buona.
Si poteva prendere caffé tutto il giorno.

title: Was a great stay until we had money stolen from our wallets in the room
text:
The hotel is very central within the mid town area and good if it's your first time in New York as you can get to everything easily.  Had to change the principal booker of the room as my friend was arriving earlier than I was (first time I had experienced this) and the hotel would not let her access the room.

The room was a good size and beds were very comfortable and bathroom was good as well.  Breakfast was included and they had a good selection of continental style breakfast but did get sick of the plastic approach to everything.

Wifi was ok but my friend had trouble with her device.

The hotel has a good rooftop area where you can take your drinks and get a fantastic view of the Empire State building.  From 5 pm to 6.30 pm they were giving away free wine which was lovely and we took our drinks up to the rooftop area.

The not so good bit was that we had $20 stolen from our wallets (£12 from one and £8 from another) when we were down at breakfast.  Management didn't seem to care and claimed that they had had nothing stolen from their hotel in 22 years.  Our safe wasn't working properly so we had left our bags in the room.  If you choose to stay here - count your money (that's how we knew our money had been interfered with), don't trust the staff, use the don't disturb sign when out of the room for short period and use the safe.

Needless to say, we won't be coming back here and the only tip I can leave for housekeeping is not to steal off your guests.

If this does happen to you while here, then please report it to the police on 35th and 9th as this helps to show that this hotel has a problem with theft

title: Well worth a stay
text:
Stayed here for a few nights as part of a tour of America for my Silver Wedding Anniversary. The hotel is very central and is  on the same street as Macy's one only one block down. Times Square is only 15 mins max walk away. 

Breakfast was part of the deal and while it's not 5 star the bagels etc certainly fill you up for a days walking. The evening wine tasting is a nice wee touch and the wine is actually pretty good! 

A hint at night time in good weather is bring a bottle of wine and sit at the tables on the roof as you get a great view of Empire State Building which is almost just over the road. 

Why only 4 stars then? Well the room is just a bit too small. It's nice, clean, comfy and first class bathroom but put a couple of suitcases in and you are tight for space. 

All in all a nice hotel and I'd stay again if offered it.

title: Recomendo
text:
Hotel muito bom, atendeu nossas expectativas, localização perfeita, cafe da manhã sem muitas opções mas suficiente, com bolos, pães, cafe, leite, frutas, geleias, sucos e cereais. 
O hotel dispõe de uma rede wifi que funcional e uma sala de negócios onde podemos acessar computador e impressora.

title: Brief trip to NY
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Saturday night just this past weekend. We chose it because of its location near Penn Station and because of positive reviews. The front desk staff was pleasant and we were able to check in early. We had booked a room with 2 queen beds and actually got a corner suite which was super spacious. I wished we could have stayed longer. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was bright and clean. Additionally, there was a complimentary wine happy hour from 5 to 7 and a continental breakfast offered in the morning. Coffee and tea was available all day which is nice. The property has a roof deck on the 12th floor with a great view of the Empire State Building.

The hotel was close to Greeley Square and Herald Square and easily within walking distance to the High Line. We had a most comfortable stay and would definitely book in again.

title: Kanonhotell!
text:
Bodde på Hotel Metro i 8 nätter.
Läget var kanon! Mitt på Manhattan, med gångavstånd till allt....om man nu vill promenera!
Hotellet har bra standard. Vi fick ett mindre rum med en 160 cm säng. Riktigt skön!. På rummet fanns det TV, kylskåp och allt vad man behöver. Hade ett rum in mot "gården" ( men även om man hade haft rum utåt gatan hade man bara haft en annan byggnad som utsikt... ), vilket var ganska skönt om nätterna eftersom där är mycket trafik dygnet runt. Fanns även AC på rummet.
Hade frukost på hotellet, en enkel sådan, men vilket vi tyckte va skönt, att slippa gå ut och äta på morgonen. Uppe på taket fanns en terrass, med sol och utsikt mot Empire State Building
Personalen var trevlig och hjälpsam.
Och med anledning av min födelsedag, stod där ett fint kort och en flaska bubbel på rummet när vi anlände!
Ett hotell att rekommendera!.

title: 4 nights in new york
text: location of the Hotel Metro is great and we chose this hotel as have stayed in Metros across the world.   The room was very small for a superior room and overall it was tired with some faults.  The safe never worked despite technician coming to check it and saying it was fine. The aircon was lacklustre and weak as was the wifi connection that kept dropping in and out.  Breakfast was included in our tariff and was sufficient to start the day. The one lift was extremely slow so we used the stairs for convenience and speed.  The evening happy hour drinks and nibbles for guests was a nice touch.

title: USA trip
text: Easy check-in and out. Expected a small room based on previous hotels in NYC, but we had a corner room which was large and very comfortable and outside noise was not a problem. Closest subway is half a block away, empire state building one block away and easy walking distance to times square. Breakfast was included and was adequate comprising cereals, variety baked items, bead/toast, fruit, yoghurt and coffee / juice. Bonus was the late afternoon wine tasting. Wi-Fi was no problem. Can recommend this hotel.

title: Très bien placé
text: L'hôtel est très bien placé et offre un confort tout à fait adéquat pour une visite de ville. Il est très bien placé, offre un service tout à fait correct et le wifi dans la chambre (débit OK). La terrasse au 13ème étage (toit) offre une fantastique vue sur l'Empire State Building qui se situe la rue à côté. Placé en pleine ville, l'isolation sonore n'est pas exceptionnel, mais pas inhabituelle des hôtels américains.

title: Good location, nice staff, quiet
text: Rooms are small, but have what you need. Breakfast is a large assortment of baked goods, some cereals, juices/coffees, fruit and yogurt. Wifi is spotty. Location is where it needs to be. Good value for a busy weekend. Nice and dark and cold.

title: 4 Nights without kids.
text:
Went as a couple in April 17. Hotel was ideal ,rooms were good but we looked out onto a brickwall .Breakfast was a big bonus as you could fill up for the day. There wer bagels, cereals fruit muffins and toast and yogurts.(Excellent) Location was good walkable for most things and far enough away so not noisey.
Added bonus was the wine a 5 o'clock in lounge, free just leave a tip also sometimes we got nibbles to go it.  Roof terrace was lovely to sit out and take in the view.

title: Right Where It's At
text:
We stayed at the Hotel Metro for a week in May 2017. The location was great just on block behind the Empire state building and has a roof garden with great view of the top. Advertised as a bar but drinks had to be bought in the hotel bar and taken up with you. Inconvenient if you want more than one.

Room was of a good size for New York and though dated was all in good order.

The hotel it's self is lake many in New York Art Deco style and really has some lovely features but can feel in need of an uplift. 

Staff friendly enough but not the best I've ever experienced. Could come over as abrupt but ( no offence meant ) I find that in many Americans. 

Free wine tasting each afternoon a bonus though we did not partake ourselves. You can also get tea / coffee etc. from a machine in the breakfast room when ever you wish.

The breakfast is included in price unlike many hotels and is cold buffet style with very good choice of muffins, Danish pastries, and Bagels. Plenty of them too so you good to fill up on the energy you are going to need. 

Big downside is the lack of seating. several mornings we were stood with coffee in one hand pastries on the other and had to wait to sit down in low chairs struggled. You also need to be happy to share breakfast with strangers as every available seat is taken. 

Everything is disposable too so paper cups, plates and plastic forks and spoons which I found a bit off putting.

All this taken into consideration though great for a base in central NY but not so good if you like to spend time in your hotel,

title: Fab hotel in a fab location
text: I have just returned from a 4  night stay at the Hotel Metro, this hotel is in a great location, just steps away from the Empire State, touches like the continental breakfast and complimentary wine on an evening are what sets this hotel amongst the best in New York, my only small gripes were the noise from the air con and patchy wi-fi but not major issues by a long shot, friendly reception staff and clean rooms, we stayed in a premier Queen which was cozy and clean, but to be fair not much time is spent in your room, tea and coffee available all day at no extra cost, all in all a great trip was had.  I just forgot how tiring this city was after my last visit was 12 years ago, with a body that was a few years younger!!!!

title: Great hotel!!!
text: Just returned from a great trip to Hotel Metro. The hotel is beautiful in a great location and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We were given a free upgrade to a family suite even though there were only two of us! This gave us two huge bedrooms with plenty of space!!! We particularly enjoyed the complimentary wine every evening! The guy who served the wine was very friendly and welcoming!! Thanks Hotel Metro for a great stay!!!

title: Wow !!
text: We came back from the metro yesterday and had an amazing time in new york!  Staff all really kind and friendly nothing was too much trouble. Our room was outstanding and spotless. Good choice for breakfast a plus in new york! we always found a table easily. Wine free every night four an hour and a half 😁😁all guests having a nice chat about their experiences that day while looking at a wonderful view of the empire state. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Terrasse magique
text:
Nous avons dormi 4 nuits dans cet hôtel situé sur la 35eme rue à un quart d'heure à pied de Times Square. Il est à 100 m. d'une entrée de métro ce qui est très pratique.
La literie est très bien par contre les chambres ne sont pas grandes mais pour un court séjour c'est ok.
La terrasse de l'hôtel est juste en face de l'Empire State et le soir c'est vraiment magique.
Nous le recommandons.

title: Christmas Break
text: My partner and I stayed here last December during the Christmas period for about 4/5 days. The breakfast is always yummy (my 2nd time staying at Metro!) the staff are friendly they have a concierge that can help with tourist attracts and ticket prices. Literally 5 minute walk if that to Empire State Building, 10 minute walk into time square. There is a room to put luggage in for when arriving and departing.

title: Happy with our stay
text:
We stayed two nights for my husband's birthday and to attend a concert at Madison Square Garden.  The hotel is a close walk to MSG and about a 25 minute walk to Central Park.  The bed was comfortable and our room was clean.  The rooftop deck overlooking the Empire State Building was amazing at night.
The wine tasting around 5pm with appetizers was a nice touch.  The breakfast choices were adequate.  The Metro Grill next door was nice place to grab dinner and a drink.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  We will definitely be returning to Hotel Metro on our next NYC visit.

title: Lovely Hotel,great location for our Honeymoon!
text:
My husband and I stayed in this hotel July 2016 as part of our Honeymoon. I can honestly say the hotel is a great place to stay, the free breakfast is a good way to start the day and the roof top area is a great benefit especially in warmer months.

We were lucky enough  to be upgraded to a Premier King which had a large bed was spacious with modern bathroom and lovely shower. On arrival we had a lovely bottle of fizz in our room to celebrate our honeymoon. Our room was serviced every day of our stay to a high quality. 

The location of this hotel is excellent. Just over the road from Macy's and close to Empire State Building which we could see from our hotel room!

We would definitely return here in the future.

title: Great location!
text: Had a very enjoyable stay at the Metro with friends for a week.Great location for many of the iconic sights of NY with an amazing view of the Empire State from the lovely rooftop terrace. We stayed in a mini double room which was rather on the small side but as we only slept In there it didn’t bother us. Continental breakfast was ample and free tea and coffee was available 24/7. Would definitely recommend this hotel😁

title: It was Okay
text:
Hotel Metro is very conveniently situated, just a few steps away from the Empire State Building. The rooms are clean and cozy, the rooftop terrasse is very nice with a beautiful view of the Empire State. I also enjoyed the breakfast (very basic- hot drinks and juice, bread, bagels, muffins, fruits, etc - but more than enough) and happy hour complementary glass of wine.
On the negative side, the front desk staff was not very welcoming, the guy who did my check-in was a bit rude, made me feel as if I was interrupting and disturbing him. The doormen are really nice, one of them helped me find a parking spot. The other thing is that the Internet is really bad and unreliable, very slow with a lot of interruptions. Also, there was no hot water on our last day.
Bottom line, it is a nice and cozy hotel, conveniently situated, good value compared to other hotels in the area, with just a few issues.

title: Fantastic stay as always
text: Great hotel, staff all very friendly and the complimentary breakfast is excellent.  Rooms always spotlessly clean. There is also a fridge in the room which is very handy.  Tea and coffee all day in the breakfast room you just help yourself.

title: Excellent
text: I stayed here for a week in September and I would highly recommend it! Good location to get to places from .. comfy beds the 24 hour tea/coffee is great and breakfast is amazing! Such a choice of muffins !! The lady on the desk that books shows and tours was super helpful and really friendly.. I feel bad I can’t remember her name but she was awesome, deserves a raise! The roof terrace is a great addition too, perfect for breakfast liking out onto the Empire State Building and even better for cocktails in the evening! I’ll definitely go back! Maybe for Christmas

title: A good stay
text: Stayed here 5 nights from 25th September 2017. The hotel is reasonably priced for its location. It is in a good location one block behind Empire State Building - great views of this from the hotel's roof top terrace. No view from our room - only into a lightwell outside. All of the staff were very friendly, patient and helful. Premier Queen room was spacious and, clean and maid service every day with good facilities. We liked the art decor type styling. There was a constant noise from what we think was aircon outside but not too bad to spoil our stay. Our friends got their room switched to a quieter one. Great location. Within walking distance of all Midtown and to Central Park. I would recomend this hotel.

title: Excellent location
text: We picked a good one! There are beautiful views of the Empire State Building from the relaxing rooftop patio. Our room was small, but held a queen size bed, table and chair with enough room for two. The bathroom had a lovely shower. Downstairs offered wine tasting in the evening and a nice continental breakfast. There is also a restaurant on site, we did not visit. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to get the best NYC experience

title: Perfect Hotel for us
text:
I spent 5 nights here and enjoyed every minute.
Honestly can not really fault this hotel on my first trip to New York.
Check in was quick and easy, staff are polite and helpful. The room (premier queen 9th floor) was fine for us. Clean, big enough as we only really used the room for sleeping and the bed is very comfortable. The room was quiet so had no problems sleeping. Housekeeping was great, replaced any used toiletries and towels daily. 
Wi Fi worked fine 95% of the time for us however we only used it before breakfast and when arriving back of a night so not sure what it was like in the day.
Breakfast suited us, nice bagels, pastries, muffins and fruit etc. Always somewhere to sit and the coffee was great. Nice to be able to have a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. 
The best thing about this hotel is the location! So close to Macy's and the Empire State Building. Everywhere is easy to get to from here! Hop on buses, subways etc. 
Also the Rooftop offers nice views.
100% would return here it was very good value for money!

title: saved by the rooftop terrace
text:
the rooms are spacious, clean, safe and easy to store items - didnt have a kettle which was dissapointing.
staff were courteous apart from the latina who was rude upon our arrival.
safe in room was great, alongwith good wifi and free coffee/tea (woulve been better for a kettle in a room rather than hourly visits to reception)
overall a once in a lifetime experience, excellent location, well kept but overpriced for what it is.

title: tres bon
text:
belle chambre   propre  belle literie emplacement  ideal  pour ce deplacer  entre la 5em  et la 6em  tout pres de times squart de la terrasse  au pied de l empire state  building
superbe  vue surtout  le soir avec toutes ces lumieres sur la ville

title: Déception à l'arrivée, puis satisfaction
text:
Arrivée: accueil froid, chambre proposée minuscule et bruyante (sorties climatiseurs juste en-dessous) d'où réclamation pour un changement. Seulement possible, le lendemain. Nouvelle chambre parfaite.
Petit déjeuner moyen dans une salle un peu trop exigüe (tables libres difficiles à trouver)
Situation excellente (Midtown) pour les visites de NY

title: Loyal to Hotel Metro!
text: Hotel Metro is our favorite place to stay in NYC.  The location is perfect as it is steps from Herald Square, Macy's, restaurants, bars, shopping etc.  We have stayed at Hotel Metro at least three times a year for the past 15 years!  Our favorite new addition to the Hotel Metro experience is the free wine tasting and appetizers every night, please keep this around!  The rooftop bar has gorgeous views of the Empire State building and the free breakfast in the morning is always delicious.  We have only stayed at other hotels when Hotel Metro was completely booked and we were disappointed each time.  Hotel Metro. thank you for being you!

title: Volveria de nuevo
text: Ubicacion perfecta, frente al empire State, junto a Macy's y a un paseo de cualquier sitio (Grand Central Station, Times Squar, Madison Square Garden, Bryant Park.... No da pereza salir y dar un paseo hacia cualquier sitio. Hotel con decoración vintage, desayuno aceptable, gimnasio y trato agradable del personal (casi todos hispanos). Lo mejor, sin duda, la terraza donde las vistas al emblemático Emprire State son de las que quitan el aliento. Permiten subir comida y bebida. Nosotros volveremos.

title: It could've been my best stay
text:
Except that the ac ruined it.. 
everything went well. Location - plus , rooms - plus, cleanliness - plus, value for money - plus.. 
I ended up not sleeping two nights at a stretch. I was Travelling from india to paris to New York was terribly jet lagged and had meetings and work on all days. The ac didn't work one night the room was stuffy and congested. I informed the manager he sent a happy to help bell boy, who couldn't fix it and I ended up awake all night. I complaint in the morning.. from here it went downhill. They said it was my fault I didn't know how to operate the air conditioning. They said they could move change my room but I must vacate now.. in a hectic day ahead I was very frazzled.. 
later I came to a much smaller room. Then what I had earlier. Which is ok.. since I only had one night to go. But I wish they had handled it better, I wish they had upgraded me to make up. Or would've wanted to make up in the first place. 
Anyhow! For all it's worth stay here for the central location- opposite Macy's, they offer free tea coffee all day. For someone like me travelling time zones that's was a happy surprise. For NY the rooms are descent sized. The bell boys are very pleasant and the front desk is also fine depending on who you see there.. 
all in all I wish I could say I will go back. But there's many more hotels in NY wher e I haven't stayed and I would like to explore more that's worth my money and precious time. 
Don't stay at the top floors the lifts are not very frequent. Free breakfast is ok to start the day. They don't have airport drops or pick ups.

title: Good, but with some notable inconveniences (e.g. serious lack of wifi connectivity)
text:
We travel to both Europe and NYC often, so we are accustomed to smaller-than-average hotel rooms; But our room at the Hotel Metro was *exceptionally* small. Additionally, the shower was very poorly designed; The sliding glass doors were spaced about 1.5-2.0 inches apart, so there was no way to prevent flooding of the entire tiny bathroom, even with just a quick shower. (And yes, we tried adjusting the angle of the rain shower head to prevent this, to no avail.)

But truly, the most troublesome issue for us was the lack of wifi connectivity. If we tried repeatedly connecting and disconnecting and connecting again, and waited a long enough time in between, we might get a decent connection for 1-2 minutes, long enough to respond to an email or take care of some other quick business - and then it would disconnect again. Obviously, that wasn't a practical workaround, and we eventually gave up. We actually left for the airport earlier than we needed to check out, just for LGA's wifi connectivity. 

Aside from those negatives, there were a few positives - the complimentary wine tastings every evening, and of course the outstanding view of the Empire State Building from the roof were both nice touches. The closet has a nice large safe, big enough for a laptop (which wasn't usable anyway, due to the lack of wifi). And the location is fantastic - very close to major metro stops, and near some great restaurants too.

title: Repeat Visit
text: Third time staying here. Rooms aren't huge but clean and reasonably priced. The included breakfast is ok, and the afternoon wine tasting is a bonus. Have to check out the roof deck which has the best view of the ESB in the city
